\glt ‘(if/when) you make him his fried rice (and) his banana, he will eat it.’


\label{ex:key:1541}
\gll Yu \textbf{nó} kɛ́r=an gó hospital?

\label{ex:key:1543}

\glt ‘He said “mum, mum, don’t you see that man who ran into grandmother’s room?”’

\label{ex:key:1544}
\gll A kɛ́r=\textbf{an} gó na comedor.

\glt ‘I carried him to the dining-room.’

\label{ex:key:1545}

\label{ex:key:1546}

\label{ex:key:1547}

\glt ‘She fled from the [her] home town, (...)’ 

\label{ex:key:1546}

\glt ‘I think that he’s thirty-eight years old now and is already going towards forty.’ 

\label{ex:key:1549}

\label{ex:key:1551}

\glt ‘After tomorrow, I will go see my mother.’

\label{ex:key:1552}

\glt ‘You came and removed it.’

\label{ex:key:1553}

\gls FOC 3SG.INDP 3SG.SBJ IPFV come remove 1SG.INDP that story
\glt ‘That’s when she was coming to tell me that story.’

\label{ex:key:1554}
\gll Na ín e \textbf{kán} \textbf{vɛ́ks}, e \textbf{kán} \textbf{gó}.
\gls FOC 3SG.INDP 3SG.SBJ PFV be.angry 3SG.SBJ PFV go
\glt ‘That’s why he got angry, (and) he left.’

\label{ex:key:1555}
\gll Porque if yu mék, yu sí dán polvo, e de pút=an ínsay, \textbf{yu} \textbf{kán} \textbf{yu} \textbf{dríng}, (...)
\gls because if 2SG make 2SG see that powder 3SG.SBJ IPFV put=3SG.OBJ inside 2SG come 2SG drink (...)
\glt ‘Because if you make, you see that powder, he’s putting it inside, you come and drink (...)’

\label{ex:key:1556}
\gll Ɛf yu wánt bába, yu wánt \textbf{gó} na peluquería \textbf{gó} \textbf{kɔ́t} yu hía.
\gls if 2SG want cut.hair 2SG want go LOC hairdresser’s go cut 2SG hair
\glt ‘If you want to have a hair-cut, you want to go cut your hair at the hairdresser’s.’

\label{ex:key:1557}
\gll Dán mán fít \textbf{kán} wán dé \textbf{kán} \textbf{ték} yú sé “kán wi gó”, (...)
\gls that man can come one day come take 2SG.INDP QUOT come 1PL go (...)
\glt ‘That man can come take you one day (and) say “let’s go” (...)’ 

\label{ex:key:1558}
\gll A \textbf{gó} fɔ kɔ́ntri a \textbf{gó} \textbf{bɔ́n}.
\gls 1SG.SBJ go PREP country 1SG.SBJ go give.birth
\glt ‘I went to my home town in order to give birth.’

\label{ex:key:1559}
\gll Dɛn kán \textbf{kɛ́r} mí na Madrid \textbf{fɔ} mék dɛn \textbf{gó} opera mí.
\gls 3PL PFV carry 1SG.INDP LOC PLACE PREP SBJV 3PL go operate 1SG.INDP
\glt ‘They took me to Madrid in order to go and operate me.’

\label{ex:key:1560}
\gll A púl in camiseta, a pút=an pantáp béd, \textbf{a} \textbf{gó} \textbf{a} \textbf{púl} \textbf{di} \textbf{trɔsis} a híb=an ínsay di bañera.
\gls 1SG.SBJ remove 3SG.POSS singlet 1SG.SBJ put=3SG.OBJ top bed 1SG.SBJ go 1SG.SBJ remove DEF trousers 1SG.SBJ throw=3SG.OBJ inside DEF bath.tub
\glt ‘I removed his singlet, I put him on the bed, I (went and) removed his trousers, I heaved him into the bath tub.’

\label{ex:key:1561}
\gll E kin dé lɛk sé dɛn ték \textbf{wán} \textbf{blák} \textbf{lapá} dɛn kɔ́ba yú.
\gls 3SG.SBJ HAB BE.LOC like QUOT 3PL take one black cloth 3PL cover 2SG.INDP
\glt ‘It is usually so that they cover you with a black cloth.’

\label{ex:key:1562}
\gll Yu fít gó sé “bueno a ték \textbf{páwa} gó” (...)
\gls 2SG can go QUOT good 1SG.SBJ take power go (...)
\glt ‘You can go and say, “well, I leave by my own authority” (...)’

\label{ex:key:1563}

\label{ex:key:1564}

\label{ex:key:1566}

\label{ex:key:1567}
\gll Porque e fíba sé \textbf{di} \textbf{gɛ́l} [wé e bin de \textbf{ték} \textbf{kɔmɔ́t}], e bin gɛ́t bɔkú bɔ́y dɛn.

\gll E gɛ́t bɛlɛ́, wé e wɔ́nt púl di bɛlɛ́.

\glt ‘"Wednesday" is, ah [pause], but I know it.’ 

\label{ex:key:1748c}
\gll \textbf{Jueves} na tyúsde.
\gls Thursday FOC Tuesday
\glt ‘Thursday is “tyúsde”.’ 

\label{ex:key:1749}
\gll Dís dé dɛn ren-sísin go bigín.
\gls this day PL rainy.CPD{}-season POT begin
\glt ‘These days, the rainy season should begin.’ 

\label{ex:key:1750}
\gll Wi de kɔ́l yá só amatán dán, lɛkɛ sé e kin dé lɛkɛ \textbf{niebla}.
\gls 1PL IPFV call here like.that harmattan that like QUOT 3SG.SBJ HAB BE.LOC like fog
\glt ‘Here, we call harmattan that, like it’s usually like fog.’

\label{ex:key:1751}
\gll Di bɔ́y \textbf{yɛ́lo} lɛkɛ Chici.
\gls DEF boy be.yellow like NAME
\glt ‘The guy is yellow like [the guy called] Chici.’

\label{ex:key:1752}
\gll Dán tín \textbf{yɛ́lo} lɛk banána.
\gls that thing be.yellow like banana
\glt ‘That thing is yellow like a banana.’ 

\label{ex:key:1753}

\label{ex:key:1754}

\label{ex:key:1757}

\label{ex:key:1759}

\label{ex:key:1761}
\gll Wé dɔ́kta ópin, wé dɛn bigín drɔ́ di, sɔn tín we e kin dé bihɛ́n \textbf{placenta}, na \textbf{membrana}, sɔn kán lɛ́f bifó di \textbf{matriz}, so di \textbf{matriz} nó kán lɔ́k.
\gls SUB doctor open SUB 3PL begin draw DEF some thing SUB 3SG.SBJ HAB BE.LOC behind placenta FOC membrane some PFV remain before DEF womb so DEF womb NEG PFV lock
\glt ‘When the doctor opened (the womb), they began to draw out the, a certain thing that is usually behind the placenta, it’s a membrane, some remained in front of the womb, so the womb didn’t close.’

\label{ex:key:1762}
\gll Hɛ́, a go fála yú bikɔs sɔn \textbf{cable} dé wé na fɔ Opel, yu \textbf{intenta} bríng Opel in yón na \textbf{corriente}, Opel de kɛ́r bɔkú \textbf{corriente} só e nó go fít ɛ́nta na dán \textbf{bujía}, yu go wánda sɛ́f.\\
\gls INTJ 1SG.SBJ POT accompany 2SG.INDP because some cable BE.LOC SUB FOC PREP NAME 2SG try bring NAME 3SG.POSS own FOC electricity NAME IPFV take much electricity like.that 3SG.SBJ NEG POT can enter LOC that ignition.plug 2SG POT wonder EMP
\glt ‘Hey, I’ll accompany you because there’s a cable which is an Opel (cable), (and if) you try to connect the Opel one with electricity, Opel takes a lot of electricity, so it won’t be able to enter that ignition plug, (and) you’ll be very surprised.’ 

\label{ex:key:1763}

\label{ex:key:1764}

\label{ex:key:1765}

\gll Di láyf fɔ́s tɛ́n e bin swít pás \textbf{di} \textbf{wán} tidé.
\gls DEF life first time 3SG.SBJ PST be.sweet pass DEF one today
\glt ‘Life in the past was more enjoyable than that of today.’

\label{ex:key:166}
\gll Mék e bít yú, mék e dú yú \textbf{di} \textbf{dú} e wánt, mék e hála, (...)
\gls SBJV 3SG.SBJ beat 2SG.INDP SBJV 3SG.SBJ do 2SG.INDP DEF do 3SG.SBJ want SBJV 3SG.SBJ shout (...)
\glt ‘Let him beat you, let him do to you what he wants to, let him shout (...)’

\label{ex:key:167}
\gll Porque a bin pás na \textbf{Camerún} fɔ́s.
\gls because 1SG.SBJ PST pass LOC PLACE first
\glt ‘Because I passed through Cameroon first.’

\label{ex:key:168}
\gll Na \textbf{di} \textbf{sén} \textbf{Jorge} wé a sabí nɔ́?
\gls FOC DEF same NAME SUB 1SG.SBJ know INTJ
\glt ‘It is the same Jorge that I know, right?’

\label{ex:key:169}
\gll Yu ték \textbf{di} \textbf{maíz} yu hól=an.
\gls 2SG take DEF maize 2SG hold=3SG.OBJ
\glt ‘You take the maize and hold it.’

\label{ex:key:170}
\gll \'{A}fta a de mít=an nía di klós dɛn \textbf{di} \textbf{mɔ́nin} \textbf{mɔ́nin} tɛ́n.
\gls then 1SG.SBJ IPFV meet=3SG.OBJ near DEF clothing PL DEF morning REP time
\glt ‘Then I met her near the clothes early in the morning.’

\label{ex:key:172a}
\gll Dɛn kin fíɛ \textbf{dɛn} \textbf{mán} dán káyn stáyl.
\gls 3PL HAB fear 3PL man that kind style
\glt ‘They (usually) fear their husbands and the like.’

\label{ex:key:172b}
\gll Yu de fíɛ \textbf{di} \textbf{mán} mék e nó bít yú ɔ mék e nó drɛ́b yú fɔ haws ó.
\gls 2SG IPFV fear DEF man SBJV 3SG.SBJ NEG beat 2SG.INDP or SBJV 3SG.SBJ NEG drive 2SG.INDP PREP house SP
\glt ‘You fear your man lest he should beat you or drive you out of the house.’

\label{ex:key:174}
\gll A gɛ́t \textbf{wán} \textbf{bíg} \textbf{sísta} wé na mulata.
\gls 1SG.SBJ get one big sister SUB FOC African-European.F
\glt ‘I have a/one big sister who is African-European.’

\label{ex:key:175}
\gll A wánt mék yu dú mí \textbf{sɔn} \textbf{fébɔ}, mék yu wás mi sɔn klós dɛn.
\gls 1SG.SBJ want SBJV 2SG do 1SG.INDP some favour SBJV 2SG wash 1SG.INDP some clothing PL
\glt ‘I want you to do me a favour (and) wash some clothes for me.’

\label{ex:key:176}
\gll Na sé, na layk sé di mán de mék yú \textbf{wán} \textbf{fébɔ}.
\gls FOC QUOT FOC like QUOT DEF man IPFV make 2SG.INDP one favour
\glt ‘It is that, it is as if the man is doing you a favour.’

\label{ex:key:177}
\gll Yu sabí sé \textbf{wán} \textbf{motó} fɔ wán mún na cincuenta dólar, ɛf yu hól wán motó fɔ wán mún. 
\gls 2SG know QUOT one car PREP one month FOC fifty dollar if 2SG hold one car PREP one month
\glt ‘You know that a car for one month is fifty dollars, if you keep a car for only one month.’

\label{ex:key:178}
\gll \textbf{Na} \textbf{wán} \textbf{ɔnkúl} \textbf{directo}, fɔ mi mamá in papá in fámbul pát.
\gls FOC one uncle direct PREP 1SG.POSS mother 3SG.POSS father 3SG.POSS family part
\glt ‘(He) is a direct uncle on my mother’s father’s family’s side.’

\label{ex:key:179}
\gll E dé complicado, \textbf{na} \textbf{wán} \textbf{tín} \textbf{dat}.
\gls 3SG.SBJ BE.LOC complicated FOC one thing that
\glt ‘It’s complicated, it’s one (kind of a) thing.’

\label{ex:key:180}
\gll \'{A}fta wi kán mít layk \textbf{wán} \textbf{seis} \textbf{años} después.
\gls then 1PL real meet like one six year.PL afterwards
\glt ‘Then we met again some six years later.’ [fr03ft 191]

\label{ex:key:181}
\gll Wi gɛ́t \textbf{sɔn} \textbf{fámbul} dé, na dán yu, na yu prima.
\gls 1PL get some family there FOC that 2SG FOC 2SG cousin.F
\glt ‘We have a family member there, it’s your, it’s your female cousin.’

\label{ex:key:183}
\gll Sóté a \textbf{nó} tɔ́k \textbf{nó} \textbf{wán} \textbf{wɔ́d}.
\gls until 1SG.SBJ NEG talk NEG one word
\glt ‘Until I didn’t say a single word (anymore).’

\label{ex:key:184}
\gll Yu sabí sé yu \textbf{nó} gɛ́t \textbf{pikín}?
\gls 2SG know QUOT 2SG NEG get child
\glt ‘Do you (really) know that you don’t have a child?’

\label{ex:key:185}
\gll Yɛ́s, a gɛ́t \textbf{wán}.
\gls yes 1SG.SBJ get one
\glt ‘Yes, I have one [a TV set].’

\label{ex:key:186}
\gll Na só mi yón sɛ́f, a jɔ́s báy \textbf{sɔn}.
\gls FOC like.that 1SG.POSS own EMP 1SG.SBJ just buy some
\glt ‘That’s how it is with me as well, I just bought one [a TV set].’

\label{ex:key:187}
\gll A gɛ́t \textbf{sɔn} \textbf{dɛn}.
\gls 1SG.SBJ get some PL
\glt ‘I have some (PL).’

\label{ex:key:188}
\gll \textbf{Sɔn} in sísta (...)
\gls some 3SG.POSS sister (...)
\glt ‘A sister of hers (...)’

\label{ex:key:189}
\gll A sé, \textbf{wán} mi kɔ́mpin nɔ́, (...)
\gls 1SG.SBJ QUOT one 1SG.POSS friend INTJ (...)
\glt ‘I say one of my friends, right, (...)’

\label{ex:key:190}
\gll \textbf{Sɔn} \textbf{áwa} a nó kin hébul mɔ́, mi sísta dɛn kin sɛ́n mi mɔní.
\gls some hour 1SG.SBJ NEG HAB be.capable more 1SG.POSS sister PL HAB send 1SG.INDP money
\glt ‘Sometimes I wouldn’t cope any more, (so) my sisters would send me money.’

\label{ex:key:191}
\gll Wán dé \textbf{sɔn} \textbf{pɔ́sin} bin kán sé, e de tɔ́k sé yu dɔ́n gí wán golpe \textbf{sɔn} \textbf{sáy}.
\gls one day some person PST come QUOT 3SG.SBJ IPFV talk QUOT 2SG PRF give one blow some side.
\glt ‘One day somebody came that, he was saying that you had given a blow somewhere [you had fathered a child somewhere].’

\label{ex:key:192}
\gll Djunais tɔ́k sé, nɔ́ Rubi \textbf{dí} \textbf{gɛ́l} lɛ́k yú.
\gls NAME talk QUOT INTJ NAME this girl like 2SG.INDP
\glt ‘Djunais said, really Rubi, this girl likes you.’

\label{ex:key:193}
\gll Ɔ́l \textbf{dán} pikín \textbf{dɛn} na dán mán in yón.
\gls all that child PL FOC that man 3SG.POSS own
\glt ‘All those children are that man’s.’ [hi03cb 190]

\label{ex:key:194}
\gll A tínk sé \textbf{dí} \textbf{wán} na wán problema fɔ Afrika, ɛ́n.
\gls 1SG.SBJ think QUOT this one FOC one problem PREP PLACE SP
\glt ‘I think that this is a problem in Africa.’

\label{ex:key:195}
\gll Na dé \textbf{dís} \textbf{wán} \textbf{dɛn} mamá dɛn de mék ɛ́ni tín.
\gls FOC there this one 3PL mother 3PL IPFV make every thing
\glt ‘It is then that these ones’ mothers do every thing.’

\label{ex:key:196}
\gll \textbf{Dís} nóto Manolete.
\gls this NEG.FOC NAME
\glt ‘This is not Manolete (oil).’

\label{ex:key:197}
\gll \textbf{Dát} nó go dú ó!
\gls that NEG POT do SP
\glt ‘That really won’t do.’

\label{ex:key:198}
\gll Sé \textbf{na} ín \textbf{dís}, \textbf{na} yu húman \textbf{dís}, yu wánt ɔ yu nó wánt, \textbf{na} in \textbf{dís}.
\gls QUOT FOC 3SG.INDP this FOC 2SG woman this 2SG want or 2SG NEG want FOC 3SG.POSS this
\glt ‘(She said) this is her, this is your wife, you like it or not, this is her.’

\label{ex:key:199}
\gll \textbf{Na} in vida \textbf{dát}.
\gls FOC 3SG.POSS  life that
\glt ‘That’s his (kind of) life.’

\label{ex:key:200}
\gll Lúk=an, di dé wé \textbf{dís} \textbf{Paquita} in papá bin kán ték=an, e pé avioneta.
\gls look=3SG.OBJ DEF day SUB this NAME 3SG.POSS father PST come take=3SG.OBJ 3SG.SBJ pay small.aircraft
\glt ‘Look at this, the day that Paquita’s father came to take her, he hired a small aircraft.’

\label{ex:key:201}
\gll Cuñado, mí gɛ́fɔ fɛ́n \textbf{dán} \textbf{mi} prima ó, Cristina.
\gls brother-in-law 1SG.INDP have.to look.for that 1SG.POSS cousin.F SP NAME
\glt ‘Brother(-in-law), I [EMP] really have to look for that my (female) cousin, Cristina.’

\label{ex:key:202}
\gll Ɛhɛ́, wán glás watá aparte, yu pút=an ínsay, \textbf{dán} \textbf{wán} \textbf{dé,} yu fít ték medio fɔ dán sén glas (...)
\gls INTJ one glass water separate 2SG put=3SG.OBJ inside that one there 2SG can take half PREP that same glass (...)
\glt ‘Exactly, one glass of water separately, you put it inside, as for that one, you can take half in that very glass (...)’

\label{ex:key:203}

\gls 1SG.SBJ take two peso 1SG.SBJ buy that this-thing (...)
\glt ‘I took two pesos (and) I bought this whatsit (...)’

\label{ex:key:204}

\gls with all those borders PL SUB 3PL IPFV change
\glt ‘With all those borders that are changing.’

\label{ex:key:205}
\gll Wi de gó dɔ́n, wi de gó lɛ́f=an di sáy \textbf{dán} \textbf{motó} \textbf{dé}.
\gls 1PL IPFV go down 1PL IPFV go leave=3SG.OBJ DEF side that car BE.LOC
\glt ‘We’re going down, we are going to leave it where that car is.’

\gll Wán glás watá?
\gls one glass water
\glt ‘One glass of water?’

\label{ex:key:207}

\glt ‘You can’t just throw the things into the street like that.’

\label{ex:key:208}

\glt ‘Because of people, people are usually on the road, a lot.’

\label{ex:key:209}

\glt ‘(You) can sieve it up to two times in order not to make that little bit of water remain.’

\label{ex:key:213}

\label{ex:key:228}

\label{ex:key:231}
\gll Bɔt wé di mán na \textbf{bíg} mán, di húman sɛ́f na \textbf{bíg} húman, porque ɔ́l tɛ́n na húman dé bɔtɔ́n mán.

\glt ‘But when the man is a big man, the woman, too is a big woman, because it is always the woman who is below the man.’

\label{ex:key:232}

\label{ex:key:249}

\label{ex:key:257}

\glt ‘They told her “it’s not only her”.’

\label{ex:key:258}
\gll Mi \textbf{brɔ́da} \textbf{ín} \textbf{wán} mɛ́n di pikín.
\gls 1SG.POSS brother 3SG.INDP one raise DEF child
\glt ‘My brother raised the [his] child single-handedly.’

\label{ex:key:259}
\gll (...) yu de bák \textbf{ɔ́l} \textbf{di} \textbf{mɔní} (...)
\gls (...) 2SG IPFV give.back all DEF money (...)
\glt ‘(...) you return all the money (...)’

\label{ex:key:260}
\gll \textbf{Di} \textbf{pikín} \textbf{ɔ́l} sé na mi yón bikɔs a dɔ́n pé mɔní.
\gls DEF child all QUOT FOC 1SG.POSS own because 1SG.SBJ PFV pay money
\glt ‘(...) all the children are mine, because I have paid money [the dowry].’

\label{ex:key:261}
\gll \textbf{Ɔ́l} \textbf{mán} kin lúk=an, yu go sí wi nó go mít nó bɔ́di na hós.
\gls all man HAB look=3SG.OBJ 2SG POT see 1PL NEG POT meet NEG body LOC house
\glt ‘Everybody watches it, you’ll see, we won’t run into anybody in the house.’

\label{ex:key:262}
\gll Porque na mí mí de prepara \textbf{ɔ́l} \textbf{tín}.
\gls because FOC 1SG.INDP 1SG.INDP IPFV cook all thing
\glt ‘Because it was me, I was cooking everything.’

\label{ex:key:263}
\gll Mí sɛ́f, \textbf{ɔ́l} \textbf{pɔ́sin} dɛn kin áks mí sé yu dɔ́n bɔ́n?
\gls 1SG.INDP EMP all person PL HAB ask 1SG.INDP QUOT 2SG PFV give.birth
\glt ‘As for me, all people ask me, “do you have a child?”’

\label{ex:key:264}
\gll “\textbf{Ɔ́l} \textbf{tidé} e bin de kɔ́l mí”, e kɔ́l mí wán tɛ́n dásɔl.
\gls all today 3SG.SBJ PST IPFV call 1SG.INDP 3SG.SBJ call 1SG.INDP one time only
\glt ‘“All of today he was calling me [so he says]”, he [actually] called me only once.’

\label{ex:key:265}
\gll \textbf{Ɔ́l} \textbf{hía} pák polvo.
\gls all here pack dust
\glt ‘All this place is full of dust.’

\label{ex:key:266}
\gll (...) adɔnkɛ́ e nó sí yú wán \textbf{hól} \textbf{dé}, (...)
\gls (...) even.if 3SG.SBJ NEG see 2SG.INDP one whole day (...)
\glt ‘(...) even if she didn’t see you for a whole day, (...)’

\ea{\label{ex:key:267a}
\gll Di \textbf{ónli} \textbf{lángwech} wé dɛn de tɔ́k fáyn fáyn, (...)
\gls DEF only language SUB 3PL IPFV talk fine REP (...)
\glt ‘The only language that they speak really well (...)’

\ex{\label{ex:key:267b}
\gll \textbf{\'{O}nli} dɛn wánt hía Panyá.
\gls only 3PL want hear Spanish
\glt ‘They only want to hear Spanish.’

\ea{\label{ex:key:268a}
\gll A bin bríng wán bláy só, \textbf{sósó} \textbf{jakató}.
\gls 1SG.SBJ PST bring one bag like.this only bitter.tomato
\glt ‘I brought a bag like this, full of bitter tomatoes.’

\ex{\label{ex:key:268b}
\gll Aa \textbf{sósó} yandá.
\gls INTJ only yonder
\glt ‘Ah, all the way over there.’

\label{ex:key:269}
\gll \textbf{Dásɔl} \textbf{wán} \textbf{smɔ́l}, wán glas, yu fúlɔp=an.
\gls only one small one glass 2SG fill=3SG.OBJ
\glt ‘Only one small, one glass, you fill it up.’

\label{ex:key:270}
\gll Pero di fíba bin kɛ́r wán dé \textbf{dásɔl}.
\gls but DEF fever PST carry one day only
\glt ‘But the fever lasted only one day.’

\label{ex:key:271}
\gll \textbf{Ɛ́ni} \textbf{dé} dɛn de chɔ́p rɛ́s, \textbf{ɛ́ni} \textbf{dé}.
\gls every day 3PL IPFV eat rice every day
\glt ‘Every day they eat rice, every day.’

\label{ex:key:272}
\gll Na yu \textbf{wan-grén} pikín.
\gls FOC 2SG one.CPD-grain child
\glt ‘That’s your one and only [single] child.’

\label{ex:key:273}
\gll A kin wánt kɔ́f dɛn de trowé \textbf{smɔ́l} \textbf{mélk}, leche tibia na mi trót.
\gls 1SG.SBJ HAB want cough 3PL IPFV pour small milk milk lukewarm LOC 1SG.POSS throat
\glt ‘I would have to cough (and) they would throw away a little bit of milk, lukewarm milk inside my throat.’

\label{ex:key:274}
\gll \textbf{Sɔn} \textbf{fés} dɛn dé wé a sabí nɔ́.
\gls some face PL BE.LOC SUB 1SG.SBJ know INTJ
\glt ‘There are some faces that I know, right.’

\label{ex:key:275}
\gll Bikɔs a gɛ́t \textbf{bɔkú} \textbf{mi} \textbf{kɔntri}-\textbf{mán} dɛn wé dɛn húman kin dé fɔ Annobón.
\gls because 1SG.SBJ get much 1SG.POSS country.CPD-man PL SUB 3PL woman HAB BE.LOC PREP PLACE
\glt ‘Because I have many of my countrymen whose wives are (usually) in Annobón.’

\label{ex:key:276}
\gll \textbf{Nó} nátín \textbf{nó} dé pantáp=an.
\gls NEG nothing NEG BE.LOC on=3SG.OBJ
\glt ‘Nothing is on it [the table].’

\label{ex:key:277}
\gll \textbf{Ɔ́l} \textbf{di} \textbf{tín} wé yú an dán mán bin gɛ́t, ɔ́l de lɛ́f fɔ dán mán.
\gls all DEF thing SUB 2SG.INDP and that man PST get all IPFV remain PREP that man
\glt ‘All the things that you and that man had, all remains for that man.’

\label{ex:key:278}
\gll \textbf{Mí} gɛ́t tú brɔ́da.
\gls 1SG.INDP get two brother
\glt ‘I [EMP] have two brothers.’

\label{ex:key:279}
\gll Bɔt di gɛ́l nó kán grí mék e gí in bɔ́y frɛ́n ɔ di pikín \textbf{ɔ} \textbf{ín} sénwe, e kán rɔ́n.
\gls but DEF girl NEG PFV agree SBJV 3SG.SBJ give 3SG.POSS boy friend or DEF child or 3SG.INDP self 3SG.SBJ PFV run
\glt ‘But the girl didn’t agree to surrender her boyfriend or the child or herself (and) she ran (away).’

\label{ex:key:280}
\gll \textbf{Mí} \textbf{a} nó gɛ́t.
\gls 1SG.INDP 1SG.SBJ NEG get
\glt ‘AS for me, I don’t have (one).’

\label{ex:key:281}
\gll E wás dí klós dɛn, e dráy dɛ́n, nɔ́ \textbf{na} \textbf{mí} dráy dɛ́n.
\gls 3SG.SBJ wash this clothing PL 3SG.SBJ dry 3PL.INDP INTJ FOC 1SG.INDP dry 3PL.INDP
\glt ‘She washed the clothes, she dried them, no, it is me (who) dried them.’

\label{ex:key:282}
\gll Lɛk náw só, \textbf{mí} [\textbf{wé} a nó máred, ɛf a bɔ́n pikín]?
\gls like now like.that 1SG.INDP SUB 1SG.SBJ NEG marry if 1SG.SBJ give.birth child
\glt ‘Like right now, me who is not married, if I had a child?’

\label{ex:key:283}
\gll \textbf{Yú}, kán yá!
\gls 2SG.INDP come here
\glt ‘(Hey) you, come here!’

\label{ex:key:284}
\gll Dɛn tíf \textbf{mí} ordenador.
\gls 3PL steal 1SG.INDP computer
\glt ‘They stole a computer from me.’

\label{ex:key:285}
\gll Dɛn tíf \textbf{mi} ordenador.
\gls 3PL steal 1SG.POSS computer
\glt ‘They stole my computer.’

\label{ex:key:286}
\gll Mí sénwe a mɛ́n=\textbf{an} \textbf{ɔ́l}.
\gls 1SG.INDP EMP 1SG.SBJ care.for=3SG.OBJ all
\glt ‘I [EMP] myself brought them [the children] all up.’

\label{ex:key:287}
\gll Pero \textbf{dís} \textbf{una} baf-rúm.
\gls but this 2PL bath.CPD-room
\glt ‘But this your [PL] bathroom [look how dirty it is].’

\label{ex:key:288}
\gll E sé a gó mɛ́n pikín dásɔl ɛf a dɔ́n sí \textbf{yu} \textbf{yón}.
\gls 3SG.SBJ QUOT 1SG.SBJ go care.for child only if 1SG.SBJ PRF see 2SG own
\glt ‘She said I will only care for a child when I have seen yours.’

\label{ex:key:289}
\gll Ɛf yu bin dé \textbf{yú} \textbf{wán} yu nó bin fɔ tɔ́k só.
\gls if 2SG PST BE.LOC 2SG.INDP one 2SG NEG PST COND talk like.that
\glt ‘If you had been alone, you wouldn’t have talked like that.’

\label{ex:key:290}
\gll Na \textbf{dɛ́n} \textbf{wán} de disfruta ó.
\gls FOC 3PL one IPFV enjoy SP
\glt ‘It is them alone who are enjoying [it].’

\label{ex:key:291}
\gll Na \textbf{ín} \textbf{dásɔl} dán húman dɔ́n de wók fɔ.
\gls FOC 3SG.INDP only that woman PRF IPFV work PREP
\glt ‘It is only that that that woman is working for.’

\label{ex:key:292}
\gll A sé bikɔs \textbf{una} \textbf{Camerún} una gɛ́t (...)
\gls 1SG.SBJ QUOT because 2PL PLACE 2PL get (...)
\glt ‘I said because you Cameroonians, you have (...)’

\label{ex:key:293}
\gll \textbf{Dɛn-ɔ́l} \textbf{dɛn} de salút dɛn sɛ́f.
\gls 3PL.INDP.CPD-all 3PL IPFV greet 3PL self
\glt ‘They are all greeting each other.’

\label{ex:key:294}
\gll Dɛn go reúne, \textbf{dɛn-tú} \textbf{dɛn} go kɔ́l di bɔ́y (...)
\gls 3PL POT meet 3PL.INDP.CPD-two 3PL POT call DEF boy (...)
\glt ‘They would meet, the two of them would call the boy (...)’

\label{ex:key:295}
\gll Yu sí, \textbf{dɛn}-\textbf{ɔl}-\textbf{tú} júmp fɔ bɔ́t di bɔ́l.
\gls 2SG see 3PL.INDP.CPD-all.CPD-two jump PREP head DEF ball
\glt ‘You see, they both jumped to head the ball.’

\label{ex:key:296}
\gll Lɛk sé dɛn de hía \textbf{wi-ɔl-tú} \textbf{wi} de tɔ́k yét.
\gls like QUOT 3PL IPFV hear 1PL.INDP.CPD-all.CPD-two 1PL IPFV talk yet
\glt ‘Like if they heard both of us still talking.’

\label{ex:key:297}
\gll Lydia \textbf{wet} Junior, na dɛ́n a sabí.
\gls NAME with NAME FOC 3PL.INDP 1SG.SBJ know
\glt ‘Lydia and Junior, it’s them I know.’

\label{ex:key:298}
\gll Ɔ́l di tín wé yú \textbf{an} dán mán bin gɛ́t (...)
\gls all DEF thing SUB 2SG.INDP and that man PST get (...)
\glt ‘All the things that you and that man had (...)’

\label{ex:key:299}
\gll (...) wé a tínk sé na judías blancas \textbf{ɔ} rɛ́s.
\gls (...) SUB 1SG.SBJ think QUOT FOC bean.PL white.PL or rice.
\glt ‘(...) of which I think that it is white beans or rice.’

\label{ex:key:301}
\gll Na ín a bigín \textbf{de} \textbf{lɛ́k}=an.
\gls FOC 3SG.INDP 1SG.SBJ begin IPFV like=3SG.OBJ
\glt ‘That’s when I began liking her.’

\label{ex:key:302}
\gll Dís bɔ́y, ɛ́ni dé e \textbf{de} \textbf{fáyn} mɔ́-ɛn-mɔ́.
\gls this boy every day 3SG.SBJ IPFV be.fine more-and-more
\glt ‘This boy is getting more and more handsome every day.’

\label{ex:key:303}
\gll Wi bigín \textbf{de} \textbf{nó} wi sɛ́f.
\gls 1PL begin IPFV know 1PL self
\glt ‘We began to get to know each other.’

\label{ex:key:304}
\gll Yu de respira, yu sɛ́ns de lɔ́s, e dé lɛk sé yu \textbf{slíp}.
\gls 2SG IPFV breathe 2SG mind IPFV lose 3SG.SBJ BE.LOC like QUOT 2SG sleep
\glt ‘You’re breathing, your mind is slipping away, it is as if you’re sleeping.’

\label{ex:key:305}
\gll Di dɔ́g \textbf{de} \textbf{slíp} bɔtɔ́n di tébul.
\gls DEF dog IPFV slíp under DEF table
\glt ‘The dog is sleeping/lying under the table.’

\label{ex:key:306}
\gll E \textbf{tínap} bihɛ́n di hós.
\gls 3SG.SBJ stand.up behind DEF house
\glt ‘He’s standing behind the house.’

\label{ex:key:307}
\gll E \textbf{de} \textbf{tínap}, smɔ́l pikín wé e de tráy fɔ tínap yet.
\gls 3SG.SBJ IPFV stand.up small child SUB 3SG.SBJ IPFV try PREP stand.up yet
\glt ‘He is beginning to stand, a small child that’s still trying to stand.’

\label{ex:key:308}
\gll Wi \textbf{kɔmɔ́t} dé, wi kán gó fɔ, fɔ Akebeville.
\gls 1PL go.out there 1PL PFV go PREP PREP PLACE
\glt ‘(When) we left there, we went to, to Akebeville.’

\label{ex:key:309}
\gll \'{U}s=sáy yu \textbf{kɔmɔ́t}?
\gls Q=side 2SG come.from
\glt ‘Where do you come from?' or ‘Where did you exit [e.g. the market]?’

\label{ex:key:310}
\gll Yu \textbf{de} \textbf{kɔmɔ́t} ús=sáy?
\gls 2SG IPFV come.out Q=side
\glt ‘Where are you coming from?’

\label{ex:key:311}
\gll Mí gɛ́t dán problema wet bɔ́y dɛn wé dɛn \textbf{kɔmɔ́t} Bata nɔ́, sé ‘no Pichi es un dialecto.’
\gls 1SG.INDP get that problem with boy PL SUB 3PL come.out Bata INTJ QUOT no Pichi it.is a dialect
\glt ‘I have that problem with guys who are from Bata, right, [they] say “no, Pichi is a dialect [not a language].”’

\label{ex:key:312}
\gll Dɛn \textbf{de} \textbf{sláp} dɛn sɛ́f.
\gls 3PL IPFV slap 3PL self
\glt ‘They’re slapping each other.’

\label{ex:key:313}
\gll \MakeUppercase{A} \textbf{bigín} \textbf{gó} skúl.
\gls 1SG.SBJ begin go school
\glt ‘I began going to school.’

\label{ex:key:314}
\gll A \textbf{pás} di domɔ́t bihɛ́n sáy a \textbf{gó} fɛ́n sigá.
\gls 1SG.SBJ pass DEF door behind side 1SG.SBJ go look.for cigarette
\glt ‘I passed through the entrance at the back, I went to look for a cigarette.’

\label{ex:key:315}
\gll Ɛ́ni sáy wé pɔ́sin \textbf{wánt} sidɔ́n, dɛn de sidɔ́n.
\gls every side SUB person want stay 3PL IPFV stay
\glt ‘Anywhere that a person wanted to stay, they stayed.’

\label{ex:key:316}
\gll \MakeUppercase{A} \textbf{sabí} sɔn kápinta dɛn.
\gls 1SG.SBJ know some carpenter PL
\glt ‘I know some carpenters.’ or ‘I got to know some carpenters.’

\label{ex:key:317}
\gll \textbf{Bifó} wi rích fɔ carretera di bolsa \textbf{évi}.
\gls before 1PL arrive PREP road DEF bag be.heavy
\glt ‘Before we reached the road the bag had become heavy.’

\label{ex:key:318}
\gll Dán húman e \textbf{brók} \textbf{di} \textbf{plét}
\gls that woman 3SG.SBJ break DEF plate
\glt ‘That woman (she) broke the plate.’

\label{ex:key:319}
\gll A \textbf{ték} di trí chía dɛn, dán butaca ɔ́p sáy, mí \textbf{sidɔ́n} dé, e \textbf{sidɔ́n} dís pát.
\gls 1SG.SBJ take DEF three chair PL that elbow.chair up side 1SG.INDP sit.down there 3SG.SBJ sit.down this part
\glt ‘I took the three chairs, that elbow chair up there, I [EMP] sat down there, he sat down on this side.’

\label{ex:key:320}
\gll E go \textbf{dé} fáyn ɛf e \textbf{kán}.
\gls 3SG.SBJ POT BE.LOC fine if 3SG.SBJ come
\glt ‘It will be nice, if he comes.’

\label{ex:key:321}
\gll If yu \textbf{wánt}, a fít sɛ́l yu mi hós.
\gls if 2SG want 1SG.SBJ can sell 2SG 1SG.POSS house
\glt ‘If you want, I can sell you my house.’

\label{ex:key:322a}
\gll \'{A}fta háw fɔ mék di ógi?
\gls then how PREP make DEF corn.porridge
\glt ‘Then how do you make the corn porridge?’

\label{ex:key:322b}
\gll Yu fít ték náw, wán, wán smɔ́l kɔ́p nɔ́, \textbf{yu} \textbf{pút}=an na fáya, ínsay di pɔ́t.
\gls 2SG can take now one one small cup INTJ 2SG put=3SG.OBJ LOC fire inside DEF pot
\glt ‘Now you can take, a, a small cup, right, you put it on the fire, inside 

\label{ex:key:323}
\gll Dán mán e bin \textbf{kán} \textbf{gó} na jél lɔ́n tɛ́n.
\gls that man 3SG.SBJ PST PFV go LOC jail long time
\glt ‘That man went to jail a long time ago.’

\label{ex:key:324}
\gll E gí di papá di pikín, kɔmɔ́t, e \textbf{kán} \textbf{kán} na Malábo.
\gls 3SG.SBJ give DEF father DEF child go.out 3SG.SBJ PFV come LOC PLACE
\glt ‘She gave her child to the father, left, (and then) she came to Malabo.’

\ea{\label{ex:key:325a}
\gll A \textbf{kán} \textbf{gó} na mi ɔnkúl in papá in lét brɔ́da.
\gls 1SG.SBJ PFV go LOC 1SG.POSS uncle 3SG.POSS father 3SG.POSS late brother
\glt ‘I went to my uncle’s father’s late brother.’

\ex{\label{ex:key:325b}
\gll Mi lét papá in brɔ́da, a \textbf{kán} \textbf{dé} na in hós.
\gls 1SG.POSS late father 3SG.POSS brother 1SG.SBJ PFV BE.LOC LOC 3SG.POSS house
\glt ‘My late father’s brother, I came to be in his house.’

\label{ex:key:326}
\gll Pero ɛf di tín \textbf{kán} \textbf{bɔkú} mɔ́ pás di watá, e go lɛ́f wán pasta.
\gls but if DEF thing PFV much more pass DEF water 3SG.SBJ POT leave one paste
\glt ‘But if the thing has become more than the water, a paste will remain.’

\label{ex:key:327}
\gll E \textbf{kán} \textbf{lɛ́k} ɔ́da húman.
\gls 3SG.SBJ PFV like other woman
\glt ‘(Then) he fell in love with another woman.’

\label{ex:key:328}
\gll Ɛf yu \textbf{bin} \textbf{kán} bigín lás semana, yu bin fɔ dɔ́n fínis tidé.
\gls if 2SG PST PFV begin last week 2SG PST COND PRF finish today
\glt ‘If you had begun last week, you would have finished by today.’

\label{ex:key:329}
\gll A \textbf{de} \textbf{smɛ́l} di sɛ́nt fɔ lɛk háw e \textbf{de} \textbf{kúk} plantí.
\gls 1SG.SBJ IPFV smell DEF scent PREP like how 3SG.SBJ IPFV cook plantain
\glt ‘I smell the scent of him cooking plantain.’

\label{ex:key:330}
\gll \textbf{Ɛ́ni} \textbf{dé} dɛn de chɔ́p rɛ́s, \textbf{ɛ́ni} \textbf{dé}.
\gls every day 3PL IPFV eat rice every day
\glt ‘Every day they eat rice, every day.’

\label{ex:key:331}
\gll Yu \textbf{de} \textbf{krés}.
\gls 2SG IPFV be.crazy
\glt ‘You are crazy.’

\label{ex:key:332}
