\gls 3SG.SBJ IPFV sick malaria
\glt ‘He is sick with malaria.’

\label{ex:key:333}
\gll \'{A}fta dɛn \textbf{de} \textbf{gɛ́t} fisionomía fɔ, fɔ \'{A}frika dɛn.
\gls then 3PL IPFV get physiognomy PREP PREP Africa PL
\glt ‘Then they have the physiognomy of, of Africans.’

\label{ex:key:334}
\gll A nó, a nó \textbf{de} \textbf{lɛ́k}=an mɔ́, nó.
\gls 1SG.SBJ NEG 1SG.SBJ NEG IPFV like=3SG.OBJ more NEG
\glt ‘I don’t, I don’t love him any longer, no.’

\label{ex:key:335}
\gll Dɛn nó \textbf{lɛ́k} pɔ́sin, dɛn tú badhát.
\gls 3PL NEG like person 3PL too be.mean
\glt ‘They don’t like people, they’re too mean.’

\label{ex:key:336}
\gll In mɔní \textbf{de} \textbf{bɔkú}.
\gls 3SG.POSS money IPFV be.much
\glt ‘Her money is getting more.’

\label{ex:key:337}
\gll In mɔní \textbf{de} \textbf{smɔ́l}.
\gls 3SG.POSS money IPFV be.small
\glt ‘His money is getting less.’

\label{ex:key:338}
\gll A \textbf{de} \textbf{lɛ́f} na Lubá sóté di nɛ́ks wík.
\gls 1SG.SBJ IPFV remain LOC PLACE until DEF next week
\glt ‘I’m staying in Luba until next week.’

\label{ex:key:339}
\gll A \textbf{de} \textbf{ték} mi pikín gó na hospital claro.
\gls 1SG.SBJ IPFV take 1SG.POSS child go LOC hospital clear
\glt ‘I would take my child to hospital, of course.’

\label{ex:key:340}
\gll Yu \textbf{gɛ́fɔ} \textbf{de} tɔ́n=an.
\gls 2SG have.to IPFV turn=3SG.OBJ
\glt ‘You need to be stirring it.’

\label{ex:key:341}
\gll Yu \textbf{wánt} \textbf{de} gó?
\gls 2SG want IPFV go
\glt ‘Do you want to go?’

\label{ex:key:342}
\gll E tɛ́l mí sé “wi \textbf{kin} \textbf{mítɔp} ínsay wán motó”.
\gls 3SG.SBJ tell 1SG.INDP QUOT 1PL HAB meet inside one car
\glt ‘He told me (that) “we would meet inside a car.”

\label{ex:key:343}
\gll Nit na in éks dɛn wé e \textbf{kin} \textbf{de} \textbf{pút}.
\gls nit FOC 3SG.POSS egg PL SUB 3SG.SBJ HAB IPFV put
\glt ‘The nits are the eggs that it lays.’

\label{ex:key:344}
\gll Sé ús=tín \textbf{kin} \textbf{dé} ínsay dé?
\gls QUOT Q=thing HAB BE.LOC inside there
\glt ‘(She) said “what is usually in there?”‘

\label{ex:key:345}
\gll Dɛn nó \textbf{kin} \textbf{nó} sɛ́f.
\gls 3PL NEG HAB know EMP
\glt ‘They didn’t even use to know.’

\label{ex:key:346}
\gll Dɔ́g \textbf{kin} bɛ́t.
\gls dog HAB bite
\glt ‘Dogs bite.’

\label{ex:key:347}
\gll Wétin yu \textbf{de} \textbf{chench-chénch} nɔ́mba dɛn só?
\gls what 2SG IPFV RED.CPD-change number PL like.that
\glt ‘Why do you constantly change (telephone) numbers like that?’

\ea{\label{ex:key:348a}
\gll Wé a \textbf{kin} \textbf{mék} só, a nó de fíl hɔ́t.
\gls SUB 1SG.SBJ HAB make like.that 1SG.SBJ NEG IPFV feel heat
\glt ‘Anytime I would do like this, I wouldn’t feel heat.’

\label{ex:key:348b}
\gll Pero wé a \textbf{kin} \textbf{tɔ́ch} in fút, in hán dé, na só dɛn [kó:::l].
\gls but SUB 1SG.SBJ HAB touch 3SG.POSS foot 3SG.POSS hand there FOC like.that 3PL be.cold.EMP
\glt ‘When I would touch his leg, his hand there, that’s how terribly cold they were.’

\label{ex:key:349}
\gll A \textbf{bigín} \textbf{di} \textbf{wók} wé yu dɔ́n gó.
\gls 1SG.SBJ begin DEF work SUB 2SG PRF go
\glt ‘I began the work when you had gone.’

\label{ex:key:350}
\gll A \textbf{bigín} \textbf{gó} skúl.
\gls 1SG.SBJ begin go school
\glt ‘I began going to school.’

\label{ex:key:351}
\gll A \textbf{bigín} \textbf{de} \textbf{lás}, a de kɔ́stɔn.
\gls 1SG.SBJ begin IPFV endure 1SG.SBJ IPFV get.used
\glt ‘I began enduring (it), I was getting used (to it).’

\label{ex:key:352}
\gll Dɛn \textbf{kán} \textbf{bigín} kɔ́l mí Francisca.
\gls 3PL PFV begin call 1SG.INDP NAME
\glt ‘They began to call me Francisca.’

\label{ex:key:353}
\gll Wi \textbf{bigín} \textbf{de} \textbf{nó} wi sɛ́f.
\gls 1PL begin IPFV know 1PL self
\glt ‘We began to get to know each other.’

\label{ex:key:354}
\gll E tɛ́l mí sé dán papá wé e \textbf{jɔ́s} \textbf{kɔmɔ́t} cobra in mɔní fɔ cacao, salút=an!
\gls 3SG.SBJ tell 1SG.INDP QUOT that father SUB 3SG.SBJ just come.out receive 3SG.POSS money PREP cocoa greet=3SG.OBJ
\glt ‘He said to me “that elderly man that just received the money for his cocoa, greet him!”’

\label{ex:key:355}
\gll Di gɛ́l kán \textbf{kɔmɔ́t} dé.
\gls DEF girl PFV go.out there
\glt ‘The girl left there [that place].’

\label{ex:key:356}
\gll \'{U}s=sáy yu \textbf{kɔmɔ́t} \textbf{chák} só?
\gls Q=side 2SG come.out get.drunk like.that
\glt ‘Where do you come from drunk like this?’

\label{ex:key:357}
\gll Wé e \textbf{kin} \textbf{kɔmɔ́t} wók, a kin mék=an so, lɛk háw mún fínis.
\gls SUB 3SG.SBJ HAB come.out work 1SG.SBJ HAB make=3SG.OBJ like.that like how month finish
\glt ‘When he comes from work/ when he has just finished working, I do like this to him [stretches out hand], as soon as the month is over.’

\label{ex:key:358}
\gll A \textbf{jɔ́s} \textbf{báy} sɔn.
\gls 1SG.SBJ just buy some
\glt ‘I just bought some.’

\label{ex:key:359}
\gll Náw dɛn \textbf{de} \textbf{jís} \textbf{de} kán.
\gls now 3PL IPFV just IPFV come
\glt ‘Now they’re just coming.’

\label{ex:key:360}
\gll \textbf{Jɔ́s} e kɔmɔ́t na Baney (...)
\gls just 3SG.SBJ come.out LOC PLACE (...)
\glt ‘She had just left Baney (...)’

\label{ex:key:361}
\gll Yu nó gɛ́fɔ pút=an fɔ plástik yu \textbf{jɔ́s} gó na bús yu trowé=an.
\gls 2SG NEG have.to put=3SG.OBJ PREP plastic 2SG just go LOC forest 2SG throw=3SG.OBJ
\glt ‘You don’t have to put it into a plastic (bag), you just go to the forest and throw it away.’

\label{ex:key:362}
\gll Bɔt dá mɔní de \textbf{fínis} kwík.
\gls but that money IPFV finish quickly
\glt ‘But that money used to finish quickly.’

\label{ex:key:363}
\gll E \textbf{fínis} \textbf{bɛ́n} di písis fáyn.
\gls 3SG.SBJ finish bend DEF piece.of.cloth fine
\glt ‘She has finished folding the piece of cloth real nice.’

\label{ex:key:364}
\gll Náw a \textbf{dɔ́n} \textbf{de} \textbf{fínis} sém fɔ wɛ́r dán sús, ɛf a bin nó a fɔ kɛ́r ɔ́da sús.
\gls now 1SG.SBJ PRF IPFV finish be.ashamed PREP wear that shoe if 1SG.SBJ PST know 1SG.SBJ COND carry other shoes
\glt ‘Now I am really ashamed to be wearing those shoes, if I had known I would have brought other shoes.’

\label{ex:key:366}
\gll A \textbf{sigue} \textbf{plé} bɔ́l sóté ívin tɛ́n.
\gls 1SG.SBJ continue play ball until evening time
\glt ‘I continued playing ball until the evening.’

\label{ex:key:367}
\gll Mi gran-má wet mi gran-pá wé dɛn \textbf{stíl} \textbf{dé} láyf, dɛn-ɔ́l dɛn dé na Panyá.
\gls 1SG.POSS grand-ma with 1SG.POSS grand-pa SUB 3PL still BE.LOC life 3PL.CPD-all 3PL BE.LOC FOC Spain
\glt ‘My grandmother and my grandfather, when they were still alive, they were all in Spain.’

\label{ex:key:368}
\gll Ɛf yu \textbf{stíl} \textbf{de} smók, yu go sík.
\gls if 2SG still IPFV smoke 2SG POT sick
\glt ‘If you continue smoking, you’ll be sick.’

\label{ex:key:369}
\gll E \textbf{nó} dé\textbf{} \textbf{mɔ́}.
\gls 3SG.SBJ NEG BE.LOC more
\glt ‘He’s no longer (here/there).’

\label{ex:key:370}
\gll E \textbf{de} \textbf{stíl} \textbf{de} wáka.
\gls 3SG.SBJ IPFV still IPFV walk
\glt ‘He’s still walking.’

\label{ex:key:371}
\gll Dís bɔ́y, ɛ́ni dé e de fáyn \textbf{mɔ́-ɛn-mɔ́}.
\gls this boy every day 3SG.SBJ IPFV be.fine more-and-more
\glt ‘This boy, everyday he is getting more handsome.’

\label{ex:key:372}
\gll Layk háw dɛn \textbf{wánt} \textbf{kɛ́r} yu na hospital yu dɔ́n dáy.
\gls like how 3PL want carry 2SG LOC hospital 2SG PRF die
\glt ‘As they’re about to carry you to hospital, you’re already dead.’

\label{ex:key:373}
\gll E \textbf{wɔ́nt} \textbf{lɔ́n} lɛkɛ in papá.
\gls 3SG.SBJ want be.long like 3SG.POSS father
\glt ‘She’s about to become as tall as her father.’

\label{ex:key:375}
\gll A bin chɛ́k sé rén \textbf{go} \textbf{fɔ́l}.
\gls 1SG.SBJ PST check QUOT rain POT fall
\glt ‘I thought it might rain.’

\label{ex:key:376}
\gll \textbf{Yɛ́stadé} náyt wé a \textbf{de} \textbf{kɔ́l} yú, yɛ́stadé náyt, nɔ́ dís mɔ́nin náw.
\gls yesterday night SUB 1SG.SBJ IPFV call 2SG.INDP yesterday night NEG this morning now
\glt ‘Yesterday night, when I was calling you, yesterday night, not this morning.’

\label{ex:key:377}
\gll Wán ívin tɛ́n a kɔmɔ́t mɔ́, a gó wáka, wé a \textbf{de} \textbf{rích} na hós, hía Djunais (...)
\gls one evening time 1SG.SBJ go.out more 1SG.SBJ go walk SUB 1SG.SBJ IPFV reach LOC house hear NAME (...)
\glt ‘One evening, I went out again, I went for a stroll, when I was arriving at the house, [I] hear Djunais [say that...].’

\label{ex:key:378}
\gll Mí nó \textbf{sabí}, e \textbf{fíba} sé e nó \textbf{lɛ́k} tín dɛn fɔ súp.
\gls 1SG.INDP NEG know 3SG.SBJ seem QUOT 3SG.SBJ NEG like thing PL PREP soup
\glt ‘I [EMP] don’t know, it seems that she doesn’t like soupy things.’

\label{ex:key:379}
\gll E \textbf{ték} di háma, e \textbf{nák} ɔntɔ́p di tébul, di plét \textbf{brók}.
\gls 3SG.SBJ take DEF hammer 3SG.SBJ hit on DEF table DEF plate break
\glt ‘She took the hammer, she hit [it] on the table, (and) the plate broke.’

\label{ex:key:380}
\gll \textbf{Dán} \textbf{tɛ́n} a \textbf{dé} fáyn.
\gls that time 1SG.SBJ BE.LOC fine
\glt ‘That time, I was fine.’

\label{ex:key:381}
\gll Mí \textbf{bin} \textbf{dé} dé, a \textbf{bin} \textbf{mék} dásɔl, dís, a \textbf{de} \textbf{mék}} fínga dɛn, manicura.
\gls 1SG.INDP PST BE.LOC there 1SG.SBJ PST make only this 1SG.SBJ IPFV make finger PL manicure
\glt ‘(As for) me, (when) I was there, I only made, this, I used to make fingers, manicure.’

\label{ex:key:382}
\gll Mí dú=an fɔséko sé a \textbf{bin} \textbf{wánt} hɛ́lp=an.
\gls 1SG.INDP do=3SG.OBJ due.to QUOT 1SG.SBJ PST want help=3SG.OBJ
\gls \glt ‘I [EMP] did it because I wanted to help him.’

\label{ex:key:383}
\gll \MakeUppercase{A} kán kɔmɔ́t na dán hós wé a \textbf{bin} \textbf{dé}.
\gls 1SG.SBJ PFV go.out LOC that house SUB 1SG.SBJ PST BE.LOC
\glt ‘I left that house where I had been.’

\ea{\label{ex:key:384a}
\gll Náw e \textbf{dɔ́n} \textbf{dáy} sɛ́f.
\gls now 3SG.SBJ PRF die EMP
\glt ‘Now he’s even dead.’

\ex{\label{ex:key:384b}
\gll E \textbf{bin} \textbf{dé} na jél.
\gls 3SG.SBJ PST BE.LOC LOC jail
\glt ‘He had been to prison.’

\ea{\label{ex:key:385a}
\gll Wán dé wán pikín \textbf{bin} \textbf{de} \textbf{sík}.
\gls one day one child PST IPFV sick
\glt ‘One day a child was sick.’

\ex{\label{ex:key:385b}
\gll A nó sabí ús=káyn tín \textbf{bin} \textbf{pás}.
\gls 1SG.SBJ NEG know Q=kind thing PST pass
\glt ‘I don’t know what had happened.’

\label{ex:key:386}
\gll Mí \textbf{go} \textbf{bí} dɔ́kta.
\gls 1SG.INDP POT BE doctor
\glt ‘I’ll be doctor.’

\label{ex:key:387}
\gll \'{I}n \textbf{go} \textbf{chɔ́p}=an, e nó gɛ́t nó problema.
\gls 3SG.INDP POT eat=3SG.OBJ 3SG.SBJ NEG get NEG problem
\glt ‘He [EMP] will/would eat it, he has no problem whatsoever [with this kind of food].’

\label{ex:key:388}
\gll E \textbf{go} \textbf{púl} yú=an \textbf{tumɔ́ro}.
\gls 1SG.SBJ POT pull 2SG.INDP=3SG.OBJ tomorrow
\glt ‘He’ll tell it [the story] to you tomorrow.’

\label{ex:key:389}
\gll Lɛ́f=an, a go chɔ́p, áfta a \textbf{go} \textbf{dríng}.
\gls leave=3SG.OBJ 1SG.SBJ POT eat then 1SG.SBJ POT drink
\glt ‘Leave it, I will eat, then I will drink.’

\label{ex:key:390}
\gll A bin de chɛ́k sé a \textbf{go} \textbf{máred}.
\gls 1SG.SBJ PST IPFV check QUOT 1SG.SBJ POT marry
\glt ‘I was thinking that I would marry/get married.’

\label{ex:key:391}
\gll Dɛn tɛ́l mí sé ɛf a pút=an, a \textbf{go} \textbf{de} \textbf{kéch} Panya.
\gls 3PL tell 1SG.INDP QUOT if 1SG.SBJ put=3SG.OBJ 1SG.SBJ POT IPFV catch Spain
\glt ‘They told me if I put it [the antenna], I will be receiving Spain.’

\label{ex:key:392}
\gll Di aráta \textbf{dɔ́n} \textbf{kɔmɔ́t} ínsay di hól.
\gls DEF rat PRF come.out inside DEF hole
\glt ‘The rat has come out of the hole [it is outside now].’

\label{ex:key:393}
\gll Ɛ, dán bɔ́y \textbf{dɔ́n} \textbf{kɔ́t} ó.
\gls INTJ that boy PRF cut SP
\glt ‘Hey, that guy is badly cut.’

\label{ex:key:394}
\gll Dán gál, e \textbf{dɔ́n} \textbf{lɛ́k}=an bád.
\gls That girl 3SG.SBJ PRF like=3SG.OBJ extremely
\glt ‘That girl, he really loves her.’

\label{ex:key:395}
\gll E de fɔgɛ́t sé Rubi \textbf{nɔ́ba} \textbf{chɔ́p}.
\gls 3SG.SBJ IPFV forget QUOT NAME NEG.PRF eat
\glt ‘He forgets that Rubi has not yet eaten.’

\label{ex:key:396}
\gll Ɛf e bin kán listin wí, e \textbf{nó} \textbf{bin} \textbf{fɔ} \textbf{dɔ́n} dáy náw só.
\gls if 3SG.SBJ PST PFV listen 1PL.INDP 3SG.SBJ NEG PST PREP PRF die now like.that
\glt ‘If he had listened to us, he would not be dead now.’

\label{ex:key:397}
\gll Mék yu nó kán a las cinco, dán tɛ́n a nó \textbf{go} \textbf{dɔ́n} fínis.
\gls SBJV 2SG NEG come at the.PL five that time 1SG.SBJ NEG POT PRF finish
\glt ‘Don’t come at five o’clock, (at) that time I won’t have finished yet.’

\label{ex:key:398}
\gll Yu sísta e \textbf{nɛ́a} \textbf{máred} \textbf{yét}?
\gls 2SG sister 3SG.SBJ NEG.PRF marry yet
\glt ‘Your sister isn’t married yet?’

\label{ex:key:399}
\gll E \textbf{nó} \textbf{máred} \textbf{yét}?
\gls 3SG.SBJ NEG marry yet
\glt ‘She isn’t married yet?’

\label{ex:key:400}
\gll Las cuatro wi \textbf{go} \textbf{dɔ́n} \textbf{dé} dé, mí sɛ́f a wánt, a gɛ́fɔ gó na hós.
\gls the.PL four 1PL POT PRF BE.LOC there 1SG.INDP EMP 1SG.SBJ want 1SG.SBJ have.to go LOC house
\glt ‘At four o’clock we will already be there, I myself want, I have to go home.’

\label{ex:key:401}
\gll Di tín wé a \textbf{bin} \textbf{dɔ́n} fɔ́s sí wé a bin dɔ́n tráy=an.
\gls DEF thing SUB 1SG.SBJ PST PRF first see SUB 1SG.SBJ PST PRF try=3SG.OBJ
\glt ‘The thing that I had first seen when I had tried it.’ 

\label{ex:key:402}
\gll Wé e \textbf{bin} \textbf{dɔ́n} \textbf{de} gó, e tɛ́l mí sé di tín wé e fít gí mi, e wánt lɛ́f mi sɔn ríng.
\gls SUB 3SG.SBJ PST PRF IPFV go 3SG.SBJ tell 1SG.INDP QUOT DEF thing SUB 3SG.SBJ can give 1SG.INDP 3SG.SBJ want leave 1SG.INDP some ring
\glt ‘When he was just about to go, he told me that the thing he could give me, he wanted to leave me a ring.’

\label{ex:key:403}
\gll Di bɔ́y dé dé e \textbf{dɔ́n} \textbf{de} \textbf{dáy}.
\gls DEF boy BE.LOC there 3SG.SBJ PRF IPFV die
\glt ‘The boy is just there in his death throes.’

\label{ex:key:404}
\gll Náw a \textbf{dɔ́n} \textbf{de} \textbf{fínis} sém fɔ wɛ́r dán sús, ɛf a bin nó a fɔ kɛ́r ɔ́da sús.
\gls now 1SG.SBJ PRF IPFV finish be.ashamed PREP wear that shoe if 1SG.SBJ PST know 1SG.SBJ PREP carry other shoe
\glt ‘Now I am completely ashamed to be wearing those shoes, if I had known I would have brought another (pair of) shoes.’

\label{ex:key:405}
\gll \textbf{Wé} a \textbf{dɔ́n} jɔ́ch dɛ́n, a sé tumɔ́ro sénwe a de gó mít in mán.
\gls SUB 1SG.SBJ PRF judge 3PL.INDP 1SG.SBJ QUOT tomorrow EMP 1SG.SBJ IPFV go meet 3SG.POSS man
\glt ‘When I had judged [scolded] them, I said tomorrow [EMP] I’m going to meet her husband.’ 

\label{ex:key:406}
\gll A nó bin \textbf{fít} \textbf{tɔ́k}, bikɔs a nó \textbf{fít} \textbf{tɔ́k}, a kán a de lúk yú.
\gls 1SG.SBJ NEG PST can talk because 1SG.SBJ NEG can talk 1SG.SBJ come 1SG.SBJ IPFV look 2SG.INDP
\glt ‘I couldn’t talk, because I couldn’t talk, I came (and) was just looking at you.’

\label{ex:key:407}
\gll Yu mamá nó go \textbf{hébul} \textbf{pé} ɔ́l dán wók wé di mán dɔ́n dú fɔ yú.
\gls 2SG mother NEG POT be.capable pay all that work SUB DEF man PRF do PREP 2SG.INDP
\glt ‘Your mother won’t be able to pay all that work that the man has done for you.’

\label{ex:key:408}
\gll A nó \textbf{mánech} \textbf{mít}=an tidé.
\gls 1SG.SBJ NEG manage meet=3SG.OBJ today
\glt ‘I didn’t manage to meet her today.’

\label{ex:key:409}
\gll E nó \textbf{fít} \textbf{dú}=an mɔ́.
\gls 3SG.SBJ NEG can do=3SG.OBJ more
\glt ‘He can’t do it again [he wouldn’t dare do it again].’

\label{ex:key:410}
\gll Di mán e nó \textbf{sabí} \textbf{tɔ́k} Panyá.
\gls DEF man 3SG.SBJ NEG know talk Spanish
\glt ‘The man doesn’t know how to speak Spanish.’

\label{ex:key:411}
\gll Bifó a \textbf{kin} \textbf{gráp}, a de sí bíg bíg fáya.
\gls before 1SG.SBJ ABL get.up 1SG.SBJ IPFV see big REP fire
\glt ‘Before I could get up, I was seeing a huge fire.’

\label{ex:key:412}
\gll A \textbf{wánt} \textbf{tɔ́k} dán smɔ́l tɔ́k dé.
\gls 1SG.SBJ want talk that small talk there
\glt ‘I want to say that particular small word.’

\label{ex:key:413}
\gll Dɛn gɛ́fɔ \textbf{mín} \textbf{sé} e de hambɔ́g wí.
\gls 3PL have.to mean QUOT 3SG.SBJ IPFV bother 1PL.INDP
\glt ‘They must mean for it [the dog] to bother us.’

\label{ex:key:414}
\gll Ɛf yu gɛ́fɔ baja diez veces yu \textbf{gɛ́fɔ} \textbf{calcula} dán mɔní.
\gls if 2SG have.to go.down ten time.PL 2SG have.to calculate that money
\glt ‘If you have to go down ten times, you have to calculate that (amount of) money.’

\label{ex:key:415}
\gll E \textbf{nó} \textbf{gɛ́fɔ} \textbf{lúk} yú na fés.
\gls 3SG.SBJ NEG have.to look 2SG.INDP LOC face
\glt ‘He [the child] shouldn’t look you in the face [while responding].’

\label{ex:key:416}
\gll Ɛf dán pikín bin tɔ́k trú, dɛn \textbf{fɔ} \textbf{púl} dán pikín, dán pikín e nó \textbf{bin} \textbf{fɔ} \textbf{dáy}.
\gls if that child PST talk true 3PL COND remove that child that child 3SG.SBJ NEG PST COND die
\glt ‘If that child [girl] had told the truth, the child [foetus] would have been removed, (and) that child [girl] wouldn’t have died.’

\label{ex:key:417}
\gll \textbf{Na} \textbf{fɔ} \textbf{gó} las seis y media.
\gls FOC PREP go the.PL six and half
\glt ‘It is in order to go at six thirty.’

\label{ex:key:418}
\gll \'{A}fta yu \textbf{fɔ} \textbf{pé} dɛ́n.
\gls then 2SG PREP pay 3PL.INDP
\glt ‘Then you have to pay them.’

\label{ex:key:419}
\gll \textbf{Háw} a \textbf{fɔ} dú, \textbf{háw} a \textbf{fɔ} dú wet=an?
\gls How 1SG.SBJ PREP do how 1SG.SBJ PREP do with=3SG.OBJ
\glt ‘How should I do (it), how should I do [proceed] with him?’

\label{ex:key:420}
\gll Yu fít hɛ́lp mí, a nó sabí \textbf{háw} \textbf{fɔ} dú=an.
\gls 2SG can help 1SG.INDP 1SG.SBJ NEG know how PREP do=3SG.OBJ
\glt ‘Can you help me, I don’t know how I should do it/how to do it.’

\label{ex:key:421}
\gll A \textbf{mɔs} \textbf{gó} Alemania wán dé.
\gls 1SG.SBJ OBL go PLACE one day
\glt ‘I absolutely have to go to Germany one day.’

\label{ex:key:423}
\gll \textbf{Nó} \textbf{mɔs} \textbf{gó} dán sáy!
\gls NEG OBL go that side
\glt ‘(You) must not go to that place!’

\label{ex:key:424}
\gll A \textbf{níd} \textbf{fɔ} mék yu gó dé.
\gls 1SG.SBJ need PREP SBJV 2SG go there
\glt ‘I need you to go there.’

\label{ex:key:425}
\gll Fɔ tɔ́k Píchi yu \textbf{nó} \textbf{níd} \textbf{fɔ} gó skúl.
\gls PREP talk Pichi 2SG NEG need PREP go school
\glt ‘In order to talk Pichi you don’t need to go to school.’

\label{ex:key:426}
\gll A bɛ́g, yu go ɛskyús mí pero yu nó \textbf{fít} \textbf{ték}=an sóté e gɛ́t quince años.
\gls 1SG.SBJ beg 2SG POT excuse 1SG.INDP but 2SG NEG can take=3SG.OBJ until 3SG.SBJ get fifteen years
\glt ‘Sorry, you’ll excuse me but you can’t take her along until she is fifteen years old.’

\label{ex:key:427}
\gll So na dán tín mék, e de \textbf{grí} \textbf{sé} \textbf{mék} a de gí=an smɔ́l tín ɔ́l tɛ́n.
\gls so FOC that thing make 3SG.SBJ IPFV agree QUOT SBJV 1SG.SBJ IPFV give=3SG.OBJ small thing all time
\glt ‘So that’s why she allows me to give her a small amount all the time.’

\label{ex:key:428}
\gll \textbf{Mék} yu mɛ́n=an \textbf{ó}!
\gls SBJV 2SG care.for=3SG.OBJ SP
\glt ‘Make sure to take care of her!’

\label{ex:key:429}
\gll \textbf{Mék} \textbf{a} gí yú di cheque, (...)
\gls SBJV 1SG.SBJ give 2SG.INDP DEF cheque (...)
\glt ‘Let me give you the cheque (...)’

\label{ex:key:430}
\gll tín fɔ fɔ́s tɛ́n \textbf{mék} \textbf{e} dé, bikɔs pípul de kán fɔ kán sí=an.
\gls thing PREP first time make 3SG.SBJ BE.LOC because people IPFV come PREP come see=3SG.OBJ
\glt ‘(The) thing of the past, let it be, because people come to see it.’

\label{ex:key:431}
\gll \'{U}dat tíf? \textbf{Tɛ́l} mí di ném!
\gls Who steal tell 1SG.INDP DEF NAME
\glt ‘Who stole (something)? Tell me the name!’

\label{ex:key:432}
\gll \textbf{Una} \textbf{mék} chénch!
\gls 2PL make change
\glt ‘Swap [plural]!’

\label{ex:key:433}
\gll \textbf{Nó} láf!
\gls NEG laugh
\glt ‘Don’t laugh!’

\label{ex:key:434}
\gll \textbf{Mék} \textbf{yu} \textbf{nó} pút di watá mék e fɔdɔ́n fuera fɔ di glas.
\gls SBJV 2SG NEG put DEF water sbjv 3SG.SBJ fall outside PREP DEF glass
\glt ‘Don’t put the water (in such a way) that it drops outside of the glass.’

\label{ex:key:435}
\gll Mék e fɔdɔ́n ínsay di glás, \textbf{mék} \textbf{e} \textbf{nó} fɔdɔ́n na grɔ́n!
\gls SBJV 3SG.SBJ fall inside DEF glass SBJV 3SG.SBJ NEG fall LOC ground
\glt ‘Let it flow into the glass, don’t let it flow onto the floor!’ 

\label{ex:key:436}
\gll \textbf{Tɔ́n}=an \textbf{tɔ́n}=an \textbf{mék} yu nó para!
\gls turn=3SG.OBJ turn=3SG.OBJ SBJV 2SG NEG stop
\glt ‘Stir, stir it, and don’t stop!’

\label{ex:key:437}
\gll Ɛhɛ́, \textbf{kán} wi sigue!
\gls INTJ come 1PL continue
\glt ‘Let’s continue!’

\label{ex:key:438}
\gll \textbf{Mék} wi sí!
\gls SBJV 1PL see
\glt ‘Let’s see!’

\label{ex:key:439}
\gll \textbf{A} \textbf{bɛ́g}, kán yá smɔ́l!
\gls 1SG.SBJ beg come here a.bit
\glt ‘Please come here a bit [would you please come here?].’

\label{ex:key:440}
\gll Yu \textbf{fít} pás yá?
\gls 2SG can pass here
\glt ‘Can you pass here?’

\label{ex:key:441}
\gll \textbf{Tráy} reduce ín!
\gls tráy reduce 3SG.INDP
\glt ‘Try to reduce it [please reduce it]!’

\label{ex:key:442}
\gll A fía sé dɛn \textbf{go} \textbf{bɛlɛ́} mi pikín fɔ mí.
\gls 1SG.SBJ fear QUOT 3PL POT impregnate 1SG.POSS child PREP 1SG.INDP
\glt ‘I feared that my child might be impregnated (on me).’

\label{ex:key:443}
\gll (...) mék yu tɔ́n=an, porque bɔtɔ́n \textbf{go} \textbf{rós}.
\gls (...) SBJV 2SG turn=3SG.OBJ because bottom POT burn
\glt ‘(...) turn it, because the bottom might burn.’

\label{ex:key:444}
\gll Pero bambáy bambáy \textbf{sɔntɛ́n} yu \textbf{go} sí di wán wé \textbf{go} máred yú.
\gls but gradually REP perhaps 2SG POT see DEF one SUB POT marry 2SG.INDP
\glt ‘But very gradually perhaps you will find the one who will marry you.’

\label{ex:key:445}
\gll Porque \textbf{mébi} a \textbf{go} wánt fɛ́n di ném.
\gls because maybe 1SG.SBJ POT want look.for DEF name
\glt ‘Maybe I might want to find the name [for this word, you never know].’

\label{ex:key:446}
\gll E go \textbf{dɔ́n} drɔ́ngo, e \textbf{go} \textbf{dɔ́n} slíp.
\gls 3SG.SBJ POT PRF be.dead.drunk 3SG.SBJ POT PRF sleep
\glt ‘He should be dead drunk, he should already be sleeping.’

\ea{\label{ex:key:447a}
\gll A fít sé \textbf{if} yu consigue gafa we/ yu \textbf{go} \textbf{wɔ́k} na ród.
\gls 1SG.SBJ can QUOT if 2SG obtain glasses SUB 2SG POT walk LOC road
\glt ‘I can tell you if you obtained glasses which/ you would walk on the road.’

\ex{\label{ex:key:447b}
\gll Eyé.
\gls INTJ
\glt ‘Good gracious.’

\ex{\label{ex:key:447c}
\gll Dán gafa, yu \textbf{go} \textbf{slíp} wet=an.
\gls that glasses 2SG POT sleep with=3SG.OBJ
\glt ‘Those glasses, you would sleep with them.’

\ex{\label{ex:key:447d}
\gll A \textbf{de} \textbf{slíp} wet=an cuñado.
\gls 1SG.SBJ IPFV sleep with=3SG.OBJ brother-in-law
\glt ‘I would sleep with them brother.’

\ex{\label{ex:key:447e}
\gll A \textbf{go} \textbf{púl}=an \textbf{na} mi yáy sé wétin?
\gls 1SG.SBJ POT remove=3SG.OBJ LOC 1SG.POSS eye QUOT what
\glt ‘I would remove them [the sunglasses] from my eyes for what?’

\ex{\label{ex:key:447f}
\gll A \textbf{wánt} dé flipado ɔ́l áwa, ɔ́l áwa.
\gls 1SG.SBJ want BE.LOC turned.on all hour all hour
\glt ‘I would want to be turned on all the time, all the time.’

\label{ex:key:448}
\gll \textbf{Di} \textbf{dé} \textbf{wɛ́n} mi mamá \textbf{go} gɛ́t sɔn faya-wúd wé dɛn brók=an na  fám, e \textbf{go} tɛ́l dɛ́n, dɛn \textbf{go} gó tót=an fɔr=an.
\gls DEF day SUB 1SG.POSS mother POT get some fire.CPD{}-wood SUB 3PL break=3SG.OBJ LOC farm 3SG.SBJ POT tell 3PL.INDP 3PL POT go carry=3SG.OBJ PREP=3SG.OBJ
\glt ‘On those days that my mother would get some fire wood that had been broken up at the farm, she would tell them (and) they would go and carry it for her.’

\label{ex:key:449}
\gll E \textbf{fít} \textbf{kán} tumára.
\gls 3SG.SBJ can come tomorrow
\glt ‘He might come tomorrow.’

\label{ex:key:450}
\gll E \textbf{fít} \textbf{bí} sé na paludismo.
\gls 3SG.SBJ can BE QUOT FOC malaria
\glt ‘It might be malaria.’

\label{ex:key:451}
\gll E \textbf{fíba} sé Boyé gɛ́t mɔní.
\gls 3SG.SBJ seem QUOT NAME get money
\glt ‘It seems that Boyé has money.’

\label{ex:key:452}
\gll (...) \textbf{sɔntɛ́n} di bɔ́y nó gɛ́t páwa, sɔntɛ́n di gál gɛ́t sɔn defecto.
\gls (...) perhaps DEF boy NEG get power perhaps DEF girl get some defect.
\glt ‘(...) the boy might have no power [is impotent], (or) the girl might have a defect.’

\label{ex:key:453}
\gll Dɛn bin \textbf{gɛ́fɔ} sabí sé e go kán.
\gls 3PL PST have.to know QUOT 3SG.SBJ POT come
\glt ‘They must have known that she would come.’

\label{ex:key:454}
\gll Iris \textbf{gɛ́fɔ} gɛ́t, a tínk sé diez años.
\gls NAME have.to get 1SG.SBJ think QUOT ten years
\glt ‘Iris should be, I think, ten years old.’

\label{ex:key:455}
\gll Dɛn bɔ́n na Corisco \textbf{trú} \textbf{trú}.
\gls 3PL be.born LOC PLACE true REP
\glt ‘They were really born on [the island of] Corisco.’

\ea{\label{ex:key:456a}
\gll Dé, ɛ́ni káyn tín na mɔní, yu fít mék ɛ́ni káyn tín, yu go sí mɔní.
\gls there every kind thing FOC money 2SG can make every kind thing 2SG POT see money
\glt ‘There, everything is money, you can do anything, you will earn money.’

\ex{\label{ex:key:456b}
\gll Mi \textbf{bin} dé dé a \textbf{bin} mék dásɔl, dís, a \textbf{de} mék fínga dɛn, manicura.
\gls 1SG.INDP PST BE.LOC there 1SG.SBJ PST make only this 1SG.SBJ IPFV make finger PL manicure
\glt ‘(When) I was there, I only used to do, I used to do fingers, manicure.’

\ex{\label{ex:key:456c}
\gll A \textbf{de} mék tapete dɛn fɔ chía, a bin gɛ́t mi mɔní.
\gls 1SG.SBJ IPFV make table.cloth PL PREP chair 1SG.SBJ PST get 1SG.POSS money
\glt ‘I used to make table cloths [covers] for chairs, I used to get my money.’

\ex{\label{ex:key:456d}
\gll \'{A}fta mɔ́ a \textbf{bin} wók dís sén wók wé a de dú, a \textbf{de} dú=an dé sɛ́f. 
\gls then  more 1SG.SBJ PST work this same work SUB 1SG.SBJ IPFV do 1SG.SBJ IPFV do=3SG.ob there   EMP
\glt ‘Apart from that, I used to work in this very job that I do (now), I did it there, too.’

\ex{\label{ex:key:456e}
\gll So a \textbf{bin} \textbf{de} gɛ́t mi mɔní dé pero yá al contrario nada.
\gls so 1SG.SBJ PST IPFV get 1SG.POSS money there but here at.the contrary nothing
\glt ‘So I used to get my money there but here, on the contrary, nothing.’

\ea{\label{ex:key:457a}
\gll E \textbf{gó}, e \textbf{wás} di klós dɛn.
\gls 3SG.SBJ go 3SG.SBJ wash DEF clothing PL
\glt ‘She went off, she washed the clothes.’

\ex{\label{ex:key:457b}
\gll E \textbf{wás} dí klós dɛn, e \textbf{dráy} dɛ́n, nó na mi \textbf{dráy} dɛ́n.
\gls 3SG.SBJ wash this clothing PL 3SG.SBJ dry 3PL.INDP NEG FOC 1SG.INDP dry 3PL.INDP
\glt ‘She washed the clothes, she dried them, no, I dried them.’

\ex{\label{ex:key:457c}
\gll Pero di klós dɛn \textbf{slíp} na dɔ́n ó.
\gls but DEF clothing PL lie.down LOC down SP
\glt ‘But the clothes came to lie on the ground.’

\ex{\label{ex:key:457d}
\gll Mɔ́nin tɛ́n wé a kán lúk, a de sí sɔn klós dɛn, a nó de sí mi yón dɛn.
\gls morning time SUB 1SG.SBJ come look 1SG.SBJ IPFV see some clothing PL 1SG.SBJ NEG IPFV see 1PL own PL
\glt ‘(In the) morning, when I looked, I saw some clothes, (but) I didn’t see mine.’

\label{ex:key:458}
\gll Mí \textbf{bin} \textbf{dé} na bích wé a \textbf{bin} \textbf{sidɔ́n} wet mi papá, mi bin dé na bích mɔ́nin tɛ́n a gó latrin a gó kaká (...)
\gls 1SG.INDP PST BE.LOC LOC beach SUB 1SG.SBJ PST sit.down with 1SG.POSS father 1SG.INDP PST BE.LOC LOC beach morning time 1SG.SBJ go latrine 1SG.SBJ go defecate (...)
\glt ‘I [EMP] was at the beach while I was sitting with my father, I [EMP] was at the beach in the morning, I went to the latrine, I went to shit (...)’

\ex{\label{ex:key:459b}
\gll Sɔn tɛ́n dɛn wi kin de gó dé sɛ́f fɔ gó, bueno, fɔ gó visít nɔ́, fɔ pás vacaciones dɛn.
\gls some time PL 1PL HAB IPFV go there EMP PREP go good PREP go visit INTJ PREP pass holiday.PL PL
\glt ‘Sometimes we even used to go there in order to, well, in order to go visit, in order to spend our holidays.’

\ex{\label{ex:key:459c}
\gll Na dé a \textbf{kán} \textbf{sabí} mi mamá in papá in fámbul.
\gls FOC there 1SG.SBJ PFV know 1SG.POSS mother 3SG.POSS father 3SG.POSS family
\glt ‘That’s where I got to know my mother’s father’s family.’

\label{ex:key:460a}
\gll A \textbf{kán} \textbf{recupera} smɔ́l.
\gls 1SG.SBJ PFV recover small
\glt ‘(Then) I recovered a bit.’

\ex{\label{ex:key:460b}
\gll A \textbf{kán} \textbf{kɔmɔ́t} na dán hós wé a bin dé.
\gls 1SG.SBJ PFV go.out LOC that house SUB 1SG.SBJ PST BE.LOC
\glt ‘Then I left that house where I was.’

\ex{\label{ex:key:460c}
\gll A \textbf{kán} \textbf{gó} na mi ɔnkúl in papá in lét brɔ́da.
\gls 1SG.SBJ PFV go LOC 1SG.POSS uncle 3SG.POSS father 3SG.POSS late brother
\glt ‘Then I went to my uncle’s father’s late brother.’

\ex{\label{ex:key:460d}
\gll Mi lét papá in brɔ́da, a \textbf{kán} \textbf{dé} na in hós.
\gls 1SG.POSS late father 3SG.POSS brother 1SG.SBJ PFV BE.LOC LOC 3SG.POSS house
\glt ‘My late father’s brother, I came to stay at his house.’ 

\ex{\label{ex:key:460e}
\gll Na dé a \textbf{dé} wán hía a nó \textbf{fít} dú nó nátin.
\gls FOC there 1SG.SBJ BE.LOC one year 1SG.SBJ NEG can do NEG nothing
\glt ‘It is there that I was for one year, I couldn’t do anything.’

\ea{\label{ex:key:461a}
\gll E \textbf{kán} \textbf{gó} na hós e \textbf{kán} \textbf{lɛ́f} mí sɔn dirección fɔ Chicago, a \textbf{kán} \textbf{ráyt}.
\gls 3SG.SBJ PFV go LOC house 3SG.SBJ PFV leave 1SG.INDP some address PREP PLACE 1SG.SBJ PFV write
\glt ‘He went home (and) he left me an address in Chicago (and) I wrote to him.’

\ex{\label{ex:key:461b}
\gll E de ánsa mí, a \textbf{sɛ́n} mɔní, dɛn \textbf{sɛ́n} mí sɔn portamonedas bɔt e \textbf{kán} \textbf{lɔs}.
\gls 3SG.SBJ IPFV answer 1SG.INDP 1SG.SBJ send money 3PL send 1SG.INDP some wallet but 3SG.SBJ PFV lose
\glt ‘He used to reply to me, I sent money (and) I was sent a wallet but it got lost.’

\ex{\label{ex:key:462b}
\gll Lɛk háw dɛn wánt kɛ́r yú na hospital yu dɔ́n dáy.
\gls like how 3PL want carry 2SG.INDP LOC hospital 2SG PRF die
\glt ‘Just when they want to bring you to hospital, you’re already dead.’

\ex{\label{ex:key:462c}
\gll Lɛk háw dɛn \textbf{go} \textbf{pút} yú na tébul yu dɔ́n de rɔ́tin, fɔ mék dɛn gó bɛ́r yú kwík.
\gls like how 3PL POT put 2SG.INDP LOC table 2SG PRF IPFV rot PREP SBJV 3PL go bury 2SG.INDP quickly
\glt ‘As soon as they put you on the table, you’re already about to rot, in order for them to bury you quickly.’

\ex{\label{ex:key:462d}
\gll Ɛf dɛn \textbf{go} \textbf{gó} bɛ́r yú, dɛ́n sénwe \textbf{go} \textbf{gó} na dán bɛ́rin.
\gls if 3PL POT go bury 2SG.INDP 3PL.INDP EMP POT go LOC that burial
\glt If they go to bury you, they themselves will go to that burial.’

\ex{\label{ex:key:462e}
\gll Na nɛ́t a las doce dɛn \textbf{go} \textbf{kán} dɛn púl yú yu nɔ́ba dáy.
\gls LOC night at the.PL twelve 3PL POT come 3PL remove 2SG.INDP 2SG NEG.PRF die
\glt ‘In the night, at twelve o’clock they’ll come and remove you (and) you haven’t died.’

\ex{\label{ex:key:462f}
\gll Dɛn \textbf{go} \textbf{rɛdí} yú dɛn \textbf{go} \textbf{mék} lɛk háw dɛn de mék fɔ wích, dɛn \textbf{ték} yú dɛn \textbf{pút} yú na avión dɛn sɛ́n yú fɔ ɔ́da kɔ́ntri yu \textbf{gó} wók mɔní.
\gls 3PL POT prepare 2SG.INDP 3PL POT make like how 3PL IPFV make PREP sorcery 3PL take 2SG.INDP 3PL put 2SG.INDP LOC plane 3PL send 2SG.INDP PREP other country 2SG go work money
\glt ‘They’ll prepare you the way it’s done with sorcery, they’ll take you, put you into a plane and send you to another country (and) you’ll go earn money (for them).’

\ea{\label{ex:key:463a}
\gll Dɛn \textbf{go} púl dán mán, a sé e kán bí sé dɛn/ pípul dɛn kɛ́r=an, dɛn lɛ́f di cadáver dɛn rɔ́n.
\gls 3PL POT remove that man 1SG.SBJ QUOT 3SG.SBJ PFV BE QUOT 3PL people PL carry=3SG.OBJ 3PL leave DEF corpse 3PL run
\glt ‘They’ll remove that man, I say, it came to pass that they/people carried him, they left the corpse and run away.’

\ex{\label{ex:key:463c}
\gll Dɛn \textbf{kin} \textbf{gó} na bɛrin-grɔ́n wet gɔ́n.
\gls 3PL HAB go LOC burial.CPD-ground with gun
\glt ‘They go to the cemetery with a gun.’

\ex{\label{ex:key:463d}
\gll A hía sé Bata dɛn \textbf{kin} \textbf{sút} yú.
\gls 1SG.SBJ hear QUOT PLACE PL HAB shoot 2SG.INDP
\glt ‘I heard that the mainlanders (even) shoot you.’

\ex{\label{ex:key:463e}
\gll Dɛn \textbf{kin} \textbf{sút}.
\gls 3PL HAB shoot
\glt ‘They shoot (you).’

\ex{\label{ex:key:463f}
\gll Wé dɛn sút di pɔ́sin, di pɔ́sin \textbf{kin} \textbf{sék}.
\gls SUB 3PL shoot DEF person DEF person HAB shake
\glt ‘When they’ve shot the person, the person shakes.’

\ex{\label{ex:key:463g}
\gll A dɔ́n sí, yɛ́s.
\gls 1SG.SBJ PRF see yes
\glt ‘I have experienced (this), yes.’

\ea{\label{ex:key:464a}
\gll Yu yɔ́ng, yu jɔ́s/ sɔntɛ́n yu gɛ́t sɛventín, etín yíɛs ɔ twɛ́nti, yu dé yɔ́ng yu dé frɛ́sh, yu dɔ́n kɔmɔ́t, yu \textbf{dɔ́n} \textbf{bɔ́n} fó pikín, yu \textbf{dɔ́n} \textbf{bɔ́n} fáyf, yu dɔ́n bɔ́n tɛ́n.
\gls 2SG be.young 2SG just perhaps 2SG get seventeen eighteen years or twenty 2SG BE.LOC young 2SG BE.LOC fresh 2SG PRF go.out 2SG PRF give.birth four child 2SG PRF give.birth five 2SG PRF give.birth ten
\glt ‘You’re young, you just/ perhaps you’re seventeen, eighteen years old or twenty, you’re young, you’re fresh, you’ve left [the parental home], you’ve given birth to four children, you’ve given birth to five, you’ve given birth to ten.’

\ex{\label{ex:key:464b}
\gll Náw wé yu \textbf{dɔ́n} \textbf{de} \textbf{gó} yu \textbf{dɔ́n}/
\gls now SUB 2SG PRF IPFV go 2SG PRF
\glt ‘Now that you’re about to leave [the man], you’ve/’

\ex{\label{ex:key:464c}
\gll Dɛn tɛ́l yú sé mék yu bák dán mɔní wé yu \textbf{dɔ́n}, dán mán \textbf{dɔ́n} \textbf{pé} fɔ yu héd.
\gls 3PL tell 2SG.INDP QUOT SBJV 2SG return that money SUB 2SG PRF that man PRF pay PREP 2SG head
\glt ‘They tell you to return that money that you have, that man has paid for you.’

\label{ex:key:465}
\gll Kip, dɛn \textbf{dɔ́n} \textbf{fínis} remata ín dé, Boyé dɔ́n kán e púl wí torí torí.
\gls IDEO 3PL PRF finish finish.off 3SG.INDP there NAME PRF come 3SG.SBJ remove 1PL.INDP story REP
\glt ‘(When) they had finished him off there [by hitting him with blunt objects] (and) Boyé had come, he told us the story.’

\label{ex:key:467}
\gll Dán gɛ́l, a tɛ́l yú sé e chapea lɛk wán sáy wé e \textbf{bíg} \textbf{pás} dí wán.
\gls that girl 1SG.SBJ tell 2SG.INDP QUOT 3SG.SBJ weed like one side SUB 3SG.SBJ be.big pass this one
\glt ‘That girl, I tell you that she weeded like a place that was bigger than this.’

\label{ex:key:468}
\gll Porque a bin \textbf{pás} na Camerún fɔ́s.
\gls because 1SG.SBJ PST pass LOC PLACE first
\glt ‘Because I passed through Cameroon first.’

\label{ex:key:469}
\gll Tú dé wé e \textbf{pás} bihɛ́n, a sí mi mamá.
\gls two day SUB 3SG.SBJ pass behind 1SG.SBJ see 1SG.POSS mother
\glt ‘Two days ago, I saw my mother.’

\label{ex:key:470}
\gll Yu sí di stík e de \textbf{pás} ɔntɔ́p watá?
\gls 2SG see DEF tree 3SG.SBJ IPFV pass on water
\glt ‘Do you see the stick passing by on the water?’

\label{ex:key:471}
\gll Dán wán wé e \textbf{lɔ́n} \textbf{mɔ́}, na ín de salút dán ɔ́da tú húman dɛn.
\gls that one SUB 3SG.SBJ be.long more FOC 3SG.INDP IPFV greet that other two woman PL
\glt ‘The one who is taller, it’s her that’s greeting the other two women.’

\label{ex:key:472}
\gll Náw náw mí de chɛ́k sé Libreville wet yá, yá \textbf{mɔ́} \textbf{día} pás dé.
\gls now REP 1SG.INDP IPFV check QUOT PLACE with here here more be.expensive pass there
\glt ‘Right now, I [EMP] think that Libreville and here, here is more expensive than there.’

\label{ex:key:473}
\gll Aquí es \textbf{más} \textbf{caro} \textbf{que} allá.
\gls here is more expensive than there
\glt ‘Here [it] is more expensive than there.’

\label{ex:key:474}
\gll Mék e gɛ́t \textbf{mɔ́} \textbf{énfasis}.
\gls SBJV 3SG.SBJ get more emphasis
\glt ‘Let it be more emphatic [than usual].’

\label{ex:key:475}
\gll E púl \textbf{mɔ́} plɛ́nte \textbf{mɔ́}.
\gls 3SG.SBJ remove more be.plenty more
\glt ‘He removed much more.’

\label{ex:key:476}
\gll Porque ɔ́da sáy fít dé wé, a go wók só, a go \textbf{wín} \textbf{mɔ́} \textbf{pás} dé.
\gls because other side can BE.LOC SUB 1SG.SBJ POT work like.that 1SG.SBJ POT earn more pass there
\glt ‘Because there could be another place where, (if) I worked like this, I might earn more than there.’

\label{ex:key:477}
\gll Dí wán dɔ́n de tɔ́k, dí wán de \textbf{tɔ́k} \textbf{fáyn} \textbf{pás} in sísta
\gls this one PRF IPFV talk this one IPFV talk fine pass 3SG.POSS sister
\glt ‘This one talks, this one talks [the Bube language] better than her sister.’

\label{ex:key:478}
\gll Lage de \textbf{tɔ́k} \textbf{Bubɛ} \textbf{pás} mí.
\gls NAME IPFV talk Bube pass 1SG.INDP
\glt ‘Lage talks Bube (better) than me.’

\label{ex:key:479}
\gll A de gó fawe \textbf{pás} \textbf{di} \textbf{sáy} wé Paquita sidɔ́n.
\gls 1SG.SBJ IPFV go far pass DEF side SUB Paquita stay
\glt ‘I’m going farther than the place where Paquita lives.’

\label{ex:key:480}
\gll A báy \textbf{pás} \textbf{di} \textbf{sáy} wé di mɔní rích.
\gls 1SG.SBJ buy pass DEF side SUB DEF money arrive
\glt ‘I bought more than the money was sufficient for.’

\label{ex:key:481}
\gll Na lɛk sé yu wánt tɛ́l wán pɔ́sin sé yu dú sɔn tín pás \textbf{lɛk} \textbf{háw} yu bin gɛ́fɔ dú=an.
\gls FOC like QUOT 2SG want tell one person QUOT 2SG do some thing pass like how 2SG PST have.to do=3SG.OBJ
\glt ‘It’s as if you want to tell a person that you’ve done something more than what you should have done.’

\label{ex:key:482}
\gll Bɔt yu nó fít tɔ́k sé a chɔ́p trí spún \textbf{pantáp} \textbf{lɛk} \textbf{háw} a kin chɔ́p.
\gls but 2SG NEG can talk QUOT 1SG.SBJ eat three spoon on like how 1SG.SBJ HAB eat
\glt ‘But you can’t say that you have eaten three spoons more than you usually eat.

\label{ex:key:483}
\gll Di pikín \textbf{pás} yú \textbf{fɔ} \textbf{sɛ́ns}.
\gls DEF child pass 2SG.INDP PREP brain
\glt ‘The child is more intelligent than you.’

\label{ex:key:484}
\gll E \textbf{gɛ́t} \textbf{sɛ́ns} \textbf{pás} yú.
\gls 3SG.SBJ get brain pass 2SG.INDP
\glt ‘He is more intelligent than you.’

\label{ex:key:485}
\gll In sɛ́ns \textbf{pás} yu yón.
\gls 3SG.POSS brain pass 2SG own
\glt ‘His intelligence surpasses yours.’

\label{ex:key:486}
\gll Dí wán na di hós wé \textbf{fáyn} \textbf{mɔ́}.
\gls DEF one FOC DEF house SUB be.fine more
\glt ‘This is the house that’s more beautiful.’

\label{ex:key:487}
\gll ?Dí wán na di bɔ́y wé \textbf{fáyn} \textbf{pás}.
\gls DEF one FOC DEF boy SUB be.fine pass
\glt ?This is the boy who is more handsome. 

\label{ex:key:488}
\gll E dɔ́n de \textbf{pás}.
\gls 3SG.SBJ PRF IPFV pass
\glt ‘It’s become too much now.’

\label{ex:key:489}
\gll Boyé \textbf{stáwt} \textbf{pás} \textbf{ɔ́l} \textbf{mán} na di hós.
\gls NAME be.corpulent pass all man LOC DEF house
\glt ‘Boyé is more corpulent than every person in the house.’

\label{ex:key:490}
\gll Di tín wé bin dé \textbf{difícil} \textbf{mɔ́} na dí hós, fɔ pút nivel.
\gls DEF thing SUB PST BE.LOC difficult more LOC this house PREP put level
\glt ‘The thing that was most difficult [of all the construction work] in this house, (was) to level (the ground).’

\label{ex:key:491}
\gll Di smɔ́l wán dɔ́n de tɔ́k \textbf{pás} \textbf{mák}.
\gls DEF small one PRF IPFV talk pass mark
\glt ‘The small one already talks unbelievably well.’

\label{ex:key:492}
\gll E nó fúl \textbf{nó} \textbf{smɔ́l}.
\gls 3SG.SBJ NEG be.foolish NEG be.small
\glt ‘She’s not in the least foolish.’

\label{ex:key:493}
\gll Di chɔ́p \textbf{óva}.
\gls DEF food be.excessive
\glt ‘The food is too much.’

\label{ex:key:494}
\gll Wɛ́n dɛn dɔ́n dríng \textbf{óva}, nɔ́?
\gls SUB 3PL PRF drink over INTJ
\glt ‘When they’ve drunk excessively, right?’

\label{ex:key:495}
\gll Di hós \textbf{ova-dɔtí}.
\gls DEF house over.CPD{}-be.dirty
\glt ‘The house is excessively dirty.’

\label{ex:key:497}
\gll Di chɔ́p e \textbf{tú} \textbf{bɔkú}.
\gls DEF food 3SG.SBJ too be.much
\glt ‘The food is too much.’

\label{ex:key:498}
\gll E \textbf{wós}.
\gls 3SG.SBJ be.very.bad
\glt ‘It’s very bad.’ or ‘It’s worse.’

\label{ex:key:499}
\gll Di prɔ́blɛm dɛn \textbf{dɔ́n} \textbf{tú} \textbf{mɔ́ch} (...)
\gls DEF problem 3PL PRF too be.much (...)
\glt ‘The problems became too much (...)’

\label{ex:key:500}
\gll Di chɔ́p \textbf{bɔkú}, di chɔ́p e \textbf{tú} \textbf{bɔkú}.
\gls DEF food be.much DEF food 3SG.SBJ too be.much
\glt ‘The food is very (or too) much, the food is too much.’

\label{ex:key:501}
\gll E \textbf{mɔ́} \textbf{wós}.
\gls 3SG.SBJ more be.very.bad
\glt ‘It’s much worse.’

\label{ex:key:502}
\gll Panyá, na ín \textbf{wós} \textbf{mɔ́}.
\gls Spain FOC 3SG.INDP be.very.bad more
\glt ‘As for Spain, that’s really bad [as a place to live in].’

\label{ex:key:504}
\gll E \textbf{mɔ́} \textbf{bɛ́ta}.
\gls 3SG.SBJ more be.very.good
\glt ‘It’s much better.’

\label{ex:key:505}
\gll Nó chɔ́p nó dé wé e \textbf{swít} \textbf{lɛk} kokó.
\gls NEG food NEG BE.LOC SUB 3SG.SBJ be.tasty like cocoa.yam
\glt ‘There’s no food that’s as tasty as cocoa yam.’

\label{ex:key:506}
\gll E nó \textbf{fáyn} \textbf{lɛk} mí.
\gls 3SG.SBJ NEG fine like 1SG.INDP
\glt ‘He isn’t as handsome as me.’

\label{ex:key:507}
\gll Yu fít tɔ́k sé ‘mi brɔ́da dɛn \textbf{bɔkú} \textbf{lɛk} \textbf{nyɔ́ní}’.
\gls 2SG can talk QUOT 1SG.POSS brother 3PL be.much like ant
\glt ‘You can say “my siblings are many just like ants”.’

\label{ex:key:508}
\gll (...) mék yu nó para sóté mék e \textbf{tík} \textbf{lɛk} \textbf{háw} e bin dé só.
\gls (...) SBJV 2SG NEG stop until SBJV 3SG.SBJ be.thick like how 3SG.SBJ PST BE.LOC like.that
\glt ‘(...) don’t stop until it’s (as) thick as it was.’

\label{ex:key:509}
\gll Mí nóto \textbf{tan} dɛ́bul \textbf{lɛk} \textbf{háw} yu de chɛ́k mí.
\gls 1SG.INDP NEG.FOC as devil like how 2SG IPFV think 1SG.INDP
\glt ‘I’m not as much of a devil as you think I am.’

\label{ex:key:510}
\gll E nó \textbf{rích} mí \textbf{fɔ} \textbf{fáyn}.
\gls 3SG.SBJ NEG arrive 1SG.INDP PREP fine
\glt ‘He doesn’t equal me in beauty.’

\label{ex:key:511}
\gll E dɔ́n \textbf{rích}.
\gls 3SG.SBJ PRF arrive
\glt ‘It’s enough.’ or ‘S/he has arrived.’

\label{ex:key:512}
\gll A wánt \textbf{fláy} \textbf{rích} na tɔ́n náw náw.
\gls 1SG.SBJ want fly arrive LOC town now REP
\glt ‘I want to hurry to town right now.’

\label{ex:key:513}
\gll E sɛ́n di bɔ́l.
\gls 3SG.SBJ send DEF ball
\glt ‘She threw the ball.’

\label{ex:key:514}
\gll A sé “nó gí=\textbf{an} \textbf{leche}, gí=an wɔtá”.
\gls 1SG.SBJ QUOT NEG give=3SG.OBJ milk give=3SG.OBJ water
\glt ‘I said “don’t give him milk, give him water”.'

\label{ex:key:515}
\gll Di chía blák, di \textbf{chía}, \textbf{e} blák.
\gls DEF chair be.black DEF chair 3SG.SBJ be.black
\glt ‘The chair is black, the chair (it) is black.’

\label{ex:key:516}
\gll \textbf{Dán} \textbf{mán}, a dɔ́n sí=\textbf{an} sɛ́f.
\gls that man 1SG.SBJ PRF see=3SG.OBJ EMP
\glt ‘That man, I have even seen him.’

\label{ex:key:517}
\gll \textbf{Dɛ́n}, a nó de pút \textbf{dɛ́n} ínsay.
\gls 3PL.INDP 1SG.SBJ NEG IPFV put 3PL.INDP inside
\glt ‘As for them, I don’t put them inside.’

\label{ex:key:518}
\gll \textbf{Dɛ́n}, \textbf{dɛn} bin de, dɛn bin dɔ́n sabí (...)
\gls 3PL.INDP 3PL PST IPFV 3PL PST PRF know (...)
\glt ‘As for them, they were, they had already found out (...)’

\label{ex:key:519}
\gll \textbf{Mí} dɔ́n sɔ́fa.
\gls 1SG.INDP PRF suffer
\glt ‘I [EMP] have suffered.’

\label{ex:key:520}
\gll A dɔ́n de gládin \textbf{sé} \textbf{a} \textbf{dɔ́n} \textbf{gó}.
\gls 1SG.SBJ PRF IPFV be.glad QUOT 1SG.SBJ PRF go
\glt ‘I was already glad that I was gone.’ or

\label{ex:key:521}
\gll Di bɔ́ks e \textbf{tú} \textbf{évi}.
\gls DEF box 3SG.SBJ too be.heavy
\glt ‘The box (it) is too heavy.’

\label{ex:key:522}
\gll Di strít \textbf{tú} \textbf{dé} wɔwɔ́.
\gls DEF street too BE.LOC ugly
\glt ‘The street is too messed up.’

\label{ex:key:523}
\gll Djunais dɔ́n dríng \textbf{smɔ́l}.
\gls NAME PRF drink a.bit
\glt ‘Djunais has drunk a bit [of alcohol].’

\label{ex:key:524}
\gll Mí \textbf{na} di chíf nɔ́.
\gls 1SG.INDP FOC DEF chief INTJ
\glt ‘I’m the boss, right.’

\label{ex:key:525}
\gll \textbf{Nóto} mecánico.
\gls NEG.FOC mechanic
\glt ‘(He’s) not a mecanic.’

\label{ex:key:526}
\gll Tidé di húman \textbf{dé} \textbf{fáyn}.
\gls today DEF woman BE.LOC fine
\glt ‘Today the woman is fine.’

\label{ex:key:527}
\gll E \textbf{dé} \textbf{na} \textbf{grɔ́n}.
\gls 3SG.SBJ BE.LOC LOC ground
\glt ‘He is [lying] on the ground.’

\label{ex:key:528}
\gll Nó \textbf{láf}!
\gls NEG laugh
\glt ‘Don’t laugh!’

\label{ex:key:529}
\gll \textbf{Una} \textbf{púl} di torí!
\gls 2PL pull DEF story
\glt ‘Tell [PL] the story!’

\label{ex:key:530}
\gll \textbf{Mék} a púl wán smɔ́l torí?
\gls SBJV 1SG.SBJ pull one small story
\glt ‘Should I tell a little story?’

\label{ex:key:531}
\gll \textbf{Wé} e bin dáy só.
\gls SUB 3SG.SBJ PST die like.that
\glt ‘And he died just like that.’

\label{ex:key:532}
\gll Dɛn de \textbf{gí} dɛ́n skúl fɔ training centre.
\gls 3PL IPFV give 3PL.INDP school PREP training centre
\glt ‘They give them classes at a training centre.’

\label{ex:key:533}
\gll Dɛn \textbf{nó} de \textbf{gí} \textbf{nó} nátín.
\gls 3PL NEG IPFV give NEG nothing
\glt ‘They don’t give anything.’

\label{ex:key:534}
\gll Láyf \textbf{nó} \textbf{dé} náw, wɔ́l \textbf{nó} \textbf{dé}.
\gls life NEG BE.LOC now world NEG BE.LOC
\glt ‘[Nowadays] there is no life, there is no (proper) world.’

\label{ex:key:535}
\gll Ho, dán mán \textbf{go} dú vɔ́mit tidé, e \textbf{nó} \textbf{go} slíp.
\gls INTJ that man POT do vomit today 3SG.SBJ NEG POT sleep
\glt ‘That man is going to vomit today, he won’t sleep.’

\label{ex:key:536}
\gll E \textbf{bin} dé na jél.
\gls 3SG.SBJ PST BE.LOC LOC jail
\glt ‘He was in jail.’

\label{ex:key:537}
\gll A \textbf{nó} \textbf{bin} fít ték motó.
\gls 1SG.SBJ NEG PST can take car
\glt ‘I wasn’t able to take a car.’

\label{ex:key:538}
\gll \textbf{Pás} na mákit mɔ́!
\gls pass LOC market again
\glt ‘Pass by the market again!’

\label{ex:key:539}
\gll Nó, wi de conversa, \textbf{nó} \textbf{vɛ́ks} Djunais!
\gls NEG 1PL IPFV converse NEG be.angry NAME
\glt ‘No, we’re (just) conversing, don’t be angry Djunais!’

\label{ex:key:541}
\gll Yu \textbf{dɔ́n} bɔ́n fo pikín, (...)
\gls 2SG PRF give.birth four child (...)
\glt ‘You have given birth to four children, (...)’

\label{ex:key:542}
\gll E \textbf{nɛ́a} \textbf{bɔ́n} pikín.
\gls 3SG.SBJ NEG.PRF give.birth child
\glt ‘She hasn’t given birth to a child yet.’

\label{ex:key:543}
\gll Yu sísta e \textbf{nɔ́ba} máred \textbf{yét}?
\gls 2SG sister 3SG.SBJ NEG.PRF marry yet
\glt ‘Your sister isn’t married yet?’

\label{ex:key:544}
\gll E \textbf{nó} máred \textbf{yét}?
\gls 3SG.SBJ NEG marry yet
\glt ‘She isn’t married yet?’

\label{ex:key:545}
\gll Dɛn \textbf{nó} go fláy na Bata \textbf{mɔ́}.
\gls 3PL NEG POT fly LOC PLACE more
\glt ‘They’re not going to fly to Bata anymore/again.’

\label{ex:key:546}
\gll Náw e dɔ́n dáy \textbf{sɛ́f}.
\gls now 3SG.SBJ PRF die EMP
\glt ‘Now he is even dead.’

\label{ex:key:547}
\gll Ɛ́n, dɛn \textbf{nó} nó \textbf{sɛ́f}.
\gls INTJ 3PL NEG know EMP
\glt ‘Yes, they don’t even know (at all).’

\label{ex:key:548}
\gll Fíba \textbf{nó} sube ín.
\gls fever NEG go.up 3SG.INDP
\glt ‘(The) fever hasn’t risen on him.’

\label{ex:key:549}
\gll \textbf{Mán} \textbf{dɛn} \textbf{nó} de bísin fɔ mék fám mɔ́, yu gó fɔ mákit, \textbf{chɔ́p} \textbf{nó} dé.
\gls man PL NEG IPFV be.busy PREP make farm more 2SG go PREP market food NEG BE.LOC
\glt ‘People don’t care about farming anymore, (if) you go to the market there’s no food.’

\label{ex:key:550}
\gll E sé bueno ás \textbf{nó} \textbf{dɔ́kta} \textbf{nó} de kán sí (...)
\gls 3SG.SBJ QUOT good as NEG doctor NEG IPFV come see (...)
\glt ‘She said, ok, since no doctor is at all coming to see (...)’

\label{ex:key:551}
\gll \textbf{Nó} \textbf{motó} \textbf{nó} dé wé e smát lɛk mi yón.
\gls NEG car NEG BE.LOC SUB 3SG.SBJ be.fast like 1SG.POSS own
\glt ‘There is not a single car that is as fast as mine.’

\label{ex:key:552}
\gll A \textbf{nó} gɛ́t pamáyn.
\gls 1SG.SBJ NEG get oil
\glt ‘I don’t have (any) oil.’

\label{ex:key:553}
\gll \'{I}n go chɔ́p=an, e \textbf{nó} gɛ́t \textbf{nó} problema.
\gls 3SG.INDP POT eat=3SG.OBJ 3SG.SBJ NEG get NEG problem
\glt ‘He [EMP] will eat it, he has no problem whatsoever [with this kind of food].’

\label{ex:key:554}
\gll Sóté a \textbf{nó} tɔ́k \textbf{nó} \textbf{wán} wɔ́d.
\gls until 1SG.SBJ NEG talk NEG one word
\glt ‘Until I didn’t say a single word (anymore).’

\label{ex:key:555}
\gll \textbf{Ni} ín \textbf{ni} in brɔ́da dɛn \textbf{nó} lán.
\gls NEG 3SG.INDP NEG 3SG.POSS brother 3PL NEG learn
\glt ‘Neither he nor his brothers (have) studied.’

\label{ex:key:556}
\gll \textbf{Ni} él \textbf{ni} su hermano han estudiado.
\gls NEG he NEG his brother have studied
\glt ‘Neither he nor his brother has studied.’

\label{ex:key:557}
\gll Mí wánt aks yú \textbf{sɔn} \textbf{tín}.
\gls 1SG.INDP want ask 2SG.INDP some thing
\glt ‘I want to ask you something.’ 

\label{ex:key:559}
\gll Mí \textbf{nó} go tɛ́l=an \textbf{nó} \textbf{nátín}.
\gls 1SG.INDP NEG POT tell=3SG.OBJ NEG nothing
\glt ‘I [EMP] wouldn’t tell him anything.’

\label{ex:key:562}
\gll \textbf{Nó} \textbf{mán} \textbf{nó} blánt yá mɔ́ sɛ́f.
\gls NEG man NEG reside here more EMP
\glt ‘Nobody even lives here anymore.’

\label{ex:key:563}
\gll \textbf{Pɔ́sin} go entiende bɔt e nó dé bien.
\gls person POT understand but 3SG.SBJ NEG BE.LOC good
\glt ‘One would understand, but it doesn’t sound good.’

\label{ex:key:564}
\gll \textbf{Ɔ́l} \textbf{mán} kin lúk=an, yu go sí wi nó go mít nó bɔ́di na hós.
\gls all man HAB look=3SG.OBJ 2SG POT see 1PL NEG POT meet NEG body LOC house
\glt ‘Everybody watches it [the series], you’ll see we won’t meet anybody at home.’

\label{ex:key:565}
\gll \textbf{Ɛ́ni} \textbf{sáy} wé pɔ́sin wánt sidɔ́n, dɛn de sidɔ́n.
\gls every side SUB person want stay 3PL IPFV stay
\glt ‘Everywhere/anywhere people want to stay, they stay.’

\label{ex:key:566}
\gll A \textbf{nó} de gó \textbf{nó} \textbf{sáy}.
\gls 1SG.SBJ NEG IPFV go NEG side
\glt ‘I’m not going anywhere.’

\label{ex:key:567}
\gll \textbf{Sáy} \textbf{nó} dé.
\gls side NEG BE.LOC
\glt ‘There is no space [to sit].’

\label{ex:key:568}
\gll \textbf{Sáy} \textbf{nó} dé fɔ wás hán?
\gls side NEG BE.LOC PREP wash hand
\glt ‘Is there no place to wash (one’s) hands? 

\label{ex:key:569}
\gll Di húman \textbf{ɔ́l} \textbf{tɛ́n} e dé fáyn.
\gls DEF woman all time 3SG.SBJ BE.LOC fine
\glt ‘The woman is always looking fine.’

\label{ex:key:570}
\gll E sé \textbf{nó} \textbf{wán} \textbf{dé} e \textbf{nó} go dú=an mɔ́.
\gls 3SG.SBJ QUOT NEG one day 3SG.SBJ NEG POT do=3SG.OBJ more
\glt ‘He said he would never do it again.’

\label{ex:key:571}
\gll Dán banána, a gí=an \textbf{sɔn}.
\gls that banana 1SG.SBJ give=3SG.OBJ some
\glt ‘That banana, I gave him one.’

\label{ex:key:572}
\gll A \textbf{nó} gɛ́t \textbf{sɔn}.
\gls 1SG.SBJ NEG get some
\glt ‘I don’t have some/any.’

\label{ex:key:573}
\gll \textbf{Nó} \textbf{wán} \textbf{nó} lɛ́f wet mí.
\gls NEG one NEG remain with 1SG.INDP
\glt ‘None (at all) remains with me.’

\label{ex:key:574}
\gll A go tɛ́l=an sé a nó de sɛ́l \textbf{nó} teléfono, \textbf{nó} \textbf{wán}.
\gls 1SG.SBJ POT tell=3SG.OBJ QUOT 1SG.SBJ NEG IPFV sell NEG telephone NEG one
\glt ‘I’ll tell her that I’m not going to sell any telephone, none (at all).’ 

\label{ex:key:575}
\gll \textbf{Nó} tɔ́k \textbf{nó} \textbf{wán} wɔ́d!
\gls NEG talk NEG one word
\glt ‘Don’t say a single word!’

\label{ex:key:576}
\gll \textbf{Nóto} \textbf{ɔ́l} \textbf{húman} fít máred.
\gls NEG.FOC all woman can marry
\glt ‘Not all women can get married.’ 

\label{ex:key:577}
\gll Ɛ́n, \textbf{na} \textbf{tidé} mí híɛ.
\gls INTJ FOC today 1SG.INDP hear
\glt ‘Yes, it’s today that I [EMP] heard (it).’

\label{ex:key:578}
\gll \textbf{Nóto} \textbf{fɔ} \textbf{dán} \textbf{tín} yu de kráy?
\gls FOC PREP that thing 2SG IPFV cry
\glt ‘Is it not because of that that you are crying?’

\label{ex:key:579}
\gll Ɛhɛ́, \textbf{nóto} “e fíba,” na esclavitud, \textbf{nóto} “fíba”.
\gls INTJ NEG.FOC 3SG.SBJ resemble FOC slavery NEG.FOC seem
\glt ‘Yes, not “it resembles (slavery)”, it’s slavery, not “resemble”.’

\label{ex:key:580}
\gll Ɛf \textbf{nóto} \textbf{yu} \textbf{bay}, dán húman go bít yú sóté yu go gó lɛ́f=an.
\gls if NEG.FOC 2SG buy that woman POT beat 2SG.INDP until 2SG POT go leave=3SG.OBJ
\glt ‘If it wasn’t the case that you had bought (it), that woman would beat you until you’d go and leave it there.’

\label{ex:key:581}
\gll \textbf{Nóto} \textbf{sé} na hɔ́s dɛn fɔ fɔ́s tɛ́n wé dɛn strɔ́n, e fɔ dɔ́n fɔdɔ́n.
\gls NEG.FOC QUOT FOC house PL PREP first time SUB 3PL be.strong 3SG.SBJ PREP PRF fall
\glt ‘(If) it wasn’t the case that they were houses of the past that are strong, it would have already collapsed.’

\label{ex:key:582}
\gll Yu wánt de \textbf{gó}?
\gls 2SG want IPFV go
\glt ‘Do you want to go?’

\label{ex:key:583}
\gll Yu nó=an \textbf{ɛ́n}?
\gls 2SG know=3SG.OBJ INTJ
\glt ‘You know her, right?’

\label{ex:key:585}
\gll Yu sí \textbf{údat} \textbf{dɛn}?
\gls 2SG see who PL
\glt ‘Who [plural] did you see?’ 

\label{ex:key:586}
\gll Yu sí \textbf{ús=pɔ́sin} \textbf{dɛn}?
\gls 2SG see Q=person PL
\glt ‘Who [plural] did you see?’ 

\label{ex:key:587}
\gll Quién-\textbf{es} son?
\gls WHO-PL are
\glt ‘Who are they?’

\label{ex:key:588}
\gll Na \textbf{údat} \textbf{in} \textbf{búk} dís?
\gls FOC who 3SG.POSS book this
\glt ‘Whose book (is) this?’

\label{ex:key:589}
\gll \textbf{\'{U}dat} \textbf{wet} \textbf{wétin} de hambɔ́g yú?
\gls who with what IPFV bother 2SG.INDP
\glt ‘Who and what is bothering you?’

\label{ex:key:590}
\gll \textbf{\'{U}s=sáy} \textbf{wet} \textbf{háw} yu de wás?
\gls Q=side with how 2SG IPFV wash
\glt ‘Where and how are you washing?’ 

\label{ex:key:591}
\gll \textbf{Na} \textbf{údat} hambɔ́g dɛ́n?
\gls FOC who bother 3PL.INDP
\glt ‘Who bothered them?’ 

\label{ex:key:592}
\gll \textbf{\'{U}s=tín} yu tɔ́k mɔ́ sɛ́f?
\gls Q=thing 2SG talk again EMP
\glt ‘What did you say again?’

\label{ex:key:593}
\gll \textbf{Na} \textbf{ús=káyn} \textbf{tín} dɛn \textbf{ték} mék dís, digamos dí bɔ́tul?
\gls FOC Q=kind thing 3PL take make this let’s.say this bottle
\glt ‘What’s, let’s say this bottle, made of?’

\label{ex:key:594}
\gll \textbf{Wétin} yu wánt sabí \textbf{fɔ}?
\gls what 2SG want know PREP
\glt ‘What do you want to know for?’

\label{ex:key:595}
\gll \textbf{\'{U}s=mán} yu bin de tɔ́k \textbf{wet} yɛ́stadé?
\gls Q=man 2SG PST IPFV talk with yesterday
\glt ‘Who were you talking with yesterday?’

\label{ex:key:596}
\gll \textbf{\'{U}s=béd} yu kin slíp \textbf{pan}?
\gls Q=bed 2SG HAB sleep on
\glt ‘Which bed do you usually sleep on?’

\label{ex:key:597}
\gll Yu tɔ́k sé Pancho de yús \textbf{údat} \textbf{in} \textbf{motó}?
\gls 2SG talk QUOT NAME IPFV use who 3SG.POSS car
\glt ‘You said that Pancho uses whose car?’

\label{ex:key:598}
\gll \textbf{\'{U}s=tín} yu tɔ́k sé yu wánt \textbf{sabí}?
\gls Q=thing 2SG talk QUOT 2SG want know
\glt ‘What did you say you wanted to know?’

\label{ex:key:599}
\gll A go púl=an na mi yáy \textbf{sé} \textbf{wétin}?
\gls 1SG.SBJ POT remove=3SG.OBJ LOC 1SG.POSS eye QUOT what
\glt ‘I would remove it [the pair of sunglasses] from my eyes for what?’

\label{ex:key:600}
\gll \textbf{Wétin} yu wánt \textbf{nó}?
\gls what 2SG want know
\glt ‘What do you want to know?’

\label{ex:key:601}
\gll Yu wánt \textbf{nó} \textbf{wétin}?
\gls 2SG want know what
\glt ‘You want to know what?’

\label{ex:key:602}
\gll \textbf{Na} \textbf{údat} \textbf{in} \textbf{motó} Pancho de yús?
\gls FOC who 3SG.POSS car NAME IPFV use
\glt ‘It’s whose car Pancho is using?’

\label{ex:key:603}
\gll \textbf{Na} \textbf{údat} gɛ́t dís búk?
\gls FOC who get this book
\glt ‘Who possesses this book?’

\label{ex:key:604}
\gll Ɛhɛ́, dán wán min sé \textbf{ús=wán} na di escala?
\gls exactly that one mean QUOT Q=one LOC DEF scale
\glt ‘Exactly, that means which one [of the two] is the scale?’

\label{ex:key:605}
\gll \textbf{\'{U}s=wán} na in ném?
\gls Q=one FOC 3SG.POSS NAME
\glt ‘What’s his name?’

\label{ex:key:606}
\gll E bíg \textbf{pás} \textbf{údat}?
\gls 3SG.SBJ big pass who
\glt ‘He is bigger than who?’

\label{ex:key:607}
\gll Dɛn kɛ́r di motó \textbf{gó} \textbf{ús=sáy}?
\gls 3PL carry DEF car go where
\glt ‘Where did they take the car to?’

\label{ex:key:608}
\gll \textbf{Na} \textbf{údat} dí bɔ́y bíg \textbf{pás}?
\gls FOC who this boy big pass
\glt ‘Who is this boy bigger than?’

\label{ex:key:609}
\gll \textbf{\'{U}s=sáy} yu de kɛ́r di motó \textbf{gó}?
\gls Q=side 2SG IPFV carry DEF car go
\glt ‘Where are you taking the car to?’

\label{ex:key:610}
\gll \textbf{\'{U}s=káyn} plɛ́nk dɛn \textbf{ték} bíl di hós?
\gls Q=kind board 3PL take build DEF house
\glt ‘What (kind of) board did they build the house with?’

\label{ex:key:611}
\gll Na \textbf{wet} \textbf{ús=tín} dɛn \textbf{ték} bíl di hós?
\gls FOC with Q=thing 3PL take build DEF house
\glt ‘With what did they build the house?’

\label{ex:key:613}
\gll Dɛn \textbf{ték} stón \textbf{bíl} \textbf{ús=káyn} \textbf{hós}?
\gls 3PL take stone build Q=kind house
\glt ‘Which house did they build of stone?’

\label{ex:key:614}
\gll \textbf{Wích} \textbf{mán} dɛn bin kíl na kwáta?
\gls which man 3PL PST kill LOC quarter
\glt ‘Which man was killed in (our) quarter?’

\label{ex:key:615}
\gll \textbf{\'{U}s=mán} dɛn kíl na kwáta?
\gls Q=man 3PL kill LOC quarter
\glt ‘Which man/who was killed in our quarter?’

\label{ex:key:616}
\gll \textbf{\'{U}s=nɔ́mba} yu gɛ́t fɔ dán móvil?
\gls which=number 2SG get PREP that mobile
\glt ‘Which number do you have in that mobile phone?’

\label{ex:key:617}
\gll \textbf{\'{U}s=nésɔn}?
\gls which=nation
\glt ‘Which people [does he belong to]?’

\ea{\label{ex:key:618a}
\gll E kin kúk súp.
\gls 3SG.SBJ HAB cook soup
\glt ‘He usually cooks soup.’

\label{ex:key:618b}
\gll \textbf{\'{U}s=káyn} súp?
\gls Q=kind soup
\glt ‘Which (kind of) soup?’

\label{ex:key:619}
\gll Sé papá gɔ́d \textbf{ús=káyn} trɔ́bul dís?
\gls QUOT father God Q=kind trouble this
\glt ‘(I said) God, what (kind of) trouble (is) this?’

\label{ex:key:620}
\gll \'{A}fta a nó sabí \textbf{ús=káyn} tín kán pás.
\gls then 1SG.SBJ NEG know Q=kind thing PFV pass
\glt ‘Then, I don’t know what happened.’ 

\label{ex:key:621}
\gll Yu nó wet \textbf{ús=káyn} tín dɛn mék dís tín?
\gls 2SG know with Q=kind thing 3PL make this thing
\glt ‘Do you know with what this is made?’

\label{ex:key:622}
\gll \textbf{\'{U}s=tɛ́n} yu rích?
\gls Q=time 2SG arrive
\glt ‘When [which time/day/month/year] did you arrive?'

\label{ex:key:623}
\gll \textbf{\'{U}s=dé} yu kán yá?
\gls Q=day 2SG come here
\glt ‘When [on which day] did you come here?’

\label{ex:key:624}
\gll \textbf{\'{U}s=mún} yu de gó?
\gls Q=month 2SG IPFV go
\glt ‘When [in which month] are you going?’

\label{ex:key:625}
\gll \textbf{\'{U}s=hía} yu bɔ́n?
\gls Q=year 2SG be.born
\glt ‘When [in which year] were you born?’

\label{ex:key:626}
\gll \textbf{\'{U}s=áwa} yu rích?
\gls Q=hour 2SG reach
\glt ‘When [at what period of the day, at what time] did you arrive?’

\label{ex:key:627}
\gll \textbf{\'{U}s=sáy} yu kɔmɔ́t?
\gls Q=side 2SG come.out
\glt ‘Where do you come from?’

\label{ex:key:628}
\gll \textbf{\'{U}s=pát} yu kɔmɔ́t?
\gls Q=part 2SG come.out
\glt ‘Where do you come from?’ or ‘Which place do you come from?’

\label{ex:key:629}
\gll Na \textbf{ús=káyn} \textbf{stáyl} yu ték kán na yá?
\gls FOC Q=kind style 2SG take come LOC here
\glt ‘By which means did you come here?’

\label{ex:key:630}
\gll \textbf{\'{U}s=káyn} \textbf{stáyl} yu rích yá?
\gls Q=kind style 2SG reach here
\glt ‘By which means did you get here?’

\label{ex:key:631}
\gll \textbf{Háw} e bin só, \textbf{háw} e bigín, \textbf{háw} e salút yú?
\gls how 3SG.SBJ PST show how 3SG.SBJ begin how 3SG.SBJ greet 2SG.INDP
\glt ‘How did he show [respect], how did he begin, how did he greet you?’

\label{ex:key:632}
\gll \textbf{Háw} yu sabí sé na rubio?
\gls how 2SG know QUOT FOC blond
\glt ‘How do you know it’s light?’

\label{ex:key:633}
\gll \textbf{Háw} \textbf{mɔ́ch} dís sɔ́t \textbf{kɔ́s}?
\gls how much this shirt cost
\glt ‘How much did this shirt cost?’

\label{ex:key:634}
\gll \textbf{Háw} \textbf{mɔ́ch} \textbf{lɔ́n}?
\gls how much be.long
\glt ‘How long?’

\label{ex:key:635}
\gll \textbf{Háw} \textbf{mɔ́ch} dí tín \textbf{évi}?
\gls how much this thing be.heavy
\glt ‘How heavy is this thing?’

\label{ex:key:636}
\gll Yu bin sté \textbf{háw} \textbf{mɔ́ch} \textbf{dé}?
\gls 2SG PST stay how much day
\glt ‘How many days did you stay?’

\label{ex:key:637}
\gll \textbf{Háw} \textbf{mɔ́ch} \textbf{wɔtá} yu wánt?
\gls how much water 2SG want
\glt ‘How much water do you want?’

\label{ex:key:638}
\gll \textbf{Háw} \textbf{mɔ́ch} \textbf{pikín} de gó na dán skúl?
\gls how much child IPFV go LOC that school
\glt ‘How many children go to that school.’

\label{ex:key:639}
\gll \textbf{Wétin} yu nó de wók tidé?
\gls what 2SG NEG IPFV work today
\glt ‘Why [how come] come you’re not working today?’

\label{ex:key:640}
\gll \textbf{Háw} mosquito nó \textbf{go} bɛ́t=an?
\gls how mosquito NEG POT bite=3SG.OBJ
\glt ‘Why wouldn’t mosquitos bite him [since you have removed the mosquito net]?’

\label{ex:key:641}
\gll \textbf{Háw} yu \textbf{go} dé yu nó gɛ́t pikín?
\gls how 2SG POT BE.LOC 2SG NEG get child
\glt ‘How would you be [live like] without having children [what a ridiculous thing to demand]?’

\label{ex:key:642}
\gll \textbf{Fɔ} \textbf{wétin} yu nó de wók tidé?
\gls PREP what 2SG NEG IPFV work today
\glt ‘Why aren’t you working today?’

\label{ex:key:643}
\gll \textbf{Na} \textbf{wet} \textbf{ús=tín} in pikín dáy, ús=sík?
\gls FOC with Q=thing 3SG.POSS child die Q=sickness
\glt ‘Due to what did his child die, which sickness?’ 

\label{ex:key:644}
\gll \textbf{Na} \textbf{fɔséka} \textbf{ús=tín} in pikín dáy?
\gls FOC due.to Q=thing 3SG.POSS child die
\glt ‘Why did his child die?’ 

\label{ex:key:645}
\gll \textbf{Fɔséka} in pikín dáy?
\gls due.to 3SG.POSS child die
\glt ‘Due to (what) did his child die?’

\label{ex:key:646}
\gll \textbf{Wétin} \textbf{mék} yu nó de wók tidé?
\gls what make 2SG NEG IPFV work today
\glt ‘How come you aren’t working today?’

\label{ex:key:647}
\gll \textbf{Wétin} \textbf{mék} dá wán, ɛ́n?
\gls what make that one INTJ
\glt ‘What causes that?’

\label{ex:key:648}
\gll \textbf{Wétin} \textbf{mék} \textbf{sé} yu nó wók tidé?
\gls what make QUOT 2SG NEG work today
\glt ‘How come you didn’t work today?’

\label{ex:key:649}
\gll \textbf{\'{U}s=tín} \textbf{de} \textbf{mék} \textbf{sé} \textbf{mék} yu nó wók tidé?
\gls Q=thing IPFV make QUOT SBJV 2SG NEG work today
\glt ‘What is causing you not to work today?’ 

\ea{\label{ex:key:650a}
\gll Náw yu fít dríng=an nɔ́?
\gls now 2SG can drink=3SG.OBJ INTJ
\glt ‘Now, you’re able to drink it, right?’

\ex{\label{ex:key:650b}
\gll Náw so, \textbf{yɛ́s}, a fít dríng=an fáyn.
\gls now like.that yes 1SG.SBJ can drink=3SG.OBJ fine
\glt ‘Now, I’m able to drink it [milk] well.’ 

\ea{\label{ex:key:651a}
\gll So yu \textbf{nó} go chɔ́p?
\gls so 2SG NEG POT eat
\glt ‘So you won’t eat?’

\ex{\label{ex:key:651b}
\gll \textbf{Yɛ́s}.
\gls yes
\glt ‘No (I won’t eat).’

\ea{\label{ex:key:652a}
\gll Yu go chɔ́p?
\gls 2SG POT eat
\glt ‘Will you eat?’

\ex{\label{ex:key:652b}
\gll \textbf{Nó}.
\gls NEG
\glt ‘No (I won’t eat).’

\label{ex:key:653}
\gll So yu \textbf{nó} go kán?
\gls so 2SG NEG POT eat
\glt ‘So you won’t come?’

\label{ex:key:654}
\gll Yu de fíl hɔ́t \textbf{nɔ́}?
\gls 2SG IPFV feel hot INTJ
\glt ‘You’re feeling hot, aren’t you?'

\label{ex:key:655}
\gll \textbf{Nɔ́}, nó tɔ́k ɛ́n!
\gls INTJ NEG talk INTJ
\glt ‘No, don’t talk [and call into question the truth of my story].’

\ea{\label{ex:key:656a}
\gll Dɛn tɛ́l=an sé “\textbf{nóto} só.”
\gls 3PL tell=3SG.OBJ QUOT NEG.FOC like.that
\glt ‘They said to her “that’s not how it was”.‘

\label{ex:key:657}
\gll Na yú chɔ́p dí tín?
\gls FOC 2SG.INDP eat this thing
\glt ‘Did you eat this (thing)?’

}\ex{\label{ex:key:657b}
\gll \textbf{Nó} \textbf{wán} \textbf{dé}, nóto mi.
\gls NEG one day NEG.FOC 1SG.INDP
\glt ‘Never, it’s not me.’

\label{ex:key:658}
\gll Yu go kán wet mí?
\gls 2SG POT come with 1SG.INDP
\glt ‘Will you come with me?’

\ex{\label{ex:key:658b}
\gll \textbf{Nó} \textbf{wé}, a nó go kán.
\gls NEG way 1SG.SBJ NEG POT come
\glt ‘No way, I won’t come.’ 

\label{ex:key:659}
\gll Dɛn dɔ́n gí yu di mɔní?
\gls 3PL PRF give 2SG DEF money
\glt ‘Have they given you the money?’

}\ex{\label{ex:key:659b}
\gll \textbf{\'{U}s=sáy}?
\gls Q=side
\glt ‘Where? [not at all]’

\label{ex:key:660}
\gll Yu nó go dú=an fɔ mí?
\gls 2SG NEG POT do=3SG.OBJ PREP 1SG.INDP
\glt ‘Won’t you do it for me?’

\ex{\label{ex:key:660b}
\gll \textbf{Kɔmɔ́t} \textbf{dé}!
\gls go.out there
\glt ‘Get lost!’

\label{ex:key:661}
\gll \'{U}s=wán na in ném?
\gls Q=one FOC 3SG.POSS name
\glt ‘What’s his name?’

\ex{\label{ex:key:661b}
\gll Nguema Mba.
\gls NAME NAME
\glt ‘Nguema Mba’

\label{ex:key:662}
\gll Dán gál e kin fíks in \textbf{sɛ́f}, pént in \textbf{sɛ́f}.
\gls that girl 3SG.SBJ HAB fix 3SG.POSS self paint 3SG.POSS self
\glt `That girl, she usually does herself up, paints herself [puts on make-up].’

\ea{\label{ex:key:663a}
\gll Dán mán e bin kán gó na jél lɔ́n tɛ́n.
\gls that man 3SG.SBJ PST PFV go LOC jail long time
\glt ‘That man, he went to jail long ago.’

}\ex{\label{ex:key:663b}
\gll Náw e dɔ́n dáy \textbf{sɛ́f}.
\gls now 3SG.SBJ PRF die EMP
\glt ‘Now he is even dead.’

\label{ex:key:664}
\gll Wé di bɔ́y in \textbf{sɛ́f}, wé e sí mí, estaba contento.
\gls SUB DEF boy 3SG.POSS self SUB 3SG.SBJ see 1SG.INDP he.was content
\glt ‘And the boy himself, when he saw me, he was content.’

\label{ex:key:665}
\gll \'{I}n \textbf{sɛ́f} gó na baf-rúm e wás.
\gls 3SG.INDP EMP go LOC bath-room 3SG.SBJ wash
\glt ‘He (by) himself went to the bathroom (and) washed.’

\label{ex:key:666}
\gll Yu nó \textbf{sɛ́f}, yu jɔ́s kán, yu nó go sabí.
\gls 2SG know EMP 2SG just come 2SG NEG POT know
\glt ‘Even (if) you know, if you’ve just come, you won’t know.’

\label{ex:key:667}
\gll Mí \textbf{sɛ́f} dɔ́n rích Cotonou.
\gls 1SG.INDP EMP PRF arrive PLACE
\glt ‘I myself have been to Cotonou (too).’

\label{ex:key:668}
\gll Dí wán, \textbf{yú} \textbf{sénwe} yu de gó.
\gls this one 2SG.INDP EMP 2SG IPFV go
\glt ‘This time, you yourself are going [to die].’

\label{ex:key:669}
\gll Bata tɔ́ng \textbf{ó}.
\gls PLACE tongue SP
\glt ‘That’s the Fang language for you [see how peculiar it is].’ 

\label{ex:key:670}
\gll \MakeUppercase{A} bin dɔ́n, a bin dɔ́n blánt fɔ Gabón \textbf{ó}.
\gls 1SG.SBJ PST PRF 1SG.SBJ PST PRF reside PREP Gabon SP
\glt ‘I’ve already, I’ve already lived in Gabon [contrary to what you think].’

\label{ex:key:671}
\gll Djunais, yu badhát \textbf{ɛ́n}.
\gls NAME 2SG be.mean INTJ
\glt ‘Djunais you‘re really mean.’

\label{ex:key:672}
\gll Fresco \textbf{ɛ́n}, dɛn de gí wí.
\gls fresh INTJ 3PL IPFV give 1PL.INDP
\glt ‘Fresh, (that’s how) they would give (it) to us.’

\label{ex:key:673}
\gll Na Trinidad \textbf{sɛ́f} nɔ́?
\gls LOC PLACE EMP INTJ
\glt ‘Even in Trinidad, right?’

\label{ex:key:674}
\gll Ɛf e de gó yu se supone que e de fáyn na yu skin \textbf{sɛ́f}.
\gls if 3SG.SBJ IPFV go 2SG REFL assume that 3SG.SBJ IPFV fine LOC 2SG body EMP
\glt ‘If it goes well with you, it’s assumed that it looks nice on you(r body).’

\ea{\label{ex:key:675a}
\gll Bɔt dán káyn mamá dɛn \textbf{sɛ́f}.
\gls but that kind mother PL EMP
\glt ‘But these kinds of mother, really.’

\label{ex:key:676}
\gll Wé a dɔ́n jɔ́ch dɛ́n, a sé “\textbf{tumɔ́ro} \textbf{sénwe} a de gó mít in mán”.
\gls SUB 1SG.SBJ PRF judge 3PL.INDP 1SG.SBJ QUOT tomorrow EMP 1SG.SBJ IPFV go meet 3SG.POSS man
\glt ‘When I had talked them down, I said “tomorrow, I’m going to meet her husband”.’

\label{ex:key:677}
\gll E lúk di análisis, tiene paludismo de una cruz \textbf{wé} kin kíl pikín \textbf{sɛ́f}.
\gls 3SG.SBJ look DEF analysis he.has malaria of one cross SUB HAB kill child EMP
\glt ‘She [the doctor] looked at the analysis “he has malaria of one cross which even kills children”.’

\label{ex:key:678}
\gll Bikɔs dɛn tɔ́k \textbf{sé} na paludismo \textbf{ó}.
\gls because 3PL talk QUOT FOC malaria SP
\glt ‘Because they said that it’s malaria.’

\label{ex:key:679}
\gll Tú pípul \textbf{sɛ́f} wet wán pikín dɔ́n kán \textbf{ó}.
\gls two people EMP with one child PRF come SP
\glt ‘Even two people and one child have come.’

\label{ex:key:680}
\gll A bin wánt tɔ́k dán “convence” dé sɛ́f na Pichi \textbf{sénwe}, a nó de mɛ́mba.
\gls 1SG.SBJ PST want talk that convince there EMP LOC Pichi EMP 1SG.SBJ NEG IPFV remember
\glt ‘I had actually wanted to say that “convence” there in Pichi itself (but) I don’t remember [how to say it].’

\label{ex:key:681}
\gll Nó mán \textbf{nó} blánt yá mɔ́ \textbf{sɛ́f}.
\gls NEG man NEG reside here more EMP
\glt ‘Nobody even lives here anymore.’

\label{ex:key:682}
\gll \textbf{Mí} wánt dán mán?
\gls 1SG.INDP want that man
\glt ‘Do I [EMP] want that man?’

\label{ex:key:683}
\gll \'{A}fta in \textbf{papá} \textbf{sɛ́f} kán ték=an.
\gls then 3SG.POSS father EMP come take=3SG.OBJ
\glt ‘Then her father came to take her.’

\label{ex:key:684}
\gll \'{A}fta e nóto, e nó fáyn fɔ di pikín \textbf{sɛ́f}.
\gls then 3SG.SBJ NEG.FOC 3SG.SBJ NEG fine PREP DEF child EMP
\glt ‘Then it’s not, it’s not good for the child itself.’

\label{ex:key:685}
\gll Mí nó sabí us mán dɛn kíl, a nɔ́ba hía dán torí \textbf{sɛ́f}.
\gls 1SG.INDP NEG know which man 3PL kill 1SG.SBJ NEG.PRF hear that story EMP
\glt ‘I don’t know who was killed, I haven’t even heard that story yet.’

\label{ex:key:686}
\gll Lagos \textbf{sɛ́f}, e gɛ́t di sáy wé na di húman dɛn de máred di mán.
\gls PLACE EMP 3SG.SBJ get DEF side SUB FOC DEF woman PL IPFV marry DEF man
\glt ‘Even in Lagos, there is a place where it’s the women (who) marry the men.’

\label{ex:key:687}
\gll \'{A}fta di róp \textbf{sɛ́f}, wi nó sí nó mán wé e híb=\textbf{an}.
\gls then DEF rope EMP 1PL NEG see NEG man SUB 3SG.SBJ throw=3SG.OBJ
\glt ‘And the rope, we didn’t see anybody who threw it.’

\label{ex:key:688}
\gll \textbf{Mi} \textbf{sɛ́f}, ɔ́l pɔ́sin dɛn kin áks mi sé ‘yu dɔ́n bɔ́n?’
\gls 1SG.INDP EMP all person 3PL HAB ask 1SG.INDP QUOT 2SG PRF give.birth
\glt ‘Even me, everybody asks me “have you given birth [do you have a child]?”'

\label{ex:key:689}
\gll A go wás=an wet mi hán \textbf{mí} \textbf{sénwe}.
\gls 1SG.SBJ POT wash=3SG.OBJ with 1SG.POSS hand 1SG.INDP EMP
\glt ‘I myself would wash it with my hand.’

\label{ex:key:690}
\gll \'{A}fta \textbf{na} dán tɛ́n {\emptyset} a kán gó na Alemania.
\gls then FOC that time SUB 1SG.SBJ PFV go LOC PLACE
\glt ‘So it’s THAT TIME that I went to Germany.’

\label{ex:key:691}
\gll Sé pero mán mi brɔ́da dát, ús=tín e de dú na yá, \textbf{nóto} \textbf{ín} wi bɛ́r=\textbf{an}?
\gls QUOT but man 1SG.POSS brother that Q=thing 3SG.SBJ IPFV do LOC here NEG.FOC 3SG.INDP 1PL bury=3SG.OBJ
\glt ‘But man, that’s my brother, what’s he doing here, isn’t it him that we buried?’

\label{ex:key:692}
\gll \textbf{Es} \textbf{que} e fáyn wé yu nó sabí sé e kɔmɔ́t fɔ di animal.
\gls it.is that 3SG.SBJ fine SUB 2SG NEG know QUOT 3SG.SBJ come.out PREP DEF animal
\glt ‘It’s that it is fine when you don’t know that it [the milk] has just come out of the animal.’

\ea{\label{ex:key:693a}
\gll Dɛn táy=an.
\gls 3PL tie=3SG.OBJ
\glt ‘They’ve tied it [that’s why it’s barking].’

\ea{\label{ex:key:694a}
\gll Nó mete mí ínsay dí tɔ́k a bɛ́g!
\gls NEG put 1SG.INDP inside this talk 1SG.SBJ ask.for
\glt ‘Don’t involve me in this matter, please!’

\label{ex:key:695}
\gll \'{U}dat de hala-hála só?
\gls who IPFV RED.CPD-shout like.that
\glt ‘Who is shouting around like that?’

\label{ex:key:696}
\gll Di húman \textbf{na} strɔ́n húman.
\gls DEF woman FOC strong woman
\glt ‘The woman is a strong woman.’

\ea{\label{ex:key:697a}
\gll Dɛn sɛ́n di bɔ́l.
\gls 3PL send DEF ball
\glt ‘The ball was thrown.’

}\ex{\label{ex:key:697b}
\gll \textbf{Na} pɔ́sin {\emptyset} sɛ́n di bɔ́l.
\gls FOC person SUB send DEF ball
\glt ‘It’s a person/somebody who threw the ball.’

\ea{\label{ex:key:698a}
\gll Háw yu kin kɔ́l=an wé pɔ́sin de siente vergüenza?
\gls how 2SG HAB call=3SG.OBJ SUB person IPFV feel shame
\glt ‘How do you call it, when a person feels ashamed?’

\label{ex:key:699}
\gll \textbf{\'{I}n} \textbf{na} wán mán \textbf{wé} de plé wet di bɔ́l.
\gls 3SG.INDP FOC one man SUB IPFV play with DEF ball
\glt ‘(He/that’s) a man who is playing with the ball.’ 

\label{ex:key:701}
\gll \textbf{Na} Nguema Mba bin gí mí dán beca \textbf{sɛ́f}.
\gls FOC NAME NAME PST give 1SG.INDP that scholarship EMP
\glt ‘It’s Nguema Mba (who) actually gave me that scholarship.’

\label{ex:key:702}
\gll \textbf{Na} \textbf{wán} \textbf{smɔ́l} \textbf{híl} e klém.
\gls FOC one small hill 3SG.SBJ climb
\glt ‘It’s a small hill that he climbed.’

\label{ex:key:703}
\gll Wé wi smɔ́l, \textbf{na} \textbf{sósó} \textbf{Píchi} wé wi de tɔ́k.
\gls SUB 1PL be.small FOC only Pichi SUB 1PL IPFV talk
\glt ‘When we were small, it’s only Pichi that we would talk.’

\label{ex:key:704}
\gll Sí, \textbf{na} \textbf{só} mí sɛ́f kin dé.
\gls see FOC like.that 1SG.INDP EMP HAB BE.LOC
\glt ‘See, it’s like that that I’m also usually like.’

\label{ex:key:705}
\gll \textbf{Na} \textbf{dé} e de gó, yu nó dé?
\gls FOC there 3SG.SBJ IPFV go 2SG know there
\glt ‘It’s there that she’s going, you know there [that place]?’

\label{ex:key:706}
\gll E de wáka rɔn-sáy, \textbf{na} \textbf{rɔn-sáy} e wáka.
\gls 3SG.SBJ IPFV walk wrong-side FOC wrong.CPD-side 3SG.SBJ walk
\glt ‘He is walking backwards, it’s backwards that he walked.’

\label{ex:key:707}
\gll E sé e kɔmɔ́t fá, \textbf{na} \textbf{fá} e kɔmɔ́t.
\gls 3SG.SBJ QUOT 3SG.SBJ come.out far FOC far 3SG.SBJ come.out
\glt ‘He said he came from far away, it’s far away that he was from.’

\label{ex:key:708}
\gll \textbf{Na} \textbf{wet} \textbf{ús=tín} dɛn bíl=an?
\gls FOC with Q=thing 3PL build=3SG.OBJ
\glt ‘It’s with what that it was built?’

\label{ex:key:709}
\gll \textbf{Na} \textbf{fɔ} \textbf{dán} \textbf{área} wi sté.
\gls FOC PREP that area 1PL stay
\glt ‘It’s in that area that we stay.’

\label{ex:key:710}
\gll Wé yu dɔ́n de nák, \textbf{na} \textbf{sé} yu wánt sɔn tín e \textbf{brók}, \textbf{mék} e krás, \textbf{mék} e \textbf{destroza}.
\gls SUB 2SG PRF IPFV hit FOC QUOT 2SG want some thing 3SG.SBJ break SBJV 3SG.SBJ crash SBJV 3SG.SBJ destroy
\glt ‘When you’re hitting, it’s that you want a thing to break, to crash, to be destroyed.’

\label{ex:key:711}
\gll E de kráy pero \textbf{nóto} \textbf{sé} e wánt chɔ́p.
\gls 3SG.SBJ IPFV cry but NEG.FOC QUOT 3SG.SBJ want eat
\glt ‘He is crying but it’s not the he wants to eat.’

\label{ex:key:712}
\gll \textbf{Ɛf} \textbf{nóto} yu báy dán húman go bít yú sóté yu go gó lɛ́f=an.
\gls if NEG.FOC 2SG buy that woman POT beat 2SG.INDP until 2SG POT go leave=3SG.OBJ
\glt ‘If it’s not that [the correct type] you’ve bought, that woman would beat you until you would go return it.’

\label{ex:key:713}
\gll \textbf{Es} \textbf{que} está bien usar el subjuntivo.
\gls It’s that it.is good use the subjunctive
\glt ‘It’s that it’s good to use the subjunctive (mood).’

\label{ex:key:714}
\gll Entonces \textbf{dí} \textbf{káyn} \textbf{pikín}, \textbf{es} \textbf{que} normalmente e go tɛ́l yú dán tín, (...)
\gls so this kind child it.is that normally 3SG.SBJ POT tell 2SG.INDP that thing (...)
\glt So this kind of child, it’s that usually it will tell you exactly that (...)’ 

\label{ex:key:715}
\gll \textbf{Es} \textbf{que} \textbf{na} \textbf{dán} \textbf{klém} \textbf{wé} e de klém, e de gó e de klém.
\gls it.is that FOC that climb SUB 3SG.SBJ IPFV climb 3SG.SBJ IPFV go 3SG.SBJ IPFV climb
\glt ‘It’s that in that climb that she’s climbing, she’s just climbing along.’

\label{ex:key:716}
\gll Bɛt e fíba sé \textbf{wán} dé wé \textbf{na} \textbf{ín} de púl di ɔ́da wán di torí.
\gls but 3SG.SBJ resemble QUOT one BE.LOC SUB FOC 3SG.INDP IPFV pull DEF other one DEF story
\glt ‘But it seems that one is there that it’s him who is telling the other one a story.’ 

\label{ex:key:717}
\gll Na frɔn in hós, \textbf{na} \textbf{dé} yu go ték máred.
\gls FOC from 3SG.POSS house FOC there 2SG POT take marry
\glt ‘It’s from her house, it’s there that you’d enter marriage.’

\label{ex:key:718}
\gll Di sáy wé mɔní dé, \textbf{na} \textbf{dé} yu gɛ́fɔ gó.
\gls DEF side SUB money BE.LOC FOC there 2SG have.to go
\glt ‘The place where there’s money, that’s where you have to go.’

\label{ex:key:719}
\gll A los quince años, \textbf{na} \textbf{yá} e kán.
\gls at DEF.PL fifteen years FOC here 3SG.SBJ come
\glt ‘With exactly fifteen years, that’s when she came.’

\label{ex:key:720}
\gll \textbf{Na} \textbf{dé} dán, dán kandá, dán tín, dán membrano, na dé e kɔmɔ́t.
\gls FOC there that that skin that thing that membrane FOC there 3SG.SBJ go.out
\glt ‘That’s when that, that skin, that thing, that membrane, that’s when it came out.’

\label{ex:key:721}
\gll Na di fáyn chɔ́p, \textbf{na} \textbf{ín} de stáwt=an.
\gls FOC DEF fine food FOC 3SG.INDP IPFV make.corpulent=3SG.OBJ
\glt ‘It’s the good food, that’s what’s making her corpulent.’

\label{ex:key:722}
\gll Tɛ́l=an sé, nɔ́, dís traje fɔ mono, \textbf{na} \textbf{ín} e wánt.
\gls tell=3SG.OBJ QUOT INTJ this suit PREP overall FOC 3SG.INDP 3SG.SBJ want
\glt ‘(He) told him, no, this overall-like suit, that’s what he wants.’

\label{ex:key:723}
\gll Wé e dɔ́n dé pan di chía, \textbf{na} \textbf{ín} e strét.
\gls SUB 3SG.SBJ PRF BE.LOC on DEF chair FOC 3SG.INDP 3SG.SBJ be.straight
\glt ‘When she was completely on the chair, that’s when she straightened up.’

\label{ex:key:724}
\gll \textbf{Na} \textbf{bikɔs} in abuelo dɔ́n dáy, \textbf{na} \textbf{ín} e de kráy.
\gls FOC because 3SG.POSS grandfather PRF die FOC 3SG.INDP 3SG.SBJ IPFV cry
\glt ‘It’s because his grandfather has died, that’s why he’s crying like that.’

\label{ex:key:725}
\gll \textbf{Na} \textbf{bikɔs} dɛn púl di motó, \textbf{na} \textbf{di} \textbf{tín} \textbf{mék} e chakrá.
\gls FOC because 3PL remove DEF car FOC DEF thing make 3SG.SBJ destroy
\glt ‘It’s because the car was removed, that’s why it got broken.’

\label{ex:key:726}
\gll E sé \textbf{na} mán \textbf{dís}.
\gls 3SG.SBJ QUOT FOC man this
\glt ‘He said “this is a man”.’

\label{ex:key:727}

\gls FOC rope that
\glt ‘That’s a rope.’

\label{ex:key:728}

\gls this one FOC wild.animal
\glt ‘This (one) is a wild animal.’

\label{ex:key:729}

\gls that one FOC breast
\glt ‘That (one) is the breast.’

\label{ex:key:730}

\gls FOC DEF very.good food SUB man IPFV food that
\glt ‘That was the best food that one [I] was eating.’

\label{ex:key:731}
\gll Sé papá gɔ́d \textbf{ús}=\textbf{káyn} trɔ́bul \textbf{dís}?
\gls QUOT father God Q=kind trouble this
\glt ‘(I) said God, what (kind of) trouble (is) this?’

\label{ex:key:732}
\gll \textbf{Na} \textbf{gó} a de \textbf{gó} ó.
\gls FOC go 1SG.SBJ IPFV go SP
\glt ‘[Mind you] I’m going.’

\gll Chico, \textbf{na} \textbf{bíg} e \textbf{bíg}.
\gls boy FOC big 3SG.SBJ big
\glt ‘Oh boy, it’s really big.’

\label{ex:key:735}
\gll Na \textbf{krách}=an yu de \textbf{skrách}.

\glt ‘You’re actually scratching it.’

\glt ‘We actually walked there.’

\gls FOC walk 1PL walk go there
\glt ‘We walked there.’

\glt ‘He really wants to walk right now.’

\label{ex:key:740}

\gls FOC eat/food 3SG.SBJ eat yesterday SP
\glt ‘He really ate yesterday.’ or ‘It’s (really good) food that he ate yesterday.’

\label{ex:key:741}

\glt ‘It’s a hell of a lot of food that he usually eats.’

\label{ex:key:742}

\glt ‘Even this [little Bube that you speak], you’re really making an effort.’

\label{ex:key:743}

\gls now 1SG.SBJ PRF IPFV finish be.ashamed PREP wear that shoe
\glt ‘Now I’m really ashamed to be wearing that (pair of) shoes.’

\label{ex:key:744}
\gll E de para na dán in yáy \textbf{bɔkú} \textbf{bád.}
