\glt ‘It [the white spot in his eye] just sits there in that his eye really bad.’

\label{ex:key:745}

\glt ‘Yes, but he stays far down there.’

\label{ex:key:746}
\gll Dɛn bin \textbf{fáyn} wán \textbf{fáyn} \textbf{ó}.
\gls 3PL PST fine one fine SP
\glt ‘They were really beautiful.’

\label{ex:key:747}

\glt ‘They hit him (hard) in the chest with a thumping sound.’

\label{ex:key:748}

\glt ‘That school is near the cemetery, right?’

\label{ex:key:749}
\gll Wán dé wán pikín bin de sík.

\glt ‘One day, a child was sick.’

\label{ex:key:750}

\glt ‘This cardboard box, did she find it here?’

\label{ex:key:751}

\gls every thing 2SG want remove=3SG.OBJ LOC harbour 2SG IPFV pay
\glt ‘Everything, you want to remove it from the port, you pay [tax].’

\label{ex:key:752}
\gll \textbf{Mí}, lɛk háw yu de sí \textbf{mí}, \textbf{a} dɔ́n sí plɛ́nte tín.
\gls 1SG.INDP like how 2SG IPFV see 1SG.INDP 1SG.SBJ PRF see plenty thing
\glt ‘As for me, as you see me (now), I’ve seen many things (in life).’

\label{ex:key:753}
\gll \textbf{Panyá}, \textbf{na} \textbf{ín} wɔ́s mɔ́.
\gls Spain FOC 3SG.INDP be.very.bad more
\glt ‘As for Spain, that’s what’s really terrible [as a place to live in].’

\label{ex:key:754}
\gll \textbf{Fɔ} \textbf{tɔ́k} \textbf{Píchi}, yu nó níd fɔ gó skúl.
\gls PREP talk Pichi 2SG NEG need PREP go school
\glt ‘In order to talk Pichi, you don’t need to go to school.’

\label{ex:key:755}
\gll Di tín wé bin dé difícil mɔ́ na dí hós, \textbf{fɔ} \textbf{pút} \textbf{nivel}.
\gls DEF thing SUB PST BE.LOC difficult more LOC this house PREP put level
\glt ‘The thing that was most difficult in [building] this house, [was] to level the ground.’

\label{ex:key:756}
\gll \textbf{Náw} e tínap na grɔ́n.
\gls now 3SG.SBJ stand LOC ground
\glt ‘Now it’s standing on the ground.’

\label{ex:key:757}

\gls month now 3SG.SBJ PRF BE English
\glt ‘As for “mɔnt”, it’s already English.’

\label{ex:key:758}
\gll \textbf{Pikín} \textbf{náw}, \textbf{e} nó hád.
\gls child now 3SG.SBJ NEG hard
\glt ‘As for [having] kids, that’s not difficult.’

\label{ex:key:759}
\gll \textbf{Sósó} \textbf{Píchi} \textbf{náw} \textbf{wé} wi de tɔ́k.
\gls only Pichi now SUB 1PL IPFV talk
\glt ‘(It was) only Pichi that we used to talk.’

\label{ex:key:760}
\gll \textbf{Na} \textbf{ín} \textbf{náw} a bin de chɛ́k sé e bin fɔ dé fáyn if a mít wán pɔ́sin (...)
\gls FOC 3SG.INDP now 1SG.SBJ PST IPFV check QUOT 3SG.SBJ PST COND BE.LOC fine if 1SG.SBJ meet one person (...)
\glt ‘That’s why I was thinking it would be fine if I met somebody (...)’ 

\label{ex:key:761}
\gll Dán tín \textbf{na} di pasta.
\gls that thing FOC DEF paste
\glt ‘That thing is the paste.’

\label{ex:key:762}
\gll \'{I}n \textbf{na} kres-húman.
\gls 3SG.INDP FOC be.crazy.CPD-woman
\glt ‘She’s a crazy woman.’

\label{ex:key:763}
\gll Mi papá \textbf{na} dɔ́kta bɔt mí nó go \textbf{tɔ́n} dɔ́kta.
\gls 1SG.POSS father FOC doctor but 1SG.INDP NEG POT turn doctor
\glt ‘My father is a doctor but I won’t become a doctor.’

\label{ex:key:764}
\gll Yɛ́s, mi ném \textbf{na} Djunais.

\glt ‘Yes, my name is Djunais.’

\label{ex:key:765}

\glt ‘It’s then that I came to know that my mother was my mother.’ 

\label{ex:key:766}
\gll \textbf{Na} kasára.
\gls FOC cassava
\glt ‘That’s (a) cassava.’ 

\label{ex:key:767}

\label{ex:key:768}

\glt ‘Her father is Chinese.’

\label{ex:key:769}

\glt ‘I am the only child.’

\label{ex:key:771}
\gll E \textbf{dɔ́n} \textbf{bí} wán señorita.

\glt ‘She has already become a real young lady.’

\label{ex:key:772}
\gll Mí \textbf{go} \textbf{bí} dɔ́kta.
\gls 1SG.INDP POT BE doctor
\glt ‘I’ll be doctor.’

\label{ex:key:773}
\gll Mi ném \textbf{bin} \textbf{bí} Francisca Belobe Toichoa, porque mi mamá in ném \textbf{na} Belobe Toichoa.
\gls 1SG.POSS name PST BE NAME NAME NAME because 1SG.POSS mother 3SG.POSS name FOC NAME NAME
\glt ‘My name was Francicsa Belobe Toichoa because my mother’s name is/was Belobe Toichoa.’

\label{ex:key:774}
\gll So mí, mi yón e \textbf{kán} \textbf{bí} una desgracia.
\gls so 1SG.INDP 1SG.POSS own 3SG.SBJ PFV BE DEF disgrace
\glt ‘So as for me, mine [my matter] came to be a disgrace.’

\label{ex:key:775}
\gll “Kɔ́t” \textbf{fít} bí lɛkɛ herida.
\gls cut can BE like wound
\glt ` “Kɔ́t” can be [mean] like a wound.’

\label{ex:key:776}

\gls SBJV 3SG.SBJ BE.LOC QUOT NAME PRF come
\glt ‘(Please) let it be that Kofí has come.’

\label{ex:key:777}
\gll \textbf{Frɔn} wé a \textbf{bí} pikín a \textbf{bin} wánt kɔmɔ́t na dís kɔ́ntri.
\gls from SUB 1SG.SBJ BE child 1SG.SBJ PST want go.away LOC this country
\glt ‘From when I was a child, I wanted to leave this country.’

\label{ex:key:778}
\gll E \textbf{nó} \textbf{go} \textbf{bí} mecánico.
\gls 3SG.SBJ NEG POT BE mechanic
\glt ‘He won’t be a mechanic.’

\ea{\label{ex:key:779a}
\gll Ebongolo \textbf{dé}?
\gls NAME BE.LOC
\glt ‘Is Ebongolo around/his usual self/fine/alright?’

}\ex{\label{ex:key:779b}
\gll Yɛ́s, e \textbf{dé}.
\gls yes 3SG.SBJ BE.LOC
\glt ‘Yes, he’s here/around/his usual self/fine/alright.’

\label{ex:key:780}
\gll E \textbf{dé} \textbf{na} \textbf{grɔ́n}.
\gls 3SG.SBJ BE.LOC LOC ground
\glt ‘He is [lying] on the ground.’

\label{ex:key:781}
\gll Yu fon \textbf{dé} \textbf{nía} \textbf{tébul}.
\gls 2SG phone BE.LOC near table
\glt ‘Your phone is near the table.’ 

\label{ex:key:782}
\gll \'{A}fta dí wán wé e \textbf{dé} \textbf{yandá}, e bíg.
\gls then this one SUB 3SG.SBJ BE.LOC yonder 3SG.SBJ be.big
\glt ‘Then, that one that’s over there, it’s big.’ 

\label{ex:key:783}
\gll Somos tú dásɔl wé wi \textbf{dé} \textbf{láyf}.
\gls we.are two only SUB 1PL BE.LOC life
\glt ‘We are only two who are alive.’ 

\label{ex:key:784}
\gll Wi \textbf{dé} \textbf{íbin} \textbf{tɛ́n}.
\gls 1PL BE.LOC evening time
\glt ‘It’s evening.’

\label{ex:key:785}
\gll Wi \textbf{dé} \textbf{las} \textbf{dos} \textbf{y} \textbf{media}.
\gls 1PL BE.LOC the.PL two and half
\glt ‘It’s two thirty.’

\label{ex:key:786}
\gll Dán tɛ́n a \textbf{dé} \textbf{fáyn}.
\gls that time 1SG.SBJ BE.LOC fine
\glt ‘That time I was [feeling] fine.’

\label{ex:key:787}
\gll Na \textbf{só} e \textbf{dé}.
\gls FOC like.that 3SG.SBJ BE.LOC
\glt ‘That’s the way it is.’

\label{ex:key:788}
\gll E \textbf{dé} \textbf{ɔ́da} \textbf{stáyl}.
\gls 3SG.SBJ BE.LOC other style
\glt ‘It’s different.’

\label{ex:key:789}
\gll A wánt \textbf{dé} \textbf{lɛk} Miguel Ángel.
\gls 1SG.SBJ want BE.LOC like NAME NAME
\glt ‘I want to be like Miguel Ángel [the way he dresses/acts/looks].’

\label{ex:key:790}
\gll \textbf{Háw} yu go \textbf{dé}, yu nó gɛ́t pikín?
\gls how 2SG POT there 2SG NEG get child
\glt ‘How would you be [feel] (if) you had no child?’

\label{ex:key:791}
\gll Bɔt mí wánt sabí \textbf{háw} dán tín \textbf{dé}.
\gls but 1SG.INDP want know how that thing BE.LOC
\glt ‘But I [EMP] wanted to know how that thing was.’

\label{ex:key:792}
\gll Yu gɛ́fɔ lɛ́f=an \textbf{lɛk} \textbf{háw} e \textbf{dé}.
\gls 2SG have.to leave=3SG.OBJ like how 3SG.SBJ BE.LOC
\glt ‘You have to leave it how it is.’

\label{ex:key:793}
\gll Nó bɔ́dí \textbf{nó} \textbf{dé} na pueblo.
\gls NEG body NEG BE.LOC LOC village
\glt ‘Nobody is in the village.’

\label{ex:key:794}
\gll Sé “ús=tín \textbf{kin} \textbf{dé} ínsay dé?”
\gls QUOT Q=thing HAB BE.LOC inside there
\glt ‘(They) said “what is usually in there?”‘

\label{ex:key:795}
\gll Yu gɛ́fɔ de \textbf{tɔ́n}=an.
\gls 2SG have.to IPFV turn=3SG.OBJ
\glt ‘You have to be stirring it.’

\label{ex:key:796}
\gll \textbf{Tɔ́n} na yu lɛ́f-hán!
\gls turn LOC DEF left.CPD-hand
\glt ‘Turn left!’

\label{ex:key:797}
\gll Mék a gó dú smɔ́l tín a \textbf{tɔ́n} \textbf{bák}.
\gls SBJV 1SG.SBJ go do be.small thing 1SG.SBJ turn back
\glt ‘Let me go do something quickly (and) come back.’

\label{ex:key:798}
\gll Dɛn-ɔ́l dɛn dɔ́n \textbf{tɔ́n} \textbf{europeos} \textbf{dɛn}.
\gls 3PL.CPD-all 3PL PRF turn European.PL PL
\glt ‘They have all turned into Europeans.’

\label{ex:key:799}
\gll A \textbf{lɛ́f} di tín dɛn di sáy wé yu bin tɛ́l mí.
\gls 1SG.SBJ leave DEF thing PL DEF side SUB 2SG PST tell 1SG.INDP
\glt ‘I left the things where you told me to.’

\label{ex:key:800}
\gll Yu go mék mék di gál \textbf{lɛ́f} wet brok-hát.
\gls 2SG POT make SBJV DEF girl remain with break.CPD-heart

\label{ex:key:801}
\gll Machyta \textbf{lɛ́f} wet in fámbul.

\label{ex:key:802}
\gll \MakeUppercase{A} de trén=an porque e go \textbf{kɔmɔ́t} pɔ́sin.
\gls 1SG.SBJ IPFV train=3SG.OBJ because 3SG.SBJ POT come.out person
\glt ‘I’m bringing him up because [so that] he will turn out to be a (responsible) person.’

\label{ex:key:803}
\gll Bɛ́ta tín nó de \textbf{sté}.
\gls very.good thing NEG IPFV last
\glt ‘Good things don’t last.’

\label{ex:key:804}
\gll Dís smɔ́l bɔ́tul dɛn Fanta, wé e \textbf{gɛ́t} Coca-Cola, e \textbf{gɛ́t} Fanta, e \textbf{gɛ́t} limón, e báy=an wán.
\gls this small bottle PL NAME SUB 3SG.SBJ get NAME 3SG.SBJ get NAME 3SG.SBJ get lemon 3SG.SBJ buy=3SG.OBJ one
\glt ‘These small bottles of Fanta, where there is Coca-Cola, there is Fanta, there is Lemon, she bought him one (of them).’

\label{ex:key:806}
\gll Bɔt yu dɔ́n sabí na Afrika \textbf{yu} \textbf{nó} \textbf{gɛ́t} nó relación fɔ mán lɛk na Europa.
\gls but 2SG PRF know LOC PLACE 2SG NEG get NEG relation PREP man like LOC Europe
\glt ‘But you already know that in Africa you don’t have a relationship with a man like in Europe.’

\label{ex:key:807}
\gll Bɔt na dán fɔ́s tɛ́n hós dɛn \textbf{wé} e \textbf{gɛ́t} dá piso dɛn fɔ dán altura dɛn.
\gls but FOC that first time house PL SUB 3SG.SBJ get that storey PL PREP that height PL
\glt ‘But its those houses of the past where there are those high storeys’ 

\label{ex:key:808}
\gll Bueno aunque dé, \textbf{bɔkú} \textbf{interés} \textbf{económico} \textbf{dé}.
\gls good although there much interest economic BE.LOC
\glt ‘Alright although there, there’s a lot of economic interest.’

\label{ex:key:809}
\gll Bueno, \textbf{mi} \textbf{gran-pá} bin \textbf{dé}.
\gls good 1SG.POSS grand-pa PST BE.LOC
\glt ‘Alright, my grandfather was around/fine.’

\label{ex:key:810}
\gll Paciente dɛn \textbf{dé} \textbf{na} \textbf{sala}, yú dɔ́kta la una yu de kán?
\gls patient PL BE.LOC LOC hall 2SG.INDP doctor the one 2SG IPFV come
\glt ‘Patients are in the hall, (and) you doctor, it’s (only) at one o’clock that you come?’

\label{ex:key:811}
\gll Dɛn de kɔ́l dɛn sé, \textbf{e} \textbf{nó} \textbf{gɛ́t} tɔ́k na Píchi.

\glt ‘They’re called, there is no word (for that) in Pichi.’

\label{ex:key:812}

\label{ex:key:816}

\label{ex:key:818}

\gls this man get liver INTJ PREP go.out with this kind big girl
\glt ‘Than man has guts, right, to go out with such an influential girl.’

\label{ex:key:819}
\gll Di papá de gládin sé in pikín \textbf{dɔ́n} \textbf{gɛ́t} wók.

\glt ‘The father is happy that his child has found work.’

\label{ex:key:820}

\gls 1SG.SBJ HAB get money 1SG.SBJ HAB follow woman PL
\glt ‘(When) I used to receive money, I would chase women.’

\label{ex:key:821}
\gll Sɔn Píchi \textbf{dé} \textbf{fɔ} sɔn mán wé de síng, dɛn de kɔ́l Lapiro.
\gls some Pichi BE.LOC PREP some man SUB IPFV síng 3PL IPFV call NAME
\glt ‘There’s a kind of Pichi used by a man who sings, he’s called Lapiro [dé Mbanga].’

\label{ex:key:822}
\gll Di tín \textbf{dé} \textbf{fɔr}=an, di tín \textbf{na} \textbf{fɔ} ín.
\gls DEF thing BE.LOC PREP=3SG.OBJ DEF THING FOC PREP 3SG.INDP
\glt ‘The thing is his, the thing is his (...)’

\label{ex:key:823}
\gll A fít \textbf{hól} dán mɔní \textbf{durante} \textbf{un} \textbf{mes} \textbf{entero}.
\gls 1SG.SBJ can keep that money during DEF month whole
\glt ‘I’m able to keep that money for a whole month.’ 

\label{ex:key:824}
\gll “Yu \textbf{hól} wán motó”, yu de dráyb=an, pero sé yu gɛ́t, cuando tienes, “a \textbf{gɛ́t} wán motó”.
\gls 2SG hold one car 2SG IPFV drive=3SG.OBJ but QUOT 2SG get when you.get 1SG.SBJ get one car
\glt ` “Yú hól wán motó” (means) you’re driving it, but when you possess it, when you have it “a gɛ́t wán motó.”’

\label{ex:key:826}
\gll Bikɔs e \textbf{hól} yú na hós yu gɛ́fɔ gɛ́t di hóm trénin.
\gls because 3SG.SBJ hold 2SG.INDP LOC house 2SG have.to get DEF home training
\glt ‘Because she has guardianship over you in her house you have to receive home education.’

\label{ex:key:827}
\gll Nó, na di húman \textbf{de} \textbf{hól} di plét.
\gls NEG FOC DEF woman IPFV hold DEF plate
\glt ‘No, it’s the woman that’s holding the plate.’

\label{ex:key:828}
\gll George, mi móvil nó \textbf{dé} \textbf{na} \textbf{mi} \textbf{hán}, a nó gɛ́t móvil náw.
\gls NAME 1SG.POSS mobile NEG BE.LOC LOC 1SG.POSS hand 1SG.SBJ NEG get mobile now
\glt ‘George, I don’t have my mobile phone on me, I don’t have a mobile phone now.’

\label{ex:key:829}
\gll Yu sabí sé yu \textbf{nó} \textbf{gɛ́t} pikín?

\glt ‘Do you know whether you don’t have a child?’

\label{ex:key:830}

\label{ex:key:832}
\gll Moka bɔ́y dɛn krés wé dɛn sí lɛk háw a frɛ́s, na so a \textbf{dé} \textbf{bráyt}.

\glt ‘The Moka boys went crazy when they saw how fresh I was, that’s how bright I looked.’

\label{ex:key:833}
\gll Yu skín \textbf{bráyt} ó.

\glt ‘Your body is really glowing (with beauty).’

\label{ex:key:834}

\glt ‘The street looks messed up.’

\glt ‘The street is messed up, the street is destroyed, the street is not fine.’

\label{ex:key:836}

\glt ‘When you fall you’ll be in a bad state.’

\label{ex:key:837}

\glt ‘(If) you see a fine girl, you go chat her up.’

\label{ex:key:838}

\glt It’s hard for them to build here because the ground is too stony.’

\label{ex:key:839}

\gls 3SG.SBJ be.hard PREP build LOC here because QUOT DEF ground get much sand
\glt ‘It’s hard to build here because the ground is very sandy.’

\label{ex:key:840}

\label{ex:key:841}

\glt ‘But he stays far down over there.’

\label{ex:key:842}
\gll Nó chɛ́k=an \textbf{bɔkú} \textbf{tɛ́n}, tɛ́l mí sé nó.

\glt ‘Don’t think about it for a long time, tell me “no”.’

\label{ex:key:843}

\glt ‘That’s why one day, I told one of my seniors in, in my secondary school there, (...)’

\glt ‘I absolutely have to go to Germany someday.’

\label{ex:key:845}

\glt ‘Ebongolo told me about his problem yesterday.’

\label{ex:key:846}

\label{ex:key:847}

\glt ‘Unfortunately, the first doctor that we had wasn’t up (there) in the hospital.’

\label{ex:key:848}

\glt ‘I nearly died there.’ 

\label{ex:key:849}

\glt ‘Maybe they won’t ask you to pay a lot (...)’

\label{ex:key:852}
\gll E de pás \textbf{só} lɛk sé e nó nó mí mɔ́.

\label{ex:key:855}

\label{ex:key:863}

\glt ‘The girl is too thin, she’s too lean.’ 

\label{ex:key:864}

\label{ex:key:865}

\label{ex:key:866}

\glt ‘They said it’s not her alone, there’s yet another one.’

\label{ex:key:867}
\gll E de sigue \textbf{mɔ́}.

\glt ‘It’s still continuing.’

\label{ex:key:868}
\gll E dé e nó de \textbf{ánsa} mí \textbf{mɔ́}.

\glt ‘She was (just) there (and) wasn’t responding to me any more.’

\label{ex:key:869}

\gls from PLACE descending 3SG.SBJ NEG POT BE.LOC more

\label{ex:key:870}

\gls 1SG.SBJ NEG IPFV talk more
\glt ‘I was not talking any longer.’ OR ‘I was not saying (anything) more/again.’

\label{ex:key:871}
\gll \textbf{Nó} \textbf{pát} \textbf{fɔ} \textbf{wɔ́l} \textbf{mɔ́} nó dé.
\gls NEG part PREP world more NEG BE.LOC
\glt ‘There is no other part of the world [where it’s like that].’

\label{ex:key:872}
\gll \textbf{\'{A}fta mɔ́} a bin wók dís sén wók wé a de dú.
\gls then more 1SG.SBJ PST work this same work SUB 1SG.SBJ IPFV do
\glt ‘Then, additionally, I worked this same job that I’m doing (now).’ 

\label{ex:key:873}
\gll \textbf{Wok-sáy} a de híɛ wé dɛn de tɔ́k=an bɔkú.
\gls work.CPD-side 1SG.SBJ IPFV hear SUB 3PL IPFV talk=3SG.OBJ much
\glt ‘(At) work I hear them talk it [Ghanaian Pidgin English] a lot.’

\label{ex:key:874}
\gll E kán \textbf{sán} \textbf{tɛ́n}.
\gls 3SG.SBJ come sun time
\glt ‘He came (at) noon.’

\label{ex:key:875}
\gll Dɛn só di sɔ́t \textbf{tú} \textbf{stáyl}.
\gls 3PL sew DEF shirt two style
\glt ‘The shirt was sewn in two (different) ways.’

\label{ex:key:876}
\gll A pút di kí \textbf{na} pála.
\gls 1SG.SBJ put DEF key LOC parlour
\glt ‘I put the key in the parlour.’

\label{ex:key:877}
\gll E fíks dɛ́n \textbf{fáyn}.
\gls 3SG.SBJ fix 3PL.INDP fine
\glt ‘She has arranged them properly.’

\label{ex:key:878}
\gll Chico, yu dɔ́n chɔ́p=an \textbf{haydháyd}.
\gls boy 2SG PRF eat=3SG.OBJ secretly
\glt ‘Man, you’ve eaten it secretly.’

\label{ex:key:879}
\gll \'{A}s dɛn nɔ́ba bin sí plantí, dɛn bin chɔ́p=an \textbf{rɔ́n-wán}.
\gls as 3PL NEG.PRF PST see plantain 3PL PST eat=3SG.OBJ wrong-ADV
\glt ‘Since they had never seen plantain before, they ate it the wrong way.’

\label{ex:key:880}
\gll Dɛn tíf di mɔní \textbf{síkrit} \textbf{stáyl}.
\gls 3PL steal DEF money secret style
\glt ‘They stole the money secretly.’

\label{ex:key:881}
\gll A wáka \textbf{fɔ} \textbf{fút} wet mi maleta.
\gls 1SG.SBJ walk PREP foot with 1SG.POSS suitcase
\glt ‘I walked by foot with my suitcase.’

\label{ex:key:882}
\gll E gó na wók \textbf{wé} e \textbf{klín}.
\gls 3SG.SBJ go LOC work SUB 3SG.SBJ be.clean
\glt ‘She went to work clean.’

\label{ex:key:884}
\gll E kɔmɔ́t na rúm \textbf{nékɛd}.
\gls 3SG.SBJ come.out LOC room be.naked
\glt ‘He left the room naked.’

\label{ex:key:885}
\gll E pút di bɔ́tul pan di tébul \textbf{wet} \textbf{di} \textbf{mɔ́t} \textbf{dɔ́n}.
\gls 3SG.SBJ put DEF bottle pan DEF table with DEF mouth down
\glt ‘He put the bottle on the table upside-down.’

\label{ex:key:886}
\gll Pero mi mamá kán acepta di pikín \textbf{lɛk} \textbf{mi} \textbf{brɔ́da} \textbf{in} \textbf{pikín}.
\gls but 1SG.POSS mother PFV accept DEF child like 1SG brother 3SG.POSS child
\glt ‘But my mother accepted the child as my brother’s child.’

\label{ex:key:887}
\gll Mí nó lɛ́k yú bɔt wi fít dé \textbf{lɛk} \textbf{kɔ́mpin}.
\gls 1SG.INDP NEG like 2SG.INDP but 1PL can BE.LOC like friend
\glt ‘I don’t love you but we can be (like) friends.’

\label{ex:key:888}
\gll Di cubana húman de \textbf{wók} \textbf{lɛk} \textbf{dɔ́kta} na Malábo.
\gls DEF Cuban woman IPFV work like doctor LOC PLACE
\glt ‘The Cuban woman works as a doctor in Malabo.’

\label{ex:key:889}
\gll Yu fít gí mí \textbf{lɛk} \textbf{dos} \textbf{mil} só?
\gls 2SG can give 1SG.INDP like two thousand like.that
\glt ‘Can you give me around two thousand?’

\label{ex:key:890}
\gll E de dú \textbf{lɛk} \textbf{sé} e de fɛ́n sɔn tín.
\gls 3SG.SBJ IPFV do like QUOT 3SG.SBJ IPFV look.for some thing
\glt ‘He’s pretending to look for something.’

\label{ex:key:891}
\gll E dríng di \textbf{watá} \textbf{kól}.
\gls 3SG.SBJ drink DEF water be.cold
\glt ‘She drank the water cold.’

\label{ex:key:892}
\gll E dríng \textbf{kol-watá}.
\gls 3SG.SBJ drink cold.CPD-water
\glt ‘She drank cold water.’

\label{ex:key:893}
\gll Pero wé a kin tɔ́ch in fút, in hán dé, na só dɛn \textbf{kó.ól}~\textup{[k\H{o}::l]}.
\gls but SUB 1SG.SBJ HAB touch 3SG.POSS leg 3SG.POSS hand there FOC like.that 3PL cold.EMP
\glt ‘But when I would touch his foot (and) his hand, they were so extremely cold.’

\label{ex:key:894}
\gll Dɛn kéch=an dɛn bít=an \textbf{sóté.e}~\textup{[s\H{o}t\H{e}::]}.
\gls 3PL catch=3SG.OBJ 3PL beat=3SG.OBJ until.EMP
\glt ‘They caught him and beat the hell out of him.’

\label{ex:key:895}
\gll Wántɛn a skía, e sé “nó skía, a kɔmɔ́t \textbf{fá.áwe}~\textup{[fá:we]}, a kɔmɔ́t \textbf{fá.á}~\textup{[fá::]}.”
\gls suddenly 1SG.SBJ be.scared 3SG.SBJ QUOT NEG be.scared 1SG.SBJ come.out far.EMP 1SG.SBJ come.out far.EMP
\glt ‘Suddenly, I became scared, he said “don’t be scared, I come from very far away, I come from very far”.’

\label{ex:key:897}
\gll A de sɔ́ri \textbf{bád.}
\gls 1SG.SBJ IPFV feel.sorry extremely
\glt ‘I really feel sorry.’

\label{ex:key:898}
\gll E fáyn \textbf{bád,} e fáyn \textbf{bád.}
\gls 3SG.SBJ be.fine extremely 3SG.SBJ be.fine extremely
\glt ‘She is really beautiful, she is really beautiful.’

\label{ex:key:899}
\gll E hád \textbf{ó}.
\gls 3SG.SBJ be.hard SP
\glt ‘It’s really difficult.’

\label{ex:key:900}
\gll Di pépa dé \textbf{na} \textbf{tébul}.
\gls DEF paper BE.LOC LOC table
\glt ‘The paper is on the table.’

\label{ex:key:901}
\gll (...) e lɛ́f dɛ́n \textbf{pan} di tébul.
\gls (...) 3SG.SBJ leave 3PL.INDP on DEF table
\glt ‘(...) she left them on the table.’

\label{ex:key:902}
\gll Wé in mamá dáy, na \textbf{frɔn} \textbf{dé} e bigín krés.

\label{ex:key:903}
\gll E kán fɔdɔ́n \textbf{sóté} \textbf{yá}.
\gls 3SG.SBJ PFV fall until here
\glt ‘(And then) it fell up to here.’

\label{ex:key:904}
\gll (...) na di tín a kán \textbf{na} \textbf{yá}.
\gls (...) FOC DEF thing 1SG.SBJ come LOC here
\glt ‘(...) that’s why I came here.’

\label{ex:key:905}

\glt ‘As for here, people of the island pay [the bride price] in alcohol.’

\label{ex:key:906}
\gll Na só dɛn de mék café \textbf{na} \textbf{dí} \textbf{sáy}.
\gls FOC like.that 3PL IPFV make coffee LOC this side
\glt ‘That’s how they make coffee here.’

\label{ex:key:907}
\gll E bin pás \textbf{na} \textbf{mi} \textbf{hós}.
\gls 3SG.SBJ PST pass LOC 1SG.POSS house
\glt ‘She passed by my house [to see me].’

\label{ex:key:908}
\gll Yu gó \textbf{to} yu kɔ́mpin yu sé “chico dán gɛ́l de bɔ́t mi”.
\gls 2SG go to 2SG friend 2SG QUOT boy that girl IPFV hit.with.head 1SG.INDP
\glt ‘You go to your friend (and) you say “man, that girl is rejecting me”.’

\label{ex:key:909}
\gll Wé dɛn bin kɛ́r=an gó \textbf{to} dɔ́kta, (...)

\glt ‘When they took her to the doctor, (...)’

\label{ex:key:910}
\gll (...) mék yu tɔ́n=an, porque \textbf{bɔtɔ́n} go rós.
\gls (...) SBJV 2SG turn=3SG.OBJ because bottom POT burn
\glt ‘(...) turn it, because the bottom might burn.’

\label{ex:key:911}
\gll Yu de klém fɔ \textbf{rích} \textbf{pantáp}.
\gls 2SG IPFV climb PREP arrive top
\glt ‘You’re climbing in order to reach the top.’

\label{ex:key:912}

\gls (...) 3SG.SBJ BE.LOC up go like.that
\glt ‘(...) it’s [farther] up, go this way!’

\glt ‘The lower part is violet.’

\label{ex:key:916}

\glt ‘(...) she’s selling (and) she’s putting a bit at the side in order to be able to give that man back his money.’

\label{ex:key:917}

\glt ‘She’s in front of the house.’

\glt ‘She’s at the front.’

\label{ex:key:919}

\glt ‘Boyé lives behind this house.’

\label{ex:key:922}

\gls 3SG.SBJ IPFV cross.CPD{}-cross before DEF door 3SG.SBJ IPFV do like QUOT 3SG.SBJ IPFV look.for some thing
\glt ‘He’s walking back and forth in front of the door, he’s pretending to be looking for something.’

\label{ex:key:923}
\gll Yu fít tɔ́k sé “dɛn sidɔ́n \textbf{nía} \textbf{di} \textbf{fáya}”.
\gls 2SG can talk QUOT 3PL sit near DEF fire
\glt ‘You can say “they’re sitting by the fire”.’

\glt ‘(The) clubs are under the ground, you know.’

\label{ex:key:927}

\label{ex:key:931}

\label{ex:key:932}
\gll E sé mí nó de mék e slíp \textbf{bɔtɔ́n} \textbf{dé}.

\gll \textbf{Di} \textbf{mán} \textbf{tínap} míndul pípul dɛn.

\label{ex:key:945}

\glt ‘He stood up the cassava between two trees.’

\label{ex:key:946}
\gll \textbf{Di} \textbf{bɔ́tul} \textbf{slíp} pantáp di tébul bikɔs \textbf{di} \textbf{bɔ́tul} \textbf{lé} dé.

\glt ‘The bottle is lying [in a horizontal position] on the table because the bottle is lying there.’

\label{ex:key:947}

\gls 3SG.SBJ sleep DEF bottle top DEF table
\glt ‘He laid the bottle on the table [in a horizontal position].’ 

\label{ex:key:948}
\gll Dɛn \textbf{para} di búk dɛn sé dɛn \textbf{jám} dɛn sɛ́f.
\gls 3PL stand.up DEF book PL QUOT 3PL make.contact 3PL self
\glt ‘The books were stood up [in such way] that they’re in contact with each other.’

\label{ex:key:949}
\gll So di mán kán pás nía ín, e \textbf{jám}=an, di plét fɔdɔ́n na grɔ́n.
\gls so DEF man PFV pass near 3SG.INDP 3SG.SBJ make.contact=3SG.OBJ DEF plate fall LOC ground
\glt ‘So the man passed near her, he bumped into her, the plate fell to the ground.’

\label{ex:key:950}
\gll Di písis \textbf{hɛ́ng} na di stík nɔ́, bikɔs nó mán nó pút=an.
\gls DEF piece.of.cloth hang LOC DEF tree INTJ because NEG man NEG put=3SG.OBJ
\glt ‘The piece of cloth is hanging onto the stick, right, because nobody put it there.’

\label{ex:key:951}
\gll E táy di kasára wet róp áfta e \textbf{hɛ́ng}=an.
\gls 3SG.SBJ tie DEF cassava with rope then 3SG.SBJ hang=3SG.OBJ
\glt ‘He tied the cassava with a rope and then he hung it up.’

\label{ex:key:952}
\gll A \textbf{kɔmɔ́t} \textbf{colegio}, (...)

\glt ‘I came out of college (...)’

\glt ‘I’m coming from town right now.’

\label{ex:key:954}

\label{ex:key:956}

\label{ex:key:960}

\label{ex:key:963}

\glt ‘Miguel Ángel is jumping on/onto the bed.’

\label{ex:key:965}

\gls NEG.FOC 3SG.SBJ climb top DEF chair
\glt ‘Not “he climbed [being] on the chair”.’

\label{ex:key:966}
\gll Dɛn \textbf{híb}=an \textbf{dɔ́n}.

\glt ‘It was thrown down.’

\label{ex:key:967}

\label{ex:key:968}

\glt ‘He’s throwing the ball with aim in order to hit the cardboard box.’

\label{ex:key:969}
\gll E \textbf{sɛ́n}=an di bɔ́l.

\glt ‘He threw the ball to him.’

\label{ex:key:970}

\label{ex:key:971}

\label{ex:key:972}

\label{ex:key:973}

\label{ex:key:974}

\label{ex:key:975}

\label{ex:key:976}
\gll E kán \textbf{fɔdɔ́n} \textbf{sóté} yá.

\label{ex:key:977}

\label{ex:key:978}

\glt ‘They pushed the car in order for it to enter the garage.’

\label{ex:key:979}
\gll Olinga \textbf{kɔmɔ́t} \textbf{frɔn} bɔtɔ́n.
\gls NAME come.out from bottom
\glt ‘Olinga comes from the bottom [worked himself up from the bottom].’

\label{ex:key:980}

\glt ‘He called from the platform, he called down here.’

\gls FOC Q=kind thing 3PL take make this let’s.say this bottle
\glt ‘What is, let’s say this bottle, made of?’

\label{ex:key:1078}
\gll Na dɛ́n bin de transfiere mɔní mɔ́ na Western Union \textbf{pás} \textbf{guineano} \textbf{dɛn}.
\gls FOC 3PL PST IPFV transfiere money more LOC NAME NAME pass Guinean PL
\glt ‘It’s them who were transferring more money by Western Union than Equatoguineans.’

\label{ex:key:1079}
\gll Di gɛ́l \textbf{wáka} \textbf{gó} na tɔ́n.
\gls DEF girl walk go LOC town
\glt ‘The girl walked to town.’

\label{ex:key:1082}
\gll Di gɛ́l \textbf{wáka} \textbf{gó} na tɔ́n.
\gls DEF girl walk go LOC town
\glt ‘The girl walked to town.’

\glt ‘I want to fly [hurry] to town right now.’

\glt ‘She’s sick with fever.’

\label{ex:key:1190}
\gll (...) dán papá de \textbf{kráy} in \textbf{mɔní}.
\gls (...) that father IPFV cry 3SG.POSS money.
\glt ‘(...) that elderly man was crying over his (lost) money.’

\label{ex:key:1191}
\gll Dán pɔ́sin go ánsa yú, “yɛ́s, na malérya e bin de \textbf{sík}.”
\gls that person POT answer 2SG.INDP yes FOC malaria 3SG.SBJ PST IPFV sick
\glt ‘That person would reply to you “yes, it’s malaria that she was sick with”.’

\label{ex:key:1192}
\gll \'{U}s=káyn \textbf{sík} e de \textbf{sík}?
\gls Q=kind sickness 3SG.SBJ IPFV be.sick
\glt ‘What kind of sickness does she have?’

\label{ex:key:1193}
\gll Wé yu kɔmɔ́t \textbf{sík} \textbf{dán} \textbf{sík} na Panyá, wé yu de sík, náw yu bigín tɔ́k Panyá.
\gls SUB 2SG come.out be.sick that sickness LOC Spain SUB 2SG IPFV sick now 2SG begin talk Spanish
\glt ‘When you had just fallen sick with that sickness in Spain, when you were sick, then you began to talk Spanish.’

\label{ex:key:1194}
\gll A wánt \textbf{tɔ́k} \textbf{dán} \textbf{smɔ́l} \textbf{tɔ́k} dé.
\gls 1SG.SBJ want talk that small word there
\glt ‘I want to say that small word there.’

\label{ex:key:1195}
\gll Dɛn bin \textbf{fáyn} \textbf{wán} \textbf{fáyn}.
\gls 3PL PST be.fine one fineness
\glt ‘They were really fine.’

\label{ex:key:1196}
\gll Dán torí bin de \textbf{swít} mí \textbf{wán} \textbf{swít}.
\gls that story PST IPFV be.tasty 1SG.INDP one tastiness
\glt ‘I really enjoyed that story.’

\label{ex:key:1197}
\gll \'{E}y, dán káyn spɛ́tikul, a \textbf{dáy} \textbf{dáy}.

\glt ‘Hey, [if I had] that kind of glasses, I would surely die.’

\label{ex:key:1198}

\gls FOC go 1SG.SBJ IPFV go SP
\glt ‘[Mind you] I’m going now!’

\gls 3PL give DEF money PREP 1SG.INDP
\glt ‘They gave the money (to someone) for me.’ but not ‘They gave me the money.’

\glt ‘I was given a scholarship.’

\label{ex:key:1207}

\label{ex:key:1208}

\label{ex:key:1209}

\label{ex:key:1210}

\label{ex:key:1211}

\label{ex:key:1297}
\gll Dɛn de kán sé dɛn kán \textbf{wás}.
\gls 3PL IPFV come QUOT 3PL come wash
\glt ‘They come to wash themselves.’

\label{ex:key:1298}
\gll Yu dɔ́n \textbf{báf}?
\gls 2SG PRF bathe
\glt ‘Have you bathed?’

\label{ex:key:1299}
\gll A \textbf{wɛ́r}.
\gls 1SG.SBJ wear
\glt ‘I’m dressed up.’

\label{ex:key:1300}
\gll Na lɛk if yu \textbf{wɛ́r} \textbf{sɔ́t} di gud-sáy wet di rɔn-sáy.
\gls FOC like if 2SG wear shirt DEF good.CPD-side with DEF wrong.CPD-side
\glt ‘That’s like if you put on a shirt the right way or inside out.’

\label{ex:key:1301}
\gll \textbf{Wás} yu \textbf{skín}!
\gls wash 2SG body
\glt ‘Wash yourself!’

\label{ex:key:1302}
\gll Djunais \textbf{wɛ́r} in \textbf{sɛ́f}.
\gls NAME wear 3SG.POSS self
\glt ‘Djunais has dressed up.’

\label{ex:key:1303}
\gll E de wáka e \textbf{bɛ́n}.
\gls 3SG.SBJ IPFV walk 3SG.SBJ bend
\glt ‘He is walking stooped over.’

\label{ex:key:1304}
\gll Sé dɛn \textbf{líng} dɛn sɛ́f ɔ fɔ lɛk háw dɛn \textbf{bɛ́n} dɛn sɛ́f?
\gls QUOT 3PL lean 3PL self or PREP like how 3PL bend 3PL self
\glt ‘That they’re leaning (onto something) or how they’re stooped over?’

\label{ex:key:1305}
\gll A kán \textbf{háyd} ínsay hós.
\gls 1SG.SBJ PFV hide inside house
\glt ‘(Then) I hid in the house.’

\label{ex:key:1306}
\gll A \textbf{háyd} mi sɛ́f na hós.
\gls 1SG.SBJ hide 1SG.POSS self LOC house
\glt ‘I hid myself in the house.’

\label{ex:key:1307}
\gll A de \textbf{bló} ɔ a de \textbf{rɛ́s}.
\gls 1SG.SBJ IPFV relax or 1SG.SBJ IPFV rest
\glt ‘I’m relaxing or I’m resting.’

\label{ex:key:1308}
\gll A wánt gó \textbf{rɛ́s} \textbf{mi} \textbf{sɛ́f}.
\gls 1SG.SBJ want go rest 1SG.POSS self
\glt ‘I want to go rest.’

\label{ex:key:1309}
\gll A wánt gó \textbf{bló} \textbf{mi} \textbf{sɛ́f}.
\gls 1SG.SBJ want go relax 1SG.POSS self
\glt ‘I want to go rest.’

\label{ex:key:1310}
\gll (...) wi \textbf{nák} \textbf{wi} \textbf{sɛ́f}.
\gls (...) 1PL knock 1PL self
\glt ‘(...) we knocked each other.’ 

\label{ex:key:1311}
\gll \'{I}nsay di motó, na dé unu de \textbf{slíp} \textbf{unu} \textbf{sɛ́f}?
\gls inside DEF car FOC there 2PL IPFV sleep 2PL self
\glt ‘In the car, that’s where you sleep with each other?’

\label{ex:key:1312}
\gll Una \textbf{slíp}?
\gls 2PL sleep
\glt ‘You slept (with each other)?’

\label{ex:key:1313}
\gll E tɛ́l mí sé wi kin \textbf{mítɔp} ínsay wán motó.
\gls 3SG.SBJ tell 1SG.INDP QUOT 1PL HAB meet inside one car
\glt ‘He told me “we usually meet inside a car”.’ 

\label{ex:key:1314}
\gll \'{A}fta wi kán \textbf{mít} layk wán seis años después.
\gls then 1PL PFV meet like one six years afterwards
\glt ‘Then we met some six years later.’

\label{ex:key:1315}
\gll Pero e \textbf{mít} \textbf{mi} \textbf{gran-má}.
\gls but 3SG.SBJ meet 1SG.POSS grand-ma
\glt ‘But he met my grandmother.’

\label{ex:key:1316}
\gll \textbf{Mí} \textbf{wet} \textbf{Djunais} wi mítɔp.
\gls 1SG.INDP with NAME 1PL meet
\glt ‘Me and Djunais (we) met.’

\label{ex:key:1317}
\gll \textbf{Djunais} fíba \textbf{Boyé}.
\gls NAME resemble NAME
\glt ‘Djunais resembles Boyé.’

\label{ex:key:1318}
\gll \textbf{Djunais} \textbf{wet} \textbf{Boyé} dɛn fíba.
\gls NAME with NAME 3PL resemble
\glt ‘Djunais and Boyé (they) resemble (each other).’

\label{ex:key:1319}
\gll Yu fít \textbf{mék} mí wán café?
\gls 2SG can make 1SG.INDP one coffee
\glt ‘Can you make me a coffee?’

\label{ex:key:1320}
\gll A sé a nó fít \textbf{lɛ́f}=an.
\gls 1SG.SBJ QUOT 1SG.SBJ NEG can leave=3SG.OBJ
\glt ‘I said I can’t leave her (behind).’

\label{ex:key:1321}
\gll Lotería dɔ́n \textbf{mék} \textbf{mék} mi mɔní \textbf{bɔkú}.
\gls lottery PRF make SBJV 1SG.POSS money be.much
\glt ‘The lottery has made my money become a lot.’

\label{ex:key:1322}
\gll A go \textbf{mék}=an \textbf{gó} tumɔ́ro.
\gls 1SG.SBJ POT make=3SG.OBJ go tomorrow
\glt ‘I’ll make him go tomorrow.’

\label{ex:key:1323}
\gll A níd fɔ drink sɔn tín wé de mék \textbf{mék} a \textbf{bɛ́lch}
\gls 1SG.SBJ need PREP drink some thing SUB IPFV make SBJV 1SG.SBJ belch
\glt ‘I need to drink something that will make me belch.’

\label{ex:key:1324}
\gll Na ín mék \textbf{sé} \textbf{mék} dɛn \textbf{wích}=an.
\gls FOC 3SG.INDP make QUOT SBJV 3PL bewitch=3SG.OBJ
\glt ‘That’s why he was bewitched.’

\label{ex:key:1325}
\gll A \textbf{drɔ́ngor}=an, a \textbf{mék} mék e \textbf{drɔ́ngo}.
\gls 1SG.SBJ get.drunk=3SG.OBJ 1SG.SBJ make SBJV 3SG.SBJ be.drunk
\glt ‘I got him drunk, I made him drunk.’ 

\label{ex:key:1326}
\gll E bin mék \textbf{mék} a \textbf{gí} di gɛ́l di plantí.
\gls 3SG.SBJ PST make SBJV 1SG.SBJ give DEF girl DEF plantain
\glt ‘She made me give the girl the plantain.’

\label{ex:key:1327}
\gll Pút di watá pero \textbf{nó} \textbf{mék} mék e \textbf{fɔdɔ́n} nado.
\gls put DEF water but NEG make SBJV 3SG.SBJ fall outside
\glt ‘Put the water (inside) but don’t make it fall outside (the vessel).’ 

\label{ex:key:1328}
\gll Fít sifta ín sóté tú tɛ́n \textbf{mék} mék dán smɔ́l smɔ́l watá dɛn \textbf{nó} \textbf{lɛ́f}.
\gls can sieve 3SG.INDP until two time make SBJV that small small water PL NEG remain
\glt ‘(You) can sift it up to two times to make none of that little water remain.’

\label{ex:key:1329}
\gll Na ín \textbf{mék} dɔtí \textbf{dɔ́n} plɛ́nte.
\gls FOC 3SG.INDP make dirty PRF plenty
\glt ‘That’s why the dirt has become so much.’

\label{ex:key:1330}
\gll Wétin \textbf{mék} yu nó \textbf{de} wók tidé?
\gls what make 2SG NEG IPFV work today
\glt ‘Why aren’t you working today?’

\label{ex:key:1331}
\gll \'{U}s=sáy yu \textbf{wánt} \textbf{mék} di smók kɔmɔ́t?
\gls Q=side 2SG want SBJV DEF smoke come.out
\glt ‘Where do you want the smoke to come out?’

\label{ex:key:1332}
\gll A \textbf{lɛ́f} mi pikín \textbf{mék} e gó Panyá.
\gls 1SG.SBJ leave 1SG.POSS child SBJV 3SG.SBJ go Spain
\glt ‘I allowed my child to go to Spain.’

\label{ex:key:1333}
\gll Seis años, \textbf{lɛ́f}=an \textbf{mék} e wɛ́r klós, mék e gó báy in brɛ́d.
\gls six year.PL leave=3SG.OBJ SBJV 3SG.SBJ wear clothing SBJV 3SG.SBJ go buy 3SG.POSS bread
\glt ‘(At) six years, let him dress up (by himself), let him go buy his (own) bread.’ 

\label{ex:key:1334}
\gll Dís húman \textbf{yún} yét.
\gls this woman be.young yet
\glt ‘This woman is still young.’ 

\label{ex:key:1335}
\gll E \textbf{lɛ́f} yú \textbf{yún}.
\gls 3SG.SBJ leave 2SG.INDP be.young
\glt ‘It makes/made you (appear) young.’

\label{ex:key:1336}
\gll Dí wán nó \textbf{kɔrɛ́t}.
\gls this one NEG be.correct
\glt ‘This one is not correct.’

\label{ex:key:1337}
\gll Gɔ́d go \textbf{lɛ́f} di mán \textbf{kɔrɛ́t}.
\gls God POT leave DEF man be.correct
\glt ‘God will make this man righteous.’ 

\label{ex:key:1338}
\gll Di húman \textbf{na} \textbf{yun-gɛ́l}.
\gls DEF woman FOC be.young.CDP-girl
\glt ‘The woman is a young woman.’

\label{ex:key:1339}
\gll Di klós dɛn de \textbf{lɛ́f} yú \textbf{yun-bɔ́y}.
\gls DEF clothing PL IPFV leave 2SG.INDP be.young.CPD-boy
\glt ‘These clothes make you (appear) a young man.’

\label{ex:key:1340}
\gll Ɛf yu húman \textbf{na} \textbf{bíg} \textbf{húman}, e hád fɔ \textbf{pút} yu sɛ́f \textbf{bíg} \textbf{mán}.
\gls if 2SG woman FOC big woman 3SG.SBJ hard PREP put 2SG self big man
\glt ‘If your wife is an important woman, it is difficult to make yourself an important man.’

\label{ex:key:1341}
\gll \textbf{Dɛn} de wɛ́r wáyt ɔ́p violeta dɔ́n.
\gls 3PL IPFV wear white up violet down
\glt ‘They [the pupils] wear white up (and) violet down.’

\label{ex:key:1342}
\gll Esto na wán ɔ́da kɔ́ntri, \textbf{dɛn} go púl yú inmediatamente, \textbf{dɛn} de púl yú wók.
\gls this LOC one other country 3PL POT remove 2SG.INDP immediately 3PL IPFV remove 2SG.INDP work
\glt ‘This in another country, they would remove you immediately, they would remove you from your job.’

\label{ex:key:1343}
\gll Di \textbf{ród} strét.
\gls DEF road be.straight
\glt ‘The road is straight.’

\label{ex:key:1344}
\gll \textbf{Dɛn} dɔ́n strét di \textbf{ród}.
\gls 3PL PRF straighten DEF road
\glt ‘The road has been straightened.’

\label{ex:key:1345}
\gll \textbf{Dɛn} \textbf{bɛ́t}=an na fám.
\gls 3PL bite=3SG.OBJ LOC farm
\glt ?‘She was bitten on the farm.’

\label{ex:key:1346}
\gll \textbf{Snék} \textbf{bɛ́t}=an na fám.
\gls snake bite=3SG.OBJ LOC farm
\glt ‘A snake bit her on the farm.’

\label{ex:key:1347}
\gll \textbf{Dɛn} \textbf{pút}=an mɔ́t dɔ́n fɔ di tébul.
\gls 3PL put=3SG.OBJ mouth down PREP DEF table
\glt ‘It has been put mouth-down on the table.’

\label{ex:key:1348}
\gll \textbf{Pɔ́sin} go entiende bɔt e nó dé bien.
\gls person POT understand but 3SG.SBJ NEG BE.LOC good
\glt ‘One would understand but it’s not correct.’

\label{ex:key:1349}
\gll \textbf{Dɛn} go hía ín bɔt e nó só dé claro.
\gls 3PL POT hear 3SG.INDP but 3SG.SBJ NEG like.that BE.LOC clear
\glt ‘It would be understood but it’s not so clear.’

\label{ex:key:1350}
\gll \textbf{Wi} de pús=an.
\gls 1PL IPFV push=3SG.OBJ
\glt ‘I’m managing.’ [Lit. ‘We’re pushing it.’]

\label{ex:key:1351}
\gll Na lɛkɛ \textbf{wí} náw, \textbf{wi} de tɔ́k Panyá, \textbf{wi} go nó sé dís pɔ́sin, na nigeriano.
\gls FOC like 1PL.INDP now 1PL IPFV talk Spanish 1PL POT know QUOT this person FOC Nigerian
\glt ‘It’s like with us now, (if) we spoke Spanish, we would know that this person, is Nigerian.’

\label{ex:key:1352}
\gll Dé, ɛ́ni káyn tín na mɔní, \textbf{yu} fít mék ɛ́ni káyn tín \textbf{yu} go sí mɔní.
\gls there every kind thing FOC money 2SG can make every kind thing 2SG POT see money
\glt ‘There, everything is money, you can do anything (and) you’ll earn money.’

\label{ex:key:1353}
\gll \textbf{Na} \textbf{fɔ} tík=an mɔ́.
\gls FOC PREP thicken=3SG.OBJ more
\glt ‘It has to be thickened more.’

\label{ex:key:1354}
\gll \textbf{Na} \textbf{to} inicia ín.
\gls FOC to initiate 3SG.INDP
\glt ‘He has to be initiated [to social life in Malabo].’

\label{ex:key:1355}
\gll Yu gó yu pé, siete mil yu baja, \textbf{áfta} yu fínis yu sube, \textbf{wé} yu de pák mɔ́ siete mil, \textbf{wé} yu sube.
\gls 2SG go 2SG pay seven thousand 2SG go.down then 2SG finish 2SG go.up SUB 2SG IPFV pack more seven thousand SUB 2SG go.up
\glt ‘You go, you pay, seven thousand, you go down, then you finish, you go up and take seven thousand again and go up.’

\label{ex:key:1356}
\gll \MakeUppercase{A} nó sabí ús=tín bin kán pás, \textbf{áfta} e gó na hospital.
\gls 1SG.SBJ NEG know Q=thing PST PFV pass then 3SG.SBJ go LOC hospital
\glt ‘I don’t know what happened that he went to (the) hospital.’

\label{ex:key:1357}
\gll \textbf{Lɛk} náw, \textbf{lɛk} Boyé só na mi mán, \textbf{áfta} mi sísta go kɔ́l=an sé, wé e go kán, “ús=sáy mi brɔda-lɔ́ dé?”
\gls like now like NAME like.that FOC 1SG.POSS man then 1SG.POSS sister POT call=3SG.OBJ QUOT SUB 3SG.SBJ POT come Q=side 1SG.POSS brother.CPD{}-law BE.LOC
\glt ‘Suppose now, suppose Boyé here were my husband, then my sister would call him, if she came, “where’s my brother-in-law?”’

\label{ex:key:1358}
\gll Ɛf yu sí sé, sɔn sáy di plés klín, \textbf{áfta} dɛn de dú di tín dɛn fáyn, yu nó go bísin ɛf yu gasta mɔní.
\gls if 2SG see QUOT some side DEF PLACE be.clean then 3PL IPFV do DEF thing PL fine 2SG NEG POT be.busy if 2SG spend money
\glt ‘If you see that, somewhere the place is clean and/ because things are done well, you don’t bother if you spend money.’

\label{ex:key:1359}
\gll E mít mi antí.
\gls 3SG.SBJ meet 1SG.POSS aunt
\glt ‘He met my aunt.’

\label{ex:key:1359b}
\gll \textbf{Dán} \textbf{tɛ́n} mi antí gɛ́t bɛlɛ́.
\gls that time 1SG.POSS aunt get belly
\glt ‘At that time my aunt was pregnant.’

\label{ex:key:1360}
\gll Bikɔs ín de sé, ɛ́ni \textbf{las} \textbf{doce} \textbf{na} \textbf{ín} in abuela kin kán kɔ́l=an.
\gls because 3SG.INDP IPFV QUOT every the.PL twelve FOC 3SG.INDP 3SG.POSS grandmother HAB come call=3SG.OBJ
\glt ‘Because she would say, always at twelve o’clock, that’s when her grandmother used to come and call her.’

\label{ex:key:1361}
\gll Só e gó na \textbf{bús,} e sé e de gó kíl bíf.
\gls so 3SG.SBJ POT LOC forest 3SG.SBJ QUOT 3SG.SBJ IPFV go kill wild.animal
\glt ‘So he went to the forest, (and) he said he was going to kill wild game.’

\label{ex:key:1362}
\gll \'{A}fta na mi gran-má a bin de kɔ́l mamá.
\gls then FOC 1SG.POSS grand-ma 1SG.SBJ PST IPFV call mother
\glt ‘So it’s my grandmother that I used to call mother.’

\ex{\label{ex:key:1362b}
\gll \textbf{Wé}\textstylePichiexamplespaceZchn{} wi kán kán na tɔ́n, \textbf{wé} a bigín gó skúl, wé a bin gɛ́t, a tínk sé seis años.
\gls SUB 1PL PFV come LOC town SUB 1SG.SBJ begin go school SUB 1SG.SBJ PST get 1SG.SBJ think QUOT six years
\glt And then we came to town, and then I began to go to school, when I was, I think six years old.’

\label{ex:key:1363}
\gll Frijoles yɛ́s frijoles.
\gls bean.PL yes bean.PL
\glt ‘[The Cubans call them] frijoles, yes frijoles.’

\label{ex:key:1364}
\gll Dɛn de kɔ́l dís tín fɔ cacahuete, dɛn de kɔ́l=an maní.
\gls 3PL IPFV call this thing PREP groundnut 3PL IPFV call=3SG.OBJ ground.nut
\glt ‘They call this peanut thing, they call it “maní”.’

\label{ex:key:1365}
\gll E nák di tébul \textbf{an} di stáyl wé e nák di tébul strɔ́n, e kán sék di plét \textbf{an} di plét kán brók.
\gls 3SG.SBJ hit DEF table and DEF style SUB 3SG.SBJ hit DEF table be.strong 3SG.SBJ PFV shake DEF plate and DEF plate PFV break
\glt ‘He hit the table and the way that he hit the table in a strong way, he shook the plate, and the plate broke.’

\label{ex:key:1366}
\gll Di dé wé yu go níd=an, yu go \textbf{sé} “a nó gɛ́t pamáyn”, yu go kɔ́t gadinɛ́ks.
\gls DEF day SUB 2SG POT need=3SG.OBJ 2SG POT QUOT 1SG.SBJ NEG get oil 2SG POT cut egg-plant
\glt ‘The day that you will need it, you are going to say “I don’t have oil,” (and) you will cut egg-plants.’

\label{ex:key:1367}
\gll E \textbf{kin} \textbf{sé} “kán wi gó na Barca wi gó dríng.”
\gls 3SG.SBJ HAB QUOT come 1PL go LOC PLACE 1PL go drink
\glt ‘He usually says “come let’s go to Barca and drink”.’

\label{ex:key:1368b}
\gll A \textbf{tɔ́k} \textbf{wán} \textbf{wɔ́d}.
\gls 1SG.SBJ talk one word
\glt ‘I said one word.’

\label{ex:key:1370}
\gll Yu \textbf{fít} \textbf{tɔ́k} “a de fíl di sɛ́nt fɔ lɛk háw e de kúk di plantí” ɔ “a de siente di sɛ́nt sé pɔ́sin de kúk plantí dé”.
\gls 2SG can talk 1SG.SBJ IPFV feel DEF scent PREP like how 3SG.SBJ IPFV cook DEF plantain SP 1SG.SBJ IPFV feel DEF scent QUOT person IPFV cook plantain there
\glt ‘You can say “I smell the scent of him cooking the plantain”, or “I smell the scent that somebody is cooking plantain there”.’

\ea{\label{ex:key:1371a}
\gll A \textbf{sé} “na mán dís?”
\gls 1SG.SBJ QUOT FOC man this
\glt ‘I said “this is a man?”’

\label{ex:key:1371e}
\gll \textbf{Sé} na mán?
\gls QUOT FOC man
\glt ‘(You) say it’s a man?’

\label{ex:key:1372a}
\gll \textbf{E} \textbf{go} \textbf{sé} e de fíɛ, e nó go gí mí di tín wé a de sɛ́n=an.
\gls 3SG.SBJ POT QUOT 3SG.SBJ IPFV fear 3SG.SBJ NEG POT give 1SG.INDP DEF thing SUB 1SG.SBJ IPFV send=3SG.OBJ
\glt ‘He would say, he was afraid (and) he wouldn’t give me the thing that I was sending him for.’

\label{ex:key:1372b}
\gll \textbf{Sé} ín nó wánt in abuelo skrách=an.
\gls QUOT 3SG.INDP NEG want 3SG.POSS grandfather scratch=3SG.OBJ
\glt ‘(He’d) say he [\textsc{emp}] doesn’t want his grandfather to scratch him.’ or ‘Because he doesn’t want his grandfather to scratch him.’

\label{ex:key:1373}
\gll In brɔ́da dɛn ɔ́l kɔmɔ́t na tɔ́n yá só \textbf{dɛn} \textbf{sé} dɛn de kán ték=an.
\gls 3SG.POSS brother PL all go.out LOC town here like.that 3PL QUOT 3PL IPFV come take=3SG.OBJ
\glt ‘His brothers all left town, (so) they said they came to take her.’

\label{ex:key:1374}
\gll E nó sabí tɔ́k ni Panyá, \textbf{e} \textbf{sé} e wánt muchachita de diecisiete años.
\gls 3SG.SBJ NEG know talk even Spanish 3SG.SBJ QUOT 3SG.SBJ want young.girl of seventeen year.PL
\glt ‘He doesn’t even know how to talk Spanish (and) he says he wants a young girl of seventeen years.’

\label{ex:key:1375}
\gll Tidé e kán \textbf{e} sé, “\textbf{a} tínk sé a go fínis ɔ́l di resto”.
\gls today 3SG.SBJ come 3SG.SBJ QUOT 1SG.SBJ think QUOT 1SG.SBJ POT finish all DEF rest
\glt ‘Today he came, he said “I think I am going to finish all the rest”.’ 

\label{ex:key:1376}
\gll Krío mamá dɛn wé dɛn de tɔ́k Píchi dɛn kin \textbf{tɔ́k} \textbf{sé} \textbf{grín}.
\gls Krio mother PL SUB 3PL IPFV talk Pichi 3PL HAB talk QUOT green
\glt ‘The elderly Krio women, when they talk Pichi, they usually say green.’ \newline [as opposed to ‘verd’ like younger people]

\label{ex:key:1377}
\gll Na fada-lɔ́, na di papá wé e bɔ́n mí, na ín mi mán go \textbf{kɔ́l} \textbf{sé} \textbf{suegro}.
\gls FOC father.CPD{}-law FOC DEF father SUB 3SG.SBJ beget 1SG.INDP FOC 3SG.INDP 1SG.POSS man POT call QUOT father-in-law
\glt ‘That is the father-in-law, that is the father who begat me, it is him that my husband would call father-in-law.’

\label{ex:key:1378}
\gll A fít tɛ́l yú \textbf{sé} morera, teca, kalabo.
\gls 1SG.SBJ can tell 2SG.INDP QUOT mulberry teak kalabo
\glt ‘I can tell you mulberry, teak, kalabo [listing types of wood].’

\label{ex:key:1379}
\gll Na mi mamá.
\gls FOC 1SG.POSS mother
\glt ‘That’s my mother.’

\label{ex:key:1380}
\gll Di pikín ɔ́l \textbf{sé} \textbf{na} mi yón bikɔs a dɔ́n pé mɔní.
\gls DEF child all QUOT FOC 1SG.POSS own because 1SG.SBJ PRF pay money
\glt ‘The children are all mine because I have paid money [the dowry].’

\label{ex:key:1381}
\gll \textstylePichiglossZchn{Yú} \textbf{wɔ́nt} \textbf{de} gó?
\gls 2SG want IPFV go
\glt ‘You want to (get) go(ing)?’

\label{ex:key:1382}
\gll Yu \textbf{fít} \textbf{de} bɔ́n\textbf{} yu pikín dɛn (...)
\gls 2SG can IPFV give.birth 2SG child PL (...)
\glt ‘You can be (continuously) having your children (...)’ 

\label{ex:key:1383}
\gll Yu \textbf{gɛ́fɔ} \textbf{de} tɔ́n=an.
\gls 2SG have.to IPFV turn=3SG.OBJ
\glt ‘You have to (continuously) be stirring it.’

\label{ex:key:1384}
\gll E wánt \textbf{tráy} mɛ́n fɔ́s.
\gls 3SG.SBJ want try cure first
\glt ‘She wanted to try to get better first.’

\label{ex:key:1386}
\gll Mék e \textbf{lɛ́f} \textbf{fɔ} dríng.
\gls SBJV 3SG.SBJ leave PREP drink
\glt ‘She should leave drinking.’

\label{ex:key:1387}
\gll Náw a dɔ́n de fínis \textbf{sém} \textbf{fɔ} wɛ́r dán sús, ɛf a bin nó a fɔ kɛ́r ɔ́da sús.
\gls now 1SG.SBJ PRF IPFV finish be.ashamed PREP wear that shoe if 1SG.SBJ PST know 1SG.SBJ COND carry other shoe
\glt ‘Now I am completely ashamed to be wearing those shoes, if I had known I would have brought another (pair of) shoes.’

\label{ex:key:1388}
\gll Di chɔ́p \textbf{ísi} \textbf{fɔ} chɔ́p.
\gls DEF food be.easy PREP eat
\glt ‘The food is easy to eat.’ 

\label{ex:key:1389}
\gll Di gál nó \textbf{grí} \textbf{fɔ} fála mí.
\gls DEF girl NEG agree PREP follow 1SG.INDP
\glt ‘The girl didn’t agree to come with me.’

\label{ex:key:1390}
\gll A \textbf{mɛ́mba} \textbf{fɔ} kɔ́l=an.
\gls 1SG.SBJ remember PREP call=3SG.OBJ
\glt ‘I remembered to call her.’

\label{ex:key:1391}
\gll A \textbf{mɛ́mba} \textbf{mék} \textbf{a} kɔ́l=an.
\gls 1SG.SBJ remember SBJV 1SG.SBJ call=3SG.OBJ
\glt ‘I remembered to call her.’

\label{ex:key:1392}
\gll So wé yu dɔ́n lán yu lángwech ɛ́n, e dɔ́n \textbf{hád} \textbf{fɔ} \textbf{mék} yu lán Panyá.
\gls so SUB 2SG PRF learn 2SG language INTJ 3SG.SBJ PRF hard PREP SBJV 2SG learn Spanish
\glt ‘So when you’ve learned your (home) language, it is hard for you to learn Spanish.’

\label{ex:key:1393}
\gll (...) \textbf{a} go tráy \textbf{mék} \textbf{e} báy mí dán káyn gafas por dios.
\gls (...) 1SG.SBJ POT try SBJV 3SG.SBJ buy 1SG.INDP that kind glasses by God
\glt ‘(...) I will try that she buys me that kind of glasses, by God.’

\label{ex:key:1394}
\gll Na ín a \textbf{mɛ́mba} \textbf{mék} a \textbf{nó} gó dé.
\gls FOC 3SG.INDP 1SG.SBJ remember SBJV 1SG.SBJ NEG go there
\glt ‘That’s when I remembered not to go there.’

\label{ex:key:1395}
\gll E \textbf{fáyn} \textbf{fɔ} dríng smɔ́l-wán.
\gls 3SG.SBJ fine PREP drink small{-adv}
\glt ‘It’s good to drink little.’

\label{ex:key:1396}
\gll Wé yu de dríng, e dé \textbf{fáyn} \textbf{sé} \textbf{mék} yu nó chák.
\gls SUB 2SG IPFV drink 3SG.SBJ BE.LOC fine QUOT SBJV 2SG NEG get.drunk
\glt ‘When you drink, it’s good not to get drunk.’

\label{ex:key:1397}
\gll A \textbf{fɔ́s}=an \textbf{mék} e lúk mí.
\gls 1SG.SBJ force=3SG.OBJ SBJV 3SG.SBJ look 1SG.INDP
\glt ‘I forced him to look at me.’

\label{ex:key:1398}
\gll A \textbf{tún}=an \textbf{sé} \textbf{mék} e báy mí motó.
\gls 1SG.SBJ tune=3SG.OBJ QUOT SBJV 3SG.SBJ buy 1SG.INDP car
\glt ‘I coaxed her into buying me a car.’ 

\label{ex:key:1399}
\gll E \textbf{mék} \textbf{mék} in húman dríng di cerveza.
\gls 3SG.SBJ make SBJV 3SG.POSS woman drink DEF beer
\glt ‘He made his woman drink the beer.’

\label{ex:key:1400}
\gll E nák di plét pan di tébul bikɔs e \textbf{wánt} \textbf{mék} di plét brók.
\gls 3SG.SBJ hit DEF plate pan DEF table because 3SG.SBJ want SBJV DEF plate break
\glt ‘He hit the plate on the table because he wanted the plate to break.’

\label{ex:key:1401}
\gll \'{A}fta, bueno \textbf{tɛ́l}=an sé \textbf{mék} e bák yú di mɔní.
\gls then good tell=3SG.OBJ QUOT SBJV 3SG.SBJ give.back 2SG.INDP DEF money
\glt ‘Then, ok, tell him that he should give you back the money.’ 

\label{ex:key:1402}
\gll E bin \textbf{bɛ́g}=an sé \textbf{mék} e kíl di fɔ́l.
\gls 3SG.SBJ PST beg=3SG.OBJ QUOT SBJV 3SG.SBJ kill DEF fowl
\glt ‘She asked him to kill the fowl.’

\label{ex:key:1403}
\gll Na ín mi gran-má bin kán tɔ́k sé in nó go \textbf{lɛ́f} mi a \textbf{gó}.
\gls FOC 3SG.INDP 1SG.POSS grand-ma PST come talk QUOT 3SG.INDP NEG POT leave 1SG.INDP 1SG.SBJ go
\glt ‘That’s when my grandma said that she [EMP] wouldn’t let me go.’

\label{ex:key:1404}
\gll Sé ín nó \textbf{wánt} {in} {abuelo} \textbf{skrách=an}.
\gls QUOT 3SG.INDP NEG want 3SG.POSS grandfather scratch=3SG.OBJ
\glt ‘(He) said, he [EMP] didn’t want his grandfather to scratch him.’ 

\label{ex:key:1405}
\gll Yɛ, a kán \textbf{tɛ́l}=an \textbf{sé} ‘chica, mí nó lɛ́k yú bɔt wi fít dé lɛk kɔ́mpin’.
\gls yeah 1SG.SBJ PFV tell=3SG.OBJ QUOT girl 1SG.INDP NEG like 2SG.INDP but 1PL can BE.LOC like friend
\glt ‘Yeah, I told her “girl, I don’t love you but we can be like friends”.’

\label{ex:key:1406}
\gll Nɔ́ a \textbf{tínk} \textbf{sé} realmente yu níd pikín.
\gls INTJ 1SG.SBJ think QUOT really 2SG need child
\glt ‘Actually, I think that one really needs children.’ 

\label{ex:key:1407}
\gll Yu jɔ́s \textbf{hía} \textbf{sé} pɔ́sin dɛn bin de tɔ́k, bɔt yu nó listin.
\gls 2SG just hear QUOT person PL PST IPFV talk but 2SG NEG listen
\glt ‘You just heard that people were talking but you didn’t listen.’

\label{ex:key:1408}
\gll A de \textbf{hía} ín \textbf{sé} e de nák di gitá ɔ a de \textbf{hía} ín \textbf{lɛk} \textbf{háw} e de nák di gita.
\gls 1SG.SBJ IPFV hear 3SG.INDP QUOT 3SG.SBJ IPFV hit DEF guitar or 1SG.SBJ IPFV hear 3SG.INDP like how 3SG.SBJ IPFV hit DEF guitar
\glt ‘I hear him that he’s playing the guitar.’ or ‘I hear him how he’s playing the guitar.’

\label{ex:key:1409}
\gll \textbf{E} \textbf{dé} \textbf{sé} dán gál e bin de kán yá.
\gls 3SG.SBJ BE.LOC QUOT that girl 3SG.SBJ PST IPFV come here
\glt ‘It’s that/it came to pass that that girl used to come here.’

\label{ex:key:1410}
\gll E \textbf{fáyn} \textbf{sé} e kán \textbf{yɛ́stadé}.
\gls 3SG.SBJ fine QUOT 3SG.SBJ come yesterday
\glt ‘It’s good that he came yesterday.’

\label{ex:key:1411}
\gll E \textbf{fáyn} sé \textbf{mék} e kán \textbf{tumɔ́ro}.
\gls 3SG.SBJ fine QUOT SBJV 3SG.SBJ come tomorrow
\glt ‘It’s good for him to come tomorrow.’ 

\label{ex:key:1412}
\gll E dɔ́n sté, a tínk sé e dɔ́n \textbf{sté} \textbf{wé} una bin gɛ́t insecticida yá.
\gls 3SG.SBJ PRF be.long 1SG.SBJ think QUOT 3SG.SBJ PRF be.long SUB 2PL PST get insecticide here
\glt ‘It’s long ago, I think that it’s long ago that you people had insecticide here/when you people last had insecticide here.’

\label{ex:key:1413}
\gll Yu nó \textbf{hía} \textbf{wé} a tɛ́l Mario sé quiero cocinar?
\gls 2SG NEG hear SUB 1SG.SBJ tell NAME QUOT I.want cook
\glt ‘You didn’t hear that I told Mario that I want to cook?’ or ‘You didn’t hear when I told Mario that I want to cook?’

\label{ex:key:1414}
\gll Mék yú nó \textbf{fíl} \textbf{sɔ́ri} \textbf{wé} a nó gí yú nó nátín.
\gls SBJV 2SG.INDP NEG feel sorry SUB 1SG.SBJ NEG give 2SG.INDP NEG nothing
\glt ‘Don’t be disappointed that I didn’t give you anything.’ 

\label{ex:key:1415}
\gll A de \textbf{fíl} \textbf{sɔ́ri} \textbf{sé} e de kíl di fɔl.
\gls 1SG.SBJ IPFV feel sorry QUOT 3SG.SBJ IPFV kill DEF fowl
\glt ‘I feel sorry that she’s killing the fowl.’

\label{ex:key:1416}
\gll \textbf{Tɛnk} \textbf{gɔ́d} \textbf{wé} yu dɔ́n kán!
\gls thank God SUB 2SG PRF come
\glt ‘Thank God that you have come!’

\label{ex:key:1418}
\gll A sé bikɔs una Camerún, una gɛ́t \textbf{di} \textbf{fúlis} \textbf{sé}, wé náw wé yu ték=an, yu go sɛ́l=an.
\gls 1SG.SBJ QUOT because 2PL PLACE 2PL get DEF foolishness QUOT SUB now SUB 2SG take=3SG.OBJ 2SG POT sell=3SG.OBJ
\glt ‘I say because you Cameroonians, you have the foolish habit that, when now, when you take it, you will sell it.’

\label{ex:key:1420}
\gll Ɔ́l dí mán dɛn [\textbf{wé} \textbf{dɛn} gɛ́t mɔní], na di tín wé dɛn de mék.
\gls all this man PL SUB 3PL get money FOC DEF thing SUB 3PL IPFV make
\glt ‘All these men who have money, that’s what they do.’ or ‘All these men, when they have money, that’s what they do.’

\label{ex:key:1421}
\gll Mék e bák yú di mɔní [\textbf{wé} e gɛ́t].
\gls SBJV 3SG.SBJ give.back 2SG.INDP DEF money SUB 3SG.SBJ get
\glt ‘Let him give you back the money that he got.’

\label{ex:key:1422}
\gll Somos \textbf{tú} \textbf{dásɔl} [wé wi dé láyf] (...)
\gls we.are two only SUB 1PL BE.LOC life (...)
\glt ‘We are, (it’s) only two of us that are alive (...)’ 

\label{ex:key:1423}
\gll Sɔn dé yét \textbf{sɛ́f} [wé a nó mék].
\gls some BE.LOC yet EMP SUB 1SG.SBJ NEG make
\glt ‘Some is actually still left that I haven’t made.’

\label{ex:key:1425}
\gll Porque dán tín na tín \textbf{dɛn} [wé \textbf{dɛn} dɔ́n sté dán tɛ́n dɛn wé esclavitud dé].
\gls because that thing FOC thing PL SUB 3PL PRF stay that time PL SUB slavery BE.LOC
\glt ‘Because those are things that have stayed (from) those times when there was slavery.’

\label{ex:key:1426}
\gll Bikɔs mí dé sɔn stáyl, layk \textbf{dán} \textbf{gɛ́l} [wé mí \textbf{wet=an} bin gó dé], a tɛ́l=an sé a wɔ́nt sí háw dɛn de mék.
\gls because 1SG.INDP BE.LOC some style like that girl SUB 1SG.INDP with=3SG.OBJ PST go there 1SG.SBJ tell=3SG.OBJ {} 1SG.SBJ want see how 3PL IPFV make
\glt ‘Because I was (feeling) a way, like that girl with whom I went there, I told her that I wanted to see how it is done.’

\label{ex:key:1427}
\gll Bɔt di pé wé yu gɛ́fɔ pé, if yu nó de gí mí yu fɔ́s \textbf{mán} [wé \textbf{na} \textbf{in} gí yú dí bɛlɛ́], yu de gí mi di pikín [wé de kɔmɔ́t].
\gls but DEF pay SUB 2SG have.to pay if 2SG NEG IPFV give 1SG.INDP 2SG first man SUB FOC 3SG.INDP give 2SG.INDP this belly 2SG IPFV give 1SG.INDP DEF child SUB IPFV come.out
\glt ‘But the price that you have to pay (is), if you don’t give me your first man, who it is him who gave you the first pregnancy, you will give me the child that will come out.’

\label{ex:key:1428}
\gll Na dán \textbf{bɔ́y} [wé a tɛ́l yú \textbf{sé} in mamá dɔ́n gó na Panyá].
\gls FOC that boy SUB 1SG.SBJ tell 2SG.INDP QUOT 3SG.POSS mother PRF go LOC Spain
\glt ‘It is that boy (of) who I told that his mother has gone to Spain.’

\label{ex:key:1429}
\gll A gɛ́t sɔn kɔ́mpin, sɔn \textbf{Ghana-mán} [wé a nó sabí \textbf{ús=sáy} dán mán dé].
\gls 1SG.SBJ get some friend some Ghana.CPD{}-man SUB 1SG.SBJ NEG know Q=side that man BE.LOC
\glt ‘I have a friend, a Ghanaian who I don’t know where that man is.’ 

\label{ex:key:1430}
\gll Ɛf yu chɔ́p ɔ́l \textbf{dís} \textbf{chɔ́p} [wé \textbf{e} nó dɔ́n], tumɔ́ro yu go sík.
\gls if 2SG eat all this food SUB 3SG.SBJ NEG done tomorrow 2SG POT be.sick
\glt ‘If you eat all this food that is not done you’ll be sick tomorrow.’

\label{ex:key:1431}
\gll \textbf{Mí} na wán húman [wé \textbf{a} síryɔs].
\gls 1SG.INDP FOC one woman SUB 1SG.SBJ be.serious
\glt ‘I [EMP] am a woman who is serious.’

\label{ex:key:1432}
\gll Pero \textbf{di} \textbf{gabonés} [wé de tɔ́k Bata] wet \textbf{di} \textbf{guineano} [wé de tɔ́k Bata], di sonido nó dé di sén.
\gls but DEF Gabonese SUB IPFV talk Fang with DEF Guinean SUB IPFV talk Fang DEF sound NEG BE.LOC DEF same
\glt ‘But the Gabonese who talks Fang and the Guinean who talks Fang, the sound is not the same.’

\label{ex:key:1433}
\gll Mék e bít yú, mék e dú yú di \textbf{dú} [e \textbf{wánt}] (...)
\gls SBJV 3SG.SBJ beat 2SG.INDP SBJV 3SG.SBJ do 2SG DEF do 3SG.SBJ want (...)
\glt ‘Let him beat you, let him do to you [what he wants] (...)’

\label{ex:key:1434}
\gll Sɔn bloques dɛn lɛ́f [\textbf{wé} dɛn gɛ́fɔ monta] nɔ́?
\gls some block.PL PL remain SUB 3PL have.to mount INTJ
\glt ‘Some blocks remain that have to be mounted, right?’

\label{ex:key:1435}
\gll Yu sí dán \textbf{pikín} dé [wé in mamá de gí=\textbf{an} chɔ́p]?
\gls 2SG see that child there SUB 3SG.POSS mother IPFV give=3SG.OBJ food
\glt ‘Have you seen that child whose mother is giving her food?’

\label{ex:key:1436}
\gll A bin sí di \textbf{pikín} [wé di húman bin gí chɔ́p na strít].
\gls 1SG.SBJ PST see DEF child SUB DEF woman PST give food LOC street
\glt ‘I saw the child that the woman gave food to in the street.’ 

\label{ex:key:1437}
\gll Di \textbf{béd} [\textbf{wé} e de slíp \textbf{pan}], e dé na di rúm.
\gls DEF bed SUB 3SG.SBJ IPFV sleep on 3SG.SBJ BE.LOC LOC DEF room
\glt ‘The bed that she sleeps on, it’s in the room.’

\label{ex:key:1438}
\gll Dɛn de gó wet dán \textbf{gɔ́n} [\textbf{wé} dɛn de kíl bíf] ɔ pistola.
\gls 3PL IPFV go with that gun SUB 3PL IPFV kill wild.animal or pistol
\glt ‘They go with that gun which they kill wild animals (with) or a pistol.’ 

\label{ex:key:1439}
\gll A kán kɔmɔ́t na dán \textbf{hós} [\textbf{wé} a bin dé].
\gls 1SG.SBJ PFV go.out LOC that house SUB 1SG.SBJ PST BE.LOC
\glt ‘I left that house which I had been (in).’

\label{ex:key:1440}
\gll Yu nó nó na ús=tín, matapenso?
\gls 2SG NEG know FOC Q=thing pestle
\glt ‘You don’t know what it is, a pestle?’

\label{ex:key:1440b}
\gll Dán tín [\textbf{wé} dɛn de mék súp], \textbf{fɔ} mék fufú.
\gls that thing SUB 3PL IPFV make soup PREP make fufu
\glt ‘That thing they make soup (with), in order to make fufu (with).’ 

\label{ex:key:1441}
\gll So na \textbf{di} \textbf{tín} [\textbf{wé} e rɔ́n], e kɔmɔ́t.
\gls so FOC DEF thing SUB 3SG.SBJ run 3SG.SBJ go.out
\glt ‘So that is why [lit. the thing that] she fled, (and) she left.’

\label{ex:key:1442}
\gll (...) e go sé e de fíɛ e nó go gí mí \textbf{di} \textbf{tín} [\textbf{wé} a de sɛ́n=an].
\gls (...) 3SG.SBJ POT QUOT 3SG.SBJ IPFV fear 3SG.SBJ NEG POT give 1SG.INDP DEF thing SUB 1SG.SBJ IPFV send=3SG.OBJ
\glt ‘(...) he would say he is afraid, he would not give me the thing that I had sent him (for).’

\label{ex:key:1443}
\gll A de gó nía \textbf{di} \textbf{sáy} [Paquita \textbf{sidɔ́n}].
\gls 1SG.SBJ IPFV go near DEF side NAME stay
\glt ‘I am going near where Paquita stays.’ 

\label{ex:key:1444}
\gll A ték tú peso a báy dán dís-tín, \textbf{sɔn} \textbf{smɔ́l} \textbf{pépa} dɛn de \textbf{pút}=\textbf{an} cacahuete].
\gls 1SG.SBJ take two peso 1SG.SBJ buy that this-thing some small paper 3PL IPFV put=3SG.OBJ groundnut
\glt ‘I took two pesos (and) I bought this whatsit, a small paper (into which) groundnuts are put.’

\label{ex:key:1445}
\gll Bikɔs \textbf{wán} \textbf{isla} dé [wé e fíba sé petroleo dé \textbf{na} \textbf{dís} \textbf{isla}].
\gls because one island BE.LOC SUB 3SG.SBJ seem QUOT oil BE.LOC LOC this island
\glt ‘Because there is an island of which it seems that there is oil on this island.’

\label{ex:key:1446}
\gll A sé blák gɛ́l dɛn gɛ́t \textbf{sɔn} \textbf{fáyn} [wé wáyt húman dɛn nó gɛ́t \textbf{dá} \textbf{wán}].
\gls 1SG.SBJ QUOT black girl PL get some fine SUB white woman PL NEG get that one
\glt ‘I say black girls have a beauty which white women do not have (that one).’

\label{ex:key:1447}
\gll (...) dɛn de kɔmɔ́t na wán \textbf{pueblo} [wé \textbf{in} \textbf{ném} na Basakato dé la Sagrada Familia.
\gls {} 3PL IPFV hail.from LOC one village SUB 3SG.POSS name FOC PLACE PLACE PLACE PLACE PLACE
\glt ‘(...) they come from a village whose name is Basakato dé la Sagrada Familia.’

\label{ex:key:1448}
\gll Dán \textbf{húman} [wé a só yú], \textbf{in} \textbf{motó} dé na strít.
\gls that woman SUB 1SG.SBJ show 2SG.INDP 3SG.POSS car BE.LOC LOC street
\glt ‘That woman which I showed you, her car is in the street.’

\label{ex:key:1449}
\gll A ték di stík \textbf{in} \textbf{kandá} [wé a sí dé], a rós=an.
\gls 1SG.SBJ take DEF tree 3SG.POSS bark SUB 1SG.SBJ see there 1SG.SBJ burn=3SG.OBJ
\glt ‘I took the bark of the tree that saw there, I burnt it.’

\label{ex:key:1450}
\gll A dɔ́n tɛ́l yú [\textbf{wétin} pás na nɛ́t], dán nɛ́t.
\gls 1SG.SBJ PRF tell 2SG.INDP what pass LOC night that night
\glt ‘I’ve already told you what happened in the night, that night.’

\label{ex:key:1451}
\gll Dɛn nó nó [\textbf{údat} hambɔ́g=an].
\gls 3PL NEG know who bother=3SG.OBJ
\glt ‘They don’t know who disturbed her.’

\label{ex:key:1452}
\gll Mí nó sabí [\textbf{ús=mán} dɛn kíl], a nɔ́ba hía dán torí sɛ́f.
\gls 1SG.INDP NEG know Q=man 3PL kill 1SG.SBJ NEG.PRF hear that story EMP
\glt ‘I don’t know which man they killed, I haven’t even heard that story.’

\label{ex:key:1453}
\gll E nɛ́a tɛ́l mí [\textbf{ús=tɛ́n} e go rích dé].
\gls 3SG.SBJ NEG.PRF tell 1SG.INDP Q=time 3SG.SBJ POT arrive there
\glt ‘He hasn’t told me when he is going to arrive there.’

\label{ex:key:1454}
\gll Bɔt mí wánt sabí [\textbf{háw} dán tín dé].
\gls but 1SG.INDP want know how that thing BE.LOC
\glt ‘But I wanted to know how that thing is.’

\label{ex:key:1455}
\gll Mí nó áks=an [\textbf{háw} \textbf{mɔ́ch} e wɔ́nt].
\gls 1SG.INDP NEG ask=3SG.OBJ how much 3SG.SBJ want
\glt ‘I [EMP] didn’t ask him how much he wants.’

\label{ex:key:1456}
\gll Sé yu wánt \textbf{sabí} \textbf{ɛf} rén de fɔ́l, nɔ́?
\gls QUOT 2SG want know if rain IPFV fall INTJ
\glt ‘(You) say you want to know if the rain is falling, right?’

\label{ex:key:1457}
\gll Mí sɛ́f, ɔ́l pɔ́sin dɛn kin \textbf{áks} mí \textbf{sé} yu dɔ́n bɔ́n?
\gls 1SG.INDP EMP all person 3PL HAB ask 1SG.INDP QUOT 2SG PRF give.birth
\glt ‘Even me, everybody usually asks me “have you given birth”?’

\label{ex:key:1458}
\gll \textbf{Wé} a go fínis skúl, a go tɔ́n dɔ́kta.
\gls SUB 1SG.SBJ POT finish school 1SG.SBJ POT turn doctor
\glt ‘When I finish school, I’ll become a doctor.’ 

\label{ex:key:1459}
\gll Pero \textbf{wé} a kán mít dís mán, \textbf{wé} wi bigín bɔ́n in yón pikín dɛn.
\gls but SUB 1SG.SBJ PFV meet this man SUB 1PL begin beget 3SG.POSS own child PL
\glt ‘But then/when I met this man, and then we began to have his own children.’

\label{ex:key:1460}
\gll \textbf{Wé} e \textbf{kin} kɔmɔ́t wók a \textbf{kin} mék=an só, lɛk háw mún fínis.
\gls SUB 3SG.SBJ HAB come.out work 1SG.SBJ HAB make=3SG.OBJ like.that like how month finish
\glt ‘When he leaves work, I do to him like this [stretches out hand in a gesture that indicates that her husband’s salary should be handed over to her], as soon as the month is over.’

\label{ex:key:1461}
\gll \textbf{Wé} a \textbf{rích} na hós dé, a \textbf{sé} ‘yu go tɛ́l mi di sáy wé unu kin gó mítɔp.’
\gls SUB 1SG.SBJ reach LOC house there 1SG.SBJ QUOT 2SG POT tell 1SG.INDP DEF side SUB 2PL HAB go meet
\glt ‘When I reached the house, I said “you’re going to tell me where you usually meet.’

\label{ex:key:1462}
\gll A go firma \textbf{wé} a go \textbf{dɔ́n} chɔ́p.
\gls 1SG.SBJ POT sign SUB 1SG.SBJ POT PRF eat
\glt ‘I will sign when I have finished eating.’

\label{ex:key:1463}
\gll Dɛn púl di motó na garaje \textbf{wé} \textbf{dɛn} \textbf{de} \textbf{pús}=\textbf{an}.
\gls 3PL remove DEF car LOC workshop SUB 3PL IPFV push=3SG.OBJ
\glt ‘They removed the car from the workshop by pushing it.’ 

\label{ex:key:1464}
\gll Náw fɔ mék dɛn fít gɛ́t wán amiga nadó \textbf{wé} \textbf{yu} \textbf{sísta} \textbf{dɛn} \textbf{sabí}, in go had.
\gls now PREP SBJV 3PL can get one girlfriend outside SUB 2SG sister 3PL know 3SG.INDP POT be.hard
\glt ‘Now for them to be able to have a girl-friend outside while/although your sisters know, that will be difficult.’

\ea{\label{ex:key:1465a}
\gll Yu nó bin dé na mákit, \textbf{wé} a tɛ́l yú sé mék yu bríng mi watá?
\gls 2SG NEG PST BE.LOC LOC market SUB 1SG.SBJ tell 2SG.INDP QUOT SBJV 2SG bring 1SG.INDP water
\glt ‘Weren’t you at the market although I had told you to bring me water?’

\label{ex:key:1465b}
\gll Wétin yu kán sin watá?
\gls what 2SG come without water
\glt ‘Why did you come without water?’

\ea{\label{ex:key:1466a}
\gll Sɔn mamá dɛn, dɛn bád.
\gls some mother PL 3PL bad
\glt ‘Some mothers, they are bad.’

\label{ex:key:1466b}
\gll \textbf{Wé} yu pikín, yu nó aconseja ín frɔn doce años.
\gls SUB 2SG child 2SG NEG advise 3SG.INDP from twelve years
\glt ‘Because as for your child, you didn’t advise her from twelve years on.’ [although you know about the dangers of early pregnancy].’ 

\label{ex:key:1467}
\gll Wétin yu de wét?
\gls what 2SG IPFV wait
\glt ‘What [why] are you waiting?’

\label{ex:key:1468}
\gll “Yu hól wán motó”, yu de dráyb=an, pero \textbf{sé} yu gɛ́t, \textbf{cuando} tienes, “a gɛ́t wán motó”.
\gls 2SG hold one car 2SG IPFV drive=3SG.OBJ but QUOT 2SG get when you.get 1SG.SBJ get one car
\glt ` “Yú hól wán motó” (means) you’re driving it, but if you possess it, when you have it “a gɛ́t wán motó”.’

\label{ex:key:1469}
\gll Dɛn púl di motó na garaje \textbf{sé} \textbf{dɛn} \textbf{de} \textbf{pús}=\textbf{an}.
\gls 3PL remove DEF car LOC workshop QUOT 3PL IPFV push=3SG.OBJ
\glt ‘They removed the car from the workshop by pushing it.’

\label{ex:key:1470}
\gll E dú di ejercicio \textbf{sé} \textbf{e} \textbf{táya}.
\gls 3SG.SBJ do DEF exercise QUOT 3SG.SBJ be.tired
\glt ‘She did the exercise while/although she was tired.’ 

\label{ex:key:1471}
\gll “A hól wán motó” na \textbf{lɛk} \textbf{sé} yu de dráyb wé yu de wók.
\gls 1SG.SBJ hold one car FOC like QUOT 2SG IPFV drive SUB 2SG IPFV work
\glt ‘“A hól wán motó” is like you drive (a car temporarily) while you work.’ 

\label{ex:key:1472}
\gll Di húman kán na hós \textbf{di} \textbf{áwa} [wé a de kúk].
\gls DEF woman come LOC house DEF hour SUB 1SG.SBJ IPFV cook
\glt ‘The woman came to the house when I was cooking.’ 

\label{ex:key:1473}
\gll \textbf{Di} \textbf{tɛ́n} [wé dɛn bin de kán hía wet kenú], (...)
\gls DEF time SUB 3PL PST IPFV come here with canoe (...)
\glt ‘(The time) when they were coming here by canoe (...)’

\label{ex:key:1474}
\gll \textbf{Di} \textbf{dé} [wé a nó wánt gí yú quinientos] a de gí yú trescientos para tu cigarillo.
\gls DEF day SUB 1SG.SBJ NEG want give 2SG.INDP five.hundred 1SG.SBJ IPFV give 2SG.INDP three.hundred for your cigarette
\glt ‘(The day) when I don’t want to give you five hundred, I give you three hundred for your cigarette.’

\label{ex:key:1475}
\gll Tumɔ́ro, \textbf{lɛk} \textbf{háw} yu tɔ́k wet Buehú, yu kɔ́l mí, (...)
\gls tomorrow like how 2SG talk with NAME 2SG call 1SG.INDP (...)
\glt ‘Tomorrow, as soon as you’ve talked to Buehu, you call me, (...)’ 

\label{ex:key:1476}
\gll \textbf{Bifó} a kin gráp, a de sí bíg bíg fáya.
\gls before 1SG.SBJ HAB get.up 1SG.SBJ IPFV see big REP fire
\glt ‘Before I could get up, I saw a huge fire.’

\label{ex:key:1477}
\gll (...) wé dɛn sáyn yu bigín baja mɔ́, \textbf{bifó} yu ɛ́nta.
\gls (...) SUB 3PL sign 2SG begin go.down more before 2SG enter
\glt ‘(...) when they have signed, you begin to go down once more before

\label{ex:key:1478}
\gll Lɛ́f=an, a go chɔ́p, \textbf{áfta} a go dríng.
\gls leave=3SG.OBJ 1SG.SBJ POT eat then 1SG.SBJ POT drink
\glt ‘Leave it, I will eat, then I will drink.’

\label{ex:key:1479}
\gll Sifta, \textbf{wé} a \textbf{dɔ́n} sifta ín, e de lɛ́f wet di watá.
\gls sift SUB 1SG.SBJ PRF sift 3SG.INDP 3SG.SBJ IPFV leave with DEF water
\glt ‘Sift (it), when I have sifted it, it’ll be left with the water.’

\label{ex:key:1480}
\gll A bin chɔ́p di plantí di \textbf{stáyl} [wé pɔ́sin dɛn fɔ Malábo dɛn de chɔ́p=an]
\gls 1SG.SBJ PST eat DEF plantain DEF style SUB person PL PREP Malabo 3PL IPFV food=3SG.OBJ
\glt ‘I ate the plantain the way Malabo people eat it.’ 

\label{ex:key:1481}
\gll Mí chɔ́p di plantí \textbf{lɛk} \textbf{háw} Malabo-pípul dɛn de chɔ́p=an.
\gls 1SG.INDP eat DEF plantain like how Malabo.CPD{}-people PL IPFV eat=3SG.OBj
\glt ‘I [EMP] ate the plantain the way Malabo people eat it.’ 

\label{ex:key:1482}
\gll A nó sabí ús=tín dɛn nó go restaura ín \textbf{lɛk} \textbf{háw} e bin dé jamás.
\gls 1SG.SBJ NEG know Q=thing 3PL NEG POT restorate 3SG.INDP like how 3SG.SBJ PST BE.LOC ever
\glt ‘I don’t know why they won’t restore it the way it was back then.’

\label{ex:key:1483}
\gll A de \textbf{hía} ín \textbf{lɛk} \textbf{háw} e de nák di gita.
\gls 1SG.SBJ IPFV hear 3SG.INDP like how 3SG.SBJ IPFV hit DEF guitar
\glt ‘I hear him playing the guitar.’ or ‘I hear (him) how he’s playing the guitar.’ 

\label{ex:key:1484}
\gll A de \textbf{smɛ́l} di sɛ́nt fɔ \textbf{lɛk} \textbf{háw} e de kúk plantí.
\gls 1SG.SBJ IPFV smell DEF scent PREP like how 3SG.SBJ IPFV cook plantain
\glt ‘I smell the scent of him cooking plantain.’ 

\label{ex:key:1485}
\gll Mí, \textbf{lɛk} \textbf{háw} \textbf{yu} \textbf{de} \textbf{sí} \textbf{mí} a dɔ́n sí plɛ́nte tín.
\gls 1SG.INDP like how 2SG IPFV see 1SG.INDP 1SG.SBJ PRF see plenty thing
\glt ‘(As for) me, when you looking at me you should also know that I have seen many things [in life].’

\label{ex:key:1486}
\gll \textbf{Lɛk} \textbf{háw} e \textbf{de} \textbf{wáka}, e butú, e nó bɛ́n.
\gls like how 3SG.SBJ IPFV walk 3SG.SBJ stoop 3SG.SBJ NEG bend
\glt ‘The way he’s walking (now), he’s stooped over, he’s not bent over.’

\label{ex:key:1487}
\gll \textbf{Lɛk} \textbf{háw} e \textbf{pút} dán mɔní na mi hán, nó wét mɔ́!
\gls like how 3SG.SBJ put that money LOC 1SG.POSS hand NEG wait more
\glt ‘As soon as he has put that money into my hand, no time to waste!’

\label{ex:key:1488}
\gll E nák di tébul an di \textbf{stáyl} [wé e \textbf{nák} di tébul strɔ́n], e kán sék di plét, an di plét kán brók.
\gls 3SG.SBJ hit DEF table and DEF style SUB 3SG.SBJ hit DEF table be.strong 3SG.SBJ PFV shake DEF plate and DEF plate PFV break
\glt ‘He hit the table and the way that he hit the table in a strong way, he shook the plate, and the plate broke.’

\label{ex:key:1489}
\gll Náw e dɔ́n wánt bigín de fɛ́t wet \textbf{di} chía, di \textbf{sáy} [wé dɛn sidɔ́n].
\gls now 3SG.SBJ PRF want begin IPFV fight with DEF chair DEF side SUB 3PL sit
\glt ‘Now he already wanted to begin fighting with the chair, where they were sitting.’

\label{ex:key:1490}
\gll Yu nó nó \textbf{di} \textbf{plés} [wé a sidɔ́n]?
\gls 2SG NEG know DEF PLACE SUB 1SG.SBJ stay
\glt ‘You don’t know where I stay?’

\label{ex:key:1491}
\gll \MakeUppercase{A} dɔ́n tú \textbf{ól} \textbf{fɔ} máred.
\gls 1SG.SBJ PRF too old PREP marry
\glt ‘I’m too old to marry.’ 

\label{ex:key:1492}
\gll A go firma, \textbf{wét} \textbf{fɔ} \textbf{mék} a chɔ́p, a bɛ́g.
\gls 1SG.SBJ POT sign wait PREP SBJV 1SG.SBJ eat 1SG.SBJ beg
\glt ‘I’ll sign, wait for me to eat/have eaten, please.’

\label{ex:key:1493}
\gll Dɛn kán kɛ́r mí na Madrid \textbf{fɔ} \textbf{mék} dɛn \textbf{gó} opera mí.
\gls 3PL PFV carry 1SG.INDP LOC PLACE PREP SBJV 3PL go operate 1SG.INDP
\glt ‘They took me to Madrid in order to operate on me.’ 

\label{ex:key:1494}
\gll Mi papá bin {kán} yá \textbf{fɔ} {kán} wók.
\gls 1SG.POSS father PST come here PREP come work
\glt ‘My father came here in order to work.’

\label{ex:key:1495}
\gll Layk háw dɛn go pút yú na tébul {yu} dɔ́n de rɔ́tin, \textbf{fɔ} \textbf{mék} dɛn gó bɛ́r yú kwík.
\gls like how 3PL POT put 2SG.INDP LOC table 2SG PRF IPFV rot PREP SBJV 3PL go bury 2SG.INDP quickly
\glt ‘As soon as they put you on the table you are already rotting away for you to be buried quickly.’

\label{ex:key:1496}
\gll Na ín \textbf{dɛn} táy=an \textbf{mék} \textbf{e} nó kɔmɔ́t.
\gls FOC 3SG.INDP 3PL tie=3SG.OBJ SBJV 3SG.SBJ NEG go.out
\glt ‘That’s why they tied it [the dog] so that it wouldn’t leave.’

\label{ex:key:1497}
\gll \textbf{A} go gó lúk=an fɔ wán vecino \textbf{mék} \textbf{a} lúk las damas.
\gls 1SG.SBJ POT go look=3SG.OBJ PREP one neighbour SBJV 1SG.SBJ look the.PL lady.PL
\glt ‘I’ll watch it at a neighbour’s in order to look at the (first) ladies.’

\label{ex:key:1498}
\gll \textbf{A} dríng di mɛ́rɛsin fɔ \textbf{mék} \textbf{a} \textbf{nó} sík.
\gls 1SG.SBJ drink DEF medicine PREP SBJV 1SG.SBJ NEG be.sick
\glt ‘I drank the medicine in order not to fall sick.’ 

\label{ex:key:1500}
\gll A bin lás gó a de fɛ́n bíg bíg mamá dɛn, \textbf{sé} \textbf{mék} dɛn bí mi gɛ́l frɛ́n, \textbf{mék} dɛn de gí mi chɔ́p.
\gls 1SG.SBJ PST end.up go 1SG.SBJ IPFV look.for big REP mother PL QUOT SBJV 3PL BE 1SG.POSS girl friend SBJV 3PL IPFV give 1SG.INDP food
\glt ‘I finally went to look for mature/established women for them to be my girlfriends, for them to give me food.’

\label{ex:key:1501}
\gll A wáka wet=an \textbf{sé} ‘tidé a go gó vive ín.’
\gls 1SG.SBJ walk with=3SG.OBJ QUOT today 1SG.SBJ POT go live 3SG.INDP
\glt ‘I went with him so that today I would witness it.’

\label{ex:key:1502}
\gll So e go na bús \textbf{e} \textbf{sé} e de gó kíl bíf.
\gls so 3SG.SBJ POT LOC forest 3SG.SBJ QUOT 3SG.SBJ IPFV go kill wild.animal
\glt ‘So he went to the forest in order to/he said he’d go kill a wild animal.’

\label{ex:key:1503}
\gll (...) e \textbf{sút}=an \textbf{sé} e \textbf{dɔ́n} \textbf{wɔ́nt} gó ték=an, (...) e sí di tín dɔ́n de tɔ́n pɔ́sin.
\gls (...) 3SG.SBJ shoot=3SG.OBJ QUOT 3SG.SBJ PRF want go take=3SG.OBJ (...) 3SG.SBJ see DEF thing PRF IPFV turn person
\glt ‘(...) he shot it [the animal] and was about to go take it, (when) he saw the thing turning into a human-being.’

\label{ex:key:1504}
\gll A drɛ́b mi mán \textbf{bikɔs} \textbf{sé} a nó wánt=an mɔ́.
\gls 1SG.SBJ drive 1SG.POSS man because QUOT 1SG.SBJ NEG want=3SG.OBJ more
\glt ‘I drove my husband away because I didn’t want him anymore.’

\label{ex:key:1506}
\gll \textbf{\'{A}s} dɛn nɔ́ba bin sí plantí, dɛn bin chɔ́p=an rɔ́n-wán.
\gls as 3PL NEG.PRF PST see plantain 3PL PST eat=3SG.OBJ wrong{-adv}
\glt ‘As they hadn’t yet seen plaintain, they ate it in the wrong way.’

\label{ex:key:1507}
\gll \textbf{Como} e sabí sé dán tín dé na mi hát (...)
\gls since 3SG.SBJ know QUOT that thing BE.LOC LOC 1SG.POSS heart (...)
\glt ‘Since she knows that that thing [matter] is in my heart (...)’ 

\label{ex:key:1508}
\gll E bin fɔ dé fáyn.
\gls 3SG.SBJ PST COND BE.LOC fine
\glt ‘That would have been fine.’

\label{ex:key:1509}
\gll Mí dú=an \textbf{fɔséko} \textbf{sé} a bin wánt hɛ́lp=an.
\gls 1SG.INDP do=3SG.OBJ due.to QUOT 1SG.SBJ PST want help=3SG.OBJ
\glt ‘I [EMP] did it because I wanted to help her.’

\label{ex:key:1510}
\gll Mék e wét \textbf{sóté} mún dɔ́n, wé wi gɛ́t di mɔní, gó báy di chɔ́p.
\gls SBJV 3SG.SBJ wait until month finish SUB 1PL get DEF money go buy DEF food
\glt ‘Let him wait until the month is over, when we have the money, (then we) go buy the food.’

\label{ex:key:1511}

\gls 1SG.SBJ eat bean.PL until 1SG.SBJ be.tired
\glt ‘I ate beans until I was tired (of it).’ 

\label{ex:key:1512}
\gll Tɔ́n=an tɔ́n=an, mék yu nó para \textbf{sóté} \textbf{mék} e tík lɛk háw e bin dé só.
