\gls 1SG.SBJ PST make=3SG.OBJ only PREP help
\glt ‘I did it only in order to help.’ 

\label{ex:key:1515}
\gll Wi de sí \textbf{dásɔl} \textbf{sé} di písis dɔ́n hɛ́ng.
\gls 1PL IPFV see only QUOT DEF piece.of.cloth PRF hang
\glt ‘We only see that the piece of cloth is already hanging.’

\label{ex:key:1516}
\gll \textbf{\'{O}nli} \textbf{bikɔs} yu de tɔ́k só, yu de salút só, yu de ánsa só.
\gls only because 2SG IPFV talk like.that 2SG IPFV greet like.that 2SG IPFV answer like.that
\glt ‘Only because you talk like that, you greet like that, you respond like that.’

\label{ex:key:1517}
\gll \textbf{Frɔn} \textbf{wé} dán bɛ́lps de wók, chico, e dɔ́n chénch.
\gls from SUB that babe IPFV work boy 3SG.SBJ PRF change
\glt ‘(Ever) since that babe has been working, man, she has changed.’

\label{ex:key:1518}
\gll \textbf{Frɔn} \textbf{wé} a bí pikín a bin wánt kɔmɔ́t na dís kɔ́ntri.
\gls from SUB 1SG.SBJ BE child 1SG.SBJ PST want go.away LOC this country
\glt ‘(Ever) since I was a child, I wanted to leave this country.’

\label{ex:key:1519}
\gll \textbf{Síns} \textbf{wé} a bí pikín, a de mɛ́mba fɔ kɔmɔ́t na dí kɔ́ntri.
\gls since SUB 1SG.SBJ BE child 1SG.SBJ IPFV think.of PREP go.out LOC this country
\glt ‘Since I was a child, I think about leaving this country.’

\label{ex:key:1520}
\gll Yu kɔmɔ́t dɔ́n, yu wánt ɛ́nta mɔ́, yu gɛ́fɔ gó pé ɔ́da quinientos.
\gls 2SG go.out down 2SG want enter more 2SG have.to go pay other five.hundred
\glt ‘(If) you come out from below and you want to enter again, you have to go pay five hundred again.’

\label{ex:key:1521}
\gll \textbf{Lɛk} \textbf{sé} yu de dríng nɔ́, dán pɔ́sin wé dé yandá, e de kán sube wí wet glás, na di tín wé mék mék yu nó dríng nó nátin wet glas.
\gls like QUOT 2SG IPFV drink INTJ that person SUB BE.LOC yonder 3SG.SBJ IPFV come go.up 1PL.INDP with glass FOC DEF thing SUB make SBJV 2SG NEG drink NEG nothing with glass
\glt ‘Supposing that you were (out) drinking, right, (and) that person who is over there comes up to us with a glass, that’s what would make you not drink anything from a glass.’

\label{ex:key:1522}
\gll \textbf{Ɛf} yu bin bigín lás wík, \textbf{lɛk} yu dɔ́n fínis di wók.
\gls if 2SG PST begin last week like 2SG PRF finish DEF work
\glt ‘If you had begun last week, you would have finished the work.’

\label{ex:key:1523}
\gll Pero \textbf{ɛf} na húman na bíg húman yu mán nó de tɔ́n bíg mán.
\gls but if FOC woman FOC big woman 2SG man NEG IPFV turn big man
\glt ‘But if it’s the wife who’s an influential woman, your [her] husband doesn’t [automatically] turn into an influential man.’

\label{ex:key:1524}
\gll \textbf{Ɛf} yu \textbf{chɔ́p} ɔ́l dís chɔ́p wé e nó dɔ́n, tumɔ́ro yu \textbf{go} sík.
\gls if 2SG eat all this food SUB 3SG.SBJ NEG done tomorrow 2SG POT sick
\glt ‘If you eat/ate all this food that is not done, you’ll/’d be sick tomorrow.’ 

\label{ex:key:1525}
\gll Mí nó \textbf{go} tɛ́l=an nó nátín.
\gls 1SG.INDP NEG POT tell=3SG.OBJ NEG nothing
\glt ‘I [EMP] wouldn’t tell him anything.’

\label{ex:key:1526}
\gll Nóto mí a \textbf{de} ɛ́nta ínsay dán hós ó.
\gls NEG.FOC 1SG.INDP 1SG.SBJ IPFV enter inside that house SP
\glt ‘It’s not me who would enter that [haunted] house.’

\label{ex:key:1527}
\gll \textbf{Ɛf} dɛn \textbf{go} gó bɛ́r yú, dɛn sén\textbf{ }go gó na dán bɛ́rin.
\gls if 3PL POT go bury 2SG.INDP 3PL EMP POT go LOC that burial
\glt ‘If they go to bury you, they themselves will go to that burial.’

\label{ex:key:1529}
\gll \textbf{Ɛf} a \textbf{bin} sí=an yɛ́stadé a \textbf{bin} \textbf{fɔ} gí=an di mɔní.
\gls if 1SG.SBJ PST see=3SG.OBJ yesterday 1SG.SBJ PST COND give=3SG.OBJ DEF money
\glt ‘If I had seen her yesterday, I would have given her the money.’

\label{ex:key:1530}
\gll \textbf{Ɛf} a \textbf{bin} nó sé e nó \textbf{go} fɔ́l a \textbf{fɔ} bríng ɔ́da sús.
\gls if 1SG.SBJ PST know QUOT 3SG.SBJ NEG POT rain 1SG.SBJ COND bring other shoe
\glt ‘If I had known that it wouldn’t rain, I would have worn other shoes.’

\label{ex:key:1531}
\gll E \textbf{bin} \textbf{fɔ} dé fáyn.
\gls 3SG.SBJ PST COND BE.LOC fine
\glt ‘It would have been nice.’

\label{ex:key:1532}
\gll Yu \textbf{fɔ} gɛ́t hemorragia sóté blɔ́d fínis náw.
\gls 2SG COND get hemorrhage until blood finish now
\glt ‘You would have hemorrhaged until your blood would have finished.’

\label{ex:key:1533}
\gll A \textbf{bin} \textbf{fɔ} máred a los veinti-uno \textbf{ɛf} Maura in papa nó \textbf{bin} dáy.
\gls 1SG.SBJ PST COND marry at DEF.PL twenty-one if NAME 3SG.POSS father NEG PST die
\glt ‘I should/would have married at twenty-one if Maura’s father hadn’t died.’ 

\label{ex:key:1534}
\gll Yu nó \textbf{sɛ́f}, yu jɔ́s kán yu nó go sabí, yu nó go tɔ́k lɛkɛ dɛ́n.
\gls 2SG know EMP 2SG just come 2SG NEG POT know 2SG NEG POT talk like 3PL.INDP
\glt ‘Even if you know, if you have just come, you wouldn’t know, you wouldn’t talk like them.’

\label{ex:key:1535}
\gll \textbf{Ɛf} yú na smɔ́l húman \textbf{sɛ́f}, dɛn go kɔ́l yú dama.
\gls if 2SG.INDP FOC small woman EMP 3PL POT call 2SG.INDP lady
\glt ‘Even if you [EMP] are an insignificant woman, they’ll call you lady.’

\label{ex:key:1536}
\gll \textbf{Aunque} nóto paludismo, if dɛn gív tratamiento yu nó go dáy.
\gls although NEG.FOC malaria if 3PL give treatment 2SG NEG POT die
\glt ‘Even if it is not malaria, if they give you a treatment, you won’t die [of the treatment].’ 

\label{ex:key:1537}
\gll \textbf{Adɔnkɛ́} e nó sí yú wán hól dé, e nó bísin, \textbf{wáns} yu bríng di pamáyn.
\gls even.if 3SG.SBJ NEG see 2SG.INDP one whole day 3SG.SBJ NEG be.busy once 2SG bring DEF oil
\glt ‘Even if she didn’t see you the whole day, she didn’t care, if only you brought the oil.’

\label{ex:key:1538}
\gll Bɔkú motó dɛn dé yá \textbf{só}, a nó nó sé Pancho mék lɛkɛ sé e de sube bihɛ́n wí e baja mɔ́.
\gls much car PL BE.LOC here like.that 1SG.SBJ NEG know QUOT NAME make like QUOT 3SG.SBJ IPFV go.up behind 1PL.INDP 3SG.SBJ go.down more
\glt ‘(Because) a lot of cars were just there, I didn’t know that Pancho pretended to go up behind us and went down again.’

\label{ex:key:1539}
\gll Yu mék=an in \textbf{fray-rɛ́s}, in banána \textbf{dé}, e go chɔ́p=an.
\gls 2SG make=3SG.OBJ 3SG.POSS fry.CPD{}-rice 3SG.POSS banana there 3SG.SBJ POT eat=3SG.OBJ
\glt ‘(if/when) you make him his fried rice (and) his banana, he will eat it.’


\label{ex:key:1541}
\gll Yu \textbf{nó} kɛ́r=an gó hospital?
\gls 2SG NEG carry=3SG.OBJ go hospital
\glt ‘Didn’t you take him to hospital?’

\label{ex:key:1542}
\gll Yu \textbf{de} kɛ́r=an \textbf{de} gó hospital.
\gls 2SG IPFV carry=3SG.OBJ NEG go hospital
\glt ‘You’re carrying him while going to the hospital.’

\label{ex:key:1543}
\gll E sé “mɔ́mi mɔ́mi, yu nó de sí dán mán wé e \textbf{rɔ́n} \textbf{gó} abuela in rúm?”
\gls 3SG.SBJ QUOT mum mum 2SG NEG IPFV see that man SUB 3SG.SBJ run go grandmother 3SG.POSS room
\glt ‘He said “mum, mum, don’t you see that man who ran into grandmother’s room?”’

\label{ex:key:1544}
\gll A kɛ́r=\textbf{an} gó na comedor.
\gls 1SG.SBJ carry=3SG.OBJ go LOC dining-room
\glt ‘I carried him to the dining-room.’

\label{ex:key:1545}
\gll Di bíg wán, a bin de \textbf{kɛ́r}=an \textbf{gó} \textbf{wáka} na nɛ́t wet Tokobé.
\gls DEF big one 1SG.SBJ PST IPFV carry=3SG.OBJ go walk LOC night with NAME
\glt ‘As for the big one, I was carrying it off travelling by night with Tokobé.’

\label{ex:key:1546}
\gll Kɛ́r di motó yu \textbf{bríng} \textbf{kán} \textbf{fɔ} yá.
\gls take DEF car 2SG bring come PREP here
\glt ‘Take the car and bring it here.’ 

\label{ex:key:1547}
\gll E kán \textbf{rɔ́n} \textbf{kɔmɔ́t} \textbf{na} kɔ́ntri, (...)
\gls 3SG.SBJ PFV run go.out LOC country (...)
\glt ‘She fled from the [her] home town, (...)’ 

\label{ex:key:1546}
\gll A tínk sé e gɛ́t treinta y ocho años náw wé e dɔ́n de \textbf{gó} \textbf{rích} cuarenta.
\gls 1SG.SBJ think QUOT 3SG.SBJ get thirty and eight years now SUB 3SG.SBJ PRF IPFV go reach forty
\glt ‘I think that he’s thirty-eight years old now and is already going towards forty.’ 

\label{ex:key:1549}
\gll Dɛn rɔ́n \textbf{na} \textbf{farmacia}, receta de mɛ́rɛsin.
\gls 3PL run LOC pharmacy prescription of medicine
\glt ‘They ran to the pharmacy, (to get a) prescription for medicine.’

\label{ex:key:1551}
\gll \'{A}pás tumɔ́ro a go \textbf{gó} \textbf{sí} mi mamá.
\gls after tomorrow 1SG.SBJ POT go see 1SG.POSS mother
\glt ‘After tomorrow, I will go see my mother.’

\label{ex:key:1552}
\gll \textbf{Yu} kán \textbf{yu} púl=an.
\gls 2SG come 2SG remove=3SG.OBJ
\glt ‘You came and removed it.’

\label{ex:key:1553}
\gll Na ín \textbf{e} de kán púl mí dán torí.
\gls FOC 3SG.INDP 3SG.SBJ IPFV come remove 1SG.INDP that story
\glt ‘That’s when she was coming to tell me that story.’

\label{ex:key:1554}
\gll Na ín e \textbf{kán} \textbf{vɛ́ks}, e \textbf{kán} \textbf{gó}.
\gls FOC 3SG.INDP 3SG.SBJ PFV be.angry 3SG.SBJ PFV go
\glt ‘That’s why he got angry, (and) he left.’

\label{ex:key:1555}
\gll Porque if yu mék, yu sí dán polvo, e de pút=an ínsay, \textbf{yu} \textbf{kán} \textbf{yu} \textbf{dríng}, (...)
\gls because if 2SG make 2SG see that powder 3SG.SBJ IPFV put=3SG.OBJ inside 2SG come 2SG drink (...)
\glt ‘Because if you make, you see that powder, he’s putting it inside, you come and drink (...)’

\label{ex:key:1556}
\gll Ɛf yu wánt bába, yu wánt \textbf{gó} na peluquería \textbf{gó} \textbf{kɔ́t} yu hía.
\gls if 2SG want cut.hair 2SG want go LOC hairdresser’s go cut 2SG hair
\glt ‘If you want to have a hair-cut, you want to go cut your hair at the hairdresser’s.’

\label{ex:key:1557}
\gll Dán mán fít \textbf{kán} wán dé \textbf{kán} \textbf{ték} yú sé “kán wi gó”, (...)
\gls that man can come one day come take 2SG.INDP QUOT come 1PL go (...)
\glt ‘That man can come take you one day (and) say “let’s go” (...)’ 

\label{ex:key:1558}
\gll A \textbf{gó} fɔ kɔ́ntri a \textbf{gó} \textbf{bɔ́n}.
\gls 1SG.SBJ go PREP country 1SG.SBJ go give.birth
\glt ‘I went to my home town in order to give birth.’

\label{ex:key:1559}
\gll Dɛn kán \textbf{kɛ́r} mí na Madrid \textbf{fɔ} mék dɛn \textbf{gó} opera mí.
\gls 3PL PFV carry 1SG.INDP LOC PLACE PREP SBJV 3PL go operate 1SG.INDP
\glt ‘They took me to Madrid in order to go and operate me.’

\label{ex:key:1560}
\gll A púl in camiseta, a pút=an pantáp béd, \textbf{a} \textbf{gó} \textbf{a} \textbf{púl} \textbf{di} \textbf{trɔsis} a híb=an ínsay di bañera.
\gls 1SG.SBJ remove 3SG.POSS singlet 1SG.SBJ put=3SG.OBJ top bed 1SG.SBJ go 1SG.SBJ remove DEF trousers 1SG.SBJ throw=3SG.OBJ inside DEF bath.tub
\glt ‘I removed his singlet, I put him on the bed, I (went and) removed his trousers, I heaved him into the bath tub.’

\label{ex:key:1561}
\gll E kin dé lɛk sé dɛn ték \textbf{wán} \textbf{blák} \textbf{lapá} dɛn kɔ́ba yú.
\gls 3SG.SBJ HAB BE.LOC like QUOT 3PL take one black cloth 3PL cover 2SG.INDP
\glt ‘It is usually so that they cover you with a black cloth.’

\label{ex:key:1562}
\gll Yu fít gó sé “bueno a ték \textbf{páwa} gó” (...)
\gls 2SG can go QUOT good 1SG.SBJ take power go (...)
\glt ‘You can go and say, “well, I leave by my own authority” (...)’

\label{ex:key:1563}
\gll A ték \textbf{papá} \textbf{gɔ́d} bɛ́g=an.
\gls 1SG.SBJ take father God ask=3SG.OBJ
\glt ‘I implored him in the name of God.’

\label{ex:key:1564}
\gll A ték=\textbf{an} pút=\textbf{an} pantáp mi bɛlɛ́.
\gls 1SG.SBJ take=3SG.OBJ put=3SG.OBJ top 1SG.POSS belly
\glt ‘I (took him and) put him onto my belly.’

\label{ex:key:1565}
\gll \textbf{Yu} ték di maíz \textbf{yu} hól=an.
\gls 2SG take DEF maize 2SG hold=3SG.OBJ
\glt ‘You take the maize (and) you hold it.’

\label{ex:key:1566}
\gll A tɛ́l yú sé mi mán ték ín \textbf{yáy} e pút=an bɔtɔ́n grɔ́n só.
\gls 1SG.SBJ tell 2SG.INDP QUOT 1SG.POSS man take 3SG.POSS eye 3SG.SBJ put3SG.OBJ bottom ground like.that
\glt ‘I tell you that my husband diverted his eye [gaze] down like this.’

\label{ex:key:1567}
\gll Porque e fíba sé \textbf{di} \textbf{gɛ́l} [wé e bin de \textbf{ték} \textbf{kɔmɔ́t}], e bin gɛ́t bɔkú bɔ́y dɛn.
\gls because 3SG.SBJ seem QUOT DEF girl SUB 3SG.SBJ PST IPFV take go.out 3SG.SBJ PST get much boy PL
\glt ‘Because it seems that the girl that he was going out with, she had many boyfriends.’

\label{ex:key:1568}
\gll \'{U}s=káyn plɛ́nk dɛn \textbf{ték} \textbf{bíl} di hós?
\gls Q=kind board 3PL take build DEF house
\glt ‘What kind of board did they build the house with?’

\label{ex:key:1569}
\gll Na ús=káyn stáyl yu \textbf{ték} \textbf{kán} na yá?
\gls FOC Q=kind style 2SG take come LOC here
\glt ‘How did you come here.’ 

\label{ex:key:1570}
\gll Dɛn \textbf{bíl} di strít \textbf{wet} caterpillar.
\gls 3PL build DEF street with caterpillar
\glt ‘The street was built with a caterpillar.’ 

\label{ex:key:1571}
\gll \textbf{Wet} ús=káyn tín dɛn \textbf{ték} \textbf{bíl} di hós?
\gls with Q=kind thing 3PL take build DEF house
\glt ‘(With) what did they build the house with?’

\label{ex:key:1572}
\gll \textbf{Wet} ús=káyn stík yu bin \textbf{ték} \textbf{bíl} di hós?
\gls with Q=kind wood 2SG PST take build DEF house
\glt ‘(With) what kind of wood did you build the house with?’

\label{ex:key:1573}
\gll Yɛ́s, Concha \textbf{fála} \textbf{Princess} \textbf{gó} viaje.
\gls yes NAME follow NAME go voyage
\glt ‘Yes, Concha went on the voyage together with Princess.’

\label{ex:key:1574}
\gll A \textbf{jwɛ́n} Boyé \textbf{fɔ} \textbf{chɔ́p}.
\gls 1SG.SBJ join NAME PREP eat
\glt ‘I ate together with Boyé.’ 

\label{ex:key:1575}
\gll E gó \textbf{wet} in mamá?
\gls 3SG.SBJ go with 3SG.POSS mother
\glt ‘Did he go with his mother?’

\label{ex:key:1576}
\gll Lage de \textbf{tɔ́k} Bubɛ \textbf{pás} mí.
\gls NAME IPFV talk Bube pass 1SG.INDP
\glt ‘Lage speaks Bube better than me.’ 

\label{ex:key:1577}
\gll A \textbf{sí} sɔn wáyt pambɔ́d \textbf{de} \textbf{kán}.
\gls 1SG.SBJ see some white bird IPFV come
\glt ‘I saw a white bird coming.’

\label{ex:key:1578}
\gll If yu gó fɔ di máred, yu \textbf{sí=an} \textbf{e} \textbf{fáyn}.
\gls if 2SG go PREP DEF marry 2SG see=3SG.OBJ 3SG.SBJ be.fine
\glt ‘If you go to the marriage, you see it (to be) nice.’ [Lit. ‘(...) it is nice.’] 

\label{ex:key:1579}
\gll Yu jɔ́s \textbf{hía} \textbf{sé} pɔ́sin dɛn bin de tɔ́k bɔt yu nó lístin.
\gls 2SG just hear QUOT person PL PST IPFV talk but 2SG NEG listen
\glt ‘You just heard that people were talking but you didn’t listen.’

\label{ex:key:1580}
\gll \MakeUppercase{A} \textbf{lás} \textbf{chɔ́p}.
\gls 1SG.SBJ be.last eat
\glt ‘I was the last to eat/I ended up eating.’

\label{ex:key:1582}
\gll A wás \textbf{fɔ́s}.
\gls 1SG.SBJ wash first
\glt ‘I washed (myself) first.’ 

\label{ex:key:1583}
\gll Yu dɔ́n \textbf{sté} \textbf{kán}?
\gls 2SG PRF stay come
\glt ‘Did you come long ago?’ 

\label{ex:key:1584}
\gll \textbf{A} \textbf{sté} wé \textbf{a} nɛ́va chɔ́p.
\gls 1SG.SBJ stay SUB 1SG.SBJ NEG.PRF eat
\glt ‘It’s been long since I haven’t eaten.’ 

\label{ex:key:1585}
\gll \textbf{E} nó \textbf{sté} a recibe di carta, di tín wé a bɛ́g.
\gls 3SG.SBJ NEG stay 1SG.SBJ receive DEF letter DEF thing SUB 1SG.SBJ ask.for
\glt ‘It wasn’t long and I received the letter, the thing I (had) asked for.’

\label{ex:key:1586}
\gll A kɛ́r=\textbf{an} gó na comedor.
\gls 1SG.SBJ carry=3SG.OBJ go LOC dining-room
\glt ‘I carried him to the dining-room.’

\label{ex:key:1588}
\gll E mít \textbf{mí} \textbf{a} de kúk sɛ́f.
\gls 3SG.SBJ meet 1SG.INDP 1SG.SBJ IPFV cook EMP
\glt ‘He came across me while I was actually cooking.’ 

\label{ex:key:1589}
\gll Yu pikín sidɔ́n \textbf{de} \textbf{chɔ́p} dɛn tú brɛ́d.
\gls 2SG child sit IPFV eat 3PL two bread
\glt ‘Your child was sitting (there) eating those two loaves of bread.’

\label{ex:key:1590}
\gll A lɛ́f di domɔ́t \textbf{ópin}.
\gls 1SG.SBJ leave DEF door be.open
\glt ‘I left the door open.’

\label{ex:key:1591}
\gll E \textbf{dríng} di watá \textbf{kól}.
\gls 3SG.SBJ drink DEF water be.cold
\glt ‘He drank the water (and it was) cold.’

\label{ex:key:1592}
\gll Dɛn \textbf{chɔ́p} di banána \textbf{grín}.
\gls 3PL eat DEF banana be.green
\glt ‘They ate the banana green [unripe].’

\label{ex:key:1593}
\gll A \textbf{kɛ́r} di bokit-pán \textbf{ɛ́nti}.
\gls 1SG.SBJ carry DEF bucket.CPD{}-pan be.empty
\glt ‘I carried the bucket empty.’

\label{ex:key:1594}
\gll E \textbf{kɔmɔ́t} na rúm \textbf{nékɛd}.
\gls 3SG.SBJ go.out LOC room be.naked
\glt ‘He left the room naked.’

\label{ex:key:1595}
\gll E \textbf{kɔmɔ́t} na wók \textbf{wet} \textbf{hángri}.
\gls 3SG.SBJ go.out LOC work with hunger
\glt ‘He left work hungry.’

\label{ex:key:1596}
\gll Yu pikín \textbf{sidɔ́n} \textbf{de} \textbf{chɔ́p} dɛn tú brɛ́d.
\gls 2SG child sit IPFV eat 3PL two bread
\glt ‘Your child was sitting there eating those two loaves of bread.’

\label{ex:key:1597}
\gll Dɛn \textbf{sidɔ́n} \textbf{dɛn} \textbf{ráwn} di fáya.
\gls 3PL sit 3PL surround DEF fire
\glt ‘They’re sitting around the fire.’ or ‘They sat down around the fire.’

\label{ex:key:1598}
\gll Di pikín \textbf{dé} dé \textbf{de} \textbf{kráy}.
\gls DEF child BE.LOC there IPFV cry
\glt ‘The child is just (standing/sitting/lying) there crying.’

\label{ex:key:1599}
\gll Dɛn \textbf{de} \textbf{fála} dɛn sɛ́f dɛn \textbf{de} \textbf{rɔ́n}.
\gls 3PL IPFV follow 3PL self 3PL IPFV run
\glt ‘They’re following each other running.’ 

\label{ex:key:1600}
\gll E nó gɛ́t mɔní, wétin e de \textbf{wáka} e de \textbf{ópin} in sɛ́f so?
\gls 3SG.SBJ NEG get money what 3SG.SBJ IPFV walk 3SG.SBJ IPFV open 3SG.POSS self like.that
\glt ‘He doesn’t have money, why does he go around boasting like that?’ 

\label{ex:key:1601}
\gll Pero dɛn kán \textbf{dú} \textbf{mí} \textbf{a} de sté na Móka, dɛn kán dú mí na Móka.
\gls but 3PL PFV do 1SG.INDP 1SG.SBJ IPFV stay LOC PLACE 3PL PFV do 1SG.INDP LOC PLACE
\glt ‘But they did it to me while I was staying in Moka, they did it to me in Moka.’

\gls then 2PL buy DEF bricks PL tomorrow
\glt ‘Then you [plural] buy the bricks tomorrow.’ 

\label{ex:key:1699}
\gll A \textbf{ralla} ín wet \textbf{rallador}.
\gls 1SG.SBJ grate 3SG.INDP with grater
\glt ‘I grated it with a grater.’ 

\label{ex:key:1700}
\gll Yu go gɛ́t \textbf{prueba-s}.
\gls 2SG POT get proof-PL
\glt ‘You will have proof.’

\label{ex:key:1701}
\gll Mí wet Rubi wi mék jwɛn-jwɛ́n, wi báy pía, wi báy sadín, wi báy \textbf{tomates}, wi \textbf{desayuna}.
\gls 1SG.INDP with NAME 1PL make RED.CPD{}-join 1PL buy avocado 1PL buy sardine 1PL buy tomatoes 1PL have.breakfast
\glt ‘Me and Rubi, we teamed up and bought avocados, we bought sardines, we bought tomatoes, we had breakfast.’

\label{ex:key:1702}
\gll Na \textbf{traducción} \textbf{directa} e mék.
\gls FOC translation direct 3SG.SBJ make
\glt ‘It’s a direct translation that she made.’

\label{ex:key:1703}
\gll Ɛf yu bin kán bigín \textbf{las} \textbf{semana} yu bin fɔ dɔ́n fínis tidé.
\gls if 2SG PST PFV begin last week 2SG PST COND PRF finish today
\glt ‘If you had begun last week you would have been finished today.’

\label{ex:key:1705}
\gll E bríng fís, e kúk sɔn \textbf{especial} fís, e gí mí mék a chɔ́p.
\gls 3SG.SBJ bring fish 3SG.SBJ cook some special fish 3SG.SBJ give 1SG.INDP SBJV 1SG.SBJ eat
\glt ‘She brought (a) fish, she cooked a particular fish and gave it to me in order to eat.’

\label{ex:key:1706}
\gll Dí wán go tɔ́n plába \textbf{serio}.
\gls this one POT turn trouble serious
\glt ‘This will turn into real trouble.’

\label{ex:key:1707}
\gll ‘Dí mán dé trɔ́n’ nó dé fáyn, e nó gɛ́t \textbf{sentido} fáyn.
\gls this man BE.LOC strong NEG BE.LOC fine 3SG.SBJ NEG get meaning fine
\glt ‘“Dí man dé trɔn” is not nice, it doesn’t have a proper meaning.’

\label{ex:key:1708}
\gll E de gí wán \textbf{vuelta} kwík.
\gls 3SG.SBJ IPFV give one round quickly
\glt ‘She’s taking a walk quickly.’

\label{ex:key:1709}
\gll Frɔn na yá só dɛn kin \textbf{controla} di húman.
\gls from LOC here like.that 3PL HAB control DEF woman
\glt ‘From here they control the woman.’

\label{ex:key:1710}
\gll Pɔ́sin go \textbf{entiende} bɔt e nó dé \textbf{bien}.
\gls person POT understand but 3SG.SBJ NEG BE.LOC good
\glt ‘One would understand but it isn’t good.’ 

\label{ex:key:1711}
\gll E \textbf{sufre} wé náw dɛn dɔ́n lɛ́f=an, e dɔ́n klós.
\gls 3SG.SBJ suffer SUB now 3PL PRF leave=3SG.OBJ 3SG.SBJ PRF close
\glt ‘It [the building] suffered, while now they have abandoned it, it is closed.’ 

\label{ex:key:1712}
\gll A bigín de \textbf{pica}\textit{{}-}\textbf{píca}, wi fráy \textbf{patata}, wi fráy plantí.
\gls 1SG.SBJ begin IPFV RED.CPD-cut.up 1PL fry potato 1PL fry plantain
\glt ‘I began to (repeatedly) snip [the trimmings], we fried potatoes, we fried plantain.’

\gll Fíba nó \textbf{sube} ín.

\glt ‘The fever hasn’t risen on him.’

\gll A go \textbf{sigue} chɔ́p.
\gls 1SG.SBJ POT continue eat
\glt ‘I’ll continue eating.’

\label{ex:key:1715}
\gll Bɔkú motó dɛn dé yá só, a nó nó sé Pancho mék lɛk sé e de \textbf{sube} bihɛ́n wé e \textbf{baja} mɔ́.
\gls much car PL BE.LOC here like.that 1SG.SBJ NEG know QUOT NAME make like QUOT 3SG.SBJ IPFV go.up behind SUB 3SG.SBJ go.down more
\glt ‘So many cars were there, I didn’t know Pancho pretended to go up behind us (and) went down again.’

\label{ex:key:1717}

\gls DEF man be.white
\glt ‘The man is white.’ 

\label{ex:key:1723}

\gls since 1PL.INDP IPFV call=3SG.OBJ monkey LOC Spanish 3SG.INDP think=3SG.OBJ QUOT if 3SG.SBJ talk QUOT one monkey 3SG.SBJ POT BE.LOC fine
\glt ‘Since we [EMP] call it “mono” in Spanish, he [EMP] understood it such that if he said “one monkey”, it would be all right.’

\label{ex:key:1724}

\label{ex:key:1725}
\gll 'As in sísta dɛn bin de kɔ́l in mamá sé sísta, in de kɔ́l in mamá sé sísta.

\glt ‘As her sisters would call her mother sister, she [EMP] would call her mother sister.’

\label{ex:key:1726}
\gll Bɛt a dɔ́n nó wétin yu níd, \textbf{bikɔs} wi gɛ́t sɔn prɔ́blɛm wé wi de tɔ́k Pichi na Malábo.

\label{ex:key:1728}

\label{ex:key:1729}

\label{ex:key:1761}
\gll Wé dɔ́kta ópin, wé dɛn bigín drɔ́ di, sɔn tín we e kin dé bihɛ́n \textbf{placenta}, na \textbf{membrana}, sɔn kán lɛ́f bifó di \textbf{matriz}, so di \textbf{matriz} nó kán lɔ́k.
\gls SUB doctor open SUB 3PL begin draw DEF some thing SUB 3SG.SBJ HAB BE.LOC behind placenta FOC membrane some PFV remain before DEF womb so DEF womb NEG PFV lock

\label{ex:key:1762}
\gll Hɛ́, a go fála yú bikɔs sɔn \textbf{cable} dé wé na fɔ Opel, yu \textbf{intenta} bríng Opel in yón na \textbf{corriente}, Opel de kɛ́r bɔkú \textbf{corriente} só e nó go fít ɛ́nta na dán \textbf{bujía}, yu go wánda sɛ́f.\\
\gls INTJ 1SG.SBJ POT accompany 2SG.INDP because some cable BE.LOC SUB FOC PREP NAME 2SG try bring NAME 3SG.POSS own FOC electricity NAME IPFV take much electricity like.that 3SG.SBJ NEG POT can enter LOC that ignition.plug 2SG POT wonder EMP
\glt ‘Hey, I’ll accompany you because there’s a cable which is an Opel (cable), (and if) you try to connect the Opel one with electricity, Opel takes a lot of electricity, so it won’t be able to enter that ignition plug, (and) you’ll be very surprised.’

\label{ex:key:78}
\gll Di tín sɔ́rin=\textbf{an} bɔkú.
\gls DEF thing make.sorry=3SG.OBJ much
\glt ‘This made her feel very sorry.’

\label{ex:key:79}
\gll A sɔ́ri [\textbf{sɔ́r\`{ĩ}}] sé e kíl di dɔ́g.
\gls 1SG.SBJ feel.sorry {} QUOT 3SG.SBJ kill DEF dog
\glt ‘I felt sorry that she killed the dog.’

\label{ex:key:80}
\glll A bin wánt kɔmɔ́t na dís kɔ́ntri.

what make that one

\label{ex:key:91}

\label{ex:key:97}

\gll Náw dɛn \textbf{de} \textbf{jís} \textbf{de} kán.

\label{ex:key:101}

\label{ex:key:104}

\label{ex:key:105}

\label{ex:key:106}

\label{ex:key:108}

\label{ex:key:176}

\label{ex:key:177}

\label{ex:key:178}

\label{ex:key:180}

\label{ex:key:191}
\gll Wán dé \textbf{sɔn} \textbf{pɔ́sin} bin kán sé, e de tɔ́k sé yu dɔ́n gí wán golpe \textbf{sɔn} \textbf{sáy}.

\glt ‘Djunais said, really Rubi, this girl likes you.’

\label{ex:key:193}

\label{ex:key:194}

\label{ex:key:195}

\label{ex:key:198}

\label{ex:key:199}

\label{ex:key:200}

\label{ex:key:201}
\gll Cuñado, mí gɛ́fɔ fɛ́n \textbf{dán} \textbf{mi} prima ó, Cristina.
\gls brother-in-law 1SG.INDP have.to look.for that 1SG.POSS cousin.F SP NAME
\glt ‘Brother(-in-law), I [EMP] really have to look for that my (female) cousin, Cristina.’

\label{ex:key:202}
\gll Ɛhɛ́, wán glás watá aparte, yu pút=an ínsay, \textbf{dán} \textbf{wán} \textbf{dé,} yu fít ték medio fɔ dán sén glas (...)

\glt ‘Exactly, one glass of water separately, you put it inside, as for that one, you can take half in that very glass (...)’

\label{ex:key:203}

\label{ex:key:204}

\glt ‘With all those borders that are changing.’

\label{ex:key:205}
\gll Wi de gó dɔ́n, wi de gó lɛ́f=an di sáy \textbf{dán} \textbf{motó} \textbf{dé}.

\label{ex:key:206a}
\gll Wán glás watá?
\gls one glass water
\glt ‘One glass of water?’

\label{ex:key:207}

\label{ex:key:208}

\label{ex:key:209}
\gll Fít sifta ín sóté tú tɛ́n mék mék dán smɔ́l smɔ́l \textbf{watá} \textbf{dɛn} nó lɛ́f.

\glt ‘(You) can sieve it up to two times in order not to make that little bit of water remain.’

\label{ex:key:210}
\gll A bin de vɔ́mit dán \textbf{leche} \textbf{dɛn} fɔ́s fɔ́s tɛ́n dɛn.
\gls 1SG.SBJ PST IPFV vomit that milk PL first REP time PL
\glt ‘I was throwing up that milk during the first few times.’

\label{ex:key:211}
\gll E gɛ́t \textbf{tú} \textbf{pikín} \textbf{dɛn} na Panyá sɛ́f.
\gls 3SG.SBJ get two child PL LOC Spain EMP
\glt ‘She even has two children in Spain.’

\label{ex:key:212}
\gll E bríng \textbf{trí} \textbf{kasára}, e lé dɛ́n pantáp di tébul.
\gls 3SG.SBJ bring three cassava 3SG.SBJ lie 3PL.INDP on DEF table
\glt ‘He brought three cassavas and put them on the table.’

\label{ex:key:213}
\gll Yu wánt báy cuaderno, bolí \textbf{ɔ́l} \textbf{dán} \textbf{tín} \textbf{dɛn} na wet dólar.
\gls 2SG want buy exercise.book pen all that thing PL FOC with dollar
\glt ‘You want to buy an exercise book, pen and all those things, it’s with dollars.’

\label{ex:key:214}
\gll \textbf{Bɔkú} \textbf{motó} \textbf{dɛn} dé yá só, (...)
\gls much car PL BE.LOC here like.that (...)
\glt ‘(Since) there were many cars around, (...)’

\label{ex:key:215}
\gll Mí, lɛk háw yu de sí mí, a dɔ́n sí \textbf{plɛ́nte} \textbf{tín}.
\gls 1SG.INDP like how 2SG IPFV see 1SG.INDP 1SG.SBJ PRF see plenty thing
\glt ‘As for me, as you see me (now), I’ve seen many things (in life).’

\label{ex:key:216}
\gll \'{A}fta dɛ́n na mi \textbf{sobrinos} \textbf{dɛn}.
\gls then 3PL.INDP FOC 1SG.POSS nephew.PL PL
\glt ‘So, they are my nephews.’

\label{ex:key:217}
\gll Ɔ́l Ghána \textbf{bɔ́y-s} \textbf{dɛn}, wé dɛn dé (...)
\gls all Ghana boy-PL PL SUB 3PL BE.LOC (...)
\glt ‘All the Ghanaian guys that were around (...)’

\label{ex:key:218}
\gll A dɔ́n explica \textbf{Boyé} \textbf{dɛn}, sé na só mi de mɛ́mba, ɔ́l tín.
\gls 1SG.SBJ PRF explain NAME PL QUOT FOC like.that 1SG.INDP IPFV remember all thing
\glt ‘I have explained to Boyé and the others that this is how I remember everything.’

\label{ex:key:219}
\gll \textbf{Di} \textbf{húman} wé \textbf{dɛn} fáyn mɔ́ na América-Latina húman dɛn.
\gls DEF woman SUB 3PL fine more LOC PLACE woman PL
\glt ‘The women who are the most beautiful are Latin American women.’

\label{ex:key:220}
\gll Na dé dís wán dɛn mamá \textbf{dɛn} de mék ɛ́ni tín.
\gls FOC there this one 3PL mother 3PL IPFV make every thing
\glt ‘It is then that these ones’ mothers do every thing.’

\label{ex:key:221}
\gll Estudiante fɔ Guinea \textbf{dɛn} de sɔ́fa plɛ́nte.
\gls student PREP PLACE 3PL/PL IPFV suffer plenty
\glt ‘Guinean students were suffering a lot.’

\label{ex:key:222}
\gll Na \textbf{mán} in suerte.
\gls FOC man 3SG.POSS luck
\glt ‘That’s the fortune of men.’

\label{ex:key:223}
\gll \textbf{Dɔ́g} kin bɛ́t.
\gls dog HAB bite
\glt ‘Dogs bite.’

\label{ex:key:224}
\gll \textbf{Chɔ́p} dé na hós, \textbf{pamáyn} dé (...)
\gls food BE.LOC LOC house oil BE.LOC (...)
\glt ‘There’s food in the house, there’s oil (...)’

\label{ex:key:225}
\gll Yu fɔ trowé di \textbf{watá} yá só.
\gls 2SG PREP pour DEF water here like.that
\glt ‘You have to pour (out) the water here.’

\label{ex:key:226}
\gll \textbf{Brís} de bló.
\gls air IPFV blow
\glt ‘The wind is blowing.’

\label{ex:key:227}
\gll \textbf{Mán} \textbf{dɛn} nó de bísin fɔ mék fám mɔ́.
\gls man PL NEG IPFV be.busy PREP make farm more
\glt ‘People are no more into farming.’

\label{ex:key:228}
\gll Pero \textbf{di} \textbf{gabonés} wé de tɔ́k Bata wet \textbf{di} \textbf{guineano} wé de tɔ́k Bata, di sonido nó dé di sén.
\gls but DEF Gabonese SUB IPFV talk Fang with DEF Guinean SUB IPFV talk Fang DEF sound NEG BE.LOC DEF same
\glt ‘But the Gabonese who talks Fang and the Guinean who talks Fang, the sound is not the same.’

\label{ex:key:229}
\gll \textbf{Tidé} \textbf{pikín} \textbf{yu} \textbf{go} gɛ́t bɛlɛ́, \textbf{yu} púl=an \textbf{yu} \textbf{go} dáy wet bɛlɛ́.
\gls today child 2SG POT get belly 2SG remove=3SG.OBJ 2SG POT die with belly
\glt ‘As for children of today, they get pregnant, they abort it and die because of the pregnancy.’

\label{ex:key:230}
\gll A ralla ín \textbf{wet} \textbf{rallador}.
\gls 1SG.SBJ grate 3SG.INDP with grater
\glt ‘I grated it with a grater.’

\label{ex:key:231}
\gll Bɔt wé di mán na \textbf{bíg} mán, di húman sɛ́f na \textbf{bíg} húman, porque ɔ́l tɛ́n na húman dé bɔtɔ́n mán.
\gls but SUB DEF man FOC big man DEF woman EMP FOC big woman because all time FOC woman BE.LOC under man
\glt ‘But when the man is a big man, the woman, too is a big woman, because it is always the woman who is below the man.’

\label{ex:key:232}
\gll Yu pút \textbf{ɔ́da} \textbf{nyú} wán ínsay, dán wán sé mék e nó smɛ́l.
\gls 2SG put other new one inside that one QUOT SBJV 3SG.SBJ NEG smell
\glt ‘(Then) you put another one inside, that in order for it not to smell.’

\label{ex:key:233}
\gll E gɛ́t wán \textbf{trɔ́n} stáyl fɔ tɔ́k=an.
\gls 3SG.SBJ get one strong style PREP talk=3SG.OBJ
\glt ‘There’s a profound way of saying it.’

\label{ex:key:234}
\gll Dán \textbf{wáyt} tín wé e dé na in yáy.
\gls that white thing SUB 3SG.SBJ BE.LOC LOC 3SG.POSS eye
\glt ‘That white thing that’s in his eye.’

\label{ex:key:235}
\gll Na wán \textbf{mán} wé e \textbf{lɔ́s}.
\gls FOC one man SUB 3SG.SBJ lose.
\glt ‘He’s a lost man [a hopeless case].’

\label{ex:key:237}
\gll Wán \textbf{glás} \textbf{watá}.
\gls one glass water
\glt ‘One glass of water’

\label{ex:key:238}

\label{ex:key:239}

\glt ‘(...) white people’s wives.’

\label{ex:key:241}
\gll Na dé a kán sabí \textbf{mi} mamá \textbf{in} papá \textbf{in} fámbul.

\glt ‘It is there that I got to know my mother’s father’s family.’

\label{ex:key:242}

\gls then NAME NAME SUB FOC DEF last child PREP 1SG.POSS aunt
\glt ‘Then (there is) Miguel Ángel who is the last child of my aunt.’

\label{ex:key:243}
\gll \'{A}fta dɛn de gɛ́t fisionomía \textbf{fɔ} Afrika dɛn.
\gls then 3PL IPFV get physiognomy PREP PLACE PL
\glt ‘Then, they have African physiognomies.’

\label{ex:key:244}
\gll Yu nó go gɛ́t hambɔ́g \textbf{fɔ} \textbf{pípul} dɛn.
\gls 2SG NEG POT get irritation PREP people PL
\glt ‘You won’t get any irritation from people.’

\label{ex:key:245}
\gll Dán casa verde, dán casa \textbf{fɔ} \textbf{madera} (...)

\glt ‘That green house, that wooden house (...)’

\label{ex:key:246}

\gls government IPFV give 2SG part PREP DEF money
\glt ‘Government gives you part of the money.’

\label{ex:key:247}
\gll \textbf{Sɔn} \textbf{fɔ} \textbf{di} \textbf{watá} dé yét.
\gls some PREP DEF water BE.LOC yet
\glt ‘Some of the water still remains.’

\label{ex:key:248}
\gll \'{A}fta Miguel Ángel wé na di \textbf{lás} \textbf{pikín} \textbf{fɔ} \textbf{mi} \textbf{antí}.
\gls then NAME NAME SUB FOC DEF last child PREP 1SG.POSS aunt
\glt ‘Then, there is Miguel Ángel who is the last child of my aunt.’

\label{ex:key:249}
\gll Na wán prensa internacional \textbf{wán} \textbf{ministro} \textbf{fɔ} \textbf{Gabón} kán tɔ́k sé dán isla na Gabón.
\gls LOC one press international one minister PREP PLACE PFV talk QUOT that island FOC PLACE
\glt ‘In an international press [newspaper] a secretary of state of Gabon said that that island is [belongs to] Gabon.’

\label{ex:key:250}
\gll So a dɔ́n gɛ́t \textbf{trí} \textbf{nacionalidad} na dís wɔ́l.
\gls so 1SG.SBJ PRF get three nationality LOC this world
\glt ‘So I have three nationalities in this world.’

\label{ex:key:251}
\gll Ɛf yu de ték \textbf{trí}, treinta mil.
\gls if 2SG IPFV take three thirty thousand
\glt ‘If you take three, (it is) thirty thousand.’

\label{ex:key:252}

\gls 2SG  can  carry 3PL.INDP  two REP
\glt ‘You can carry them two by two.’

\label{ex:key:253}

\glt ‘It’s the first thing (...)’

\label{ex:key:256}

\gls DEF number.CPD-two child 3SG.SBJ PFV tell 1SG.INDP DEF same thing
\glt ‘(As for) the second child, she told me the same thing.’ [ed03sb 027]\is{ordinal numerals}

\label{ex:key:257}
\gll Dɛn tɛ́l=an sé “nóto \textbf{ín} \textbf{wán}”.
\gls 3PL tell=3SG.OBJ QUOT NEG.FOC 3SG.INDP one
\glt ‘They told her “it’s not only her”.’

\label{ex:key:258}

\gls 1SG.POSS brother 3SG.INDP one raise DEF child
\glt ‘My brother raised the [his] child single-handedly.’

\label{ex:key:259}

\gls (...) 2SG IPFV give.back all DEF money (...)
\glt ‘(...) you return all the money (...)’

\label{ex:key:260}
\gll \textbf{Di} \textbf{pikín} \textbf{ɔ́l} sé na mi yón bikɔs a dɔ́n pé mɔní.
\gls DEF child all QUOT FOC 1SG.POSS own because 1SG.SBJ PFV pay money
\glt ‘(...) all the children are mine, because I have paid money [the dowry].’

\label{ex:key:261}
\gll \textbf{Ɔ́l} \textbf{mán} kin lúk=an, yu go sí wi nó go mít nó bɔ́di na hós.
\gls all man HAB look=3SG.OBJ 2SG POT see 1PL NEG POT meet NEG body LOC house
\glt ‘Everybody watches it, you’ll see, we won’t run into anybody in the house.’

\label{ex:key:262}
\gll Porque na mí mí de prepara \textbf{ɔ́l} \textbf{tín}.
\gls because FOC 1SG.INDP 1SG.INDP IPFV cook all thing
\glt ‘Because it was me, I was cooking everything.’

\label{ex:key:263}
\gll Mí sɛ́f, \textbf{ɔ́l} \textbf{pɔ́sin} dɛn kin áks mí sé yu dɔ́n bɔ́n?
\gls 1SG.INDP EMP all person PL HAB ask 1SG.INDP QUOT 2SG PFV give.birth
\glt ‘As for me, all people ask me, “do you have a child?”’

\label{ex:key:264}
\gll “\textbf{Ɔ́l} \textbf{tidé} e bin de kɔ́l mí”, e kɔ́l mí wán tɛ́n dásɔl.
\gls all today 3SG.SBJ PST IPFV call 1SG.INDP 3SG.SBJ call 1SG.INDP one time only
\glt ‘“All of today he was calling me [so he says]”, he [actually] called me only once.’

\label{ex:key:265}
\gll \textbf{Ɔ́l} \textbf{hía} pák polvo.
\gls all here pack dust
\glt ‘All this place is full of dust.’

\label{ex:key:266}

\glt ‘(...) even if she didn’t see you for a whole day, (...)’

\label{ex:key:269}

\glt ‘Only one small, one glass, you fill it up.’

\label{ex:key:270}

\label{ex:key:271}

\label{ex:key:272}

\glt ‘That’s your one and only [single] child.’

\label{ex:key:273}

\gls 1SG.SBJ HAB want cough 3PL IPFV pour small milk milk lukewarm LOC 1SG.POSS throat
\glt ‘I would have to cough (and) they would throw away a little bit of milk, lukewarm milk inside my throat.’

\label{ex:key:274}

\gls some face PL BE.LOC SUB 1SG.SBJ know INTJ
\glt ‘There are some faces that I know, right.’

\label{ex:key:275}
\gll Bikɔs a gɛ́t \textbf{bɔkú} \textbf{mi} \textbf{kɔntri}-\textbf{mán} dɛn wé dɛn húman kin dé fɔ Annobón.
\gls because 1SG.SBJ get much 1SG.POSS country.CPD-man PL SUB 3PL woman HAB BE.LOC PREP PLACE
\glt ‘Because I have many of my countrymen whose wives are (usually) in Annobón.’

\label{ex:key:276}
\gll \textbf{Nó} nátín \textbf{nó} dé pantáp=an.

\glt ‘Nothing is on it [the table].’

\label{ex:key:277}
\gll \textbf{Ɔ́l} \textbf{di} \textbf{tín} wé yú an dán mán bin gɛ́t, ɔ́l de lɛ́f fɔ dán mán.

\glt ‘All the things that you and that man had, all remains for that man.’

\label{ex:key:278}

\gls 1SG.INDP get two brother
\glt ‘I [EMP] have two brothers.’

\label{ex:key:279}
\gll Bɔt di gɛ́l nó kán grí mék e gí in bɔ́y frɛ́n ɔ di pikín \textbf{ɔ} \textbf{ín} sénwe, e kán rɔ́n.

\glt ‘But the girl didn’t agree to surrender her boyfriend or the child or herself (and) she ran (away).’

\label{ex:key:280}

\gls 1SG.INDP 1SG.SBJ NEG get
\glt ‘AS for me, I don’t have (one).’

\label{ex:key:281}

\glt ‘She washed the clothes, she dried them, no, it is me (who) dried them.’

\label{ex:key:282}

\glt ‘(Hey) you, come here!’

\label{ex:key:286}

\label{ex:key:287}

\glt ‘But this your [PL] bathroom [look how dirty it is].’

\label{ex:key:288}

\glt ‘She said I will only care for a child when I have seen yours.’

\label{ex:key:289}
\gll Ɛf yu bin dé \textbf{yú} \textbf{wán} yu nó bin fɔ tɔ́k só.
\gls if 2SG PST BE.LOC 2SG.INDP one 2SG NEG PST COND talk like.that
\glt ‘If you had been alone, you wouldn’t have talked like that.’

\label{ex:key:290}
\gll Na \textbf{dɛ́n} \textbf{wán} de disfruta ó.
\gls FOC 3PL one IPFV enjoy SP
\glt ‘It is them alone who are enjoying [it].’

\label{ex:key:291}

\label{ex:key:292}

\label{ex:key:293}

\glt ‘They are all greeting each other.’

\label{ex:key:294}

\glt ‘They would meet, the two of them would call the boy (...)’

\label{ex:key:295}

\glt ‘You see, they both jumped to head the ball.’

\label{ex:key:296}
\gll Lɛk sé dɛn de hía \textbf{wi-ɔl-tú} \textbf{wi} de tɔ́k yét.

\glt ‘Like if they heard both of us still talking.’

\label{ex:key:297}

\glt ‘Lydia and Junior, it’s them I know.’

\label{ex:key:298}
\gll Ɔ́l di tín wé yú \textbf{an} dán mán bin gɛ́t (...)

\glt ‘All the things that you and that man had (...)’

\label{ex:key:299}

\glt ‘(...) of which I think that it is white beans or rice.’

\label{ex:key:301}
\gll Na ín a bigín \textbf{de} \textbf{lɛ́k}=an.
\gls FOC 3SG.INDP 1SG.SBJ begin IPFV like=3SG.OBJ
\glt ‘That’s when I began liking her.’

\label{ex:key:302}
\gll Dís bɔ́y, ɛ́ni dé e \textbf{de} \textbf{fáyn} mɔ́-ɛn-mɔ́.
\gls this boy every day 3SG.SBJ IPFV be.fine more-and-more
\glt ‘This boy is getting more and more handsome every day.’

\label{ex:key:303}
\gll Wi bigín \textbf{de} \textbf{nó} wi sɛ́f.
\gls 1PL begin IPFV know 1PL self
\glt ‘We began to get to know each other.’

\label{ex:key:304}
\gll Yu de respira, yu sɛ́ns de lɔ́s, e dé lɛk sé yu \textbf{slíp}.
\gls 2SG IPFV breathe 2SG mind IPFV lose 3SG.SBJ BE.LOC like QUOT 2SG sleep
\glt ‘You’re breathing, your mind is slipping away, it is as if you’re sleeping.’

\label{ex:key:305}
\gll Di dɔ́g \textbf{de} \textbf{slíp} bɔtɔ́n di tébul.
\gls DEF dog IPFV slíp under DEF table
\glt ‘The dog is sleeping/lying under the table.’

\label{ex:key:306}
\gll E \textbf{tínap} bihɛ́n di hós.
\gls 3SG.SBJ stand.up behind DEF house
\glt ‘He’s standing behind the house.’

\label{ex:key:307}
\gll E \textbf{de} \textbf{tínap}, smɔ́l pikín wé e de tráy fɔ tínap yet.
\gls 3SG.SBJ IPFV stand.up small child SUB 3SG.SBJ IPFV try PREP stand.up yet
\glt ‘He is beginning to stand, a small child that’s still trying to stand.’

\label{ex:key:308}
\gll Wi \textbf{kɔmɔ́t} dé, wi kán gó fɔ, fɔ Akebeville.
\gls 1PL go.out there 1PL PFV go PREP PREP PLACE
\glt ‘(When) we left there, we went to, to Akebeville.’

\label{ex:key:309}
\gll \'{U}s=sáy yu \textbf{kɔmɔ́t}?
\gls Q=side 2SG come.from
\glt ‘Where do you come from?' or ‘Where did you exit [e.g. the market]?’

\label{ex:key:310}
\gll Yu \textbf{de} \textbf{kɔmɔ́t} ús=sáy?
\gls 2SG IPFV come.out Q=side
\glt ‘Where are you coming from?’

\label{ex:key:311}
\gll Mí gɛ́t dán problema wet bɔ́y dɛn wé dɛn \textbf{kɔmɔ́t} Bata nɔ́, sé ‘no Pichi es un dialecto.’
\gls 1SG.INDP get that problem with boy PL SUB 3PL come.out Bata INTJ QUOT no Pichi it.is a dialect
\glt ‘I have that problem with guys who are from Bata, right, [they] say “no, Pichi is a dialect [not a language].”’

\label{ex:key:312}
\gll Dɛn \textbf{de} \textbf{sláp} dɛn sɛ́f.
\gls 3PL IPFV slap 3PL self
\glt ‘They’re slapping each other.’

\label{ex:key:313}
\gll \MakeUppercase{A} \textbf{bigín} \textbf{gó} skúl.
\gls 1SG.SBJ begin go school
\glt ‘I began going to school.’

\label{ex:key:314}
\gll A \textbf{pás} di domɔ́t bihɛ́n sáy a \textbf{gó} fɛ́n sigá.
\gls 1SG.SBJ pass DEF door behind side 1SG.SBJ go look.for cigarette
\glt ‘I passed through the entrance at the back, I went to look for a cigarette.’

\label{ex:key:315}
\gll Ɛ́ni sáy wé pɔ́sin \textbf{wánt} sidɔ́n, dɛn de sidɔ́n.
\gls every side SUB person want stay 3PL IPFV stay
\glt ‘Anywhere that a person wanted to stay, they stayed.’

\label{ex:key:316}
\gll \MakeUppercase{A} \textbf{sabí} sɔn kápinta dɛn.
\gls 1SG.SBJ know some carpenter PL
\glt ‘I know some carpenters.’ or ‘I got to know some carpenters.’

\label{ex:key:317}
\gll \textbf{Bifó} wi rích fɔ carretera di bolsa \textbf{évi}.
\gls before 1PL arrive PREP road DEF bag be.heavy
\glt ‘Before we reached the road the bag had become heavy.’

\label{ex:key:318}
\gll Dán húman e \textbf{brók} \textbf{di} \textbf{plét}
\gls that woman 3SG.SBJ break DEF plate
\glt ‘That woman (she) broke the plate.’

\label{ex:key:319}
\gll A \textbf{ték} di trí chía dɛn, dán butaca ɔ́p sáy, mí \textbf{sidɔ́n} dé, e \textbf{sidɔ́n} dís pát.
\gls 1SG.SBJ take DEF three chair PL that elbow.chair up side 1SG.INDP sit.down there 3SG.SBJ sit.down this part
\glt ‘I took the three chairs, that elbow chair up there, I [EMP] sat down there, he sat down on this side.’

\label{ex:key:320}
\gll E go \textbf{dé} fáyn ɛf e \textbf{kán}.
\gls 3SG.SBJ POT BE.LOC fine if 3SG.SBJ come
\glt ‘It will be nice, if he comes.’

\label{ex:key:321}
\gll If yu \textbf{wánt}, a fít sɛ́l yu mi hós.
\gls if 2SG want 1SG.SBJ can sell 2SG 1SG.POSS house
\glt ‘If you want, I can sell you my house.’

\label{ex:key:322a}
\gll \'{A}fta háw fɔ mék di ógi?
\gls then how PREP make DEF corn.porridge
\glt ‘Then how do you make the corn porridge?’

\label{ex:key:322b}
\gll Yu fít ték náw, wán, wán smɔ́l kɔ́p nɔ́, \textbf{yu} \textbf{pút}=an na fáya, ínsay di pɔ́t.
\gls 2SG can take now one one small cup INTJ 2SG put=3SG.OBJ LOC fire inside DEF pot
\glt ‘Now you can take, a, a small cup, right, you put it on the fire, inside 

\label{ex:key:323}
\gll Dán mán e bin \textbf{kán} \textbf{gó} na jél lɔ́n tɛ́n.
\gls that man 3SG.SBJ PST PFV go LOC jail long time
\glt ‘That man went to jail a long time ago.’

\label{ex:key:324}
\gll E gí di papá di pikín, kɔmɔ́t, e \textbf{kán} \textbf{kán} na Malábo.
\gls 3SG.SBJ give DEF father DEF child go.out 3SG.SBJ PFV come LOC PLACE
\glt ‘She gave her child to the father, left, (and then) she came to Malabo.’

\ea{\label{ex:key:325a}
\gll A \textbf{kán} \textbf{gó} na mi ɔnkúl in papá in lét brɔ́da.
\gls 1SG.SBJ PFV go LOC 1SG.POSS uncle 3SG.POSS father 3SG.POSS late brother
\glt ‘I went to my uncle’s father’s late brother.’

\ex{\label{ex:key:325b}
\gll Mi lét papá in brɔ́da, a \textbf{kán} \textbf{dé} na in hós.
\gls 1SG.POSS late father 3SG.POSS brother 1SG.SBJ PFV BE.LOC LOC 3SG.POSS house
\glt ‘My late father’s brother, I came to be in his house.’

\label{ex:key:326}
\gll Pero ɛf di tín \textbf{kán} \textbf{bɔkú} mɔ́ pás di watá, e go lɛ́f wán pasta.
\gls but if DEF thing PFV much more pass DEF water 3SG.SBJ POT leave one paste
\glt ‘But if the thing has become more than the water, a paste will remain.’

\label{ex:key:327}
\gll E \textbf{kán} \textbf{lɛ́k} ɔ́da húman.
\gls 3SG.SBJ PFV like other woman
\glt ‘(Then) he fell in love with another woman.’

\label{ex:key:328}
\gll Ɛf yu \textbf{bin} \textbf{kán} bigín lás semana, yu bin fɔ dɔ́n fínis tidé.
\gls if 2SG PST PFV begin last week 2SG PST COND PRF finish today
\glt ‘If you had begun last week, you would have finished by today.’

\label{ex:key:329}
\gll A \textbf{de} \textbf{smɛ́l} di sɛ́nt fɔ lɛk háw e \textbf{de} \textbf{kúk} plantí.
\gls 1SG.SBJ IPFV smell DEF scent PREP like how 3SG.SBJ IPFV cook plantain
\glt ‘I smell the scent of him cooking plantain.’

\label{ex:key:330}
\gll \textbf{Ɛ́ni} \textbf{dé} dɛn de chɔ́p rɛ́s, \textbf{ɛ́ni} \textbf{dé}.
\gls every day 3PL IPFV eat rice every day
\glt ‘Every day they eat rice, every day.’

\label{ex:key:331}
\gll Yu \textbf{de} \textbf{krés}.
\gls 2SG IPFV be.crazy
\glt ‘You are crazy.’

\label{ex:key:332}
\gll E \textbf{de} \textbf{sík} malérya.
\gls 3SG.SBJ IPFV sick malaria
\glt ‘He is sick with malaria.’

\label{ex:key:333}
\gll \'{A}fta dɛn \textbf{de} \textbf{gɛ́t} fisionomía fɔ, fɔ \'{A}frika dɛn.
\gls then 3PL IPFV get physiognomy PREP PREP Africa PL
\glt ‘Then they have the physiognomy of, of Africans.’

\label{ex:key:334}
\gll A nó, a nó \textbf{de} \textbf{lɛ́k}=an mɔ́, nó.
\gls 1SG.SBJ NEG 1SG.SBJ NEG IPFV like=3SG.OBJ more NEG
\glt ‘I don’t, I don’t love him any longer, no.’

\label{ex:key:335}
\gll Dɛn nó \textbf{lɛ́k} pɔ́sin, dɛn tú badhát.
\gls 3PL NEG like person 3PL too be.mean
\glt ‘They don’t like people, they’re too mean.’

\label{ex:key:336}
\gll In mɔní \textbf{de} \textbf{bɔkú}.
\gls 3SG.POSS money IPFV be.much
\glt ‘Her money is getting more.’

\label{ex:key:337}
\gll In mɔní \textbf{de} \textbf{smɔ́l}.
\gls 3SG.POSS money IPFV be.small
\glt ‘His money is getting less.’

\label{ex:key:338}

\gls 1SG.SBJ IPFV remain LOC PLACE until DEF next week
\glt ‘I’m staying in Luba until next week.’

\label{ex:key:339}
\gll A \textbf{de} \textbf{ték} mi pikín gó na hospital claro.
\gls 1SG.SBJ IPFV take 1SG.POSS child go LOC hospital clear
\glt ‘I would take my child to hospital, of course.’

\label{ex:key:340}
\gll Yu \textbf{gɛ́fɔ} \textbf{de} tɔ́n=an.
\gls 2SG have.to IPFV turn=3SG.OBJ
\glt ‘You need to be stirring it.’

\label{ex:key:341}
\gll Yu \textbf{wánt} \textbf{de} gó?
\gls 2SG want IPFV go
\glt ‘Do you want to go?’

\label{ex:key:342}
\gll E tɛ́l mí sé “wi \textbf{kin} \textbf{mítɔp} ínsay wán motó”.
\gls 3SG.SBJ tell 1SG.INDP QUOT 1PL HAB meet inside one car
\glt ‘He told me (that) “we would meet inside a car.”

\label{ex:key:343}
\gll Nit na in éks dɛn wé e \textbf{kin} \textbf{de} \textbf{pút}.
\gls nit FOC 3SG.POSS egg PL SUB 3SG.SBJ HAB IPFV put
\glt ‘The nits are the eggs that it lays.’

\label{ex:key:344}
\gll Sé ús=tín \textbf{kin} \textbf{dé} ínsay dé?
\gls QUOT Q=thing HAB BE.LOC inside there
\glt ‘(She) said “what is usually in there?”‘

\label{ex:key:345}
\gll Dɛn nó \textbf{kin} \textbf{nó} sɛ́f.
\gls 3PL NEG HAB know EMP
\glt ‘They didn’t even use to know.’

\label{ex:key:346}
\gll Dɔ́g \textbf{kin} bɛ́t.
\gls dog HAB bite
\glt ‘Dogs bite.’

\label{ex:key:347}
\gll Wétin yu \textbf{de} \textbf{chench-chénch} nɔ́mba dɛn só?
\gls what 2SG IPFV RED.CPD-change number PL like.that
\glt ‘Why do you constantly change (telephone) numbers like that?’

\ea{\label{ex:key:348a}
\gll Wé a \textbf{kin} \textbf{mék} só, a nó de fíl hɔ́t.
\gls SUB 1SG.SBJ HAB make like.that 1SG.SBJ NEG IPFV feel heat
\glt ‘Anytime I would do like this, I wouldn’t feel heat.’

\label{ex:key:348b}
\gll Pero wé a \textbf{kin} \textbf{tɔ́ch} in fút, in hán dé, na só dɛn [kó:::l].
\gls but SUB 1SG.SBJ HAB touch 3SG.POSS foot 3SG.POSS hand there FOC like.that 3PL be.cold.EMP
\glt ‘When I would touch his leg, his hand there, that’s how terribly cold they were.’

\label{ex:key:349}
\gll A \textbf{bigín} \textbf{di} \textbf{wók} wé yu dɔ́n gó.
\gls 1SG.SBJ begin DEF work SUB 2SG PRF go
\glt ‘I began the work when you had gone.’

\label{ex:key:350}
\gll A \textbf{bigín} \textbf{gó} skúl.
\gls 1SG.SBJ begin go school
\glt ‘I began going to school.’

\label{ex:key:351}

\gls 1SG.SBJ begin IPFV endure 1SG.SBJ IPFV get.used
\glt ‘I began enduring (it), I was getting used (to it).’

\label{ex:key:352}
\gll Dɛn \textbf{kán} \textbf{bigín} kɔ́l mí Francisca.
\gls 3PL PFV begin call 1SG.INDP NAME
\glt ‘They began to call me Francisca.’

\label{ex:key:353}
\gll Wi \textbf{bigín} \textbf{de} \textbf{nó} wi sɛ́f.

\glt ‘We began to get to know each other.’

\label{ex:key:354}

\gls 3SG.SBJ tell 1SG.INDP QUOT that father SUB 3SG.SBJ just come.out receive 3SG.POSS money PREP cocoa greet=3SG.OBJ

\label{ex:key:355}
\gll Di gɛ́l kán \textbf{kɔmɔ́t} dé.

\label{ex:key:356}

\glt ‘Where do you come from drunk like this?’

\label{ex:key:357}

\glt ‘When he comes from work/ when he has just finished working, I do like this to him [stretches out hand], as soon as the month is over.’

\gls 1SG.SBJ just buy some
\glt ‘I just bought some.’

\label{ex:key:359}

\glt ‘Now they’re just coming.’

\label{ex:key:360}

\gls just 3SG.SBJ come.out LOC PLACE (...)
\glt ‘She had just left Baney (...)’

\label{ex:key:361}
\gll Yu nó gɛ́fɔ pút=an fɔ plástik yu \textbf{jɔ́s} gó na bús yu trowé=an.
\gls 2SG NEG have.to put=3SG.OBJ PREP plastic 2SG just go LOC forest 2SG throw=3SG.OBJ
\glt ‘You don’t have to put it into a plastic (bag), you just go to the forest and throw it away.’

\label{ex:key:362}
\gll Bɔt dá mɔní de \textbf{fínis} kwík.
\gls but that money IPFV finish quickly
\glt ‘But that money used to finish quickly.’

\label{ex:key:363}
\gll E \textbf{fínis} \textbf{bɛ́n} di písis fáyn.
\gls 3SG.SBJ finish bend DEF piece.of.cloth fine
\glt ‘She has finished folding the piece of cloth real nice.’

\label{ex:key:364}
\gll Náw a \textbf{dɔ́n} \textbf{de} \textbf{fínis} sém fɔ wɛ́r dán sús, ɛf a bin nó a fɔ kɛ́r ɔ́da sús.
\gls now 1SG.SBJ PRF IPFV finish be.ashamed PREP wear that shoe if 1SG.SBJ PST know 1SG.SBJ COND carry other shoes
\glt ‘Now I am really ashamed to be wearing those shoes, if I had known I would have brought other shoes.’

\label{ex:key:366}
\gll A \textbf{sigue} \textbf{plé} bɔ́l sóté ívin tɛ́n.
\gls 1SG.SBJ continue play ball until evening time
\glt ‘I continued playing ball until the evening.’

\label{ex:key:367}
\gll Mi gran-má wet mi gran-pá wé dɛn \textbf{stíl} \textbf{dé} láyf, dɛn-ɔ́l dɛn dé na Panyá.
\gls 1SG.POSS grand-ma with 1SG.POSS grand-pa SUB 3PL still BE.LOC life 3PL.CPD-all 3PL BE.LOC FOC Spain
\glt ‘My grandmother and my grandfather, when they were still alive, they were all in Spain.’

\label{ex:key:368}
\gll Ɛf yu \textbf{stíl} \textbf{de} smók, yu go sík.
\gls if 2SG still IPFV smoke 2SG POT sick
\glt ‘If you continue smoking, you’ll be sick.’

\label{ex:key:369}
\gll E \textbf{nó} dé\textbf{} \textbf{mɔ́}.
\gls 3SG.SBJ NEG BE.LOC more
\glt ‘He’s no longer (here/there).’

\label{ex:key:370}
\gll E \textbf{de} \textbf{stíl} \textbf{de} wáka.
\gls 3SG.SBJ IPFV still IPFV walk
\glt ‘He’s still walking.’

\label{ex:key:371}
\gll Dís bɔ́y, ɛ́ni dé e de fáyn \textbf{mɔ́-ɛn-mɔ́}.
\gls this boy every day 3SG.SBJ IPFV be.fine more-and-more
\glt ‘This boy, everyday he is getting more handsome.’

\label{ex:key:372}
\gll Layk háw dɛn \textbf{wánt} \textbf{kɛ́r} yu na hospital yu dɔ́n dáy.
\gls like how 3PL want carry 2SG LOC hospital 2SG PRF die
\glt ‘As they’re about to carry you to hospital, you’re already dead.’

\label{ex:key:373}
\gll E \textbf{wɔ́nt} \textbf{lɔ́n} lɛkɛ in papá.
\gls 3SG.SBJ want be.long like 3SG.POSS father
\glt ‘She’s about to become as tall as her father.’

\label{ex:key:375}
\gll A bin chɛ́k sé rén \textbf{go} \textbf{fɔ́l}.
\gls 1SG.SBJ PST check QUOT rain POT fall
\glt ‘I thought it might rain.’

\label{ex:key:376}
\gll \textbf{Yɛ́stadé} náyt wé a \textbf{de} \textbf{kɔ́l} yú, yɛ́stadé náyt, nɔ́ dís mɔ́nin náw.
\gls yesterday night SUB 1SG.SBJ IPFV call 2SG.INDP yesterday night NEG this morning now
\glt ‘Yesterday night, when I was calling you, yesterday night, not this morning.’

\label{ex:key:377}
\gll Wán ívin tɛ́n a kɔmɔ́t mɔ́, a gó wáka, wé a \textbf{de} \textbf{rích} na hós, hía Djunais (...)
\gls one evening time 1SG.SBJ go.out more 1SG.SBJ go walk SUB 1SG.SBJ IPFV reach LOC house hear NAME (...)
\glt ‘One evening, I went out again, I went for a stroll, when I was arriving at the house, [I] hear Djunais [say that...].’

\label{ex:key:378}
\gll Mí nó \textbf{sabí}, e \textbf{fíba} sé e nó \textbf{lɛ́k} tín dɛn fɔ súp.
\gls 1SG.INDP NEG know 3SG.SBJ seem QUOT 3SG.SBJ NEG like thing PL PREP soup
\glt ‘I [EMP] don’t know, it seems that she doesn’t like soupy things.’

\label{ex:key:379}
\gll E \textbf{ték} di háma, e \textbf{nák} ɔntɔ́p di tébul, di plét \textbf{brók}.
\gls 3SG.SBJ take DEF hammer 3SG.SBJ hit on DEF table DEF plate break
\glt ‘She took the hammer, she hit [it] on the table, (and) the plate broke.’

\label{ex:key:380}
\gll \textbf{Dán} \textbf{tɛ́n} a \textbf{dé} fáyn.
\gls that time 1SG.SBJ BE.LOC fine
\glt ‘That time, I was fine.’

\label{ex:key:381}
\gll Mí \textbf{bin} \textbf{dé} dé, a \textbf{bin} \textbf{mék} dásɔl, dís, a \textbf{de} \textbf{mék}} fínga dɛn, manicura.
\gls 1SG.INDP PST BE.LOC there 1SG.SBJ PST make only this 1SG.SBJ IPFV make finger PL manicure
\glt ‘(As for) me, (when) I was there, I only made, this, I used to make fingers, manicure.’

\label{ex:key:382}
\gll Mí dú=an fɔséko sé a \textbf{bin} \textbf{wánt} hɛ́lp=an.
\gls 1SG.INDP do=3SG.OBJ due.to QUOT 1SG.SBJ PST want help=3SG.OBJ
\gls \glt ‘I [EMP] did it because I wanted to help him.’

\label{ex:key:383}
\gll \MakeUppercase{A} kán kɔmɔ́t na dán hós wé a \textbf{bin} \textbf{dé}.
\gls 1SG.SBJ PFV go.out LOC that house SUB 1SG.SBJ PST BE.LOC
\glt ‘I left that house where I had been.’

\ea{\label{ex:key:384a}
\gll Náw e \textbf{dɔ́n} \textbf{dáy} sɛ́f.
\gls now 3SG.SBJ PRF die EMP
\glt ‘Now he’s even dead.’
