\gls NEG.FOC 1PL Pichi
\glt ‘That’s not our (kind of) Pichi.’

\label{ex:key:768}
\gll In papá \textbf{na} chino.
\gls 3SG.POSS father FOC Chinese
\glt ‘Her father is Chinese.’

\label{ex:key:769}
\gll \textbf{Mí} \textbf{na} di wan-grén pikín.
\gls 1SG.INDP FOC DEF one.CPD-grain child.
\glt ‘I am the only child.’

\label{ex:key:771}
\gll E \textbf{dɔ́n} \textbf{bí} wán señorita.
\gls 3SG.SBJ PRF BE one little.lady
\glt ‘She has already become a real young lady.’

\label{ex:key:772}
\gll Mí \textbf{go} \textbf{bí} dɔ́kta.
\gls 1SG.INDP POT BE doctor
\glt ‘I’ll be doctor.’

\label{ex:key:773}
\gll Mi ném \textbf{bin} \textbf{bí} Francisca Belobe Toichoa, porque mi mamá in ném \textbf{na} Belobe Toichoa.
\gls 1SG.POSS name PST BE NAME NAME NAME because 1SG.POSS mother 3SG.POSS name FOC NAME NAME
\glt ‘My name was Francicsa Belobe Toichoa because my mother’s name is/was Belobe Toichoa.’

\label{ex:key:774}
\gll So mí, mi yón e \textbf{kán} \textbf{bí} una desgracia.
\gls so 1SG.INDP 1SG.POSS own 3SG.SBJ PFV BE DEF disgrace
\glt ‘So as for me, mine [my matter] came to be a disgrace.’

\label{ex:key:775}
\gll “Kɔ́t” \textbf{fít} bí lɛkɛ herida.
\gls cut can BE like wound
\glt ` “Kɔ́t” can be [mean] like a wound.’

\label{ex:key:776}
\gll \textbf{Mék} e \textbf{bí} sé Kofí dɔ́n kán.
\gls SBJV 3SG.SBJ BE.LOC QUOT NAME PRF come
\glt ‘(Please) let it be that Kofí has come.’

\label{ex:key:777}
\gll \textbf{Frɔn} wé a \textbf{bí} pikín a \textbf{bin} wánt kɔmɔ́t na dís kɔ́ntri.
\gls from SUB 1SG.SBJ BE child 1SG.SBJ PST want go.away LOC this country
\glt ‘From when I was a child, I wanted to leave this country.’

\label{ex:key:778}
\gll E \textbf{nó} \textbf{go} \textbf{bí} mecánico.
\gls 3SG.SBJ NEG POT BE mechanic
\glt ‘He won’t be a mechanic.’

\ea{\label{ex:key:779a}
\gll Ebongolo \textbf{dé}?
\gls NAME BE.LOC
\glt ‘Is Ebongolo around/his usual self/fine/alright?’

}\ex{\label{ex:key:779b}
\gll Yɛ́s, e \textbf{dé}.
\gls yes 3SG.SBJ BE.LOC
\glt ‘Yes, he’s here/around/his usual self/fine/alright.’

\label{ex:key:780}
\gll E \textbf{dé} \textbf{na} \textbf{grɔ́n}.
\gls 3SG.SBJ BE.LOC LOC ground
\glt ‘He is [lying] on the ground.’

\label{ex:key:781}
\gll Yu fon \textbf{dé} \textbf{nía} \textbf{tébul}.
\gls 2SG phone BE.LOC near table
\glt ‘Your phone is near the table.’ 

\label{ex:key:782}
\gll \'{A}fta dí wán wé e \textbf{dé} \textbf{yandá}, e bíg.
\gls then this one SUB 3SG.SBJ BE.LOC yonder 3SG.SBJ be.big
\glt ‘Then, that one that’s over there, it’s big.’ 

\label{ex:key:783}
\gll Somos tú dásɔl wé wi \textbf{dé} \textbf{láyf}.
\gls we.are two only SUB 1PL BE.LOC life
\glt ‘We are only two who are alive.’ 

\label{ex:key:784}
\gll Wi \textbf{dé} \textbf{íbin} \textbf{tɛ́n}.
\gls 1PL BE.LOC evening time
\glt ‘It’s evening.’

\label{ex:key:785}
\gll Wi \textbf{dé} \textbf{las} \textbf{dos} \textbf{y} \textbf{media}.
\gls 1PL BE.LOC the.PL two and half
\glt ‘It’s two thirty.’

\label{ex:key:786}
\gll Dán tɛ́n a \textbf{dé} \textbf{fáyn}.
\gls that time 1SG.SBJ BE.LOC fine
\glt ‘That time I was [feeling] fine.’

\label{ex:key:787}
\gll Na \textbf{só} e \textbf{dé}.
\gls FOC like.that 3SG.SBJ BE.LOC
\glt ‘That’s the way it is.’

\label{ex:key:788}
\gll E \textbf{dé} \textbf{ɔ́da} \textbf{stáyl}.
\gls 3SG.SBJ BE.LOC other style
\glt ‘It’s different.’

\label{ex:key:789}
\gll A wánt \textbf{dé} \textbf{lɛk} Miguel Ángel.
\gls 1SG.SBJ want BE.LOC like NAME NAME
\glt ‘I want to be like Miguel Ángel [the way he dresses/acts/looks].’

\label{ex:key:790}
\gll \textbf{Háw} yu go \textbf{dé}, yu nó gɛ́t pikín?
\gls how 2SG POT there 2SG NEG get child
\glt ‘How would you be [feel] (if) you had no child?’

\label{ex:key:791}
\gll Bɔt mí wánt sabí \textbf{háw} dán tín \textbf{dé}.
\gls but 1SG.INDP want know how that thing BE.LOC
\glt ‘But I [EMP] wanted to know how that thing was.’

\label{ex:key:792}
\gll Yu gɛ́fɔ lɛ́f=an \textbf{lɛk} \textbf{háw} e \textbf{dé}.
\gls 2SG have.to leave=3SG.OBJ like how 3SG.SBJ BE.LOC
\glt ‘You have to leave it how it is.’

\label{ex:key:793}
\gll Nó bɔ́dí \textbf{nó} \textbf{dé} na pueblo.
\gls NEG body NEG BE.LOC LOC village
\glt ‘Nobody is in the village.’

\label{ex:key:794}
\gll Sé “ús=tín \textbf{kin} \textbf{dé} ínsay dé?”
\gls QUOT Q=thing HAB BE.LOC inside there
\glt ‘(They) said “what is usually in there?”‘

\label{ex:key:795}
\gll Yu gɛ́fɔ de \textbf{tɔ́n}=an.
\gls 2SG have.to IPFV turn=3SG.OBJ
\glt ‘You have to be stirring it.’

\label{ex:key:796}
\gll \textbf{Tɔ́n} na yu lɛ́f-hán!
\gls turn LOC DEF left.CPD-hand
\glt ‘Turn left!’

\label{ex:key:797}
\gll Mék a gó dú smɔ́l tín a \textbf{tɔ́n} \textbf{bák}.
\gls SBJV 1SG.SBJ go do be.small thing 1SG.SBJ turn back
\glt ‘Let me go do something quickly (and) come back.’

\label{ex:key:798}
\gll Dɛn-ɔ́l dɛn dɔ́n \textbf{tɔ́n} \textbf{europeos} \textbf{dɛn}.
\gls 3PL.CPD-all 3PL PRF turn European.PL PL
\glt ‘They have all turned into Europeans.’

\label{ex:key:799}
\gll A \textbf{lɛ́f} di tín dɛn di sáy wé yu bin tɛ́l mí.
\gls 1SG.SBJ leave DEF thing PL DEF side SUB 2SG PST tell 1SG.INDP
\glt ‘I left the things where you told me to.’

\label{ex:key:800}
\gll Yu go mék mék di gál \textbf{lɛ́f} wet brok-hát.
\gls 2SG POT make SBJV DEF girl remain with break.CPD-heart
\glt ‘You’re going to make that girl become broken-hearted.’

\label{ex:key:801}
\gll Machyta \textbf{lɛ́f} wet in fámbul.
\gls NAME remain with 3SG.POSS family
\glt ‘Machyta has remained (temporarily) with his family’

\label{ex:key:802}
\gll \MakeUppercase{A} de trén=an porque e go \textbf{kɔmɔ́t} pɔ́sin.
\gls 1SG.SBJ IPFV train=3SG.OBJ because 3SG.SBJ POT come.out person
\glt ‘I’m bringing him up because [so that] he will turn out to be a (responsible) person.’

\label{ex:key:803}
\gll Bɛ́ta tín nó de \textbf{sté}.
\gls very.good thing NEG IPFV last
\glt ‘Good things don’t last.’

\label{ex:key:804}
\gll Dís smɔ́l bɔ́tul dɛn Fanta, wé e \textbf{gɛ́t} Coca-Cola, e \textbf{gɛ́t} Fanta, e \textbf{gɛ́t} limón, e báy=an wán.
\gls this small bottle PL NAME SUB 3SG.SBJ get NAME 3SG.SBJ get NAME 3SG.SBJ get lemon 3SG.SBJ buy=3SG.OBJ one
\glt ‘These small bottles of Fanta, where there is Coca-Cola, there is Fanta, there is Lemon, she bought him one (of them).’

\label{ex:key:806}
\gll Bɔt yu dɔ́n sabí na Afrika \textbf{yu} \textbf{nó} \textbf{gɛ́t} nó relación fɔ mán lɛk na Europa.
\gls but 2SG PRF know LOC PLACE 2SG NEG get NEG relation PREP man like LOC Europe
\glt ‘But you already know that in Africa you don’t have a relationship with a man like in Europe.’

\label{ex:key:807}
\gll Bɔt na dán fɔ́s tɛ́n hós dɛn \textbf{wé} e \textbf{gɛ́t} dá piso dɛn fɔ dán altura dɛn.
\gls but FOC that first time house PL SUB 3SG.SBJ get that storey PL PREP that height PL
\glt ‘But its those houses of the past where there are those high storeys’ 

\label{ex:key:808}
\gll Bueno aunque dé, \textbf{bɔkú} \textbf{interés} \textbf{económico} \textbf{dé}.
\gls good although there much interest economic BE.LOC
\glt ‘Alright although there, there’s a lot of economic interest.’

\label{ex:key:809}
\gll Bueno, \textbf{mi} \textbf{gran-pá} bin \textbf{dé}.
\gls good 1SG.POSS grand-pa PST BE.LOC
\glt ‘Alright, my grandfather was around/fine.’

\label{ex:key:810}
\gll Paciente dɛn \textbf{dé} \textbf{na} \textbf{sala}, yú dɔ́kta la una yu de kán?
\gls patient PL BE.LOC LOC hall 2SG.INDP doctor the one 2SG IPFV come
\glt ‘Patients are in the hall, (and) you doctor, it’s (only) at one o’clock that you come?’

\label{ex:key:811}
\gll Dɛn de kɔ́l dɛn sé, \textbf{e} \textbf{nó} \textbf{gɛ́t} tɔ́k na Píchi.
\gls 3PL IPFV call 3PL QUOT 3SG.SBJ NEG get talk LOC Pichi
\glt ‘They’re called, there is no word (for that) in Pichi.’

\label{ex:key:812}
\gll \textbf{Nó} \textbf{pát} fɔ wɔ́l mɔ́ \textbf{nó} \textbf{dé}.
\gls NEG part PREP world more NEG BE.LOC
\glt ‘There is no other part of the world [where it’s like that].’

\label{ex:key:813}
\gll “Fam-mán” \textbf{nó} \textbf{dé}.
\gls farm.CPD-man NEG BE.LOC
\glt ‘[The word] “Farm-man” doesn’t exist.’

\label{ex:key:814}
\gll Ebanistas dɛn \textbf{gɛ́fɔ} \textbf{dé}.
\gls Carpenter.PL PL have.to BE.LOC
\glt ‘Carpenters have to be there/around.’

\label{ex:key:815}
\gll Ɛhɛ́ wán accidente fɔ motó \textbf{bin} \textbf{dé}.
\gls INTJ one accident PREP car PST BE.LOC
\glt ‘Oh yes, there was a car accident.’

\label{ex:key:816}
\gll \textbf{Di} \textbf{tín} \textbf{dé} \textbf{sé} mék e mék rabia wet mí.
\gls DEF thing BE.LOC QUOT SBJV 3SG.SBJ make anger with 1SG.INDP
\glt ‘The thing is that let her be angry with me.’

\label{ex:key:817}
\gll A \textbf{gɛ́t} mɔdɛlɔ́.
\gls 1SG.SBJ get mother-in-law
\glt ‘I have a mother-in-law.’

\label{ex:key:818}
\gll Dí mán \textbf{gɛ́t} \textbf{líba} ɛ́n, fɔ kɔmɔ́t wet dís káyn bíg gɛ́l.
\gls this man get liver INTJ PREP go.out with this kind big girl
\glt ‘Than man has guts, right, to go out with such an influential girl.’

\label{ex:key:819}
\gll Di papá de gládin sé in pikín \textbf{dɔ́n} \textbf{gɛ́t} wók.
\gls DEF father IPFV be.glad QUOT 3SG.POSS child PRF get work
\glt ‘The father is happy that his child has found work.’

\label{ex:key:820}
\gll A \textbf{kin} \textbf{gɛ́t} mɔní, a kin fála húman dɛn.
\gls 1SG.SBJ HAB get money 1SG.SBJ HAB follow woman PL
\glt ‘(When) I used to receive money, I would chase women.’

\label{ex:key:821}
\gll Sɔn Píchi \textbf{dé} \textbf{fɔ} sɔn mán wé de síng, dɛn de kɔ́l Lapiro.
\gls some Pichi BE.LOC PREP some man SUB IPFV síng 3PL IPFV call NAME
\glt ‘There’s a kind of Pichi used by a man who sings, he’s called Lapiro [dé Mbanga].’

\label{ex:key:822}
\gll Di tín \textbf{dé} \textbf{fɔr}=an, di tín \textbf{na} \textbf{fɔ} ín.
\gls DEF thing BE.LOC PREP=3SG.OBJ DEF THING FOC PREP 3SG.INDP
\glt ‘The thing is his, the thing is his (...)’

\label{ex:key:823}
\gll A fít \textbf{hól} dán mɔní \textbf{durante} \textbf{un} \textbf{mes} \textbf{entero}.
\gls 1SG.SBJ can keep that money during DEF month whole
\glt ‘I’m able to keep that money for a whole month.’ 

\label{ex:key:824}
\gll “Yu \textbf{hól} wán motó”, yu de dráyb=an, pero sé yu gɛ́t, cuando tienes, “a \textbf{gɛ́t} wán motó”.
\gls 2SG hold one car 2SG IPFV drive=3SG.OBJ but QUOT 2SG get when you.get 1SG.SBJ get one car
\glt ` “Yú hól wán motó” (means) you’re driving it, but when you possess it, when you have it “a gɛ́t wán motó.”’

\label{ex:key:826}
\gll Bikɔs e \textbf{hól} yú na hós yu gɛ́fɔ gɛ́t di hóm trénin.
\gls because 3SG.SBJ hold 2SG.INDP LOC house 2SG have.to get DEF home training
\glt ‘Because she has guardianship over you in her house you have to receive home education.’

\label{ex:key:827}
\gll Nó, na di húman \textbf{de} \textbf{hól} di plét.
\gls NEG FOC DEF woman IPFV hold DEF plate
\glt ‘No, it’s the woman that’s holding the plate.’

\label{ex:key:828}
\gll George, mi móvil nó \textbf{dé} \textbf{na} \textbf{mi} \textbf{hán}, a nó gɛ́t móvil náw.
\gls NAME 1SG.POSS mobile NEG BE.LOC LOC 1SG.POSS hand 1SG.SBJ NEG get mobile now
\glt ‘George, I don’t have my mobile phone on me, I don’t have a mobile phone now.’

\label{ex:key:829}
\gll Yu sabí sé yu \textbf{nó} \textbf{gɛ́t} pikín?
\gls 2SG know QUOT 2SG NEG get child
\glt ‘Do you know whether you don’t have a child?’

\label{ex:key:830}
\gll Tidé di húman \textbf{dé} \textbf{fáyn}.
\gls today DEF woman BE.LOC fine
\glt ‘Today the woman is fine.’

\label{ex:key:831}
\gll Di húman \textbf{fáyn}.
\gls DEF woman be.fine
\glt ‘The woman is beautiful.’

\label{ex:key:832}
\gll Moka bɔ́y dɛn krés wé dɛn sí lɛk háw a frɛ́s, na so a \textbf{dé} \textbf{bráyt}.
\gls PLACE boy PL go.mad SUB 3PL see like how 1SG.SBJ be.fresh FOC like.that 1SG.SBJ BE.LOC bright
\glt ‘The Moka boys went crazy when they saw how fresh I was, that’s how bright I looked.’

\label{ex:key:833}
\gll Yu skín \textbf{bráyt} ó.
\gls 2SG body be.bright SP
\glt ‘Your body is really glowing (with beauty).’

\label{ex:key:834}
\gll Di strít \textbf{dé} \textbf{wɔwɔ́}.
\gls DEF street BE.LOC ugly
\glt ‘The street looks messed up.’

\label{ex:key:835}
\gll Di strít \textbf{wɔwɔ́}, di strít \textbf{chakrá}, di strít nó \textbf{dé} \textbf{fáyn}.
\gls DEF street be.ugly DEF street be.destroyed DEF street NEG BE.LOC fine
\glt ‘The street is messed up, the street is destroyed, the street is not fine.’

\label{ex:key:836}
\gll Wé yu go fɔdɔ́n yu \textbf{go} \textbf{dé} \textbf{bád}.
\gls SUB 2SG POT fall 2SG POT BE.LOC bad
\glt ‘When you fall you’ll be in a bad state.’

\label{ex:key:837}
\gll Yu sí wán \textbf{fáyn} \textbf{gɛ́l}, yu de gó tún=an.
\gls 2SG see one fine girl 2SG IPFV go tune=3SG.OBJ
\glt ‘(If) you see a fine girl, you go chat her up.’

\label{ex:key:838}
\gll E hád fɔ mék mék dɛn bíl na yá só bikɔs di grɔ́n e tú \textbf{dé} \textbf{wet} \textbf{stón}.
\gls 3SG.SBJ be.hard PREP make SBJV 3PL build LOC here like.that because DEF ground 3SG.SBJ too BE.LOC with stone
\glt It’s hard for them to build here because the ground is too stony.’

\label{ex:key:839}
\gll E hád fɔ bíl na yá bikɔs sé di grɔ́n \textbf{gɛ́t} \textbf{bɔkú} \textbf{sansán}.
\gls 3SG.SBJ be.hard PREP build LOC here because QUOT DEF ground get much sand
\glt ‘It’s hard to build here because the ground is very sandy.’

\label{ex:key:840}
\gll \textbf{Pero} \textbf{bambáy} \textbf{bambáy} \textbf{sɔntɛ́n} yu go sí di wán wé go máred yú.
\gls but gradually REP perhaps 2SG POT see DEF one SUB POT marry 2SG.INDP
\glt ‘But very gradually perhaps you might find the one who will marry you.’

\label{ex:key:841}
\gll Bɔt ín sidɔ́n \textbf{dɔ́n} \textbf{dɔ́n} \textbf{dɔ́n} \textbf{yandá}.
\gls but 3SG.INDP stay down REP REP yonder
\glt ‘But he stays far down over there.’

\label{ex:key:842}
\gll Nó chɛ́k=an \textbf{bɔkú} \textbf{tɛ́n}, tɛ́l mí sé nó.
\gls NEG think=3SG.OBJ much time tell 1SG.INDP QUOT NEG
\glt ‘Don’t think about it for a long time, tell me “no”.’

\label{ex:key:843}
\gll Na ín \textbf{wán} \textbf{dé} a bin tɛ́l wán grand frère na, na mi colegio dé, (...)
\gls FOC 3SG.INDP one day 1SG.SBJ PST tell one big brother LOC LOC 1SG.POSS college there (...)
\glt ‘That’s why one day, I told one of my seniors in, in my secondary school there, (...)’

\label{ex:key:844}
\gll \MakeUppercase{A} mɔs gó Alemania \textbf{wán} \textbf{dé}.
\gls 1SG.SBJ OBL go PLACE one day
\glt ‘I absolutely have to go to Germany someday.’

\label{ex:key:845}
\gll Ebongolo tɛ́l mí \textbf{yɛ́stadé} in problema.
\gls NAME tell 1SG.INDP yesterday 3SG.POSS problem
\glt ‘Ebongolo told me about his problem yesterday.’

\label{ex:key:846}
\gll A gó wás wet mi hán mí sénwe a dráy=an, \textbf{e} \textbf{fínis} a áyɛn=an.
\gls 1SG.SBJ go wash with 1SG.POSS hand 1SG.INDP EMP 1SG.SBJ dry=3SG.OBJ 3SG.SBJ finish 1SG.SBJ iron=3SG.OBJ
\glt ‘I myself went to wash (it) with my own hands, I dried it, then ironed it.’

\label{ex:key:847}
\gll \textbf{Bádtɛn} náw, di fɔ́s dɔ́kta wé wi gɛ́t, e nó dé ɔ́p na ɔspítul.
\gls unfortunately now DEF first doctor SUB 1PL get 3SG.SBJ NEG BE.LOC up LOC hospital
\glt ‘Unfortunately, the first doctor that we had wasn’t up (there) in the hospital.’

\label{ex:key:848}
\gll \textbf{Smɔ́ltɛn} a bin fɔ dáy dé.
\gls nearly 1SG.SBJ PST COND die there
\glt ‘I nearly died there.’ 

\label{ex:key:849}
\gll \textbf{Mébi} dɛn nó go bɛ́g yú plɛ́nte fɔ pé (...)
\gls maybe 3PL NEG POT beg 2SG.INDP plenty PREP pay (...)
\glt ‘Maybe they won’t ask you to pay a lot (...)’

\label{ex:key:850}
\gll \textbf{Smɔ́ltɛn} e mék hɛɛɛ.
\gls shortly 3SG.SBJ make ‘exhalation’
\glt ‘Shortly after, he made [imitates exhalation].’

\label{ex:key:851}
\gll \textbf{So} di ɔ́da wán de lístin=an.
\gls So DEF other one IPFV listen=3SG.OBJ
\glt ‘So the other one is listening to him.’

\label{ex:key:852}
\gll E de pás \textbf{só} lɛk sé e nó nó mí mɔ́.
\gls 3SG.SBJ IPFV pass like.this like QUOT 3SG.SBJ NEG know 1SG.INDP more
\glt ‘She was passing by just like that as if she didn’t know me anymore.’

\label{ex:key:853}
\gll Na \textbf{só} dɛn go mék yú.
\gls FOC like.this 3PL POT make 2SG.INDP
\glt ‘That’s what they would do to you.’

\label{ex:key:854}
\gll Frɔn \textbf{na} \textbf{yá} \textbf{só} dɛn kin controla di húman.
\gls from LOC here like.that 3PL HAB control DEF woman
\glt ‘They control the woman from right here.’

\label{ex:key:855}
\gll \textbf{Náw} \textbf{só} taksí, nó extranjero nó de drɛ́b taksí mɔ́.
\gls now like.that taxi NEG foreigner NEG IPFV drive taxi more
\glt ‘Right now, as for taxis, no foreigner drives taxis anymore.’

\label{ex:key:856}
\gll Bɔt dá mɔní de fínis \textbf{kwík}.
\gls but that money IPFV finish quickly
\glt ‘But that money used to finish quickly.’

\label{ex:key:857}
\gll Dɛn de plé=an \textbf{kwáráng}.
\gls 3PL IPFV play=3SG.OBJ IDEO
\glt ‘It is played with this hollow sound (of the seeds falling into the pits of the wooden Oware board).’

\label{ex:key:858}
\gll Náw dɛn de \textbf{jís} de kán.
\gls now 3PL IPFV just IPFV come
\glt ‘Now, they’re just coming.’

\label{ex:key:859}
\gll Yu \textbf{tú} \textbf{lɛ́k} húman.
\gls 2SG too like woman
\glt ‘You’re too much of a womaniser.’

\label{ex:key:860}
\gll E fíba lɛk sé a dɔ́n de \textbf{tú} \textbf{tɔ́k} bɔkú.
\gls 3SG.SBJ resemble like QUOT 1SG.SBJ PRF IPFV too talk much
\glt ‘It seems like I’m talking to much.’

\label{ex:key:861}
\gll E de só in sɛ́f \textbf{tú} \textbf{mɔ́ch}.
\gls 3SG.SBJ IPFV show 3SG.POSS self too much
\glt ‘He boasts too much.’

\label{ex:key:862}
\gll A de fíl \textbf{tú} \textbf{mɔ́ch} \textbf{hɔ́t}.
\gls 1SG.SBJ IPFV feel too much heat
\glt ‘I’m feeling too hot [too much heat].’

\label{ex:key:863}
\gll Di pikín \textbf{tú} \textbf{mɔ́ch} \textbf{smɔlskín}, e \textbf{dráy} \textbf{tú} \textbf{mɔ́ch}.
\gls DEF child too much be.thin 3SG.SBJ be.dry too much
\glt ‘The girl is too thin, she’s too lean.’ 

\label{ex:key:864}
\gll Dɛn nó de \textbf{só} \textbf{yús=}an mɔ́.
\gls 3PL NEG IPFV like.that use=3SG.OBJ more
\glt ‘It’s not used that much anymore.’

\label{ex:key:865}
\gll Pút=an bihɛ́n \textbf{mɔ́}!
\gls put=3SG.OBJ behind more
\glt ‘Put it behind [rewind] again!’

\label{ex:key:866}
\gll Dɛn sé nóto ín wán, ɔ́da wán dé \textbf{mɔ́}.
\gls 3PL QUOT NEG.FOC 3SG.INDP one other one BE.LOC more
\glt ‘They said it’s not her alone, there’s yet another one.’

\label{ex:key:867}
\gll E de sigue \textbf{mɔ́}.
\gls 3SG.SBJ IPFV continue more
\glt ‘It’s still continuing.’

\label{ex:key:868}
\gll E dé e nó de \textbf{ánsa} mí \textbf{mɔ́}.
\gls 3SG.SBJ BE.LOC 3SG.SBJ NEG IPFV answer 1SG.INDP more
\glt ‘She was (just) there (and) wasn’t responding to me any more.’

\label{ex:key:869}
\gll Frɔn Rebola bajando e nó go \textbf{dé} \textbf{mɔ́}.
\gls from PLACE descending 3SG.SBJ NEG POT BE.LOC more
\glt ‘As we descend from Rebola, it [the fog] won’t be there anymore.’

\label{ex:key:870}
\gll A nó de \textbf{tɔ́k} \textbf{mɔ́}.
\gls 1SG.SBJ NEG IPFV talk more
\glt ‘I was not talking any longer.’ OR ‘I was not saying (anything) more/again.’

\label{ex:key:871}
\gll \textbf{Nó} \textbf{pát} \textbf{fɔ} \textbf{wɔ́l} \textbf{mɔ́} nó dé.
\gls NEG part PREP world more NEG BE.LOC
\glt ‘There is no other part of the world [where it’s like that].’

\label{ex:key:872}
\gll \textbf{\'{A}fta mɔ́} a bin wók dís sén wók wé a de dú.
\gls then more 1SG.SBJ PST work this same work SUB 1SG.SBJ IPFV do
\glt ‘Then, additionally, I worked this same job that I’m doing (now).’ 

\label{ex:key:873}
\gll \textbf{Wok-sáy} a de híɛ wé dɛn de tɔ́k=an bɔkú.
\gls work.CPD-side 1SG.SBJ IPFV hear SUB 3PL IPFV talk=3SG.OBJ much
\glt ‘(At) work I hear them talk it [Ghanaian Pidgin English] a lot.’

\label{ex:key:874}
\gll E kán \textbf{sán} \textbf{tɛ́n}.
\gls 3SG.SBJ come sun time
\glt ‘He came (at) noon.’

\label{ex:key:875}
\gll Dɛn só di sɔ́t \textbf{tú} \textbf{stáyl}.
\gls 3PL sew DEF shirt two style
\glt ‘The shirt was sewn in two (different) ways.’

\label{ex:key:876}
\gll A pút di kí \textbf{na} pála.
\gls 1SG.SBJ put DEF key LOC parlour
\glt ‘I put the key in the parlour.’

\label{ex:key:877}
\gll E fíks dɛ́n \textbf{fáyn}.
\gls 3SG.SBJ fix 3PL.INDP fine
\glt ‘She has arranged them properly.’

\label{ex:key:878}
\gll Chico, yu dɔ́n chɔ́p=an \textbf{haydháyd}.
\gls boy 2SG PRF eat=3SG.OBJ secretly
\glt ‘Man, you’ve eaten it secretly.’

\label{ex:key:879}
\gll \'{A}s dɛn nɔ́ba bin sí plantí, dɛn bin chɔ́p=an \textbf{rɔ́n-wán}.
\gls as 3PL NEG.PRF PST see plantain 3PL PST eat=3SG.OBJ wrong-ADV
\glt ‘Since they had never seen plantain before, they ate it the wrong way.’

\label{ex:key:880}
\gll Dɛn tíf di mɔní \textbf{síkrit} \textbf{stáyl}.
\gls 3PL steal DEF money secret style
\glt ‘They stole the money secretly.’

\label{ex:key:881}
\gll A wáka \textbf{fɔ} \textbf{fút} wet mi maleta.
\gls 1SG.SBJ walk PREP foot with 1SG.POSS suitcase
\glt ‘I walked by foot with my suitcase.’

\label{ex:key:882}
\gll E gó na wók \textbf{wé} e \textbf{klín}.
\gls 3SG.SBJ go LOC work SUB 3SG.SBJ be.clean
\glt ‘She went to work clean.’

\label{ex:key:884}
\gll E kɔmɔ́t na rúm \textbf{nékɛd}.
\gls 3SG.SBJ come.out LOC room be.naked
\glt ‘He left the room naked.’

\label{ex:key:885}
\gll E pút di bɔ́tul pan di tébul \textbf{wet} \textbf{di} \textbf{mɔ́t} \textbf{dɔ́n}.
\gls 3SG.SBJ put DEF bottle pan DEF table with DEF mouth down
\glt ‘He put the bottle on the table upside-down.’

\label{ex:key:886}
\gll Pero mi mamá kán acepta di pikín \textbf{lɛk} \textbf{mi} \textbf{brɔ́da} \textbf{in} \textbf{pikín}.
\gls but 1SG.POSS mother PFV accept DEF child like 1SG brother 3SG.POSS child
\glt ‘But my mother accepted the child as my brother’s child.’

\label{ex:key:887}
\gll Mí nó lɛ́k yú bɔt wi fít dé \textbf{lɛk} \textbf{kɔ́mpin}.
\gls 1SG.INDP NEG like 2SG.INDP but 1PL can BE.LOC like friend
\glt ‘I don’t love you but we can be (like) friends.’

\label{ex:key:888}
\gll Di cubana húman de \textbf{wók} \textbf{lɛk} \textbf{dɔ́kta} na Malábo.
\gls DEF Cuban woman IPFV work like doctor LOC PLACE
\glt ‘The Cuban woman works as a doctor in Malabo.’

\label{ex:key:889}
\gll Yu fít gí mí \textbf{lɛk} \textbf{dos} \textbf{mil} só?
\gls 2SG can give 1SG.INDP like two thousand like.that
\glt ‘Can you give me around two thousand?’

\label{ex:key:890}
\gll E de dú \textbf{lɛk} \textbf{sé} e de fɛ́n sɔn tín.
\gls 3SG.SBJ IPFV do like QUOT 3SG.SBJ IPFV look.for some thing
\glt ‘He’s pretending to look for something.’

\label{ex:key:891}
\gll E dríng di \textbf{watá} \textbf{kól}.
\gls 3SG.SBJ drink DEF water be.cold
\glt ‘She drank the water cold.’

\label{ex:key:892}

\gls 3SG.SBJ drink cold.CPD-water
\glt ‘She drank cold water.’

\label{ex:key:893}

\gls but SUB 1SG.SBJ HAB touch 3SG.POSS leg 3SG.POSS hand there FOC like.that 3PL cold.EMP
\glt ‘But when I would touch his foot (and) his hand, they were so extremely cold.’

\label{ex:key:894}
\gll Dɛn kéch=an dɛn bít=an \textbf{sóté.e}~\textup{[s\H{o}t\H{e}::]}.
\gls 3PL catch=3SG.OBJ 3PL beat=3SG.OBJ until.EMP
\glt ‘They caught him and beat the hell out of him.’

\label{ex:key:895}
\gll Wántɛn a skía, e sé “nó skía, a kɔmɔ́t \textbf{fá.áwe}~\textup{[fá:we]}, a kɔmɔ́t \textbf{fá.á}~\textup{[fá::]}.”
\gls suddenly 1SG.SBJ be.scared 3SG.SBJ QUOT NEG be.scared 1SG.SBJ come.out far.EMP 1SG.SBJ come.out far.EMP
\glt ‘Suddenly, I became scared, he said “don’t be scared, I come from very far away, I come from very far”.’

\label{ex:key:897}
\gll A de sɔ́ri \textbf{bád.}
\gls 1SG.SBJ IPFV feel.sorry extremely
\glt ‘I really feel sorry.’

\glt ‘She is really beautiful, she is really beautiful.’

\label{ex:key:899}
\gll E hád \textbf{ó}.

\glt ‘It’s really difficult.’

\label{ex:key:900}

\glt ‘The paper is on the table.’

\label{ex:key:901}

\label{ex:key:902}

\label{ex:key:903}
\gll E kán fɔdɔ́n \textbf{sóté} \textbf{yá}.

\glt ‘(And then) it fell up to here.’

\label{ex:key:904}
\gll (...) na di tín a kán \textbf{na} \textbf{yá}.
\gls (...) FOC DEF thing 1SG.SBJ come LOC here
\glt ‘(...) that’s why I came here.’

\label{ex:key:905}

\glt ‘As for here, people of the island pay [the bride price] in alcohol.’

\label{ex:key:906}

\glt ‘That’s how they make coffee here.’

\label{ex:key:907}
\gll E bin pás \textbf{na} \textbf{mi} \textbf{hós}.

\glt ‘She passed by my house [to see me].’

\label{ex:key:908}

\label{ex:key:909}

\label{ex:key:910}

\label{ex:key:911}
\gll Yu de klém fɔ \textbf{rích} \textbf{pantáp}.
\gls 2SG IPFV climb PREP arrive top
\glt ‘You’re climbing in order to reach the top.’

\label{ex:key:912}
\gll (...) e \textbf{dé} \textbf{ɔ́p}, gó só!

\glt ‘(...) it’s [farther] up, go this way!’

\label{ex:key:913}

\glt ‘The lower part is violet.’

\label{ex:key:915}
\gll Na fɔ mék nó gó \textbf{na} \textbf{dɔ́n}.

\glt ‘It’s in order (for us) not to go down.’

\label{ex:key:916}
\gll E de sɛ́l e de pút smɔ́l smɔ́l wán fɔ \textbf{kɔ́na} mék e fít bák dán mán in mɔní.

\glt ‘(...) she’s selling (and) she’s putting a bit at the side in order to be able to give that man back his money.’

\label{ex:key:917}
\gll E dé \textbf{bifó} di \textbf{hós}.

\glt ‘She’s in front of the house.’

\label{ex:key:918}

\gls 3SG.SBJ BE.LOC before side
\glt ‘She’s at the front.’

\label{ex:key:919}

\gls DEF bird go behind this big stone here before part 3SG.SBJ go there
\glt ‘The bird went behind this big stone here, the front part, it went there.’

\label{ex:key:920}
\gll Di béd dé \textbf{míndul} \textbf{di} \textbf{rúm}.

\label{ex:key:921}
\gll Boyé sidɔ́n \textbf{bihɛ́n} \textbf{dís} \textbf{hós}.
\gls NAME stay behind this house
\glt ‘Boyé lives behind this house.’

\label{ex:key:922}
\gll E de cruza-cruza \textbf{bifó} \textbf{di} \textbf{domɔ́t}, e de dú lɛk sé e de fɛ́n sɔn tín.
\gls 3SG.SBJ IPFV cross.CPD{}-cross before DEF door 3SG.SBJ IPFV do like QUOT 3SG.SBJ IPFV look.for some thing
\glt ‘He’s walking back and forth in front of the door, he’s pretending to be looking for something.’

\label{ex:key:923}
\gll Yu fít tɔ́k sé “dɛn sidɔ́n \textbf{nía} \textbf{di} \textbf{fáya}”.
\gls 2SG can talk QUOT 3PL sit near DEF fire
\glt ‘You can say “they’re sitting by the fire”.’

\label{ex:key:924}
\gll A sidɔ́n \textbf{kɔ́na} \textbf{di} \textbf{aeropuerto}.
\gls 1SG.SBJ stay next.to DEF airport
\glt ‘I stay next to the airport.’

\label{ex:key:925}
\gll Di pépa dé \textbf{ɔntɔ́p} \textbf{tébul}.
\gls DEF paper BE.LOC top table
\glt ‘The paper is on the table.’

\label{ex:key:926}
\gll Discoteca dɛn dé \textbf{bɔtɔ́n} \textbf{grɔ́n} ɛ́n.
\gls club PL BE.LOC bottom ground INTJ
\glt ‘(The) clubs are under the ground, you know.’

\label{ex:key:927}
\gll Dán skúl e dé \textbf{nía} \textbf{bɛrin-grɔ́n}, nɔ́?
\gls that school 3SG.SBJ BE.LOC near burial.CPD{}-ground INTJ
\glt ‘That school is near the cemetery, right?’

\label{ex:key:928}
\gll Pɔ́sin dɛn dé \textbf{nadó} \textbf{fɔ} di avión.
\gls person PL BE.LOC outside PREP DEF plane
\glt ‘People are outside the plane.’

\label{ex:key:931}
\gll Wi de dú=an \textbf{dɔ́n} \textbf{yá} na mi kɔ́ntri.
\gls 1PL IPFV do=3SG.OBJ down here LOC 1SG.POSS country
\glt ‘We do it down here in my hometown.’ 

\label{ex:key:932}
\gll E sé mí nó de mék e slíp \textbf{bɔtɔ́n} \textbf{dé}.
\gls 3SG.SBJ QUOT 1SG.INDP NEG IPFV make 3SG.SBJ sleep under there
\glt ‘She said I [EMP] don’t make him sleep under there [the mosquito net].’

\label{ex:key:933}
\gll E pás \textbf{kɔ́na} \textbf{mí}.
\gls 3SG.SBJ pass next.to 1SG.INDP
\glt ‘He went past next to me.’

\label{ex:key:934}
\gll Motó de kɔmɔ́t \textbf{bihɛ́n} \textbf{yú} pan yu lɛf-hán.

\glt ‘A car is coming out behind you on your left.’

\label{ex:key:935}
\gll Dɛn \textbf{líng} fɔ dán butaca.
\gls 3PL lean PREP this armchair
\glt ‘They’re sitting reclined in that armchair.’

\label{ex:key:936}
\gll E \textbf{líng}=an dé.
\gls 3SG.SBJ lean=3SG.OBJ there
\glt ‘He leaned it there.’

\label{ex:key:937}

\label{ex:key:938}

\gls DEF glass BE.LOC near
\glt ‘The glass is near.’

\glt ‘The glass is near the door.’

\glt ‘Bring the glass near, please.’

\glt ‘She seated the child in (the) armchair.’

\label{ex:key:942}

\label{ex:key:943}
\gll Di \textbf{kasára} \textbf{tínap} míndul tú stík.
\gls DEF cassava stand middle two tree
\glt ‘The cassava is standing upright between two trees.’

\label{ex:key:944}
\gll \textbf{Di} \textbf{mán} \textbf{tínap} míndul pípul dɛn.
\gls DEF man stand middle people PL
\glt ‘The man is standing amidst people.’

\label{ex:key:945}

\glt ‘He stood up the cassava between two trees.’

\label{ex:key:946}
\gll \textbf{Di} \textbf{bɔ́tul} \textbf{slíp} pantáp di tébul bikɔs \textbf{di} \textbf{bɔ́tul} \textbf{lé} dé.
\gls DEF bottle sleep top DEF table because DEF bottle lie there
\glt ‘The bottle is lying [in a horizontal position] on the table because the bottle is lying there.’

\label{ex:key:947}

\gls 3SG.SBJ sleep DEF bottle top DEF table
\glt ‘He laid the bottle on the table [in a horizontal position].’ 

\label{ex:key:948}
\gll Dɛn \textbf{para} di búk dɛn sé dɛn \textbf{jám} dɛn sɛ́f.
\gls 3PL stand.up DEF book PL QUOT 3PL make.contact 3PL self
\glt ‘The books were stood up [in such way] that they’re in contact with each other.’

\label{ex:key:949}
\gll So di mán kán pás nía ín, e \textbf{jám}=an, di plét fɔdɔ́n na grɔ́n.
\gls so DEF man PFV pass near 3SG.INDP 3SG.SBJ make.contact=3SG.OBJ DEF plate fall LOC ground
\glt ‘So the man passed near her, he bumped into her, the plate fell to the ground.’

\label{ex:key:950}
\gll Di písis \textbf{hɛ́ng} na di stík nɔ́, bikɔs nó mán nó pút=an.
\gls DEF piece.of.cloth hang LOC DEF tree INTJ because NEG man NEG put=3SG.OBJ
\glt ‘The piece of cloth is hanging onto the stick, right, because nobody put it there.’

\label{ex:key:951}
\gll E táy di kasára wet róp áfta e \textbf{hɛ́ng}=an.
\gls 3SG.SBJ tie DEF cassava with rope then 3SG.SBJ hang=3SG.OBJ
\glt ‘He tied the cassava with a rope and then he hung it up.’

\label{ex:key:952}

\glt ‘I’m coming from town right now.’

\label{ex:key:954}
\gll Bɔt wé e \textbf{kán} \textbf{na} \textbf{Malábo}, ɛ́ni nɛ́t in abuela kin kán hambɔ́g=an.

\glt ‘But when she came to Malabo, every night her grandmother would come bother her.’

\label{ex:key:956}

\label{ex:key:963}

\label{ex:key:965}

\label{ex:key:966}

\glt ‘It was thrown down.’

\label{ex:key:967}

\glt ‘I flung it into the sea.’

\label{ex:key:968}

\glt ‘He’s throwing the ball with aim in order to hit the cardboard box.’

\label{ex:key:969}
\gll E \textbf{sɛ́n}=an di bɔ́l.

\label{ex:key:971}

\label{ex:key:972}

\glt ‘(And then) it fell up to here.’

\label{ex:key:977}

\label{ex:key:978}

\label{ex:key:980}

\glt ‘He called from the platform, he called down here.’

\label{ex:key:981}

\glt ‘Tomorrow very early in the morning, as soon as you get up,

\label{ex:key:998}

\glt ‘(...) early this morning, very early this morning.’ 

\label{ex:key:999}
\gll E kán wé di \textbf{mɔ́nin} de \textbf{brék}.

\glt ‘He came while morning was breaking.’ 

\label{ex:key:1000}
\gll E kán \textbf{madrugada}.
\gls 3SG.SBJ come dawn
\glt ‘She came (at) dawn.’

\label{ex:key:1001}
\gll So yu wánt dé dé las cuatro, wi dɔ́n \textbf{dé} \textbf{las} \textbf{tres} \textbf{y} \textbf{veinte}.
\gls so 2SG want BE.LOC there the.PL four 1PL PRF BE.LOC the.PL three and twenty
\glt ‘So you want to be there at four (and) we’re already here at three twenty.

\label{ex:key:1002}
\gll \'{U}s=dé yu de gó, \textbf{viernes}?

\label{ex:key:1004}

\label{ex:key:1007}
\gll Wí de kɔ́l yá só \textbf{amatán} dán, lɛk sé e kin dé lɛkɛ niebla.

\label{ex:key:1008}

\gls now 1SG.SBJ PRF see DEF thing SUB 2SG need
\glt ‘Now I’ve seen what you need.’

\label{ex:key:1009}

\label{ex:key:1010}

\glt ‘Tomorrow, I’ll see my mother.’

\glt ‘Yesterday, I saw my mother.’

\label{ex:key:1013}

\gls after yesterday 1SG.SBJ see 1SG.POSS mother
\glt ‘The day before yesterday, I saw my mother.’

\label{ex:key:1014}

\gls 1SG.SBJ IPFV leave LOC PLACE until DEF next week
\glt ‘I’m remaining in Luba until the next week.’

\label{ex:key:1015}
\gll Boyé kɔmɔ́t na tɔ́n \textbf{di} \textbf{lás} \textbf{mún}.
\gls NAME go.out LOC town DEF last month
\glt ‘Boyé left town last month.’

\label{ex:key:1016}
\gll Ɛf e nó bin gó \textbf{lás} \textbf{hía}, e bin fɔ dé wet wí na yá só.
\gls if 3SG.SBJ NEG PST go last year 3SG.SBJ PST COND BE.LOC with 1PL.INDP LOC here like.that
\glt ‘If she hadn’t gone last year, she’d be with us right here.’

\label{ex:key:1017}
\gll E bin dɔ́n pás \textbf{lɔ́n} \textbf{tɛ́n}, nóto \textbf{lɔ́n} \textbf{lɔ́n} \textbf{tɛ́n}.
\gls 3SG.SBJ IPFV PRF pass long time NEG.FOC long RED time
\glt ‘It happened long ago, not very long ago.’

\label{ex:key:1018}

\gls last.CPD-night 1SG.SBJ destroy 1SG.POSS brain
\glt ‘Last night, I drank myself senseless.’

\label{ex:key:1019}
\gll A de wét sé mék a gó \textbf{ínsay} \textbf{tú} \textbf{dé}.
\gls 1SG.SBJ IPFV wait QUOT SBJV 1SG.SBJ go inside two day
\glt ‘I’m hóping to go in two days.’

\label{ex:key:1020}
\gll Bɔ́y dɛn dé dé, \textbf{mɔ́nin} \textbf{tɛ́n} \textbf{sán} \textbf{tɛ́n} \textbf{na} \textbf{nɛ́t}, na Píchi dɛn de tɔ́k Píchi.
\gls boy PL BE.LOC there morning time sun time LOC night FOC Pichi 3PL IPFV talk Pichi
\glt ‘(The) guys are there, in the morning, at day time, at night, it’s only Pichi that they talk.’

\label{ex:key:1021}
\gll Kofí bin dé yá só \textbf{bifó} lás hía.
\gls NAME PST BE.LOC here like.that before last year
\glt ‘Kofi was here before last year [the year before last].’

\label{ex:key:1022}
\gll Dɛn go tɔ́n bák \textbf{ápás} di nɛ́ks wík.
\gls 3PL POT turn back after DEF next week
\glt ‘They’ll return the week after next [in two weeks].’

\label{ex:key:1023}
\gll Yu go moja di rɛ́s na watá, \textbf{fɔ} \textbf{tidé}, \textbf{tú} \textbf{dé} (...)
\gls 2SG POT soak DEF rice LOC water PREP today two day (...)
\glt ‘You soak the rice in water, for today [one day], (for) two days (...)’ 

\label{ex:key:1024}
\gll (...) pero di fíba bin \textbf{kɛ́r} wán dé dásɔl.
\gls (...) but DEF fever PST carry one day only
\glt ‘(...) but the fever only lasted for a day.’

\label{ex:key:1025}
\gll Háw mɔ́ch tɛ́n yu go \textbf{kɛ́r} na kɔ́ntri?
\gls how much time 2SG POT carry LOC country
\glt ‘How long are you going to stay in (your) hometown?’

\label{ex:key:1026}
\gll A de lɛ́f na Lubá \textbf{sóté} wík fínis.
\gls 1SG.SBJ IPFV remain LOC PLACE until week finish
\glt ‘I’m staying in Luba until the end of the week.’

\label{ex:key:1027}
\gll Mék e wét \textbf{sóté} \textbf{mún} \textbf{dɔ́n}, wé a gɛ́t di mɔní a go báy di chɔ́p.

\glt ‘Let him wait until the month is over, when I get the money, I’ll buy the food.’

\label{ex:key:1028}

\glt ‘The thing is let her be angry with me.’

\label{ex:key:1137}
\gll \textbf{Di} \textbf{kés} \textbf{dé} \textbf{sé}, dís dé dɛn a nó gɛ́t tɛ́n fɔ wók.
\gls DEF matter BE.LOC QUOT this day PL 1SG.SBJ NEG get time PREP work
\glt ‘It’s that these days I do not have time to work.’

\label{ex:key:1138}
\gll Na só \textbf{di} \textbf{tín} \textbf{dé}.
\gls FOC like.that DEF thing BE.LOC
\glt ‘That’s how the thing [it] is.’

\label{ex:key:1139}
\gll Na só \textbf{e} \textbf{dé}.
\gls FOC like.that 3SG.SBJ BE.LOC
\glt ‘That’s how it is.’

\label{ex:key:1140}
\gll \textbf{E} \textbf{fíba} dɛ́bul.
\gls 3SG.SBJ seem devil
\glt ‘He resembles a devil.’

\label{ex:key:1141}
\gll \textbf{E} \textbf{fíba} só.
\gls 3SG.SBJ seem like.that
\glt ‘It seems so.’

\label{ex:key:1142}
\gll \textbf{E} \textbf{fíba} \textbf{sé} nóto yú wán dɛn tíf na dí kwáta.
\gls 3SG.SBJ seem QUOT NEG.FOC 2SG.INDP one 3PL steal LOC this quarter
\glt ‘It seems that it’s not you alone they stole from in this neighbourhood.’

\label{ex:key:1143}
\gll \textbf{E} \textbf{lɛ́f} wán pɔ́sin
\gls 3SG.SBJ leave one person
\glt ‘There is one person remaining.’

\label{ex:key:1144}
\gll \textbf{E} \textbf{dɔ́n} \textbf{sté}, a tínk sé e dɔ́n sté wé una bin gɛ́t insecticida yá.
\gls 3SG.SBJ PRF be.long 1SG.SBJ think QUOT 3SG.SBJ PRF last SUB 2PL PST get insecticide here
\glt ‘It’s been long, I think it’s been long since you [PL] have had insecticide [sprayed] here.’

\label{ex:key:1145}
\gll \textbf{E} \textbf{níd} \textbf{sé} mék a gó dé tumɔ́ro.
\gls 3SG.SBJ need QUOT SBJV 1SG.SBJ go there tomorrow
\glt ‘It is necessary that I go there tomorrow.’

\label{ex:key:1146}
\gll \textbf{E} \textbf{hád} fɔ bíl na yá bikɔs sé di grɔ́n gɛ́t bɔkú sansán.
\gls 3SG.SBJ hard PREP build LOC here because QUOT DEF ground get much sand
\glt ‘It’s hard to build here because the ground is very sandy.’

\label{ex:key:1147}
\gll \textbf{E} \textbf{fáyn} fɔ dríng smɔ́l-wán.
\gls 3SG.SBJ fine PREP drink small{-adv}
\glt ‘It’s good to drink moderately.’

\label{ex:key:1149}
\gll Porque \textbf{e} \textbf{de} \textbf{sigue} wán bád smɛ́l.
\gls because 3SG.SBJ IPFV follow one bad smell
\glt ‘Because there follows a bad smell.’

\label{ex:key:1150}
\gll E sé \textbf{e} nó fít \textbf{falta}.
\gls 3SG.SBJ QUOT 3SG.SBJ NEG can lack
\glt ‘She said she can’t be absent.’

\label{ex:key:1151}
\gll Mi rabia dɔ́n fínis bɔt wé yu gó \textbf{e} \textbf{de} \textbf{sigue} mɔ́.
\gls 1SG.POSS anger PRF finish but SUB 2SG go 3SG.SBJ IPFV follow more
\glt ‘My anger is over, but when you go, it continues.’

\label{ex:key:1152}
\gll (...) bɔt \textbf{dɛn} \textbf{yón} fáyn, \textbf{e} fáyn fɔ sí.
\gls (...) but 3PL own fine 3SG.SBJ fine PREP see
\glt ‘(...) but theirs is beautiful, it [the wedding ceremony] is beautiful to see.’ 

\label{ex:key:1154}
\gll \textbf{E} \textbf{fíba} \textbf{sé} Boyé gɛ́t mɔní.
\gls 3SG.SBJ seem QUOT NAME get money
\glt ‘It seems that Boyé has money.’

\label{ex:key:1156}
\gll Boyé \textbf{fíba} \textbf{sé} \textbf{e} gɛ́t mɔní.
\gls NAME seem QUOT 3SG.SBJ get money
\glt ‘Boyé seems to have money.’ [Lit. ‘Boyé seems that he has money.’]

\label{ex:key:1157}
\gll Dɛn \textbf{gɛ́t} wók náw ó.
\gls 3PL get work now SP
\glt ‘They actually have work now.’

\label{ex:key:1158}
\gll E \textbf{gɛ́t} ɔ́da húman ‘chíp’ bɔkú problema, (...)
\gls 3SG.SBJ get other woman [SKT] much problem (...)
\glt ‘He got (himself) another woman, many problems, (...)’

\label{ex:key:1159}
\gll Smɔ́l gál, ɛf e nó \textbf{gɛ́t} \textbf{wán} \textbf{bɔ́y}, e nó \textbf{gɛ́t} \textbf{mán}, pero di húman, di bíg wán dɛn sɛ́f.
\gls small girl if 3SG.SBJ NEG get one boy 3SG.SBJ NEG get man but DEF woman DEF big one PL EMP
\glt ‘As for young girls, if they don’t have a boy-friend, if they don’t have a man [they feel worthless], but even women, the grown ones themselves.’

\label{ex:key:1160}
\gll Bikɔs a \textbf{gɛ́t} bɔkú mi kɔntri-mán \textbf{dɛn} (...)
\gls because 1SG.SBJ get much 1SG.POSS country.CPD-man PL (...)
\glt ‘Because I have many of my countrymen (...)’ 

\label{ex:key:1161}
\gll (...) dán mɔní a fít \textbf{gɛ́t=an} un mes.
\gls (...) that money 1SG.SBJ can get=3SG.OBJ DEF month
\glt ‘(...) as for that money, I can have it for a month.’

\label{ex:key:1162}
\gll (...) mébi a gɛ́t pikín, wé mébi a nó \textbf{gɛ́t}.
\gls (...) maybe 1SG.SBJ get child SUB maybe 1SG.SBJ NEG get
\glt ‘(...) maybe I have children or maybe I don’t have [children].’ 

\label{ex:key:1163}
\gll Dásɔl wé a dɔ́n bíg wé a fɔ́s \textbf{gɛ́t} \textbf{di} \textbf{fɔ́s} \textbf{bɛlɛ́} (...)
\gls only SUB 1SG.SBJ PRF big SUB 1SG.SBJ first get DEF first belly (...)
\glt ‘Then when I was grown, when I first had the first pregnancy (...)’

\label{ex:key:1164}
\gll \textbf{Na} \textbf{torí} dɛn de \textbf{púl}.
\gls FOC story 3PL IPFV pull
\glt ‘It’s a story that they’re telling.’

\label{ex:key:1165}
\gll A go \textbf{púl} yú=\textbf{an} tumɔ́ro.
\gls 1SG.SBJ POT pull 2SG.INDP=3SG.OBJ tomorrow
\glt ‘I will narrate it to you tomorrow.’

\label{ex:key:1166}
\gll If a \textbf{gɛ́t} \textbf{rabia} wet yú, (...)
\gls if 1SG.SBJ get anger with 2SG.INDP (...)
\glt ‘If I’m angry with you (...)’ 

\label{ex:key:1167}
\gll Mék yu nó sé yu dɔ́n \textbf{gɛ́t} \textbf{novio} na pueblo, na kɔ́ntri.
\gls SBJV 2SG know QUOT 2SG PRF get boyfriend LOC village LOC country
\glt ‘You should know that you already have a fiancé in the village, in the hometown.’

\label{ex:key:1168}
\gll If di fámbul nó \textbf{gí} yú \textbf{permiso} (...)
\gls if DEF family NEG give 2SG.INDP permission (...)
\glt ‘If the family doesn’t give you permission (...)’

\label{ex:key:1169}
\gll E de \textbf{gí} \textbf{wán} \textbf{vuelta} kwík
\gls 3SG.SBJ IPFV give one round quickly
\glt ‘She’s doing a round quickly.’

\label{ex:key:1170}
\gll Dɛn bin \textbf{gí} mí \textbf{beca}.
\gls 3PL PST give 1SG.INDP scholarship
\glt ‘I was given a scholarship.’

\label{ex:key:1171}
\gll E \textbf{gí} mí \textbf{di} \textbf{beca} a gó.
\gls 3SG.SBJ give 1SG.INDP DEF scholarship 1SG.SBJ go
\glt ‘He gave me the scholarship (and) I went.’

\label{ex:key:1172}
\gll A de \textbf{wás} \textbf{wɔtá}.
\gls 1SG.SBJ IPFV wash water
\glt ‘I’m washing (myself with) water.’

\label{ex:key:1173}
\gll Na China motó dɛn \textbf{fúlɔp} \textbf{pípul}.

\glt ‘In China cars are full of people.’

\gll ɔ́l hía \textbf{pák} \textbf{polvo}.
\gls all here pack dust

\label{ex:key:1175}

\gls FOC like QUOT 2SG fill DEF glass water
\glt ‘That’s as if you fill up a glass with water?’

\gls 3SG.SBJ fill DEF glass with water
\glt ‘He filled the glass with water.’

\label{ex:key:1177}
\gll Yu fít tɔ́k sé “dɛn \textbf{chúk}=an \textbf{nɛ́f}”.

\glt ‘You can say “he was stabbed with a knife”.’

\label{ex:key:1178}
\gll Dɛn \textbf{chúk} mí \textbf{wet} \textbf{nɛ́f}.
\gls 3PL stab 1SG.INDP with knife
\glt ‘I was stabbed with a knife.’

\label{ex:key:1180}
\gll \textbf{Kɔ́t}=an \textbf{wet} \textbf{sísɔs}!
\gls cut=3SG.OBJ with scissors
\glt ‘Cut it with a pair of scissors!’

\label{ex:key:1181}
\gll Yu de \textbf{kapú} \textbf{hós}.
\gls 2SG IPFV fight.over house
\glt ‘You’re fighting over a house.’

\label{ex:key:1182}

\gls 3PL IPFV fight.over PREP DEF house
\glt ‘They’re fighting over the house.’

\label{ex:key:1183}
\gll Di pikín \textbf{fɔdɔ́n} \textbf{di} \textbf{stík}.
\gls DEF child fall DEF tree
\glt ‘The child fell from the tree.’

\label{ex:key:1184}

\gls DEF child fall from up DEF tree from DEF tree
\glt ‘The child fell from (up on) the tree, from the tree.’

\label{ex:key:1185}
\gll E de kúk, áfta e de \textbf{smɛ́l} \textbf{chɔ́p}.
\gls 3SG.SBJ IPFV cook then 3SG.SBJ IPFV smell food
\glt ‘He’s cooking, afterwards he’ll smell of food.’

\label{ex:key:1186}

\gls 2SG IPFV smell food 3PL IPFV fry egg there
\glt ‘You smell food, they’re frying eggs there.’

\label{ex:key:1187}
\gll E de trén yú sé yu go \textbf{kɔmɔ́t} \textbf{pɔ́sin}.
\gls 3SG.SBJ IPFV train 2SG.INDP QUOT 2SG POT come.out person
\glt ‘She is bringing you up to become a responsible person.’

\label{ex:key:1188}

\gls 3SG.SBJ turn person one time
\glt ‘He turned into a human-being at once.’

\label{ex:key:1189}

\gls 3SG.SBJ IPFV sick fever
\glt ‘She’s sick with fever.’

\label{ex:key:1190}

\glt ‘(...) that elderly man was crying over his (lost) money.’

\label{ex:key:1191}
\gll Dán pɔ́sin go ánsa yú, “yɛ́s, na malérya e bin de \textbf{sík}.”
\gls that person POT answer 2SG.INDP yes FOC malaria 3SG.SBJ PST IPFV sick
\glt ‘That person would reply to you “yes, it’s malaria that she was sick with”.’

\label{ex:key:1192}
\gll \'{U}s=káyn \textbf{sík} e de \textbf{sík}?
\gls Q=kind sickness 3SG.SBJ IPFV be.sick
\glt ‘What kind of sickness does she have?’

\label{ex:key:1193}
\gll Wé yu kɔmɔ́t \textbf{sík} \textbf{dán} \textbf{sík} na Panyá, wé yu de sík, náw yu bigín tɔ́k Panyá.
\gls SUB 2SG come.out be.sick that sickness LOC Spain SUB 2SG IPFV sick now 2SG begin talk Spanish
\glt ‘When you had just fallen sick with that sickness in Spain, when you were sick, then you began to talk Spanish.’

\label{ex:key:1194}

\gls 1SG.SBJ want talk that small word there
\glt ‘I want to say that small word there.’

\label{ex:key:1195}
\gll Dɛn bin \textbf{fáyn} \textbf{wán} \textbf{fáyn}.

\glt ‘They were really fine.’

\label{ex:key:1196}
\gll Dán torí bin de \textbf{swít} mí \textbf{wán} \textbf{swít}.
\gls that story PST IPFV be.tasty 1SG.INDP one tastiness
\glt ‘I really enjoyed that story.’

\label{ex:key:1197}
\gll \'{E}y, dán káyn spɛ́tikul, a \textbf{dáy} \textbf{dáy}.
\gls INTJ that kind glasses 1SG.SBJ die death
\glt ‘Hey, [if I had] that kind of glasses, I would surely die.’

\label{ex:key:1198}
\gll Na \textbf{gó} a de \textbf{gó} ó!
\gls FOC go 1SG.SBJ IPFV go SP
\glt ‘[Mind you] I’m going now!’

\label{ex:key:1199}
\gll Yu gɛ́fɔ sɛ́n \textbf{wí=an}.
\gls 2SG have.to send 1PL.INDP=3SG.OBJ

\label{ex:key:1201}

\glt ‘I’ll give you (it) tomorrow.’

\label{ex:key:1203}

\glt ‘My mother gave me a present.’

\label{ex:key:1204}

\gls 1SG.POSS mother give.as.present some present PREP 1SG.INDP
\glt ‘My mother gave (somebody) a present for me.’

\label{ex:key:1205}

\gls 3PL give DEF money PREP 1SG.INDP
\glt ‘They gave the money (to someone) for me.’ but not ‘They gave me the money.’

\label{ex:key:1206}
\gll Dɛn bin gí \textbf{mí} \textbf{beca}.
\gls 3PL PST give 1SG.INDP scholarship.
\glt ‘I was given a scholarship.’

\label{ex:key:1207}

\glt ‘That’s when she comes to tell me that story.’

\label{ex:key:1208}
\gll E gɛ́fɔ sɛ́n \textbf{mí=an}.
\gls 3SG.SBJ have.to send 1SG.INDP=3SG.OBJ
\glt ‘He has to send/throw it to me.’

\label{ex:key:1209}
\gll E gɛ́fɔ sɛ́n=an \textbf{fɔ} \textbf{yú}.
\gls 3SG.SBJ have.to send=3SG.OBJ PREP 2SG.INDP
\glt ‘He has to send it to (where) you (are).’ or ‘He has to send it for you.’ but not `He has to send it to you.'

\label{ex:key:1210}
\gll A wánt mék yu dú \textbf{mí} \textbf{sɔn} \textbf{fébɔ} mék yu wás \textbf{mí} \textbf{sɔn} \textbf{klós} \textbf{dɛn}.
\gls 1SG.SBJ want SBJV 2SG do 1SG.INDP some favour SBJV 2SG wash 1SG.INDP some clothing PL
\glt ‘I want you to do me a favour (and) wash some clothes for me.’

\label{ex:key:1211}
\gll A lɛ́f mi pikín na Panyá bikɔs a de fía sé dɛn go bɛlɛ́ \textbf{mí} \textbf{mi} \textbf{pikín}.
\gls 1SG.SBJ leave 1SG.POSS child LOC Spain because 1SG.SBJ IPFV fear QUOT 3PL POT impregnate 1SG.INDP 1SG.POSS child
\glt ‘I have left my child in Spain because I fear that she would fall pregnant on me.’

\label{ex:key:1212}
\gll Dɛn tíf \textbf{mí} \textbf{mi} \textbf{sús}.
\gls 3PL steal 1SG.INDP 1SG.POSS shoe
\glt ‘They stole my shoes from me.’

\label{ex:key:1213}

\glt ‘Then the first lady bought him a car (...)’ 

\label{ex:key:1214}

\gls SG.sbj PST buy one car PREP 1SG.POSS boss

\label{ex:key:1215}

\label{ex:key:1216}

\label{ex:key:1217}
\gll Dɛn kin pút=an \textbf{fɔ} \textbf{glás}.

\label{ex:key:1218}

\glt ‘I have put peanuts into it.’

\label{ex:key:1221}

\label{ex:key:1222}

\glt ‘As if you filled this glass with water?’

\label{ex:key:1223}

\gls 3SG.SBJ fill.up DEF glass with water
\glt ‘She filled the glass with water.’

\label{ex:key:1224}

\glt ‘That girl habitually fixes herself up, paints herself [puts on make up].’

\label{ex:key:1225}

\gls 3SG.SBJ shake 3SG.POSS self much PREP turn general
\glt ‘He made a big effort to turn general.’

\label{ex:key:1226}
\gll \MakeUppercase{A} de \textbf{sí} mi \textbf{skín} na lukinglás.

\glt ‘I’m seeing myself/my body in the mirror.’

\label{ex:key:1227}
\gll \MakeUppercase{A} de \textbf{kíl} mi \textbf{skín} dé, lɛk háw a de wók.
\gls 1SG.SBJ IPFV kill 1SG.POSS body there like how 1SG.SBJ IPFV work
\glt ‘I’m killing myself there, the way I’m working.’

\label{ex:key:1228}
\gll E dɔ́n \textbf{chák} in \textbf{héd}.
\gls 3SG.SBJ PRF get.drunk 3SG.POSS head
\glt ‘She is dead drunk.’ [Lit. ‘She has got her head drunk.’] 

\label{ex:key:1229}
\gll Bɔt fɔ Bata dɛn de ték/ dán wán sí que \textbf{dɛn} \textbf{yón} máred día, dɛn yón máred de kári mɔní ɛ́n.
\gls but PREP PLACE 3PL IPFV take that one if that 3PL own marriage be.expensive 3PL own marriage IPFV carry money INTJ
\glt ‘But as for the mainlanders, they take/ as for that one, their marriage is expensive, their marriage costs money.’

\label{ex:key:1230}
\gll Toichoa \textbf{wɛ́r} \textbf{in} \textbf{sɛ́f}.
\gls NAME wear 3SG.POSS self
\glt ‘Toichoa has/is dressed up.’

\label{ex:key:1231}
\gll A \textbf{wɛ́r}.
\gls 1SG.SBJ wear
\glt ‘I’m dressed/have got dressed.’

\label{ex:key:1232}
\gll Dɛn de sláp \textbf{dɛn} \textbf{sɛ́f}.

\glt ‘They’re slapping each other.’

\label{ex:key:1233}
\gll Pero dɛn nó sidɔ́n bifó \textbf{dɛn} \textbf{sɛ́f}.
\gls but 3PL NEG sit.down before 3PL self
\glt ‘But they’re not sitting in front of each other.’

\label{ex:key:1234}
\gll Fɔ́s na \textbf{dɛn-ɔl-tú} dɛn bin de abraza \textbf{dɛn} \textbf{sɛ́f}.

\glt ‘First it’s the two of them that were embracing each other.’

\label{ex:key:1236}
\gll Dɛn lúk \textbf{dɛn} \textbf{yón} fés.
\gls 3PL look 3PL own face
\glt ‘They looked at thier own faces.’

\label{ex:key:1237}
\gll Tináda de \textbf{bló}.
\gls thunderstorm IPFV blow
\glt ‘A thunderstorm is raging.’

\label{ex:key:1238}
\gll Brís de \textbf{bló}.
\gls air IPFV blow
\glt ‘The wind is blowing.’ 

\label{ex:key:1239}
\gll Di sán \textbf{bráyt}.
\gls DEF sun be.bright
\glt ‘The sun is bright/is shining.’

\label{ex:key:1240}
\gll Di ventilador de \textbf{bló} \textbf{mí}.
\gls DEF fan IPFV blow 1SG.INDP
\glt ‘The fan is blowing at me.’

\label{ex:key:1241}
\gll Di sán \textbf{bráyt} \textbf{di} \textbf{dé}.
\gls DEF sun brighten DEF day
\glt ‘The sun lit up the sky.’

\label{ex:key:1242}
\gll \textbf{Di} \textbf{dé} dák.
\gls DEF weather be.dark
\glt ‘It’s dark.’

\label{ex:key:1243}
\gll \textbf{Di} \textbf{dé} \textbf{fɔ} \textbf{tidé} tú hɔ́t, tú mɔ́ch sán.
\gls DEF weather PREP today too be.hot too much sun
\glt ‘The weather of today is too hot, too much sun.’

\label{ex:key:1244}
\gll \textbf{Di} \textbf{dé} kól.
\gls DEF weather be.cold
\glt ‘It’s cold.’

\label{ex:key:1245}
\gll A de sí di dé lɛkɛ sé \textbf{e} wánt \textbf{fɔ́l}.
\gls 1SG.SBJ IPFV see DEF day like QUOT 3SG.SBJ want rain
\glt ‘I think the weather is like it’s going to rain.’ 

\label{ex:key:1246}
\gll A bin chɛ́k sé \textbf{rén} go \textbf{fɔ́l}.
\gls 1SG.SBJ PST check QUOT rain POT rain
\glt ‘I thought it would rain.’

\label{ex:key:1247}
\gll E \textbf{gɛ́t} \textbf{relámpago}.
\gls 3SG.SBJ get lightning
\glt ‘There is lightning.’ 

\label{ex:key:1248}
\gll Dán sáy, \textbf{niebla} \textbf{dé} dé.
\gls that side fog BE.LOC there
\glt ‘It’s foggy there.’

\label{ex:key:1249}
\gll Mi \textbf{bɛlɛ́} de \textbf{hát} mí.
\gls 1SG.POSS belly IPFV hurt 1SG.INDP
\glt ‘My stomach is hurting me.’

\label{ex:key:1250}
\gll Mi \textbf{bɛlɛ́} de \textbf{pén} mí.
\gls 1SG.POSS belly IPFV pain 1SG.INDP
\glt ‘My stomach is paining me.’ 

\label{ex:key:1251}
\gll Mi \textbf{tít} de \textbf{pén} mí.
\gls 1SG.POSS tooth IPFV pain 1SG.INDP
\glt ‘My tooth is paining me.’

\label{ex:key:1252}
\gll Smɔ́ltɛn \textbf{slíp} \textbf{kéch}=an.
\gls shortly sleep catch=3SG.OBJ
\glt ‘Shortly afterwards, he became sleepy/fell asleep.’

\label{ex:key:1253}
\gll Wán \textbf{hángri} \textbf{kéch} mí dé.
\gls one hunger catch 1SG.INDP there
\glt ‘I suddenly felt very hungry there.’

\label{ex:key:1254}
\gll \textbf{Tɔ́sti} \textbf{kéch} mí.
\gls thirst catch 1SG.INDP
\glt ‘I (suddenly) felt thirsty.’ 

\label{ex:key:1255}
\gll A de \textbf{fíl} \textbf{hángri}, A de \textbf{fíl} \textbf{slíp}.
\gls 1SG.SBJ IPFV feel hungry 1SG.SBJ IPFV feel sleep
\glt ‘I’m feeling hungry, I’m feeling sleepy.’

\label{ex:key:1256}
\gll A \textbf{fíl} di pikín in \textbf{pén}.
\gls 1SG.SBJ feel DEF child 3SG.POSS pain
\glt ‘I went into labour.’ [Lit. ‘I felt the child’s pain].’

\label{ex:key:1257}
\gll A \textbf{sɔ́fa} wán \textbf{hángri} na dán kɔ́ntri.
\gls 1SG.SBJ suffer one hunger LOC that country
\glt ‘I endured extraordinary hunger in that country.’

\label{ex:key:1258}
\gll A de \textbf{fíl} tú mɔ́ch \textbf{hɔ́t}.
\gls 1SG.SBJ IPFV feel too much heat
\glt ‘I’m feeling too hot.’

\label{ex:key:1259}
\gll E de \textbf{fíl} \textbf{gúd} ɛf e dé míndul pípul.
\gls 3SG.SBJ IPFV feel good if 3SG.SBJ BE.LOC middle people
\glt ‘She feels good if she’s amongst people.’

\label{ex:key:1260}
\gll A \textbf{de} \textbf{hángri}.
\gls 1SG.SBJ IPFV be.hungry
\glt ‘I’m hungry.’

\label{ex:key:1261}
\gll A \textbf{de} \textbf{tɔ́sti}.
\gls 1SG.SBJ IPFV be.thirsty
\glt ‘I’m thirsty.’

\label{ex:key:1262}

\glt ‘One day, a certain child was sick.’

\label{ex:key:1263}
\gll A \textbf{táya}.
\gls 1SG.SBJ be.tired
\glt ‘I’m tired.’

\label{ex:key:1264}

\glt ‘I’m well.’

\label{ex:key:1265}

\glt ‘I’m full.’

\label{ex:key:1266}

\gls DEF girl hurt
\glt ‘The girl is hurt.’

\label{ex:key:1267}

\gls that time 1SG.SBJ BE.LOC fine
\glt ‘That time, I was fine.’

\label{ex:key:1268}

\gls 3SG.SBJ IPFV sick fever
\glt ‘She’s sick with fever.’

\label{ex:key:1269}

\gls 1SG.SBJ be.satiated plantain
\glt ‘I’m full with plantain.’

\label{ex:key:1271}
\gll E tɛ́l=an \textbf{sé} “papá mí nɛ́va chɔ́p mi sénwe”.
\gls 3SG.SBJ tell=3SG.OBJ QUOT father 1SG.INDP NEG.PRF eat 1SG.INDP EMP
\glt ‘He told him “please, I myself haven’t eaten yet”.’

\label{ex:key:1271b}
\gll \textbf{Sé} chico, dí tín nó go dú mí.
\gls QUOT boy this thing NEG POT do 1SG.INDP
\glt ‘(He said) “man, this won’t do for me”.’

\label{ex:key:1272}
\gll A \textbf{bló} \textbf{dí} \textbf{pikín}.
\gls 1SG.SBJ give.blow this child
\glt ‘I gave this child [guy] a blow.’

\label{ex:key:1273}
\gll A de \textbf{bló} ɔ a de \textbf{rɛ́s}.
\gls 1SG.SBJ IPFV relax or 1SG.SBJ IPFV rest
\glt ‘I’m relaxing or I’m resting.’

\label{ex:key:1274}
\gll Mék a \textbf{bló} \textbf{dí} \textbf{pɔ́sin} mék e fít recupera.
\gls SBJV 1SG.SBJ relax this person SBJV 3SG.SBJ can recover
\glt ‘Let me make this person rest for her to be able to recover.’

\label{ex:key:1275}
\gll (...) yu \textbf{híb} \textbf{sɔn} \textbf{tín} fɔ grɔ́n (...)
\gls (...) 2SG throw some thing PREP ground (...)
\glt ‘(...) (if) you throw something on the ground (...)’ 

\label{ex:key:1276}

\gls (...) FOC 3SG.INDP 3SG.SBJ IPFV hit person
\glt ‘(...) that’s why she’s hitting somebody.’

\label{ex:key:1277}
\gll Bikɔs yu dɔ́n \textbf{tɔ́k} \textbf{wán} \textbf{bád} \textbf{tɔ́k}, e sé “gɔ́d háma yu mɔ́t!”
\gls because 2SG PRF talk one bad word 3SG.SBJ QUOT God hammer 2SG mouth
\glt ‘Because you have said something bad, she says “may God hammer your mouth!”’

\label{ex:key:1278}
\gll Sé “a bin sí bɔt a nó fít \textbf{tɔ́k}.”
\gls QUOT 1SG.SBJ PST see but 1SG.SBJ NEG can talk.
\glt ‘(He) said “I saw (it) but I couldn’t talk”.’ 

\label{ex:key:1279}

\gls 3SG.SBJ IPFV síng LOC Pichi
\glt ‘He sings in Pichi.’

\label{ex:key:1280}

\gls (...) SUB 2SG NEG know to fix one clothing to sew one clothing (...)
\glt ‘(...) when you don’t know how to fix a dress, to sew a dress (...)’ 

\label{ex:key:1281}

\gls DEF tailor IPFV sew
\glt ‘The tailor is sewing.’

\label{ex:key:1282}

\gls 3SG.SBJ HAB cook soup
\glt ‘He cooks soups.’

\label{ex:key:1283}

\label{ex:key:1284}
\gll Yu nɛ́a \textbf{rích} \textbf{Lubá}?

\gls 3SG.SBJ PRF arrive
\glt ‘He has arrived.’

\label{ex:key:1286}

\label{ex:key:1288}

\label{ex:key:1292}

\glt ‘I don’t remember.’

\label{ex:key:1293}

\gls 1SG.SBJ HAB think 2SG.INDP much
\glt ‘I think of you a lot.’

\label{ex:key:1294}

\gls NEG bother 1SG.INDP 1SG.SBJ IPFV think some thing
\glt ‘Don’t bother me, I’m thinking about something!’

\label{ex:key:1295}
\gll Bɔt wi fít de \textbf{plé} a jám yú yu fɔdɔ́n.

\glt ‘I’m dressed up.’

\label{ex:key:1300}

\glt ‘He is walking stooped over.’

\label{ex:key:1304}

\label{ex:key:1307}

\label{ex:key:1308}

\glt ‘I want to go rest.’

\label{ex:key:1310}

\label{ex:key:1313}

\label{ex:key:1317}

\gls NAME resemble NAME
\glt ‘Djunais resembles Boyé.’

\glt ‘Djunais and Boyé (they) resemble (each other).’

\label{ex:key:1319}
\gll Yu fít \textbf{mék} mí wán café?
\gls 2SG can make 1SG.INDP one coffee
\glt ‘Can you make me a coffee?’

\label{ex:key:1320}
\gll A sé a nó fít \textbf{lɛ́f}=an.

\glt ‘I said I can’t leave her (behind).’

\label{ex:key:1321}

\label{ex:key:1322}
\gll A go \textbf{mék}=an \textbf{gó} tumɔ́ro.

\glt ‘I’ll make him go tomorrow.’

\label{ex:key:1323}
\gll A níd fɔ drink sɔn tín wé de mék \textbf{mék} a \textbf{bɛ́lch}
\gls 1SG.SBJ need PREP drink some thing SUB IPFV make SBJV 1SG.SBJ belch
\glt ‘I need to drink something that will make me belch.’

\label{ex:key:1324}

\gls FOC 3SG.INDP make QUOT SBJV 3PL bewitch=3SG.OBJ
\glt ‘That’s why he was bewitched.’

\label{ex:key:1325}
\gll A \textbf{drɔ́ngor}=an, a \textbf{mék} mék e \textbf{drɔ́ngo}.
\gls 1SG.SBJ get.drunk=3SG.OBJ 1SG.SBJ make SBJV 3SG.SBJ be.drunk
\glt ‘I got him drunk, I made him drunk.’ 

\label{ex:key:1326}
\gll E bin mék \textbf{mék} a \textbf{gí} di gɛ́l di plantí.
\gls 3SG.SBJ PST make SBJV 1SG.SBJ give DEF girl DEF plantain
\glt ‘She made me give the girl the plantain.’

\label{ex:key:1327}
\gll Pút di watá pero \textbf{nó} \textbf{mék} mék e \textbf{fɔdɔ́n} nado.
\gls put DEF water but NEG make SBJV 3SG.SBJ fall outside
\glt ‘Put the water (inside) but don’t make it fall outside (the vessel).’ 

\label{ex:key:1328}
\gll Fít sifta ín sóté tú tɛ́n \textbf{mék} mék dán smɔ́l smɔ́l watá dɛn \textbf{nó} \textbf{lɛ́f}.
\gls can sieve 3SG.INDP until two time make SBJV that small small water PL NEG remain
\glt ‘(You) can sift it up to two times to make none of that little water remain.’

\label{ex:key:1329}
\gll Na ín \textbf{mék} dɔtí \textbf{dɔ́n} plɛ́nte.
\gls FOC 3SG.INDP make dirty PRF plenty
\glt ‘That’s why the dirt has become so much.’

\label{ex:key:1330}
\gll Wétin \textbf{mék} yu nó \textbf{de} wók tidé?
\gls what make 2SG NEG IPFV work today
\glt ‘Why aren’t you working today?’

\label{ex:key:1331}
\gll \'{U}s=sáy yu \textbf{wánt} \textbf{mék} di smók kɔmɔ́t?
\gls Q=side 2SG want SBJV DEF smoke come.out
\glt ‘Where do you want the smoke to come out?’

\label{ex:key:1332}
\gll A \textbf{lɛ́f} mi pikín \textbf{mék} e gó Panyá.
\gls 1SG.SBJ leave 1SG.POSS child SBJV 3SG.SBJ go Spain
\glt ‘I allowed my child to go to Spain.’

\label{ex:key:1333}
\gll Seis años, \textbf{lɛ́f}=an \textbf{mék} e wɛ́r klós, mék e gó báy in brɛ́d.
\gls six year.PL leave=3SG.OBJ SBJV 3SG.SBJ wear clothing SBJV 3SG.SBJ go buy 3SG.POSS bread
\glt ‘(At) six years, let him dress up (by himself), let him go buy his (own) bread.’ 

\label{ex:key:1334}
\gll Dís húman \textbf{yún} yét.
\gls this woman be.young yet
\glt ‘This woman is still young.’ 

\label{ex:key:1335}
\gll E \textbf{lɛ́f} yú \textbf{yún}.
\gls 3SG.SBJ leave 2SG.INDP be.young
\glt ‘It makes/made you (appear) young.’

\label{ex:key:1336}
\gll Dí wán nó \textbf{kɔrɛ́t}.
\gls this one NEG be.correct
\glt ‘This one is not correct.’

\label{ex:key:1337}
\gll Gɔ́d go \textbf{lɛ́f} di mán \textbf{kɔrɛ́t}.
\gls God POT leave DEF man be.correct
\glt ‘God will make this man righteous.’ 

\label{ex:key:1338}
\gll Di húman \textbf{na} \textbf{yun-gɛ́l}.
\gls DEF woman FOC be.young.CDP-girl
\glt ‘The woman is a young woman.’

\label{ex:key:1339}
\gll Di klós dɛn de \textbf{lɛ́f} yú \textbf{yun-bɔ́y}.
\gls DEF clothing PL IPFV leave 2SG.INDP be.young.CPD-boy
\glt ‘These clothes make you (appear) a young man.’

\label{ex:key:1340}
\gll Ɛf yu húman \textbf{na} \textbf{bíg} \textbf{húman}, e hád fɔ \textbf{pút} yu sɛ́f \textbf{bíg} \textbf{mán}.
\gls if 2SG woman FOC big woman 3SG.SBJ hard PREP put 2SG self big man
\glt ‘If your wife is an important woman, it is difficult to make yourself an important man.’

\label{ex:key:1341}
\gll \textbf{Dɛn} de wɛ́r wáyt ɔ́p violeta dɔ́n.
\gls 3PL IPFV wear white up violet down
\glt ‘They [the pupils] wear white up (and) violet down.’

\label{ex:key:1342}
\gll Esto na wán ɔ́da kɔ́ntri, \textbf{dɛn} go púl yú inmediatamente, \textbf{dɛn} de púl yú wók.
\gls this LOC one other country 3PL POT remove 2SG.INDP immediately 3PL IPFV remove 2SG.INDP work
\glt ‘This in another country, they would remove you immediately, they would remove you from your job.’

\label{ex:key:1343}
\gll Di \textbf{ród} strét.
\gls DEF road be.straight
\glt ‘The road is straight.’

\label{ex:key:1344}
\gll \textbf{Dɛn} dɔ́n strét di \textbf{ród}.
\gls 3PL PRF straighten DEF road
\glt ‘The road has been straightened.’

\label{ex:key:1345}
\gll \textbf{Dɛn} \textbf{bɛ́t}=an na fám.
\gls 3PL bite=3SG.OBJ LOC farm
\glt ?‘She was bitten on the farm.’

\label{ex:key:1346}
\gll \textbf{Snék} \textbf{bɛ́t}=an na fám.
\gls snake bite=3SG.OBJ LOC farm
\glt ‘A snake bit her on the farm.’

\label{ex:key:1347}
\gll \textbf{Dɛn} \textbf{pút}=an mɔ́t dɔ́n fɔ di tébul.
\gls 3PL put=3SG.OBJ mouth down PREP DEF table
\glt ‘It has been put mouth-down on the table.’

\label{ex:key:1348}
\gll \textbf{Pɔ́sin} go entiende bɔt e nó dé bien.
\gls person POT understand but 3SG.SBJ NEG BE.LOC good
\glt ‘One would understand but it’s not correct.’

\label{ex:key:1349}
\gll \textbf{Dɛn} go hía ín bɔt e nó só dé claro.
\gls 3PL POT hear 3SG.INDP but 3SG.SBJ NEG like.that BE.LOC clear
\glt ‘It would be understood but it’s not so clear.’

\label{ex:key:1350}
\gll \textbf{Wi} de pús=an.
\gls 1PL IPFV push=3SG.OBJ
\glt ‘I’m managing.’ [Lit. ‘We’re pushing it.’]

\label{ex:key:1351}
\gll Na lɛkɛ \textbf{wí} náw, \textbf{wi} de tɔ́k Panyá, \textbf{wi} go nó sé dís pɔ́sin, na nigeriano.
\gls FOC like 1PL.INDP now 1PL IPFV talk Spanish 1PL POT know QUOT this person FOC Nigerian
\glt ‘It’s like with us now, (if) we spoke Spanish, we would know that this person, is Nigerian.’

\label{ex:key:1352}
\gll Dé, ɛ́ni káyn tín na mɔní, \textbf{yu} fít mék ɛ́ni káyn tín \textbf{yu} go sí mɔní.
\gls there every kind thing FOC money 2SG can make every kind thing 2SG POT see money
\glt ‘There, everything is money, you can do anything (and) you’ll earn money.’

\label{ex:key:1353}
\gll \textbf{Na} \textbf{fɔ} tík=an mɔ́.
\gls FOC PREP thicken=3SG.OBJ more
\glt ‘It has to be thickened more.’

\label{ex:key:1354}
\gll \textbf{Na} \textbf{to} inicia ín.
\gls FOC to initiate 3SG.INDP
\glt ‘He has to be initiated [to social life in Malabo].’

\label{ex:key:1355}
\gll Yu gó yu pé, siete mil yu baja, \textbf{áfta} yu fínis yu sube, \textbf{wé} yu de pák mɔ́ siete mil, \textbf{wé} yu sube.
\gls 2SG go 2SG pay seven thousand 2SG go.down then 2SG finish 2SG go.up SUB 2SG IPFV pack more seven thousand SUB 2SG go.up
\glt ‘You go, you pay, seven thousand, you go down, then you finish, you go up and take seven thousand again and go up.’

\label{ex:key:1356}
\gll \MakeUppercase{A} nó sabí ús=tín bin kán pás, \textbf{áfta} e gó na hospital.
\gls 1SG.SBJ NEG know Q=thing PST PFV pass then 3SG.SBJ go LOC hospital
\glt ‘I don’t know what happened that he went to (the) hospital.’

\label{ex:key:1357}
\gll \textbf{Lɛk} náw, \textbf{lɛk} Boyé só na mi mán, \textbf{áfta} mi sísta go kɔ́l=an sé, wé e go kán, “ús=sáy mi brɔda-lɔ́ dé?”
\gls like now like NAME like.that FOC 1SG.POSS man then 1SG.POSS sister POT call=3SG.OBJ QUOT SUB 3SG.SBJ POT come Q=side 1SG.POSS brother.CPD{}-law BE.LOC
\glt ‘Suppose now, suppose Boyé here were my husband, then my sister would call him, if she came, “where’s my brother-in-law?”’

\label{ex:key:1358}
\gll Ɛf yu sí sé, sɔn sáy di plés klín, \textbf{áfta} dɛn de dú di tín dɛn fáyn, yu nó go bísin ɛf yu gasta mɔní.
\gls if 2SG see QUOT some side DEF PLACE be.clean then 3PL IPFV do DEF thing PL fine 2SG NEG POT be.busy if 2SG spend money
\glt ‘If you see that, somewhere the place is clean and/ because things are done well, you don’t bother if you spend money.’

\label{ex:key:1359}
\gll E mít mi antí.
\gls 3SG.SBJ meet 1SG.POSS aunt
\glt ‘He met my aunt.’

\label{ex:key:1359b}
\gll \textbf{Dán} \textbf{tɛ́n} mi antí gɛ́t bɛlɛ́.
\gls that time 1SG.POSS aunt get belly
\glt ‘At that time my aunt was pregnant.’

\label{ex:key:1360}
\gll Bikɔs ín de sé, ɛ́ni \textbf{las} \textbf{doce} \textbf{na} \textbf{ín} in abuela kin kán kɔ́l=an.
\gls because 3SG.INDP IPFV QUOT every the.PL twelve FOC 3SG.INDP 3SG.POSS grandmother HAB come call=3SG.OBJ
\glt ‘Because she would say, always at twelve o’clock, that’s when her grandmother used to come and call her.’

\label{ex:key:1361}
\gll Só e gó na \textbf{bús,} e sé e de gó kíl bíf.
\gls so 3SG.SBJ POT LOC forest 3SG.SBJ QUOT 3SG.SBJ IPFV go kill wild.animal
\glt ‘So he went to the forest, (and) he said he was going to kill wild game.’

\label{ex:key:1362}
\gll \'{A}fta na mi gran-má a bin de kɔ́l mamá.
\gls then FOC 1SG.POSS grand-ma 1SG.SBJ PST IPFV call mother
\glt ‘So it’s my grandmother that I used to call mother.’

\ex{\label{ex:key:1362b}
\gll \textbf{Wé}\textstylePichiexamplespaceZchn{} wi kán kán na tɔ́n, \textbf{wé} a bigín gó skúl, wé a bin gɛ́t, a tínk sé seis años.
\gls SUB 1PL PFV come LOC town SUB 1SG.SBJ begin go school SUB 1SG.SBJ PST get 1SG.SBJ think QUOT six years
\glt And then we came to town, and then I began to go to school, when I was, I think six years old.’

\label{ex:key:1363}
\gll Frijoles yɛ́s frijoles.
\gls bean.PL yes bean.PL
\glt ‘[The Cubans call them] frijoles, yes frijoles.’

\label{ex:key:1364}
\gll Dɛn de kɔ́l dís tín fɔ cacahuete, dɛn de kɔ́l=an maní.
\gls 3PL IPFV call this thing PREP groundnut 3PL IPFV call=3SG.OBJ ground.nut
\glt ‘They call this peanut thing, they call it “maní”.’

\label{ex:key:1365}
\gll E nák di tébul \textbf{an} di stáyl wé e nák di tébul strɔ́n, e kán sék di plét \textbf{an} di plét kán brók.
\gls 3SG.SBJ hit DEF table and DEF style SUB 3SG.SBJ hit DEF table be.strong 3SG.SBJ PFV shake DEF plate and DEF plate PFV break
\glt ‘He hit the table and the way that he hit the table in a strong way, he shook the plate, and the plate broke.’

\label{ex:key:1366}
\gll Di dé wé yu go níd=an, yu go \textbf{sé} “a nó gɛ́t pamáyn”, yu go kɔ́t gadinɛ́ks.
\gls DEF day SUB 2SG POT need=3SG.OBJ 2SG POT QUOT 1SG.SBJ NEG get oil 2SG POT cut egg-plant
\glt ‘The day that you will need it, you are going to say “I don’t have oil,” (and) you will cut egg-plants.’

\label{ex:key:1367}
\gll E \textbf{kin} \textbf{sé} “kán wi gó na Barca wi gó dríng.”
\gls 3SG.SBJ HAB QUOT come 1PL go LOC PLACE 1PL go drink
\glt ‘He usually says “come let’s go to Barca and drink”.’

\label{ex:key:1368b}
\gll A \textbf{tɔ́k} \textbf{wán} \textbf{wɔ́d}.
\gls 1SG.SBJ talk one word
\glt ‘I said one word.’

\label{ex:key:1370}
\gll Yu \textbf{fít} \textbf{tɔ́k} “a de fíl di sɛ́nt fɔ lɛk háw e de kúk di plantí” ɔ “a de siente di sɛ́nt sé pɔ́sin de kúk plantí dé”.
\gls 2SG can talk 1SG.SBJ IPFV feel DEF scent PREP like how 3SG.SBJ IPFV cook DEF plantain SP 1SG.SBJ IPFV feel DEF scent QUOT person IPFV cook plantain there
\glt ‘You can say “I smell the scent of him cooking the plantain”, or “I smell the scent that somebody is cooking plantain there”.’

\ea{\label{ex:key:1371a}
\gll A \textbf{sé} “na mán dís?”
\gls 1SG.SBJ QUOT FOC man this
\glt ‘I said “this is a man?”’

\label{ex:key:1371e}
\gll \textbf{Sé} na mán?
\gls QUOT FOC man
\glt ‘(You) say it’s a man?’

\label{ex:key:1372a}
\gll \textbf{E} \textbf{go} \textbf{sé} e de fíɛ, e nó go gí mí di tín wé a de sɛ́n=an.
\gls 3SG.SBJ POT QUOT 3SG.SBJ IPFV fear 3SG.SBJ NEG POT give 1SG.INDP DEF thing SUB 1SG.SBJ IPFV send=3SG.OBJ
\glt ‘He would say, he was afraid (and) he wouldn’t give me the thing that I was sending him for.’

\label{ex:key:1372b}
\gll \textbf{Sé} ín nó wánt in abuelo skrách=an.
\gls QUOT 3SG.INDP NEG want 3SG.POSS grandfather scratch=3SG.OBJ
\glt ‘(He’d) say he [\textsc{emp}] doesn’t want his grandfather to scratch him.’ or ‘Because he doesn’t want his grandfather to scratch him.’

\label{ex:key:1373}
\gll In brɔ́da dɛn ɔ́l kɔmɔ́t na tɔ́n yá só \textbf{dɛn} \textbf{sé} dɛn de kán ték=an.
\gls 3SG.POSS brother PL all go.out LOC town here like.that 3PL QUOT 3PL IPFV come take=3SG.OBJ
\glt ‘His brothers all left town, (so) they said they came to take her.’

\label{ex:key:1374}
\gll E nó sabí tɔ́k ni Panyá, \textbf{e} \textbf{sé} e wánt muchachita de diecisiete años.
\gls 3SG.SBJ NEG know talk even Spanish 3SG.SBJ QUOT 3SG.SBJ want young.girl of seventeen year.PL
\glt ‘He doesn’t even know how to talk Spanish (and) he says he wants a young girl of seventeen years.’

\label{ex:key:1375}
\gll Tidé e kán \textbf{e} sé, “\textbf{a} tínk sé a go fínis ɔ́l di resto”.
\gls today 3SG.SBJ come 3SG.SBJ QUOT 1SG.SBJ think QUOT 1SG.SBJ POT finish all DEF rest
\glt ‘Today he came, he said “I think I am going to finish all the rest”.’ 

\label{ex:key:1376}
\gll Krío mamá dɛn wé dɛn de tɔ́k Píchi dɛn kin \textbf{tɔ́k} \textbf{sé} \textbf{grín}.
\gls Krio mother PL SUB 3PL IPFV talk Pichi 3PL HAB talk QUOT green
\glt ‘The elderly Krio women, when they talk Pichi, they usually say green.’ \newline [as opposed to ‘verd’ like younger people]

\label{ex:key:1377}
\gll Na fada-lɔ́, na di papá wé e bɔ́n mí, na ín mi mán go \textbf{kɔ́l} \textbf{sé} \textbf{suegro}.
\gls FOC father.CPD{}-law FOC DEF father SUB 3SG.SBJ beget 1SG.INDP FOC 3SG.INDP 1SG.POSS man POT call QUOT father-in-law
\glt ‘That is the father-in-law, that is the father who begat me, it is him that my husband would call father-in-law.’

\label{ex:key:1378}

\gls 1SG.SBJ can tell 2SG.INDP QUOT mulberry teak kalabo
\glt ‘I can tell you mulberry, teak, kalabo [listing types of wood].’

\gll Na mi mamá.
\gls FOC 1SG.POSS mother
\glt ‘That’s my mother.’

\label{ex:key:1380}

\glt ‘She should leave drinking.’

\label{ex:key:1387}
\gll Náw a dɔ́n de fínis \textbf{sém} \textbf{fɔ} wɛ́r dán sús, ɛf a bin nó a fɔ kɛ́r ɔ́da sús.

\glt ‘The girl didn’t agree to come with me.’

\label{ex:key:1392}
\gll So wé yu dɔ́n lán yu lángwech ɛ́n, e dɔ́n \textbf{hád} \textbf{fɔ} \textbf{mék} yu lán Panyá.

\label{ex:key:1393}
\gll (...) \textbf{a} go tráy \textbf{mék} \textbf{e} báy mí dán káyn gafas por dios.
\gls (...) 1SG.SBJ POT try SBJV 3SG.SBJ buy 1SG.INDP that kind glasses by God

\label{ex:key:1394}

\label{ex:key:1395}

\glt ‘It’s good to drink little.’

\glt ‘When you drink, it’s good not to get drunk.’

\label{ex:key:1397}

\glt ‘I forced him to look at me.’

\label{ex:key:1398}

\label{ex:key:1399}

\gls 3SG.SBJ make SBJV 3SG.POSS woman drink DEF beer
\glt ‘He made his woman drink the beer.’

\label{ex:key:1400}
\gll E nák di plét pan di tébul bikɔs e \textbf{wánt} \textbf{mék} di plét brók.
\gls 3SG.SBJ hit DEF plate pan DEF table because 3SG.SBJ want SBJV DEF plate break
\glt ‘He hit the plate on the table because he wanted the plate to break.’

\label{ex:key:1401}
\gll \'{A}fta, bueno \textbf{tɛ́l}=an sé \textbf{mék} e bák yú di mɔní.
\gls then good tell=3SG.OBJ QUOT SBJV 3SG.SBJ give.back 2SG.INDP DEF money
\glt ‘Then, ok, tell him that he should give you back the money.’ 

\label{ex:key:1402}
\gll E bin \textbf{bɛ́g}=an sé \textbf{mék} e kíl di fɔ́l.
\gls 3SG.SBJ PST beg=3SG.OBJ QUOT SBJV 3SG.SBJ kill DEF fowl
\glt ‘She asked him to kill the fowl.’

\label{ex:key:1403}
\gll Na ín mi gran-má bin kán tɔ́k sé in nó go \textbf{lɛ́f} mi a \textbf{gó}.
